jobdescription.0: Position Title:Pricing Analyst Position Type: Temporary - Part-Time Requisition ID: 7304 Company: Day & Ross Inc. At Day & Ross, you’ll go far. Day & Ross is one of Canada’s largest transportation companies, serving top brands across North America. We got our start hauling potatoes in 1950, and now we have a team of more than 8,000 employees, drivers and owner operators. We believe our people are our greatest strength – and we treat them like family. For over a decade, we’ve been recognized as one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, and we were named a Top Company for Women to Work for in Transportation in 2018 and 2019. Our industry recognition is a testament to the family values we share with our parent company, McCain Foods Limited. About the Role Pricing Analyst Fixed-Term Mississauga, ON The Pricing Analyst will ensure that all rate requests are processed in a timely fashion and that all pricing components are considered and recommendations are made accordingly, and within pricing policy. How You’ll Help Receives and reviews rate requests from Account Executives. Performs cost analysis of rates requested to determine profitability. Applying cost factors for dock charges, pickup charges, delivery charges, etc. Entering data into spreadsheet for calculation of total cost Applying profit margin Comparing results to requested rates Advise Sales Reps that requested rates are approved, or what increase is necessary to maintain profit margin. Assist in negotiations with customers by the provision of information. Creates tariff with finalized rates in place. Maintains log of activity on rate requests. Prepares cost analysis for tender submissions. Reviews unrated bills from night rating activity. Determine what rate was quoted, or assign one where previously undetermined. Assists in annual tariff reviews as required. Your Skills & Experience: Bachelor's degree from a university or college program related to business or mathematics would be an asset. Minimum 3 years of related experience. Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, and governmental regulations. Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, or the general public. Ability to work with mathematical concepts such as probability and statistical inference. Ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations. Ability to apply these skills in Microsoft Excel and Access. Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form. Bilingual in English and French Please note that the successful candidate will be subject to reference and criminal background checks prior to employment.  We thank you for your application, but only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. As a federally regulated employer, The Day & Ross Transportation Group fully supports the principles of employment equity and encourages all qualified members of the designated groups to apply. Function: Transportation  Location(s): CA - Canada : Ontario : Mississauga
jobdescription.1: Title: Senior Data Analyst - Telephony Manager Reporting Manager: VP of Technology  Location: Mississauga Job Type: Full time, Permanent   Job Summary   The primary responsibility of the Telephony Manager (Senior Data Analyst) is to maintain and operate and to operate a high-volume dialer system and its subsystems in a contact center environment effectively and efficiently. Experience in managing Telephony Applications (IVR, Quality Management, Workforce Management, Reporting). You will also collaborate with business management to determine overall strategy.   Responsibilities:  Research, plan, install, configure, troubleshoot, maintain, and upgrade telephony systems. Analyze and evaluate present or proposed telephony procedures to drive contact center best practices and continually improve performance of the systems and dialer strategies. Troubleshoot and resolve hardware, software, and connectivity problems, including user access and component configuration Record and maintain hardware and software inventories, site and/or server licensing, and user access and security. Work with vendors to resolve complex Telephony problems. Produce and maintain system documentation Conduct technical research on system upgrades to determine feasibility, cost, time required, and compatibility with current system. To document system problems and resolutions logs for future reference. Works closely with management to prioritize business goals and information needs. Perform daily uploads, downloads and importing Analysis of dialer-output data to identify potential problems/issues. Create and update dialing campaigns, filter, list strategies and reports. You must be able to take ownership of your client base and complete daily tasks accurately and efficiently. General requirements:  Ability to make quick decisions, establish priorities and concentrate on detailed information sometimes under stressful conditions. Proficient understanding of Telephony Technology. Detailed oriented; ability to manage multiple projects at the same time. Excellent verbal and written communication abilities are essential. Firm understanding of business practices in a Collection Agency and Sales/Customer service contact center environment. Advanced proficiency level with Microsoft Excel Experience working with AVAYA IP Office and other alternative and multiple hosted platforms Experience working with other communication channels used in call centerish. Chat, SMS, Email.
jobdescription.3: CAREER OPPORTUNITY SENIOR METER DATA ANALYST Location: Mississauga, ON If you are an ambitious, curious, hard-working, and seasoned energy professional, this is an exciting new opportunity for you to join the Rodan Energy team – an organization that has been recognized as one of Canada’s Top Small & Medium Employers for three years in a row. Rodan Energy is a top North American energy services company, quickly growing to serve our clients across North America. We are a leader in distributed energy resource asset optimization, demand response, energy management and intelligence systems, and power systems engineering and metering services. Our innovative solutions are designed for large commercial and industrial energy users as well as power distribution and generation companies. We focus on minimizing energy costs while maximizing efficiencies and corporate sustainability for our clients. Our goal is a sustainable energy future. We have an opportunity for a Senior Meter Data Analyst based out of our head office in Mississauga. As an integral member of the Information Services team, the Senior Meter Data Analyst will be responsible for Meter data management services for retail, wholesale, and Meter Service Provider (MSP) clients including remote meter interrogation, data collection, verification and posting using meter interrogation software. Your responsibilities include: Administration of the Meter Trouble Report (MTR) process; communicating, coordinating, and assisting, customers and the Independent Electricity System Operator (IESO) Schedule MV-90-meter interrogation cycles to ensure availability of metered data and to avoid conflict with IESO reading cycles. Program meters and configure telemetry and communication devices. Configuration of equipment for real-time and near real-time telemetry using sources such as Modbus, DNP 3.0, and KYZ pulses. Interface with other metering service providers, meter data management agencies and clients regarding the provision of metering services, metering installations and metering data. Interface with the IESO for new meter installations, meter upgrades, meter deregistration, and other issues. Interface with field staff, prior to and during commissioning of meter installations and commencement of meter data collection. Maintain the metering database and ensure the accuracy and confidentiality of the data contained therein. Support Rodan staff with audit and technical proposals, engineering drawings and design, order processing, project management, MSP site registration, installation and commissioning, meter trouble reports and maintenance. Key qualifications: Post-secondary education from an accredited college or university and/or prior related work experience ideally in utility metering or billing. Experience working with data collection and/or settlement systems particularly Itron MV-90 software. Strong proficiency with MS Office, specifically MS Excel. Macro and VB scripting skills is considered an asset. Comprehensive knowledge of electrical principals, terminology, function, SLDs, and interpretation of electrical measuring instruments. Experience in networking and telecommunications. Knowledge of communications protocols, firewalls, TCP/IP. Strong customer service orientation and ability to work in a collaborative environment. Solid analytical and problem-solving skills with strong attention to detail and accuracy. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. To apply for this opportunity, please visit us at http://rodanenergy.com/careers/jobs/ Rodan Energy is strongly committed to diversity and equality of opportunity. We strive to create an environment that is welcoming and inclusive for everyone. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
jobdescription.6: Description de l'emploi Founded in 1846, Laurentian Bank Financial Group (LBCFG) is a diversified financial services provider whose mission is to help its customers improve their financial health. The Laurentian Bank of Canada and its entities are collectively referred to as Laurentian Bank Financial Group (the "Group" or the "Bank").   With more than 2,900 employees guided by the values of proximity, simplicity and honesty, the Group provides a broad range of advice-based solutions and services to its personal, business and institutional customers. With pan-Canadian activities and a presence in the U.S., the Group is an important player in numerous market segments.  The role is to fill under Laurentian Bank, a subsidiary of the Laurentian Bank Financial Group.  Responsabilités º Partner with internal stakeholders to gather customer data  º Analyze data to ensure it is concise and contains all relevant information  º Create and maintain master customer data lists  º Produce effective data visualizations for marketing teams  º Maintain high levels of accuracy and consistency with documentation  Qualifications º University Degree in a related field º Advanced excel skills and VBA and Microsoft Access knowledge º Experience with open-source programming languages with R/Python and data visualization (Tableau/Power BI) is an asset; º Good understanding of relational databases (SQL) º Experience with database marketing/marketing automation is an asset  Renseignements supplémentaires We welcome and encourage applications from individuals from all groups, including aboriginal, women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities, regardless of race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, creed, family status, national origin, age and gender.

jobdescription.8: Address: 250 Yonge Street Job Family Group: Technology Liaises with stakeholders to understand problems and opportunities and, recommends solutions to enable the achievement of organizational goals. Builds exceptional relationships with business partners and internal stakeholders. Analyzes data and creates documents and plans in service of informing, advising, or updating stakeholders. Ensures the requirements map to a real business need, are approved by all relevant stakeholders, and meet essential quality standards. Participates in reviews or inspections, in collaboration with the project team, to ensure the quality of work products. Supports the execution of strategic initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders. Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders. Leads or participates in defining the communication plan designed to positively influence or change behaviour; develops tailored messaging; and idetifies appropriate distribution channels. Works with project stakeholders to validate their requirements and analysis models via techniques such as reviews and walkthroughs. Ensures system specifications meet expectations/requirements, and negotiates solutions. Creates documentation to ensure the supportability of analyses. Maintains existing requirements to ensure that current-state needs are known. Develops and implements data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality. Identifies, analyzes, and interprets trends or patterns in complex data sets. Filters and “cleans” data, and reviews computer reports, printouts and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems. Remains alert to new techniques for insights, analytics, and data visualization, and devises new ways of applying them. Interprets data, analyzes results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports. Recommends approaches to streamline and integrate technological processes in the organization to improve overall efficiency. Facilitates discussions and follows a structured approach to plan, elicit, analyze, document, communicate and manage requirements with stakeholders. Provides analytical support and insights. Identifies opportunities to strengthen business analysis capability, such as: sharing expertise to promote technical development, mentoring employees, building communities of practice and networks across BMO. Stays abreast of industry technical and business trends through participation in professional associations, practice communities & individual learning. Focus may be on a business/group. Thinks creatively and proposes new solutions. Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules. Works mostly independently. Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed. Qualifications: Typically between 3 – 5 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Possesses analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. Demonstrates applied knowledge of one or more analysis and problem decomposition technique. Understands complete Software Development Life Cycle and can apply the applicable portions of the ‘Feasibility,’ ‘Requirements,” and ‘Analysis’ phases. Demonstrates writing and documentation skills. Understands and can explain to others the core processes involved in their area of support. Specialized knowledge from education and/or business experience. Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth. Collaboration & team skills - In-depth. Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth. Influence skills - In-depth. We’re here to help At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world. As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset. To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en . BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.
jobdescription.9: Company Description Are You Looking for a Great Place to Work? #Jointhegame Leader in the development and publishing of mobile games, Gameloft® has established itself as one of the top innovators in its field since 2000. Gameloft creates games for all digital platforms, two of which are featured in the “Top 10 Games by All-Time Worldwide Downloads” from App Annie. Gameloft operates its own established franchises such as Asphalt®, Order & Chaos, Modern Combat and Dungeon Hunter and also partners with major rights holders including Universal, Illumination Entertainment, Disney®, Marvel®, Hasbro®, Fox Digital Entertainment, Mattel® and Ferrari®. Gameloft distributes its games in over 100 countries and employs 4,600 people worldwide. Every month, 114 million unique users can be reached by advertisers in Gameloft games with Gameloft Advertising Solutions, a leading B2B offering dedicated to brands and agencies. Gameloft is a Vivendi company. All trademarks referenced above are owned by their respective trademark owners.  Job Description As Game Data Analyst at Gameloft Toronto, you’ll be working with some of the best talents in the world from hit games and franchises including Disney Magic Kingdoms, Uno & Friends and Lego Legacy: Heroes Unboxed which were created in this studio. From the beginning of your journey with us you will:Evaluate business tracking needsSupport data collection and validate the accuracy of collected dataAnalyze player data to assist with customer careDevelop scripts to identify abnormal behaviorConduct analysis to make product recommendations to production teams  Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in related field, or equivalent professional experienceExperience with commercial mobile analytic tools, such as Google Analytics or TableauExperience with writing SQL queries for large data setsExperience with PythonProfessional experience in game development is an assetC++ programming skill is an assetExcellent English communication skillsA passion for video games Additional Information What we offer: Work From Home wherever you are located for an undetermined time due to the Covid-19 Pandemic Flexible working hours to suit your schedule 3 weeks’ vacation for work- life-balance Health insurance coverage Employee Assistance Program; because sometimes we need a helping hand Social Club events with awesome prizes and giveaways Mentorship program and Training Subsidies to help you strengthen your skills or learn something new Relocation assistance for those who are joining our team from abroad Why join the Gameloft universe? Because you want to be part of an exceptional experience, within a company that is constantly growing! Because you want to work with talented people who are industry pioneers! Because you want to join a global company and meet great people around the world from all walks of life. Or, just because you’re looking for a great place to work! We can’t wait to find our next great talent! Please submit your CV, cover letter or portfolio (if applicable) Please note that only selected candidates will be contacted and your CV will be saved in our files for a period of 6 months. Gameloft Toronto is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to fostering diversity and inclusivity within our work environment. Gameloft Toronto welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Code: #LI-RD2

jobdescription.11: At the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, we are working to create a world without disease. Transforming lives by finding new and better ways to prevent, intercept, treat and cure disease inspires us. We bring together the best minds and pursue the most promising science. We are Janssen. We collaborate with the world for the health of everyone in it. Learn more at www.janssen.com and follow us @JanssenGlobal. Janssen Inc. is part of the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies. Digital & Data Science is one of the critical capability levers within our J&J Supply Chain’s Strategy, Innovation & Deployment (SI&D) innovation engine that is essential to building the world’s best supply chain. As our Digital & Data Science team continues to double-down on fact-based management – illuminating greater visibility and analytical capabilities across the key metrics that will drive growth for our business – we must ensure that our energy, resources, capabilities and talented employees are best-aligned to the evolving needs of our business and our customers. The Data Operations team sits within the Digital & Data Science organization with specific accountabilities related to Master Data Management in our global ERP systems, to enable the effective execution of the Supply Chain business activities. Our role is to deliver trusted data to enable the launch & supply of products to our customers. Our key accountabilities include: delivering and maintaining a data operating model that ensures adequate governance that optimizes data quality, timeliness, and effort; applying end-to-end data knowledge and unique insights to drive innovative customer solutions; building scalable partnerships with suppliers to be adaptable to changing needs and demands; utilizing technology to drive innovative data operations solutions; and developing our talent as a distinctive capability. This position will monitor and execute day-to-day operations to support the strategy of the Data Operations function across franchises/business units. Will lead small projects. Will develop solutions to a variety of problems of moderate to fairly intricate scope and complexity, while referring to established policies and procedures. Responsibilities: Monitor and execute the data operations and data quality process. May include coordination of testing, error handling, data conversion and/or validation, and audit/compliance actions (Non-Conformance (NC) and/or Corrective Action Preventive Action (CAPA)). Provide tactical direction to third party team(s) and function as first level escalation. Continuous improvement of existing data design, process and templates by tactically focusing on business outcomes. Implement and monitor tools and processes that maximize data operations execution. Engage with stakeholders on tactical matters. Function as Subject Matter Expert/Data Governance Lead for workstream or functional area. Provide appropriate guidance on data operations. May include completion of complex change assessments and/or project scoping requirements, point of escalation for both internal and external team members, single point of contact for strategic launches and audit/compliance activities, participate in and sometimes lead operational meetings with data owners. Prepare metrics, dashboards, and tracking to facilitate the efficient operations of the Data Operations department. May execute budget and/or value capture protocol within established framework Participate in, and sometimes lead, operational and governance meetings which may include end-to-end, value capture, and third party reviews. Contribute to the creation and maintenance of documentation for area of responsibility. May include Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), Work Instructions (WIs), protocols, data quality catalogs, and other policy and procedure documents. Develop and deliver training to educate stakeholders on documented procedures, data flows, etc. Support the deployment of the Data Management Framework (Governance Maturity Roadmap).  Qualifications  A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience. 4 years of relevant professional business experience along with a minimum of 4 years of data management experience in the context of large ERP platforms is required. Supply chain experience, preferably in master data, operations, or cross-functional business environment. Business and technical knowledge and understanding of all Supply Chain data elements, process, and organizational support models. (E.g. SAP and/or JDE, Winshuttle, Data Quality). A relevant mix of global, regional, cross-sector/industry experience. MS Office Suite (Excel, Outlook, Word). Strong written, oral, and presentation skills. Excellent organizational and prioritization skills. Ability to build strong collaborative relationships, influence multiple stakeholders, and establish common goals and objectives without sacrificing outcomes. Ability to contribute on a diverse, multicultural and remote team. Ability to work in a matrix environment where priorities change rapidly, and tight deadlines exist. This position may require up to 5% of domestic and international (US) travel. Diversity and inclusion are central elements of the shared culture across the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies. Attracting, developing and retaining a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities is essential to our success. We are committed to providing a respectful, inclusive and accessible work environment where all employees have the opportunity to achieve their potential.  Primary Location Canada-Ontario-Markham-200 Whitehall Drive Other Locations United States-Massachusetts-Raynham, United States-New Jersey-Piscataway, United States-Pennsylvania-West Chester, Canada-Ontario-Markham, Canada-Ontario-Toronto, Canada-Ontario-Guelph Organization Janssen Inc. (7710) Job Function Operations Requisition ID 2105903113W
jobdescription.13: Adresse : 234 Simcoe Street Groupe de famille d'emploi : Analyses données et rapports Creates a culture where data is managed as a valuable corporate asset. Provides input to, and follows, data governance standards and processes to improve the quality of BMO data and reduce overall data risk for the designated business/group. Develops and implements data strategies, tactics, products and a curated data model to achieve business objectives. Reviews, designs and implements data governance practices and data management processes within the business/group in alignment with Enterprise Data Governance Operating Directive. Provides guidance on the interpretation of enterprise data governance policies and maintains alignment between data governance practices and the data strategy. Develops data solutions and makes recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs. Supports the assessment, root cause analysis, and formulating proposed solutions/remediation strategies. Performs data profiling and data analyses. Documents and maintains data flow specifications. Conducts needs assessments, identifies gaps and provides suggestions to improve and streamline data management processes based on operational insights. Contributes to the development of business/group data strategies and data governance policies, procedures, and processes. Develops stakeholder communications and training in support of data management process implementation. Supports the resolution of data issues by coordinating stakeholders in the information chain. Performs quality assurance activities to ensure handling, storage, and collection of data complies with Bank Policy and regulatory requirements. Supports the management of BMO’s data as a key asset that facilitates effective decision making. Analyzes structured and unstructured data to support the design and development of a business / group curated data model. Provides advice and guidance to assigned business/group on implementation of data solutions. Identifies and implements the optimum means to collect, process, analyze and report on information and ensure ongoing accuracy, integrity and security. Participates in the timely resolution of operating/technical problems or manages escalation with other BMO technical support groups. Assists in the identification of change impacts through requirements gathering, mapping and documenting current and proposed processes. Provides support to projects and/or manages operational changes including supporting Technology with the validation and testing of systems. Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide insights and recommendations. Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders and ensures alignment. Supports development and execution of strategic initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders. Focus is primarily on Finance and Enterprise Risk Management. Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules. Works independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unique situations. Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed. Qualifications: Typically between 1 - 4 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Skilled in database environments (e.g. Hadoop, Netezza, Oracle). Skilled in working with BI tools such as PowerBI, relational databases and Hadoop-based data mining frameworks. Proficient in working with SQL Technical proficiency gained through education and/or business experience. Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth. Collaboration & team skills - In-depth. Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth. Influence skills - In-depth. Data driven decision making - In-depth. Ici, pour vous. À BMO, nous sommes animés par une raison d’être commune : Avoir le cran de faire une différence dans la vie, comme en affaires. Cette raison d’être nous invite à entraîner des changements positifs et durables pour nos clients, nos collectivités et nos gens. En travaillant ensemble, en innovant et en repoussant les limites, nous transformons des vies et des entreprises et favorisons la croissance économique partout dans le monde. En tant que membre de l'équipe de BMO, vous êtes valorisé, respecté et entendu, et vous avez plus de moyens pour progresser et obtenir des résultats. Nous nous efforçons de vous aider à obtenir des résultats dès le premier jour, pour vous-même et nos clients. Nous vous offrirons les outils et les ressources dont vous avez besoin pour franchir de nouvelles étapes, car vous aidez nos clients à franchir les leurs. Au moyen de formation et de coaching approfondis ainsi que de soutien de la direction et d'occasions de réseautage, nous vous aiderons à acquérir une expérience enrichissante et à élargir votre groupe de compétences. Pour en savoir plus, visitez-nous à l'adresse https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/fr . BMO s'engage à offrir un milieu de travail inclusif, équitable et accessible. Nous apprenons de nos différences et tirons notre force des gens et de leurs différents points de vue. Des mesures d’adaptation sont disponibles sur demande pour les candidats qui participent à tous les aspects du processus de sélection. Pour demander des mesures d’adaptation, veuillez communiquer avec votre recruteur.
jobdescription.14: Minimum qualifications:  Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 3 years of experience in sales operations, FP&A, consulting, sales strategy or similar analytical role. Experience with SQL. Preferred qualifications:  Experience extracting and manipulating large, complex datasets with SQL. Ability to create and foster cross-functional networks. Ability to be proactive and flexible, and work in a fast-paced or unstructured environment. Ability to navigate ambiguity and bring clarity and structure with limited direction while balancing competing priorities and deliverables. Excellent leadership and influencing skills, including the ability to work with senior-level stakeholders or clients. Excellent analytical and communication skills, with the ability to construct and articulate simple and impactful messages/insights from complex analysis. About the job The Google Cloud Sales Strategy and Operations team plays an important role in Google Cloud, acting as trusted advisors to the Sales Organization, partnering with Sales, Customer Engineering, Finance, Marketing, Partners and the Professional Sales Organization to together plan, strategize and run the business in a transformational way. As a Sales Strategy and Operations Analyst, you will support the Regional Sales Strategy and Operations Managers by leveraging your data extraction skills to generate reports and analysis, providing insights that support decision making and help define, land and execute on our key strategic priorities for the region. You will work on increasing efficiency by creating and simplifying processes and supporting training, communications and enablement to sales. You will be responsible for running the business cadence, helping the organization navigate the complexities of systems and tools, as well as collaborating with cross-functional Google Cloud teams to solve problems, design, manage and successfully deliver projects against high operational standards. Google Cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure, platform capabilities and industry solutions. We deliver enterprise-grade cloud solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology to help companies operate more efficiently and adapt to changing needs, giving customers a foundation for the future. Customers in more than 150 countries turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems. Responsibilities Be the subject matter expert from data to process to our internal customers, structure and communicate complex, ambiguous, and challenging business issues to advise the Google Cloud Sales leadership team. Provide strategic, analytical and day to day operational activities support for the Regional Sales Strategy and Operations Team. Perform large-scale data analysis and modeling to identify trends and efficiency opportunities. Build and maintain tools and dashboards to help with reporting and analytical needs of the team and key stakeholders. Engage in ad-hoc analyses to understand business performance/user metrics, Key Performance Indicators and provide concise summaries and recommendations to management. Identify process gaps and opportunities for process improvement. Partner with Google Cloud business teams to define and solve problems/opportunities that impact the sales organization. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
jobdescription.16: About SuMO: Enterprise Service & Operations Management is what we do. All day. Every Day. As the First Canadian-owned ServiceNow ELITE Services & Sales partner, we've been steadily growing for years and aren't slowing down yet! With ServiceNow having 2 major releases a year & 9 solution areas, we have multiple projects going all the time and you can be assured that your skills will be tested and honed. Role Overview: As the Business Analyst you will serve as the ultimate facilitator between the client and SuMO in truly understanding the client’s needs and playing a key role in the overall management and success of a project through the entire project lifecycle. Using proven methods and tools, you will lead the planning, eliciting, analyzing, validating and managing of requirements, business processes, high-level solution design, test case design, and implementation planning & support - in partnership with Engagement Managers, client Stakeholders, and technical consultants. You will work on projects that use Waterfall, Agile Scrum and hybrid delivery methods. Responsibilities: Collect, review, analyze, manage, system and user requirements from business users Form a partnership with the client business teams to deeply understand their business in order to enable the capture of clear, concise, and correct user stories Bridge the gap between business and technology, ensuring common understanding and technology/Business alignment of both functional (for business needs) and non-functional requirements (quality attributes, scalability, interfaces, constraints, etc.) Convey business requirements and design concepts with models such as gap analysis, use cases, prototypes, etc. as appropriate Responsible for creating, refining, and maintaining functional requirements/user stories/use cases and associated deliverables – process flows, test cases, etc. – to meet development and stakeholder needs Provide project management support using approved project management processes, tools, and techniques Manage the UAT process by performing smoke testing, test case validation, and obtaining business approvals on UAT for scheduled deployments. Contribute to a collaborative team environment by information sharing and team cooperation Required Skills: We are looking for high performing individuals who are: Agile and innovative individuals, who can manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold and strategic moves in this rapidly evolving environment Creative thinkers who take initiative and are capable of building, launching and managing projects/programs that drive results for our customers Problem solvers with the ability to analyze and prioritize to meet the client’s business objectives Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward What You’ve Done: University degree in Commerce/Business Administration, Applied/Computer Science, or equivalent Minimum of 5 years of experience in a Business Analyst role in a Waterfall, Agile or hybrid project-based environment Nice To Have - Fluent in ServiceNow or Service Management technology Strong knowledge of project and software development methodologies/techniques Solid presentation, facilitation, interview, and workshop skills Strong interpersonal, negotiation, and conflict-management skills Ability to work on multiple projects at the same time and under tight deadlines Ability to navigate ambiguity, overcome confusion, and simplify complex situations Proficient in developing requirements definition, functional specifications, test scenarios/scripts, data models and business procedures. Strong process flow and diagramming skills (Visio application) Creation and delivery of training materials Exposure to managing the testing disciplines (use of Quality Center tool) Strong interpersonal skills; strong relationship management and negotiation skills. Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills. Strong communication skills - verbal, written, listening and presentation. Business Analyst certification, IIBA, PMI – (PBA), or equivalent – Nice to Have What’s in it for you? We’re different. We recognize that you have opportunities in front of you but here’s what makes SuMO different and a great place to work: ELITE Partner status- What does this mean for you? It means that you get to work with large global customers on cutting-edge projects. It also means that you get to be on the cutting edge of technology and solutions – not just doing the same thing every day. A collaborative team – With experts across the country providing support for you so you know that we will have your back. Investment In YOU- We will ensure that you are equipped with everything you need in terms of Training, Certifications, and Accreditations so that you positioned for success at SuMO and for your career ahead.  Benefits & Culture– Competitive compensation including Profit Sharing. Work-life balance is also important to us as is hanging out with your colleagues at company events. If this sounds like it could be a home for you, send us your resume. We’d love to talk. We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted. You must be legally entitled to work for any employer in Canada. AjgB4doo5F
jobdescription.17: Business Analyst - Data Center Consolidation Program On behalf of our client in the Banking Sector, PROCOM is looking for a Business Analyst - Data Center Consolidation Program. Business Analyst - Data Center Consolidation Program – Job Description Data Center Consolidation Program – consolidating 7 data centers in the GTA to 2 co-location facilities. BA will help develop the business case that has to go through 3 levels of approval – including the board. Will be required to put presentation together, financial materials, and all other components requires that go into a program of 100MM. Engaging the project team, technical teams, vendors, all to establish the cost model for the program Working with different resources to identify the costs that are needed to be captured, validated that the standard quotes are comply Interface with finance group and broader finance group to ensure everyone is aligned on what the financials look like Interface with project management office, divisional PMO, enterprise PMO to address financial Building financial model and socializing  Business Analyst - Data Center Consolidation Program – Mandatory Skills 4+ Years – Business Analyst Experience with a strong Financial Acumen – Understanding how to develop a financial model that goes into a business case for approval. 4+ Years - Financial Project Experience – managing large projects with budget of $50MM minimum. Microsoft Suite Product Experience Independent – very important Experience dealing with managers of all different types of seniority Time management – yours and others Communication Sills Bachelor's degree in technical or business field  Business Analyst - Data Center Consolidation Program – Nice to Have Skills Involved in Data Center Migrations/Consolidations Banking/FI Experience  Business Analyst - Data Center Consolidation Program - Assignment Start Date ASAP – 6 months to start Business Analyst - Data Center Consolidation Program - Assignment Location Toronto, ON – Work Remotely
jobdescription.18: If you are an ambitious, curious, hard-working, and seasoned energy professional, this is an exciting new opportunity for you to join the Rodan Energy team – an organization that has been recognized as one of Canada’s Top Small & Medium Employers for three years in a row.  Rodan Energy is a top North American energy services company, quickly growing to serve our clients across North America. We are a leader in distributed energy resource asset optimization, demand response, energy management and intelligence systems, and power systems engineering and metering services. Our innovative solutions are designed for large commercial and industrial energy users as well as power distribution and generation companies. We focus on minimizing energy costs while maximizing efficiencies and corporate sustainability for our clients. Our goal is a sustainable energy future.  We have an opportunity for a Senior Meter Data Analyst based out of our head office in Mississauga. As an integral member of the Information Services team, the Senior Meter Data Analyst will be responsible for Meter data management services for retail, wholesale, and Meter Service Provider (MSP) clients including remote meter interrogation, data collection, verification and posting using meter interrogation software.  Your responsibilities include:  Administration of the Meter Trouble Report (MTR) process; communicating, coordinating, and assisting, customers and the Independent Electricity System Operator (IESO) Schedule MV-90-meter interrogation cycles to ensure availability of metered data and to avoid conflict with IESO reading cycles. Program meters and configure telemetry and communication devices. Configuration of equipment for real-time and near real-time telemetry using sources such as Modbus, DNP 3.0, and KYZ pulses. Interface with other metering service providers, meter data management agencies and clients regarding the provision of metering services, metering installations and metering data. Interface with the IESO for new meter installations, meter upgrades, meter deregistration, and other issues. Interface with field staff, prior to and during commissioning of meter installations and commencement of meter data collection. Maintain the metering database and ensure the accuracy and confidentiality of the data contained therein. Support Rodan staff with audit and technical proposals, engineering drawings and design, order processing, project management, MSP site registration, installation and commissioning, meter trouble reports and maintenance.  Key qualifications:  Post-secondary education from an accredited college or university and/or prior related work experience ideally in utility metering or billing. Experience working with data collection and/or settlement systems particularly Itron MV-90 software. Strong proficiency with MS Office, specifically MS Excel. Macro and VB scripting skills is considered an asset. Comprehensive knowledge of electrical principals, terminology, function, SLDs, and interpretation of electrical measuring instruments. Experience in networking and telecommunications. Knowledge of communications protocols, firewalls, TCP/IP. Strong customer service orientation and ability to work in a collaborative environment. Solid analytical and problem-solving skills with strong attention to detail and accuracy. Excellent verbal and written communication skills.  Rodan Energy is strongly committed to diversity and equality of opportunity. We strive to create an environment that is welcoming and inclusive for everyone.  We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
jobdescription.19: IO’s Finance, Technology, and Lending Enterprise Team ensures that IO is a financially efficient and effectively managed organization and that the agency’s finances are monitored, reported, and managed appropriately. The team also manages the infrastructure lending program, which has supported more than $18 billion in local infrastructure development, and IO’s Information Technology and Business Services, providing tools and systems to ensure secure, effective, and efficient operations. Position Purpose: In this role, the Senior Database Analyst will be in charge of developing, implementing and maintaining the organization’s data, reporting, and information strategy ensuring compatibility with the overall business strategy of the organization. The position is also expected to lead and provide mentorship to other members of the team on tasks associated to data warehousing, data integration processes and Report Tools. What You Will Do: Provide database architecture expertise and data related software solutions to IO business units. Provide technical leadership across a broad range of data analysis functions including data modeling, structured query language (SQL), data quality, data profiling and other specialized data management functions. Participate in developing specifications, products, services, applications, conversions, implementation plans, and other features associated with the implementation and deployment of the organizational data infrastructure. Implement data ingestion and ETL (Extract, Transform and Load) processes for data integration with SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) and Azure Data Factory (ADF). Make recommendations on how to optimize, rewrite, modify and redesign SQL and ETL based processes based on analysis. Implement and deploy reporting solutions utilizing technologies sanctioned by IO IT such as SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) and Power BI. Look into ways to revamp, optimize and upgrade the current data infrastructure by employing latest cloud technologies with Azure platform. Work directly with IT Business Analysts, Developers, and external third party partners to build and support the integrations. Work directly with Business Analysts, Software Developers, and business teams to document report requirements, develop reporting solutions, and support within the production environment. Work closely with the Infrastructure team and any third party managed services providers to ensure standards are applied and regular database administration tasks are successfully performed. Support integration points across different applications in organization with Microsoft BizTalk. Who We’re Looking For: A post-secondary degree in Information Systems combined with a minimum of 5 years of experience in information systems with a background in database development and business analysis. Experience with technologies including SQL Server Enterprise Edition (SSIS, SSRS, SSAS), SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), Visual Studio Data Tools, and Azure Dev Ops is required. Knowledge of OLAP, Tabular Model, and data warehousing methodologies is required. Experience in structured methodologies for the design, development, implementation and maintenance of software applications. Experience in systems design and a solid understanding of development, testing, evaluation procedures, quality assurance, and integration methodologies. Exposure to cloud-based data solution such as Azure data platform and Power BI is considered a critical asset. Experience managing projects related to new systems development, the integration of legacy systems with new systems, data and information management and process re-engineering is considered an asset. Strong oral and written communication skills in order to establish and maintain client relationships. Infrastructure Ontario is an inclusive employer, we encourage applications from all qualified candidates. We will accommodate your needs under the Ontario Human Rights Code. We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. By submitting your application you are granting Infrastructure Ontario permission to process your personal data during the recruitment process and for keeping records of the process. Infrastructure Ontario may share your personal data internally to appropriate persons involved in the recruitment process and to third parties where there is an administrative or lawful basis for doing so. Provided that Infrastructure Ontario does not have any lawful reason to continue processing your personal data, you may make a formal request to rectify, erase or restrict (the processing of) your personal data.
jobdescription.21: Job Description:  The main purpose of this job is to be in a position to answer business questions from all areas of the Parts & Service division using our vast amount of data available. Working with our Data Management team, you will mine our data, find business insights and work with the different business groups in making sound business decisions based on those insights. RESPONSIBILITIES: Data Analysis Developing reports on conclusions of data analysis Conducting problem definition sessions to elicit defined use cases for data analysis Interfacing with leadership Support Activities QUALIFICATIONS: Completed post-secondary education specializing in Math, Stats, Engineering or Analytics is required Relevant technical certification or experience for the role Working experience using statistical tools and language (Python, R or other relevant tools as they become available in open source) Ability to identify and develop strategies to work with different personality types Ability to build & grow working relationships Conversant and knowledgeable about a variety of technologies (what they do, how they work, how do they get used, how do they integrate with each other) Conversant about where the industry is going, latest trends, significant developments Positive, win/win attitude Strong collaboration skills, usage of collaborative tools/systems Team player (know when to lead & know when to follow) Expert level working experience in Excel Experience creating engaging data driven presentations Strong communication skills both verbal and written Honda Canada Inc. is committed to providing accommodation in its recruitment processes to applicants with disabilities, upon request. The accommodation will take into account the applicant's accessibility needs. If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process please email Human Resources at accessibility@honda.ca or call (905)888-4331. #LI-POST
jobdescription.22: At the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, we are working to create a world without disease. Transforming lives by finding new and better ways to prevent, intercept, treat and cure disease inspires us. We bring together the best minds and pursue the most promising science. We are Janssen. We collaborate with the world for the health of everyone in it. Learn more at www.janssen.com and follow us @JanssenGlobal. Janssen Inc. is part of the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies. Digital & Data Science is one of the critical capability levers within our J&J Supply Chain’s Strategy, Innovation & Deployment (SI&D) innovation engine that is essential to building the world’s best supply chain. As our Digital & Data Science team continues to double-down on fact-based management – illuminating greater visibility and analytical capabilities across the key metrics that will drive growth for our business – we must ensure that our energy, resources, capabilities and talented employees are best-aligned to the evolving needs of our business and our customers. The Data Operations team sits within the Digital & Data Science organization with specific accountabilities related to Master Data Management in our global ERP systems, to enable the effective execution of the Supply Chain business activities. Our role is to deliver trusted data to enable the launch & supply of products to our customers. Our key accountabilities include: delivering and maintaining a data operating model that ensures adequate governance that optimizes data quality, timeliness, and effort; applying end-to-end data knowledge and unique insights to drive innovative customer solutions; building scalable partnerships with suppliers to be adaptable to changing needs and demands; utilizing technology to drive innovative data operations solutions; and developing our talent as a distinctive capability. This position will monitor and execute day-to-day operations to support the strategy of the Data Operations function across franchises/business units. Will lead small projects. Will develop solutions to a variety of problems of moderate to fairly intricate scope and complexity, while referring to established policies and procedures. Responsibilities: Monitor and execute the data operations and data quality process. May include coordination of testing, error handling, data conversion and/or validation, and audit/compliance actions (Non-Conformance (NC) and/or Corrective Action Preventive Action (CAPA)). Provide tactical direction to third party team(s) and function as first level escalation. Continuous improvement of existing data design, process and templates by tactically focusing on business outcomes. Implement and monitor tools and processes that maximize data operations execution. Engage with stakeholders on tactical matters. Function as Subject Matter Expert/Data Governance Lead for workstream or functional area. Provide appropriate guidance on data operations. May include completion of complex change assessments and/or project scoping requirements, point of escalation for both internal and external team members, single point of contact for strategic launches and audit/compliance activities, participate in and sometimes lead operational meetings with data owners. Prepare metrics, dashboards, and tracking to facilitate the efficient operations of the Data Operations department. May execute budget and/or value capture protocol within established framework Participate in, and sometimes lead, operational and governance meetings which may include end-to-end, value capture, and third party reviews. Contribute to the creation and maintenance of documentation for area of responsibility. May include Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), Work Instructions (WIs), protocols, data quality catalogs, and other policy and procedure documents. Develop and deliver training to educate stakeholders on documented procedures, data flows, etc. Support the deployment of the Data Management Framework (Governance Maturity Roadmap).  Qualifications  A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience. 4 years of relevant professional business experience along with a minimum of 4 years of data management experience in the context of large ERP platforms is required. Supply chain experience, preferably in master data, operations, or cross-functional business environment. Business and technical knowledge and understanding of all Supply Chain data elements, process, and organizational support models. (E.g. SAP and/or JDE, Winshuttle, Data Quality). A relevant mix of global, regional, cross-sector/industry experience. MS Office Suite (Excel, Outlook, Word). Strong written, oral, and presentation skills. Excellent organizational and prioritization skills. Ability to build strong collaborative relationships, influence multiple stakeholders, and establish common goals and objectives without sacrificing outcomes. Ability to contribute on a diverse, multicultural and remote team. Ability to work in a matrix environment where priorities change rapidly, and tight deadlines exist. This position may require up to 5% of domestic and international (US) travel. Diversity and inclusion are central elements of the shared culture across the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies. Attracting, developing and retaining a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities is essential to our success. We are committed to providing a respectful, inclusive and accessible work environment where all employees have the opportunity to achieve their potential.  Primary Location Canada-Ontario-Markham-200 Whitehall Drive Other Locations United States-New Jersey-Piscataway, United States-Pennsylvania-West Chester, United States-Massachusetts-Raynham, Canada-Ontario-Markham, Canada-Ontario-Toronto, Canada-Ontario-Guelph Organization Janssen Inc. (7710) Job Function Operations Requisition ID 2105903113W
jobdescription.24: The Access to Care Program (ATC) is responsible for the IM/IT initiatives that support the Ontario Wait Time Strategy and the Patient First Act. ATC manages the Wait Time Information System (WTIS) which captures wait times for surgical data from facilities across Ontario. ATC also oversees the Surgical Efficiency Targets Program (SETP) which supports the measurement and reporting of Operating Room performance across the province. This information is used by the Ministry of Health and Long-Term Care (ministry), Local Health Integration Networks (LHINs)/regions, facilities, and other stakeholders to inform performance improvement strategies for reducing wait times and improving efficiencies for surgical services in Ontario.  The Senior Business Analyst (SBA) role for Surgery is responsible for supporting the Surgical Information Program and the Group Manager within Access to Care at Ontario Health. The SBA will work closely with a team of other analysts, clinicians, and key stakeholders to support management of high-profile provincial projects. The SBA will perform key issues analysis with efficient and effective coordination of business processes and utilizing both the surgical wait time and surgical efficiency data sets. Here is what you will be doing:  Support complex projects with key partners and stakeholders; Provide business analysis on key issues and related processes using both quantitative and qualitative data. Provide quality assurance review on team work with attention to detail when reviewing materials; Developing and enhancing business process maps and related methodologies. Performing assignments and special projects in support of departmental objectives, often developing and assisting in implementation of solutions to unique or highly complex business problems; Responding to business inquiries, creating reusable inquiry documentation, and keeping documentation updated related assigned projects or initiatives. Here is what you will need to be successful:  Education and Experience  Bachelor’s degree in Health Informatics, Business, Computer Science or related discipline, or equivalent experience is required; Minimum five years of business experience required (e.g. a role on an information technology project, collaborating with stakeholders, or experience working in a hospital setting with clinicians); Demonstrates strong knowledge of advanced analytics techniques including statistical analytics; Subject matter knowledge within surgical wait times and efficiencies in Ontario, and national/international trends and best practices is an asset; A Masters level degree in one of the above disciplines is an asset. Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Project, Visio, MS Teams and Excel required. Experience in collecting/documenting information related to operational and performance reporting; Experience collecting and documenting business processes and information flows; Attributes  Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple tasks and deadlines required; Strong communication, both written and verbal, comprehension and listening skills; Demonstrated knowledge and use of business analysis methodologies and tools; Highly organized with the capacity to prioritize and complete multiple tasks effectively; Ability to work with minimal supervision and is an effective team member and contributor; Must be team-oriented, possess a positive attitude and work well with others; Employment Type: Permanent full-time 37.5 hours ** Note- The posting title may differ slightly from the official title presented at the time of offer. We thank all applicants for their interest in the role, however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Job Posting Close Date: March 20, 2021
jobdescription.25: We are looking for a Business Analyst - Analytics for our Banking client in Toronto. This is a contract role.Responsibilities:Create clear technical and process documentation in English requiring the use of process mapping softwareWork closely with developers and IT staff to troubleshoot system issues and respond to client requestsWork with project owners and analysts during system design to determine needs and to plan solutionsPrepare system documentation, user guides and other supporting materialsQualifications:Should have previous experience client data & analytics as a BA, but focused more on reporting and visualization of metrics rather than generating client insights.Knowledge of Equities is neededExperience with various BI toolsJob Types: Full-time, ContractSalary: $0.00 per hourSchedule:Monday to FridayExperience:Equities: 2 years (Preferred)Work remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19COVID-19 precaution(s):Remote interview process
jobdescription.26: We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients. At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute. To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com Job Description What You’ll Be Doing Developing data quality Dashboards and Scorecards within Tableau to monitor Risk Data Integrity and KPIs/KRIs for the Risk Data Management Office. Partnering with Risk Management and Technology stakeholders to document, test and implement data quality fixes for Risk Data. Assisting in the execution of controls related to the integrity of risk data. Conduct ongoing data quality reviews and ensure that new initiatives meet the standards required to support the business unit’s objectives and overall controls. Managing the processes and procedures around overall Risk Data Management for the RDMO including the data controls, issue, intake and service management and overall governance documentation. Oversee the monthly loading and reconciliation of Operational Losses for the Enterprise and ensuring the integrity of the data captured within the Operational Risk System. How You’ll Succeed Data driven - Give meaning to large sets of data and aggregate information from multiple sources to summarize it into a meaningful ensemble. Continuous improvement mindset: Strong focus on process improvement. Regularly identify, develop and implement operational process enhancements with the goal of improving efficiencies and synergies between internal and external partners. Communication and Relationship Management - You get things done, but it is always done in collaboration with your peers and stakeholders. You will be a trusted advisor to stakeholders across the organization by understanding their needs, and presenting a credible and compelling plan that meets those needs. You will leverage your ability to adapt your communications style to lead working level project discussions as well as preparing management level presentations and briefings. Critical Thinking - Apply critical thinking, creativity and sound judgement to identify issues and opportunities. You can sort through complex and ambiguous scenarios to understand root causes and make tough but reasoned choices between competing alternatives and opinions. You seek to understand before proposing solutions and although you intuitively know something doesn’t make sense, you rely on data and fact to inform decisions and recommendations rather than opinion. Openly and frequently share your knowledge, ideas and views because you know your perspective matters. Who You Are You can demonstrate experience in building scorecards and dashboards with tools like Tableau. You have good coding skills, and have used SQL to extract and transform data for the purpose of producing reports for internal and external use. It's an asset if you have experience with visualization tools like Tableau and Cognos. If you have a STEM undergraduate degree, then it will be considered an asset as well. You love to learn. You're passionate about growing your knowledge, and you know that there is no limit to what you can achieve. You act like an owner. You thrive when you're empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results. You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You're confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way. You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don't. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making. Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability. What CIBC Offers At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will: Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan What You Need to Know CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit Expected End Date 2021-03-02 Job Location Toronto-CC East 13th Floor Employment Type Regular Weekly Hours 37.5
jobdescription.27: The Opportunity  Job Posting Number:  2021-055 (TEMP)  Position:  Temporary Business Analyst – 12 Month Contract  Location:  Vaughan (Cityview)  Reports to:  Head, Grid Innovation  Business Unit:  GRE&T Centre  Division:  Grid Innovation  Hours per Week:  35  Rate of Pay:  Commensurate with range and candidate’s experience  Number of Openings:  #1  Union:  No  Open:  March 4, 2021  Close:  March 18, 2021   Position Purpose:  The Alectra Green Energy & Technology Centre (GRE&T Centre) makes energy innovations come to life by identifying, evaluating, developing and accelerating the commercialization of emerging, clean, and customer-friendly energy solutions, creating sustainable values for customers, shareholders and communities it serves. The Grid Innovation team at the GRE&T Centre is focused on enabling a more sustainable electricity grid, by unleashing the potential of grid modernization technologies and integrating distributed energy resources (DERs) into local electricity grid. The Business Analyst will provide support to the project initiatives undertaken by Grid Innovation team. The incumbent will work closely with the Grid Innovation team and provide technical support in delivering pilot projects such as Non-Wires alternative (“NWA”) project aimed at designing and operating local distribution energy market that enables distributed energy resources (DER) to participate in grid services; defer or reduce the need for wires investment on distribution grid.  Responsibilities:  Participate in daily project development meeting with the software system vendor; document, update and maintain issues tracking system, capturing live issues and progress on software development. Analyze business functional requirements to identify information, procedures, and business rules; review and update functional specification documents as necessary to ensure it is up-to-date and address business requirement changes. Assist with the solution design discussion including database structure, user interface, customer experience etc. Ensure that changes and features to the system development are properly submitted, updated, assigned, escalated in the current development ticketing system. Create, deliver, and maintain user stories, process workflows, mockups and system test cases. Conduct user acceptance testing, system integration testing, regression testing and all other Q&A testing, ensuring system is functioning as designed. Discover, record and log system issues, defects and resolutions; participate in debug solutioning, fix and QA testing. Identify areas for improvement and make appropriate recommendations to the project team pertaining to best practices, processes, templates, workflows and methodologies. Coordinate and support the project teammates and management to ensure alignment of projects and timelines. Ensure deliverables and feedback needed by project team and vendor software development teams are provided in a timely manner to ensure overall delivery of projects on-time and within budget. Collaborate and interact with a variety of team members and business units to coordinate project activities; perform demos and customers/users support to the system. Perform qualitative and quantitative analysis of new and existing data sets and research reports, including advanced modelling and analysis through Excel or similar tools, and develop recommendations based on findings. Develop written reports and presentations as required to communicate project updates, share research findings and provide topical backgrounders for internal and external stakeholders. Maintain collaborative working relationships with vendor project team members and support collective efforts on projects delivery. Provide project support as needed to support the achievement of departmental objectives and other initiatives being carried on within the GRE&T Centre Other duties as assigned  Education & Specialized Knowledge:  Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science or related discipline from an accredited institution field Direct experience with both classical waterfall software development lifecycle (SDLC) and agile methodologies (i.e. scrum) High level of proficiency with MS Office applications including MS Project, Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Visio, etc. General knowledge of the energy markets and utility industries  Experience:  Minimum of 3 years of business analyst or related work experience demonstrating the range of duties expected for this position Experience in Azure DevOps system environment Experience in project management on web-based software development project Knowledge of energy policy and regulation, especially related to distributed energy resources is a strong asset Experience working in Energy/Utility and/or Data Analytics sector is a strong asset  Skills/Abilities/Competencies:  Strong analytical, problem resolution, technical, application / system troubleshooting skills with the ability to think clearly and resolve issues efficiently under pressure. Excellent organizational and time management skills with high attention to detail in a demanding, deadline-driven environment. Ability to successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously. Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and collaborate effectively with other team members as needed. Excellent data gathering techniques supported by strong interpersonal skills. Demonstrated ability to use creative and strategic thinking to identify and develop solutions for customers Demonstrated skills in research and planning to support strategy development and commercialization planning Ability to build and maintain strong collaborative and collegial working relationships with team members, and internal and external stakeholders Strong oral, written and presentation skills, with the ability to learn, apply and explain information in an organized and concise way Self-motivated; ability to work both independently and as a team player Strong results orientation, with excellent attention to detail Must hold and maintain a valid class “G” driver’s license  How to Apply  If you would like to be considered for this position and meet the qualifications, please submit your resume by visiting our Careers page at http://www.alectra.com/careers.  Alectra is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing a recruitment process that respects the dignity and independence of all candidates. Should you require accommodation at any stage in the recruitment, assessment and selection process please consult with Alectra’s People Team.  We thank all applicants for their interest in a career with Alectra. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.  March 5, 2021
