jobdescription.33: About TROX: For more than 70 years, we have partnered with Educators and IT Leaders to give them access to an unmatched selection of proven EdTech products and services for the classroom and campus, that enhance the learning experience. As a result, we have helped tens of millions of students in hundreds of thousands of K-12 classrooms and many higher education institutions throughout the US & Canada. We’re a rapidly growing company focused on selling technology solutions to North American schools. We need help analyzing our product range, managing inventory decisions and setting prices. A portion of our business comes from traditional distributors and is relatively straight forward to analyse for stock levels, order points, target pricing etc. Another portion comes from purchasing or removing large lots of computer equipment which we refurbish, warranty and resell to schools. The challenge is in analyzing those large mixed lots to make data driven instead of anecdotal decisions. If you buy a container with 1000 different laptops for $100,000, how do you assign costs to maximize profits and sales? Add in the variable time required to test and refurbish various units, failure rates, shortages in the market and other variables that determine our real cost. Simply averaging will result in low end units that are too expensive and high end units that are too cheap; what should be a simple cost is not so simple. Similarly, if every tiny variation in specs (i.e. slightly more RAM or a slightly larger hard drive) creates a new SKU, how do you derive meaningful analysis? Some variations are so slight that the SKUs should be considered the same for all analysis purposes. The ideal candidate will have the skill, experience and desire to solve complex analysis puzzles and the confidence to suggest business practices based on their data despite what general market wisdom might be. Given the complexity of the computer industry a strong general knowledge of computer hardware is essential. You will be part of the Purchasing Department and report directly to the Chief Operating Officer while working closely with logistics and development teams to understand and analyse needs, create reports and software, then implement solutions with our warehouse team. Responsibilities: Analyze historical and market data to design and implement a cost model that accurately captures costs but does not unduly burden sales Analyze sales to determine re-order points, minimum and maximum stock levels, lead times necessary to maintain stock, integrate JIT deliveries to maintain production while not crowding the warehouse Analyze different suppliers and offers to calculate and negotiate the most cost-effective solutions. Proposes strategies to reduce costs, increase efficiencies and improve procedures Requirements: A minimum of 5 years of experience in a similar role. Strong knowledge of data analysis, inventory management software, and forecasting techniques. Thorough understanding of computer hardware. An analytical mind with strong attention to detail. Creativity and problem solving skills. Excellent communication and leadership abilities. If you feel like this is a good fit for you and you can positively and significantly contribute to our team, apply today for immediate consideration. We thank all applicants for their interest; however only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. Powered by JazzHR geH2pYXFue
jobdescription.34: About Us  Our mission is to make hourly work easier for local businesses and their employees. Homebase currently serves more than 100,000 small (but mighty) businesses with everything they need to manage their hourly teams: employee scheduling, time clocks, team communication, hiring, onboarding, and compliance. We are not Human Capital Management. We are not HR Software. We're tools built for the busiest businesses, so owners and employees can spend less time on paperwork and more time on what matters. The Homebase team brings small business expertise from Intuit, Square, Yelp, Gusto, and First Data, and finance and strategy experience from Bain, Goldman Sachs, KKR, and McKinsey. Based in San Francisco and Houston, Homebase is backed by leading venture investors Bain Capital Ventures, Baseline Ventures, Cowboy Ventures, and Khosla Ventures.  We are in the early stages of what we will achieve, and we're looking for a motivated self-starter in this key Business Operations role.  You  A successful Business Operations Analyst is a dynamic, strategic, and collaborative self-starter with an ability to digest and prioritize large amounts of data to craft a narrative. You most likely have a consulting or investment banking background, are eager to act fast, and want to start learning how to build and operate a business. You love working cross-functionally and enjoy tackling a wide range of challenges, from operations to strategy.  The Job  Data Analysis and Reporting: Support as the connective tissue to the business in answering complicated strategic questions with both quantitative and qualitative insights. Be a key voice and sounding board to key players and executives in reinforcing our data-driven culture and be seen as a go-to internal expert across a variety of functions. Forecasting: Work with senior executives across functional groups to plan and measure how resources are deployed, both at the company and department level. Define and track KPIs to ensure resources are efficiently allocated and aligned in support of broader business objectives. Market Development and Growth: Identify, quantify, and execute against high potential growth opportunities within both existing and new products. Conduct customer and market research to develop hypotheses and then work with engineering, product, and marketing to execute tests and to ensure learnings are implemented successfully. Process Development: Scale existing systems and processes - or help build new ones from the ground up – to facilitate our customer growth and take our operations to the next level. Corporate Strategy & Finance: Help guide Homebase's strategic direction with solid business modeling and decision analysis. Develop forecasts, monitor market conditions, and help execute fundraising as needed.  This role is a rare opportunity to have visibility across a rapidly growing startup and to play a key role in multiple projects critical to scaling the business. The size of our team and stage of our growth means you will get your hands in a variety of unique and challenging ways, and impact the lives of millions of hourly workers.  Must-Have  Bachelor's degree required, preferably in Business, Economics, Statistics, or related field 2-3 years of analytical experience in management consulting, equity research, investment banking, private equity, and/or a corporate development, strategy, or planning & analysis role Has experience with SQL, Looker, or other Data Viz tools; or a strong desire to learn Gets a kick out of digging deep into data, structuring thoughts and process upfront to help deliver the best results and business outcomes Ability to drive complex projects and processes with minimal guidance and oversight, with a bias towards action and constant prioritization Loves finding the most customer-friendly solution to the problems, bringing in both qualitative and quantitative feedback before making decisions Proven track record for working well across teams and with external partners Keeps a process-oriented mindset with an ability to execute projects small and large Possesses a strong sense of urgency in line with our value of "No Day Wasted" Works well with and influences people with a vast array of working styles Loves local business… supporting them and building great tools for them  What We Offer You  Supplemental Benefits Stock Options - Everyone is an owner Fun Team Activities A dynamic, well-connected, productive team that is thriving while working from home and who have found new ways to connect and have fun despite social distancing  At Homebase, we value our differences, and we encourage all to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Homebase is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

jobdescription.37: This role is fully remote, and can be done anywhere in the US or Canada. The purpose of the role is to lead and support the enterprise data quality efforts for VMware Inc. This role is responsible for supporting the enterprise data quality monitoring and reporting program to ensure adherence to the organization’s data quality standards. This includes the development of standardized and executable business rules that are applied systemically across data sources, engagement and education with data consumers, owners & stewards to implement and enforce the adoption of enterprise quality standards, and the management of quality reporting through the process, technology, and communication. The incumbent will assist with the development and management of quality procedures and the promotion of data quality standards to ensure the quality of data through all upstream and downstream data channels. The incumbent will also work with business partners, stakeholders, and the IT department to provide recommendations on the resolution of data integrity gaps while supporting the implementation of systematic and procedural controls for Critical Business Elements (CBEs) in the scope of Governance. Responsibilities: Demonstrate strong information management, data quality, data analytics including strong working knowledge of data infrastructure and various technology reporting platforms. Provide leadership, motivation and establish a teamwork environment for the cross-functional data quality team and processes. Independently manage and drive work deliverables and co-ordinate with the offshore team. Play a key role in leading the development, documentation, and implementation of data quality procedures and standards to support enterprise goals. Work with business partners, stakeholders, and the IT departments to define and document data quality rules, targets, and standards. Establish change controls over quality standards and work with functional and IT partners to enforce them within the organization. Partner with data stewards and owners to implement, enhance, and manage governance dashboarding capability on quality metrics. Define user experience standards and exception reporting capability. Partner with IT to implement data quality mart and data quality trend reporting. Implement and manage training and education in the data quality space with users to ensure the use and adoption of data quality tools and processes to improve the quality of data. Facilitate and provide data quality subject matter expertise within data governance working groups focused on data quality improvement efforts. Oversee the development and implementation of the detailed project and work plans for data quality monitoring and reporting efforts within the data governance organization. Coordinate the planning, documenting, and execution activities for the projects; along with tasks, budgets, timelines, and project staffing to successfully complete projects on a timely basis and within budget. Develop documentation to support the project planning and implementation process. Lead and provide support to project teams by facilitating/attending project meetings, documenting minutes and action items, responding to assigned tasks when due. Provide recommendations for measuring and improving the effectiveness and efficiency of data governance, operational control processes, and compliance activities. Support proactive profiling, data lineage reviewing, performing root cause triage, and support identifying appropriate owners for fixing root causes of the issues. Develop and refine high quality monthly and quarterly metrics reporting and -publishing capability demonstrating program activities and communication to stakeholders & senior leadership. Technical Skills: 6+ years of experience in data quality/governance/ analysis related work or similar Proficient in SQL with a minimum of 3-5 years of hands-on experience Proficient in Informatica Data Quality with 2-3 years of hands-on experience Strong conceptual understanding of data analysis, data quality ,etc. Experience with reporting tools like Power BI, Tableau ,etc., data quality tools like Informatica IDQ, SAP Info Steward is desired Experience of intent to learn software domain related to VMware products and the way virtualization software/hardware Preferred Skills: Business Acumen, ability to translate business needs into a set of workable, specific requirements Ability to independently lead data quality efforts with minimal guidance Ability to navigate across cross-functional groups in a global organization Well versed with MS PowerPoint/Visio Ability to understand business requirements, KPIs and convert into analytical hypothesis in a structured and logical manner along with solution identification Ability to handle multiple projects at a time in terms of multitasking, prioritization, allocation, and team management Ability to coordinate and work within multiple business units from a project management perspective Ability to work across geographies and interact with global stakeholders Ability and motivation to work efficiently and productively in a multi-task environment and with minimal direction Ability to identify and analyze problems using sound judgment and determine solutions to effectively resolve issues Strong task management and prioritization capabilities Ability to initiate process improvement plans and work towards change Flexible to changing priorities and to work outside of office hours as per business requirements. Excellent written and verbal communication skills and interpersonal skills Strong work ethic and sense of responsibility What we are looking for: A Bachelor's degree with a minimum of 6 years of experience in data quality/ governance/ analysis-related work or similar. Strong SQL and relational database /data warehouse (Oracle, SQL Server, Postgress, Presto) skills, data analysis experience is needed to be successful in this role. A Techno-functional individual with strong business acumen is required. Experience with reporting tools like Power BI, Tableau, etc., data quality tools like Informatica IDQ, SAP Info Steward is desired. Comfortable dealing with ambiguity and a fast-changing environment. Ability to lead and drive efforts to completion. Knowledge of industry-leading data quality and issue management tools and practices. Strong knowledge and experience in data-related activities (data quality, data governance, metadata, data management, data standards, data structures, data aggregation, and business requirements). Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to speak to varying levels across the organization. Development and championing of cross-functional engagement within data governance and to other business / IT groups. Ability to get to the heart of the problem and make sound and timely decisions to resolve problems. “This job requisition is not eligible for employment-based immigration sponsored by VMware. jobdescription.38: Employment Opportunity  Business Systems Analyst (1 Year Contract)  TO Live  Toronto, Canada  TO Live has an opportunity in the Information Technology Department for an enthusiastic, organized, and resourceful team player who thrives in a fast-paced environment. Reporting to the Director of Information Technology, the Business Systems Analyst will be responsible for analyzing and studying new and existing technology systems and solutions. This position will also involve working with other departments to determine their future and current software, data, reporting and hardware requirements.  A key responsibility for this position will be to provide recommendations to management regarding technology systems as they are analyzed and implemented, and how they relate to overall Information Technology lifecycle expenditures. The Business Systems Analyst will also be required to create detailed documentation, workflows, and flowcharts for both new and existing technology systems.  ACTIVITIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES  Analyze software solutions regarding current business requirements: Foundation Customer Relationship Management Foundation Financials Financial Forecasting and Budgeting Microsoft Office Azure and Intune Microsoft SharePoint Cloud Storage Archives Digitization Project coordination for implementing new systems, existing system changes and/or enhancements. Analyze and evaluate current systems to identify and suggest solutions for process improvements. Maintain existing applications and databases with appropriate patches and security updates. Assist with implementation of the infrastructure lifecycle. Conduct and implement training sessions related to application changes, new software implementations, and business requirements. Proactively collect information that may turn into future projects. Perform introduction and information sessions for users regarding software and equipment use, policies and procedures. Research and address user needs by creating and/or enhancing processes and reports where required that improve user experiences and optimize expenses. Attend educational events and stay up to date with the latest technology and best practices. Backup support as required for days off and/or vacation coverage. Perform other duties as assigned by the Director of Information Technology.  JOB SPECIFICATIONS  Experience working with analyzing and implementing complex and cross-department information technology initiatives. Minimum 7 years of experience in a similar position within Information Technology. Fluent understanding of Information Technology terminology. Fluent understanding of Microsoft Windows Server, Hyper-V and VMware. Fluent understanding of Microsoft Office 365. Strong understanding of ticketing, fundraising, event, CRM and accounting processes. Diligent in training and development of training materials. Solid analytical skills and attention to detail. Ability to work under strict deadlines. Ability to work with cross-functional teams. Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously.  WORKING CONDITIONS  Flexibility in hours and schedules and includes work on nights and weekends as required. Lack of natural light in workplace. Travel between all three TO Live venues as required.  THE ORGANIZATION: TO Live is one of Canada’s largest multi-arts organizations, operating three iconic venues: Meridian Hall (formerly the Sony Centre for the Performing Arts), the St. Lawrence Centre for the Arts and Meridian Arts Centre (formerly the Toronto Centre for the Arts). In addition, TO Live presents a full range of performing arts, theatrical and concert events at these venues in both downtown and uptown Toronto. With these two hubs of creativity and content creation, TO Live has a unique place and perspective to activate creative spaces by inspiring local and international artists, connect audiences and to be the nexus for new ideas, elevate artistic potential, and be the catalyst for creative expression that is reflective of Toronto’s diversity.  HOW TO APPLY: Interested applicants should apply through our TO Live careers website at: https://tolive.bamboohr.com/jobs/  No phone calls please. TO Live thanks all applicants in advance. Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  Together with the Toronto Public Service’s (TPS) initiatives, which TO Lives follows and adheres too, TO Live encourages applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized persons/persons of colour, persons with disabilities, women, LGBTQ2S persons, and others who may contribute to fostering innovative ideas and solutions.  We ask that you complete the questions provided as part of the online application to assist us in ensuring our recruitment process and programs are equitable and accessible. Your responses are voluntary and the information that you provide is strictly confidential.  We are committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes and a work environment in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). The Human Resources department will work with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of the hiring process.  Date Posted: March 9, 2021  Application Deadline: March 23, 2021  Start Date: ASAP
jobdescription.40: Killi is currently seeking a Data & Research Analyst to join our Product team that stands apart from the rest of the market that is interested in joining a true startup culture and be part of building something special. Killi is direct to consumer (D2C) platform that allows people to take back control of their personal data and get rewarded for sharing data with buyers. Killi directly tackles the issues of personal data breaches and massive corporations getting rich by selling their customers’ data in exchange for, well, nothing. Killi also provides a transparent market solution in the face of growing cries for government regulation around the collection and use of personal data. We are a true start-up. It is hard, but you will learn a lot. We work fast, have big aspirations and have a lot of fun along the way.  What you are responsible for:  Being a customer advocate pulling together behavioral, data, and support analytics and others against the brand and product roadmap. Platform by platform analytics. Behavioral analytics (Amplitude/Branch.io), User Analytics (Metabase), documentation in Confluence, and others to analyze consumer trends and gaps not only in reporting but with consumer engagement and to generate an actionable plan to improve customer experience. Updating our data dictionaries of what data is available to our clients and at what scale. Measuring and reporting on the impact of all new features in the product while establishing suggestions and gaps for revision of these features. Fostering on-going communication with consumers through new feature validation, customer feedback, and our support channels, then championing plans to improve customer satisfaction. Assisting with designing and prioritizing the product roadmap. Participating in agile planning meetings and scrum to drive product implementation in coordination with Engineering. Assist product and engineering team with grooming. Supporting the product strategy by developing a deep understanding of market trends, the needs of prospective and current customers, as well as how customers use our products and our competitors’ products. Translating that market knowledge into user personas and product positioning statements that will serve as the foundation for improving our go-to-market activities and have also had a major input into the product roadmap.   What we need from you:  3-5 years of hands-on business analysts, and or product management. Experience in digital media space with a focus on programmatic architecture and data. Experience working with consumer-facing (DTC or Fintech) products or emerging protocols such as blockchain essential Strong SQL and RDMS skills required – Python, GO, Spark, and AWS are a bonus. Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Math or Statistics, or similar. Experience with agile methodologies – scrum master a plus. Big picture thinking while delivering iterative, impactful improvements in an Agile/scrum/lean environment. Strong business acumen with the ability to think strategically and tactically. Experience analyzing or reporting on data from various ad servers, bid management platforms, tag management systems, DSPs, social platforms and 3rd party data providers as a plus. You have experience and interest in privacy, data, AI, Machine learning and the Blockchain.   What you will get from us:  Competitive market compensation structure. Comprehensive, health, dental and vision plan. A great corporate culture. A fulfilling, challenging and flexible work experience. The opportunity for career growth. Stock Options. Wellness and Professional Development Fund.   Killi welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
jobdescription.41: Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies touches more than a billion people’s lives each day through our health care products and services, our corporate giving, and the volunteer efforts of our employees. The Johnson & Johnson Family of Consumer Companies develop and market beloved brands that address the needs of consumers and health care professionals worldwide. Our portfolio ranges across several distinct business units: Baby Care, Oral Care, Compromised Skin Care, Beauty, Feminine Care, and OTC products. In a Supply Chain Deliver environment the Logistics Strategy Analyst (LSA) plays a supporting role in the analytics, development and implementation of key Customer Logistics improvements and initiatives. The LSA partners internally to support the development of plans to improve customer service, customer collaboration, and operational efficiencies. The LSA utilizes business intelligence tools and ERP reporting and data to identify performance and growth opportunities through detailed analysis, and to support recommendations to customer policies and operational process improvements. Major Responsibilities: Develop and drive continuous improvement of customer metrics, and the creation and issuance of dashboards and service level reports. Collaborate across the Supply Chain Deliver team and internal business partners to support process improvements and to achieve logistics efficiencies. Identify and share insights and opportunities with the Deliver management team. Access and uncover trends in business and customer data, and identify gaps in logistics and customer experience opportunities. Evaluate operational and cost implications for both existing and new customer logistics strategies and policies through use of the Cost to Serve Lead or provide analytical support for special projects including, but not limited to: Customer experience improvement opportunities (eg. order automation, cycle time reduction for billings and disputes, reduction in order errors) Customer collaboration projects (eg. channel strategies, shipment consolidation) New Business Development - Acquisitions and Divestitures Cost Improvement Projects  Qualifications  University degree or equivalent experience (2+ years in an analytics role) Proficient in advanced Excel, PowerPoint and Word in a Windows environment Strong technical skills with experience using: SAP, Tableau, database management, business intelligence tools, SQL, Visual Basic; ability to quickly learn other internal and external software and systems Previous experience in an analytical role. Extensive analytical skills, strong communication & presentation skills Results and performance driven with bias for action & sense of urgency towards priorities and deadlines Strong interpersonal, interdependent partnering skills within and across organization Proven ability to cultivate strong business relationships Supply chain or healthcare experience preferred, but not required Diversity and inclusion are central elements of the shared culture across the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies. Attracting, developing and retaining a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities is essential to our success. We are committed to providing a respectful, inclusive and accessible work environment where all employees have the opportunity to achieve their potential.  Primary Location Canada-Ontario-Markham-200 Whitehall Drive Organization Johnson & Johnson Inc. (7695) Job Function General Administration Requisition ID 2105904277W
jobdescription.42: We believe small businesses are at the heart of our communities, and championing them is worth fighting for. We empower small business owners to manage their finances fearlessly, enabling more of them to thrive by offering the simplest, all-in-one financial management solution small business owners can't live without. As an award-winning company, and one of the fastest growing financial services software, we are unwavering in our commitment to grow and support both our customers and our people. We care deeply and we challenge directly. We re-image the possible, together, to achieve extraordinary results for the small business owners we support and believe in. About Wave Wave propels brave entrepreneurs who pursue their dreams and drive the world’s economy. As an award-winning product and company, and one of the fastest-growing financial services software we’re on a mission to change the lives of entrepreneurs across the globe, and are looking for only the best to join us. About this Role Reporting into the Data and Analytics Team, the Senior Data Insights Analyst, Customer Experience will be accountable for laying the foundation and advancing Wave’s customer experience analytics, intelligence, and strategy. We are looking for a talented, analytically skilled and curious self-motivator who can help transform our customer experience (CX) into a strategic, growth accelerant. We need someone who can partner with CX leadership and horizontally across various business units to deeply understand the effects of our product offerings and how we service customers to surface critical insights where customer value and business value are tightly aligned. This will start with building a strong data foundation from a customer support and behaviour lens and then expand into developing new measurement frameworks and creating new analytical and descriptive models to drive testing and experimentation to transform customer experience into a key business growth driver. This role is for someone who is naturally curious, has a strong desire to learn and can combine their strong business acumen with their expertise in the field of quantitative analytics to the context and challenge at hand. Influence and strong communication skills are a must as this role will engage with varying levels of the organization from senior leadership to front line managers to help drive business solutions through their articulation of actionable insights and highlighting opportunities. To get better, we need to change and we need someone who is not afraid to challenge the status quo in their quest for driving business value through data accuracy and exceptional customer service. Here’s how you’ll make a difference: YOUR PLAYGROUND AND SANDBOX - Partner with the broader Customer Experience team to examine and analyze the service experience. Provide actionable insights and measure the direct and indirect impacts of customer support interactions and their positive (or negative) effects on key customer behaviours (retention, acquisition, adoption, Net Promoter Score, satisfaction) across the Wave ecosystem. FOCUS ON LEARNING THROUGH EXPERIMENTATION - Using the scientific method, you’ll formulate specific hypotheses, design and evaluate various experiments to test and learn what support methods and models work in partnership with our customer operations teams (e.g., channel mix, response times, proactive versus reactive, self serve versus human). BUILD AND GOVERN OUR DATA INFRASTRUCTURE - Collaborate with Data Engineers and Developers to ensure the right data elements and pipelines are captured, organized and stored in the right format from various product administration and servicing systems to enable a consistent, repeatable analytical environment for reporting and experimentation measure progress against departmental goals and help with strategic decision making. DESIGN THE COCKPIT INSTRUMENTATION - Build and manage reporting dashboards (e.g., Looker, Zendesk Insights / Explorer) that highlight the health and performance of the different customer operations and experiments you are working on. You’re responsible for what should be included in these dashboards and how that data is presented working with the individual department managers and leads to drive consistency against targets. LINK SERVICE EXPERIENCE TO VALUE CREATION - Create relational, statistical and descriptive analytical models to support strategic decision making. (e.g., resourcing/headcount investments, service experience contribution to business returns, Wave wide customer retention service model, servicing tiers and customer segmentation) Over time, this role will evolve to include predictive modelling and analytics building upon the solid analytical foundation established These will help you succeed: 5+ years of hands-on experience in Data Analytics. This is important ‘cause this is what you’ll be doing all the time, and we need someone experienced to do it. It’s big stuff we’re working on. Experience partnering with internal business to ideate and translate data and ideas into execution. Advanced SQL & Python skills with experience querying large and very complex and varied data sources including Relational Databases, APIs, clickstream and log data. You should know what all of these words mean if you want to apply, and you’re excited about it, too. Experience calculating, tracking and understanding business and operational KPIs (e.g. CSAT, customer retention, engagement, activation, contact rate, deflection, churn, and conversion). You know the differences between Redshift, Amplitude, Looker and are super comfy with all of them. Experience in Experimental design and statistical analysis (including multivariate regression, decision trees, correlation models, and analysis of variance). This is the type of analysis you’ll be expected to do. Strong knowledge of customer support channels (phone, live chat, email) and hands-on experience linking customer experience data with business, marketing and product data. Experience in customer support, marketing and/or operations is considered an asset You’ll Thrive Here, If: You have the ability to work autonomously. No one’s going to be peering over your shoulder here. We count on you to get your work done, in ambiguous conditions, with tight deadlines, while still producing high-quality work. It’s fun, promise! You are all about collaboration. You’ll be working with Operations Managers, Product Managers, Engineering Managers, Marketing Managers, Business Unit Managers and tons of other folks as their go-to customer analytics person. It’s not going to work if you don’t see the value of different perspectives. You are a stellar communicator. This means you know how to translate technical terms into non-technical language which your grandma could understand. This also means you have no problem presenting the insights you’ve gathered from your stellar analysis to Kirk (our CEO). You’re good with other tech. Wave is a diverse place with lots of different tools, languages, frameworks, structures, and types of analysis. Knowing R, SAS, or Python would be helpful to help close the gap between your role and others We hire world-class talent, but the learning doesn’t stop once you’re in the door. We believe in the balance of IQ with EQ. We support continuous professional and personal development with flexible mentorship programs, ongoing learning opportunities and a serious investment in each employee. We’re here to do excellent work, together, and achieve that by bringing on only the best. We are a community of people with competitive hearts. Competitive in wanting to better the lives of our Brave Entrepreneurs. Competitive in never settling for less than extraordinary. Competitive in pushing each other and our ideas, by collaborating and communicating respectfully. Monthly town hall meetings are where we regularly share business metrics and updates from the CEO. When you have the data you need, you are empowered to pivot your plans to solve problems, remove bottlenecks and find a way to win. At Wave, we have an unwavering commitment to growing our people personally and professionally, and we make a serious investment in each employee’s health and wellness. Through skills training, mentorship, leadership programs, monthly mindshares, and education allowances, we foster continuous learning and development. Our extensive health benefits plan combined with flex health funds, employee assistance plan, wellness classes, and extensive time off allow our employees to stay healthy and care for themselves and their families while doing their best work - whether you choose to work from our beautiful office in Toronto or from home anywhere else in Canada. We are different from other companies in many ways; first and foremost, by our culture. We are not perfect by any means. We can all do better, and as a company, we strive with uncompromising integrity to do better every day. We have an unwavering belief that a diverse and inclusive culture creates the best workplace experiences. We embrace our differences, value individuality, and respect the broad spectrum of every Waver's skills and abilities. We challenge each other from a place of respect and pursuit of continuous growth. We trust each other and encourage everyone to bring their authentic selves to work, everyday. At Wave, our voices matter, our opinions are met with an open mind, and contributing to an inclusive culture is a part of all of our roles. Our culture is reflected in a stellar Glassdoor rating. We’ve been continuously recognized as one of Canada's Top Ten Most Admired Corporate Cultures and one of Canada’s Great Places to Work in various categories including Technology, Millennials, Mental Health, Inclusion and Women for years. Our people are incredibly talented and the key to our success, so we admire and respect each and every one greatly.  Are you ready to be a Waver? Join us!
jobdescription.43: Required Skills: Strong experience with Data Catalog Alation  Data Analysis SQL Knowledge in Cloudera CDH CDP and ecosystem tools pySpark Impala Hive Hue Hadoop scala etc Oracle Teradata python ShellScript and Amazon Web Services S3 etc will be a plus  Planning building and running enterprise class information management solutions across a variety of technologies  Big Data data profiling ETL batch processing streaming preferred etc  Curating content to support the key business initiatives  Working with data scientist and data analysts across functional disciplines  Demonstrate high proficiency across a wide range of technologies and platforms related to software design and development programming languages data integration data warehousing data analysis and cloud environments  Highly autonomous and productive in performing activities requiring only minimal direction from or interaction with supervisor  Keeps key stakeholders informed through effective verbal and written communication  May mentor or supervise a team of one or more and guide and evaluate the performance of those individuals is accountable for the effective performance of the team or individuals  Ensuring appropriate security and compliance policies are followed for information access and dissemination  Defining and applying information quality and consistency business rules throughout the data processing lifecycle Collaborating with information providers to ensure quality data updates are processed in a timely fashion  Qualifications  Bachelors Degree with 6 years of related work experience and a strong understanding of specified functional area  Degree in Computer Science or related discipline preferred Advanced degree preferred.  At least 6 years of experience in a several data Engineering roles such as data analyst and solution developer of Enterprise applications  Employee Status : Full Time Employee Shift : Day Job Travel : No Job Posting : Mar 01 2021  About Cognizant Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 194 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us @Cognizant.
jobdescription.44: The main purpose of this position is to Collaborate with the Bond Business Application and Project Stakeholders. The IT Business Analyst will reduce the rework on projects by effectively collaborating with the business stakeholders to understand their technical requirements. The IT Business Analyst will determine the complete and correct business requirements at the beginning of the project with the business stakeholders buy-in so that the steps can be implemented properly throughout the project. The IT Business Analyst will act as the conduit between the Business stakeholders and the Technical resources for the initial implementation of new technologies as well as enhancements to existing technologies and the ongoing evolving business driven technology requirements. This position reports to the Manager, Helpdesk. As our IT Business Analyst, you will: Be accountable for providing consulting services to internal Bond Corporate application users Development of corporate technical solutions for business problems Develop detailed functional and technical specifications Develop technology systems according to specifications Provide on-going support for implemented systems Build and Maintain knowledge of corporate applications, methodologies and information technology trends through training, appropriate literature and other means Review and approve test strategy, test plans and test cases, ensuring business requirements are met Analysis Phase = provide consultative services to Business Units cross BOND, investigate and identify business problem, develop targeted solution, provide estimates of work effort and duration for moderate sized enhancement. Planning Phase = prepare external design document and ensure it is comprehensive with respect to business requirement, functionality, performance and operating efficiency, participate in the design of screens, participate in walkthrough meetings with clients. Build Phase = ensure application has been properly migrated into test environment, ensure walkthroughs are held to the test requirements and test cases. Testing Phase = support testing and execution of test plan, ensure that testing team is provided with updated functional specifications Implementation Phase = responsible for user verification activities in a production environment, participate in post implementation review. As our Corporate Technical Business Analyst, you have: Broad exposure/experience of analyzing corporate requirements and making recommendations of new and improved applications to meet those requirements along with becoming the conduit between the business and Technical Implementation and Support Team. In many cases manage the relationship with external vendors and providing them with the appropriate business requirements. Excellent in-depth knowledge of various data structures and different operating system. Excellent communication skills (oral, written and interpersonal) Analytical, problem solving, decision making and negotiating skills The ability to effectively manage multiple Projects and activities of varying complexity while under time constraints Relevant client-facing experience Must be a team player Minimum 5 Years’ experience within the Business Analyst role. Why Join Us? Bond is proudly recognized as a Great Place to Work and a Best Managed Company for the third year in a row. We’re 400(ish) people working tirelessly together to make the world a more loyal place. You’ll be joining a hyper-talented team with a galaxy of skillsets ranging from research to creative to digital and beyond. You’ll have an excellent opportunity to grow, learn and make an impact as we tackle some of our client’s biggest business challenges. If you’re looking to build your career, build your skills and build bonds apply today! We're growing and have multiple roles available. At Bond, we are proud to be a diverse organization and we are committed to building and fostering an environment where our employees feel included, valued, and heard. Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion enables us to truly create equal opportunity and positive employment experiences for everyone. We encourage applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities and people with intersectional identities.
jobdescription.46: Retail Business Analyst Overview IQVIA™ (www.IQVIA™.com) is the world’s leading company providing information, technology, and services for virtually every type of stakeholder in healthcare. Every day, IQVIA™ innovates on a large scale. Since 1954 we’ve been helping healthcare organizations harness the power of commercial and scientific insights We develop and operate systems and applications using big data technologies on our private-public hybrid cloud. IQVIA™ stores and computes more than 20 petabytes of complex healthcare data on diseases, treatments, costs and outcomes, annually, helping our clients run their operations more efficiently. IQVIA processes over 50 billion healthcare transactions annually and employs over 50,000 professionals in more than 100 countries to drive results for over 5,000 healthcare clients globally. IQVIA™ is a publicly listed company (NYSE – Q) with estimated revenue exceeding $10B and a market cap of over $28B. Individuals joining us should expect a rewarding and progressive career in life sciences consulting. You’ll have the opportunity to address challenging client issues, across multiple geographies with a hands-on influence in delivering solutions. We operate in a truly multi-cultural, collegial and collaborative work environment that is rich in development and growth. Role & Responsibilities As a Retail Pharmaceutical Analyst, you will be responsible for providing data analytics, supporting the maintenance and development of a suite of syndicated offerings for retail pharmacies. This includes leading investigations to address internal and external client queries, requiring research and coordination with the commercial team, formulating client responses. Support in the investigating of both internal and external client queries. Requires research and respond and work with a commercial team to share knowledge and support workload across various offerings and databases. Retail Analyst: Provides analysis and project management support in the delivery of syndicated offerings & ad hoc studies. Manages requirements gathering, providing recommendations to develop research plans, identifying appropriate data sources and delivery options to meet client needs. Performs analysis in support of offerings production and delivery cycles. Performs quantitative research, and provides summaries of study results to commercial and offerings lead. Participates in selecting or developing methodology for use in new offerings and analytics. May consult with clients in support of project delivery or requirements gathering. Performs routine data analysis to develop customer specific insights and solutions to customer business challenges. Validates / QA’s reporting methodologies supporting the business needs Proactively develops knowledge of the pharmaceutical marketplace with emphasis on wholesale and retail pharmacy About You The skills and behaviors required for this position include: Experience within the healthcare industry. Strong understanding of business intelligence tools is preferred, with emphasis on utilization and application. Demonstrated problem solving, analytical and customer service skills. Bachelor’s Degree Four (4) years relevant analytics &/or pharmaceutical industry experience Strong analytical skills Strong communication skills Experience analyzing large amounts of data. Advantaged Knowledge of MS-Excel, MS-Access Knowledge of IQVIA datasets/databases an asset Knowledge SQL and relational database concepts Knowledge of the Canadian Healthcare/Pharmaceutical industry Excellent organizational skills; ability to prioritize and multi-task At IQVIA, we believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. The advanced analytics, technology solutions and contract research services we provide to the life sciences industry are made possible by our 67,000+ employees around the world who apply their insight, curiosity and intellectual courage every step of the way. Learn more at jobs.iqvia.com.
jobdescription.47: TD Description Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward. Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Department Overview Ready to be the change at TD? We're an innovator and leader in the change management space. When others look to change, they look to TD for inspiration and results. Across the bank, we're fast-tracking digital and agile culture transformation. Our legendary customer experience continues to guide us as we deliver groundbreaking projects and experiences. With an innovative mindset, we will achieve our critical Business Imperatives while instilling a culture that brings the TD Shared Commitments to life.  Want to be where the action is? Strategic change management is a valued and evolving discipline at TD, ready to take the organization and your career, to new heights.  Want to shape the future? This is a strong and connected enterprise-wide change management community where you'll feel connected and challenged. You'll be busy, but never bored and your real passion for change will reap lasting rewards.  See yourself shoulder to shoulder with enterprise leaders and industry influencers? We do too. This is a role where you're at the table, on industry panels and in your element. We support think time, planning and the value of connecting with peers, leaders and outside networks. There's a big appetite to raise the bar in this role. Change at TD is evolving and influencing at a rapid pace and we're looking for visionaries, just like you to be this change.  Who we are? Our Wealth Change Management team reports into the Wealth Shared Services Group of TD Wealth. Our team is focused to drive legendary client and colleague experience by taking a proactive and integrated approach to influence, lead and deliver solutions in partnership with our key stakeholders. We are the centre of excellence and lead the strategic change for our TD Wealth projects and to augment change management needs for wealth as it relates to Enterprise and Business Projects.   What we do? By leveraging our standard TD change methodology we; Address the people side of change to support people, process and technology changes Help the business with insights on how best to prepare, manage, and reinforce the change. Drive increased probability of project success, by reducing resistance, increasing speed of adoption, and sustaining the change. Job Description As a Senior Change Management Analyst, you will:  Lead, plan and / or execute on the end-to-end delivery of change management activities throughout the lifecycle for assigned projects / initiatives. Adhering to change management standards to ensure all work is in alignment with the change management strategy, TD methodology, adheres to the project delivery governance, business and project objectives. Lead a diverse range of multiple projects. Engage project partners, and subject matter experts effectively. Assess potential change processes and diverse audience issues. Analyze change impacts / risks and provide recommendations to project managers, stakeholders, employees, process, technology solutions to achieve business results Provide recommendations and direction based on the end-to-end client experience for Wealth Lead and own the project deliverables related to change management to meet the needs of the clients, colleagues, and Wealth to drive successful adoption of change. Engage appropriate stakeholders to identify and manage required outcomes of projects Assess and ensure that client and colleague experience / stakeholder impacts are appropriately understood and managed. Identify and engage appropriate stakeholders to identify and manage required change outcomes of the projects for the business. Provide on-going communications and status updates on your change management deliverables and tactics using the Project Delivery governance structure Provide critical insights to align communication and training plans to the change management strategy while ensuring the groups fully integrated and aligned for project delivery with the project manager. Respond to inquiries and escalate change related concerns from stakeholders, project managers and partners at all level in the organization. Collaborate with partners across TD and Wealth to drive successful adoption of change (e.g. communication, training, process, etc.) Work with the Business Owner / Sponsor to identify change metrics and how they will be measured Accountable for providing standard change deliverables based on scope of Wealth Change Management Service level and Enterprise methodology. Support the development / delivery of presentations / communications Exercise discretion and professionalism when providing and receiving coaching and feedback Participate fully as a member of the team, support a positive work environment that promotes service to the business, quality, innovation and teamwork and ensure timely communications of issues / points of interest Provide thought leadership for change management area of expertise and participate in knowledge transfer within the team and business units Participate in personal performance management and development activities, including cross training within the change management community Keep others informed and up to date about the status / progress of your projects and on all relevant or useful information relates to day-to-day activities. Contribute to team development of skills and capabilities through mentoring of others, by sharing knowledge and experiences in leveraging best practices. Contribute to a fair, positive and equitable environment that supports a diverse workforce. Act as a brand champion and change ambassador for Wealth and TD, both internally and externally  Job Requirements This is an expert level professional role requiring in-depth knowledge, expertise in change management and working knowledge of broader related areas including training, communications and technology. Must have the ability to lead end-to-end projects with major deliverables that are moderately complex in scope and scale. Accountable for own work and acts as a point of escalation related to change management methodology and tools for Wealth Change Management. Required to support multiple projects across multiple Wealth business areas. Ability to integrate the broader business context into change management deliverables, advice and solutions. Must have the ability to solve moderately complex problems by taking on new perspectives to drive realistic solutions. Leads the resolution to complex problems requiring analysis of multiple variables, including consultation with multiple stakeholders. Undergraduate degree Relevant Change Management accreditations are an asset Five (5) or more years of related experience, working in a project environment Proficient knowledge of change management principles, industry standards and methodologies, project management, organizational practices and business transformation Knowledge of risk management environment, standards and regulations Skill in using software tools, applications (MS Office), data analysis methods and reporting techniques Ability to communicate clearly, confidently and effectively in both oral and written form Ability to work collaboratively and build relationships, succeed in a team and work independently Ability to exercise good judgement in making decisions and consistently exercise discretion in managing information Ability to analyze, research, organize and prioritize work and meet multiple deadlines Ability to handle confidential information with discretion Inclusiveness At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs. Job Family Change Management Job Category - Primary Project Management Job Category(s) Project Management Hours 37.5 Business Line TD Wealth Time Type Full Time Employment Type Regular Country Canada **Province/State (Primary) Ontario City (Primary) Toronto Work Location TD Centre - South - 79 Wellington Street West
jobdescription.48: Inventory Planning Analyst - Pay rate $23 per hour to $25 per hour Our client, a world class CPG manufacturer is looking for an experienced Inventory Planning Analyst for their plant located in Rexdale. What's in it for You? 6 month full time contractGreat Work environmentWork Life balanceWork for a world class CPG manufacturer Position Summary Under the direction of the Senior Logistics & Operations Supervisor, the role will be responsible for providing support and performing duties necessary to ensure inventory is accurate and physical or system errors are corrected, optimizing inventory systems, using Excel and other Business Systems. jobdescription.49: February 2021   Duration: Full Time   Reports to: Program Manager, Membership and Operations   About Earth Rangers:   Environmental education at a young age plays a critical role in influencing lifelong attitudes towards our natural world. But we can’t just equip children with knowledge—to create long term behavioral change, we must empower them with the ability to act on that knowledge. Preparing the next generation to be conservationists is some of the most important work that any of us can do, and the time to do it is now. Earth Rangers is the kids’ conservation organization, committed to instilling environmental knowledge, positivity, and the confidence to take action in every child in Canada. We do this through a suite of programming that children can participate in at school, at home, and in their communities. All of these programs are educational and engaging—but more importantly, they show children that it’s not too late to help the planet, and the things we do today will matter tomorrow. Founded as a small community organization in 2004, Earth Rangers has grown to be the largest youth environmental organization globally; a homegrown, Canadian success story with over 250,000 members and alumni. Job Summary:   The successful Data Analyst will assist Earth Rangers with the management of our data and will provide evidence based insights to inform business decisions. Sources of data include our membership activities, app usage, and web and social media analytics. The successful candidate will be curious and constantly looking for ways to improve our programs based on insights gleaned from the data.  Responsibilities *  Maintain a complete understanding of Earth Rangers data structures and architecture * Interpret Earth Rangers’ data sets and analyze results using statistical techniques * Provide technical expertise on data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing * Work closely with program managers to understand and maintain focus on their analytical needs, including identifying critical metrics and KPIs, and deliver actionable insights to relevant decision-makers * Proactively analyze data to answer key questions from stakeholders or out of self-initiated curiosity with an eye for what drives business performance, investigating and communicating areas for improvement in efficiency and productivity * Regularly pull reports for each department and work with managers to prioritize business and information needs using relevant data * Create appropriate documentation that allows stakeholders to understand the steps of the data analysis process * Manage and improve existing reporting systems Qualifications * University degree in Computer Science, Economics, or Statistics/Information Management. * Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst * Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages, databases (SQL, etc), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks) * Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS, etc) * Experience representing data in understandable/consumable formats for stakeholders * Technical writing experience in relevant areas, including queries, reports, and presentations * Administrative knowledge of Salesforce an asset * Knowledge of GIS systems an asset * Demonstrated experience in handling large data sets and relational databases, web analytics, and social media insights * Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy Interested applicants please forward your resume and cover letter to hr@earthrangers.com Earth Rangers is dedicated to fostering a diverse work environment. We will consider all qualified applicants for  employment. Applicants that meet the qualifications will be contacted for an interview. Earth Rangers is committed to accommodating applicants and employees with disabilities. Should you require  accommodation or this job description to be available in an accessible format, please advise.

jobdescription.51: Position:  Data Governance Analyst  Reports To:  Supervisor, Data Governance  Tier:  Staff  Department:  Data Governance  Company:  GS1 Canada  Location: Toronto(Remote)  Status:  Full-Time Contract(12 months)   Company Profile:  We are a member organization of GS1, the world’s leading supply chain standards organization. As a neutral, not-for-profit organization, we enable our more than 20,000 subscribers – organizations of all sizes from over 20 sectors across Canada – to enhance their efficiency and cost effectiveness by adopting electronic supply chain best practices.   What We Do: We develop standards that improve the way that business is conducted and allow Canadian businesses to compete on a global scale. We deliver implementation services that enable businesses to implement standards to achieve supply chain efficiency. We educate industry on how to incorporate collaborative commerce tools and processes into their businesses through seminars, conferences, and published guides and standards.  Who We Represent:  As a user-driven and governed organization, our subscriber base includes organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries and sectors located across Canada and around the world.  Keys To The Role  Our mission is to generate the greatest possible return on internal data assets by protecting the integrity of enterprise information through data management policies and guidelines. This requires a deep understanding of governance principles and a genuine desire to create, document and audit the conditions which will enforce its robustness.  The Data Governance Analyst will lead, or provide cross functional support, in these five primary areas: Process Mapping, Policy Creation, Data Definitions, Best Practices and Exception Reporting. The incumbent will be a champion in deploying best practices while maintaining standards and be a pillar of consistency which the business can rely on.  Duties and Responsibilities Recognizes the data requirements for enterprise data throughout the entire lifecycle Supports the implementation of strategies designed to enhance data reliability, quality and integrity Work closely with senior business and technology leaders to create programs, disciplines and practices to significantly improve the ownership and quality of critical enterprise data assets Assists with new initiatives and projects by understanding impacts on data constraints, data flow and business requirements Champions initiatives to enhance data quality by identifying opportunities for continuous improvement and efficiencies in reporting, analysis and/or product development Ensures that data governance guidelines are followed and that the needs of each business unit are met Maintain common data dictionaries for key data sources, tools and methods that support data standards for the organization Create process maps which clearly represents the flow of data and key decision-making steps Monitors and tracks data quality issues or gaps in processes and develops plans for remediation Works closely with local and global member office representatives to execute remediation plans Conducts numerous data conversion activities and facilitate data cleansing, collection and processing for new initiatives Collaborates with cross functional business units to determine data requirements and help meet needs while adhering to master data necessities Develops and reports on the health of master data for stakeholders Develops and maintains metrics to support enterprise and board level reports Assists with documenting and mapping the Data Warehouse content lifecycle process Develop standards, conventions and guidelines for the creation, deployment and maintenance of BI tools and reports Assist with Data Analysis counterparts to document and maintain procedures for data management and reporting standards Ensure ongoing understanding of relevant emerging technologies and services provided by GS1 Canada.   Required Knowledge, Skills, and Experience Successful completion of a four-year undergraduate degree in an applicable field, preferably Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology, Statistics, or, equivalent experience in applicable fields 1 to 2 years work experience relative to analytics, managing data and working with large and sometimes ubiquitous data file Process thinker with knowledge of data modelling is a benefit Ability to analyze, understand and effectively communicate/confirm business requirements, technical design and operational implementation of systems and processes Proven ability to apply critical thinking. Able to read between the lines to extrapolate requirements not explicitly written or identified and anticipates next steps Understanding of governance principles and master data management required. Proficiency with Excel and advanced capability with other MS Office applications highly desirable Background in business intelligence (BI) and familiarity with master data management highly preferred. Knowledge of Data Warehouses, design and/or architecture highly desired Working knowledge of Microsoft Dynamic CRM an asset Ability to understand complex processes, work and data flows and leverages excellent technical writing experience to illustrate succinctly in standard operating procedures, functional document or diagrams. Meticulous with high attention to detail particularly when reviewing work of others Proven ability to work on multiple projects, multitask and prioritize in a fast-paced environment Ability to work at a detailed level and quickly learn business application-specific details Strong analytical skills with the ability to extrapolate pertinent information from various sources (reports and spreadsheets) and analyse data for recommendations Confident communicator capable of speaking and presenting to stakeholders at all levels Proven high level of proficiency with MS Office suite (Word, Visio & PowerPoint, etc.) Entrepreneurial spirit suited for fast-paced, results-based environment requiring flexibility to ever-changing needs   GS1 Canada is an equal opportunity employer. If selected for an interview, please advise our Human Resources team if you require accommodation due to a disability during the interview and assessment process.
jobdescription.52: Overview:  You’ve got big plans. We have opportunities to match, and we’re committed to empowering you to become a better you, no matter what you do. When you join KPMG you’ll be one of over 207,000 professionals providing audit, tax, advisory and business enablement services across 153 countries. With the support to do things differently, grow personally and professionally and bring your whole self to work, there’s no limit to the impact you can make. Let’s do this. KPMG Canada is looking to hire for a unique an exciting Business Analyst/Project Management hybrid role for Ignition Tax. This role supports KPMG Canada’s major Tax technology projects, ensuring the delivered technology and business solutions are of high quality and consistent with the Firm’s vision. The successful candidate will work closely with clients and KPMG’s internal software development and innovation team to analyze, lead, develop, and deliver services in relation to integrating business applications or technology into our current environment Why join Ignition Tax: Competitive compensation package, flexible work arrangements, pension matching and flexible benefits Commitment to learning and development An opportunity to solve real problems by building products from the ground up You love coaching and mentoring others and working collaboratively with like minded entrepreneurs Thrive in a “Start-up culture” vibe What you will do:  Key Accountabilities:. Provide primary support for formulation of problem statement and definition of scope for their assigned area(s) Work with engagement management to define scope of work in context of larger project. Demonstrate exceptional requirement gathering techniques with minimal direction from engagement management Design, conduct and facilitate requirements sessions Logically structure recommendations and support data to formulate a solid, logical and clear business case. Organize working group sessions with subject matter experts, client team members and stakeholders to gather and document business processes and business requirements. Document the results of working group sessions to clearly identify and capture requirements. Create and maintain thorough and accurate project documentation (including functional and technical design specifications) according to the project management methodologies Identifying, analyzing and documenting business, functional and non-functional requirements Completing gap/fit analysis, including software application assessment/validation Creating service level agreements Data mapping, conversion documentation including detailed conversion strategies, and data migration Liaise and coordinate with other teams including the client, the business, project management, operations, and IT to move requirements towards execution Effectively communicating your insights and plans to cross-functional team members and management Managing projects and developing optimization strategies Assessing work requests to provide scope and effort estimates for BA services, developing work package plans, and executing work as planned Contributing to the development and maintenance of processes, procedures, standards and tools for the BA service area Proactively escalate project issues and risks that require program management or executive attention Meet with clients to take detailed ordering briefs and clarify specific requirements of each project Understand Agile and Waterfall way of working, be able to adopt to working in bi-modal environment and possess capability to shift the team to execute in both ways What you bring to this role: Minimum of 5 – 7 years' experience in a Technical BA role with formal education or equivalent experience 2+ years’ experience in a project management environment dealing with end-users, working effectively in a team-based environment with situations involving rapid change, shifting priorities, and/or simultaneous demands Proven ability to take ownership of their deliverables and bring a business consultant mindset combined with clarity and speed of thought. Someone who is able to build relationships with their stakeholders, and get up to speed quickly. Thorough understanding of project management methodologies, standards and tools and their application Ability to identify, understand and articulate client needs, generate opportunities, and suggest approaches for addressing issues Provides high-quality service, translating technical applications knowledge into functional business terminology and vice versa Experience with various analysis techniques including planning and facilitation of business process review sessions, gap/fit analysis sessions, and developer walkthroughs Demonstrated ability to effectively multi-task, while maintaining attention to detail, in a fast-paced, 'high-tech' environment required Nice to have Large scale technical implementation and development experience, especially within tax Previous work in software, tax and consulting industry Our Values, The KPMG Way:  Integrity, we do what is right | Excellence, we never stop learning and improving | Courage, we think and act boldly | Together, we respect each other and draw strength from our differences | For Better, we do what matters KPMG in Canada is a proud equal opportunities employer and we are committed to creating a respectful, inclusive and barrier-free workplace that allows all of our people to reach their full potential. A diverse workforce is key to our success and we believe in bringing your whole self to work. We welcome all qualified candidates to apply and hope you will choose KPMG in Canada as your employer of choice. If you have a question about accessible employment at KPMG, or to begin a confidential conversation about your individual accessibility or accommodation needs through the recruitment process, we encourage you to contact KPMG’s Employee Relations Service team for support at email: cdnersteam@kpmg.ca or phone: 416-777-8002 or toll free 1-888-466-4778 Option 3. For general recruitment-related inquiries, please contact the HR Delivery Centre at cafmcdnhrsthotline@kpmg.ca.
jobdescription.53: Requisition ID: 97894  Join the Global Community of Scotiabankers to help customers become better off. Reporting to the RFx Management Manager, this position provides support assistance to Sourcing Managers, Evaluators and 3rd parties during the running of RFx events and with general questions. jobdescription.55: Address: 100 King Street West Job Family Group: Commercial Sales & Service Facilitates decisioning and analysis of all types of credit information to support lending decisions and processes for the bank. Maintains and promotes a client service environment to satisfy and exceed customer needs and expectations. This role will make credit decisions and recommendations in accordance with sound credit-granting principles and in compliance with Bank Policies & Procedures. Identifies new sales opportunities for prospects and existing commercial clients through analysis. May participate in on-site client visits with other internal stakeholders. Maintains and promotes a customer service environment which meets and exceeds customer needs and expectations. Recommends credit according to sound credit-granting principles. Exercises individually held Commercial unilateral discretionary limits and any held prescribed approval discretionary limits. Supports the execution of strategic initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders. Evaluates clients’ ability to repay loans and consults on loan structure and collateral. Identifies trends in client activities which may be predictive of deteriorating credit quality. Performs periodic reviews of credit where more frequent monitoring may be appropriate. Understands borrower types typical in the high net worth market and their relation to collateral ownership, loan repayment, loan structure, etc. Grants loan requests within specified limits, using understanding of credit scoring and risk management concepts. Monitors covenants of clients within assigned portfolio to identify deteriorating credit conditions and compliance with loan agreement. Provides accurate financial analysis and risk assessment of new and existing customers. Partners with internal stakeholders for accurate, detailed client information. Develops credit information to make lending decisions on new, renewal and extension loans. Assists in negotiations of terms and conditions of all decisions made via phone and e-mail interaction with clients. Prepares summary, present facts and offer opinions concerning credit worthiness. Minimizes BMO’s risk exposure by adhering to internal credit policies and procedures with respect to lending decisions. Provides input into the planning and implementation of operational programs. Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders. Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus. Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules. Works independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unique situations. Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed. Qualifications: Typically between 4 - 6 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Technical proficiency gained through education and/or business experience. Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth. Collaboration & team skills - In-depth. Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth. Influence skills - In-depth. Data driven decision making - In-depth. We’re here to help At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world. As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset. To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en . BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.
