(This position is initially open to full time, bargaining unit employees of the college) Diversity, equity and inclusion are fundamental to our mission to educate students. We are committed to education that places strong emphasis on global citizenship, social justice and equity. We live this through the strength and richness that diversity brings to our workforce and welcome contributors from equity groups including: Visible Minorities, Persons with Disabilities, Lesbian Gay, Bisexual, Transgender and Queer persons We also recognize that Centennial is situated on the Treaty Lands of the Mississauaga of the Credit First Nation and pay tribute to their legacy as well as that of all First Peoples that have been and remain present here in Toronto. We recognize that First Peoples come from sovereign Nations and that part of understanding our responsibilities of residing on this territory are understanding the true history, circumstances and legacy of the Treaties signed here (such as the Toronto Purchase, Robinson-Huron Treaty and Williams Treaties) and including pre-contact Treaties and Agreements between sovereign Nations and that all peoples in this area are therefore Treaty people with obligations and responsibilities to all our relations. Position Summary Centennial College is immediately hiring a Senior Analyst, Data Visualization & Analytics with a strong foundation in data visualization and predictive modelling. Reporting to the Manager, Institutional Research Office, the Analyst will work independently to build and implement machine learning-based solutions to drive measurable organizational outcomes. The incumbent will use a combination of techniques from statistics, machine learning, computer science and data visualization, to produce advanced predictive analytics and data visualization solutions that determine patterns and relationships of large volumes of data to predict future behaviours, events and outcomes. The successful candidate will work collaboratively with staff across departments to clearly communicate research findings through dashboards, data visualizations, interactive charts, graphs and other tools to diverse audiences. These solutions will support strategic enrolment management (SEM) initiatives and the full student life cycle carried out by academic units and student support services college-wide. Responsibilities Provide centralized support and action plans to various data visualization and predictive analytics initiatives through the development of standardized frameworks, processes, measures, templates, tools, and checklists Build, develop and maintain inter-departmental data models, reporting systems, data automation systems, dashboards and performance metrics that support answers to complex business questions Create and maintain interactive dashboards in Cognos Analytics / PowerBI / Tableau through data interpretation and analysis, integrating various reporting components from multiple data sources Translate user needs into compelling BI dashboard designs utilizing best practices in infographic design Design, implement and deploy end-to-end machine learning / deep learning pipelines and models with cloud services (e.g., DataRobot, Dataiku, AWS Sagemaker, etc.) Build relationships with internal (leaders, administrators, faculty and support staff) and external stakeholders (Ministry of Colleges and Universities, Colleges Ontario, colleges and municipal governments) to implement strategic and changing business initiatives Identify business requirements and provide data consultation services to the college community Identify emerging issues and trends within data science and predictive analytics, to inform decision-making up to the institutional level; educate and advance data literacy and methodologies Structure/clarify unclear business problems and determine the appropriate statistical methodologies and techniques based to design solutions Thoroughly document data workflows, system functionality, and processes related to the collection and clean-up of data to improve the efficiency Diagnose and determine solutions for predictive and analytical model performance issues identified through system monitoring Maintain and re-engineer KPIs and various reports, including any data cleansing and manipulation when working with multiple disparate data sources Apply scripting and/or programming skills to varying types of source data (unstructured or structured) into datasets, to address tiers of granularities (i.e. demographics, transactions, etc.) Summarize statistical findings to draw reliable and accurate conclusions; presents actionable institutional and business recommendations Active involvement on multiple projects to ensure appropriate documentation and deliverables are met Ensure team members remain up-to-date with relevant knowledge and skills, and offer training opportunities to aid in the process Other duties as required Qualifications/Experience Master’s degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or Business Administration; other quantitative disciplines and/or equivalent experience will be considered Minimum five (5) years of corporate and/or academic research-driven work experience developing data visualization; statistical and machine learning models; simulation and visualization tools Experience with R, Python, and SQL Knowledge of SQL, entity relationship diagrams and dimensional data models. Experience with data visualization tools such as Cognos Analytics, Tableau, or Power BI. Proficient with word processing software, network computer systems (e.g., Banner / AIS, Windows, Microsoft Office, Crystal, Oracle, Cognos, Internet, College Websites, etc.) Demonstrated project management experience including processes and methodology, programs, and portfolio management Proven adaptability to manage multiple and changing priorities within a high volume and deadline-driven environment A self-starter with the ability to engage others in a highly diverse work environment and deliver results with minimal supervision Innovative thinking ability to identify opportunities or solutions to stay relevant and current with changing times Proven problem-solving and analytical skills Demonstrated oral, written and presentation skills High attention to detail and accuracy Experience mentoring, training and leading others Knowledge of CRM principles and lifecycle marketing strategies (e.g. customer journey, acquisition, conversion, loyalty, engagement, retention and attrition models) is an asset  Apply online: www.centennialcollege.ca/careers Proof of credentials or equivalencies from accredited regional or federal post secondary institutions and/or their foreign equivalents will be required at the time of job offer. jobdescription.57: Client Business Analyst Mosaic is a leading North American Integrated Agency, specialized in connecting with consumers through Experiential Marketing, Sales & Merchandising, and Shopper Marketing. At Mosaic, we are never satisfied with the status quo and are in constant search for new ideas and new ways to help our clients build their brands amidst the evolving dynamics of empowered consumers and leveraging new technologies.  The Client Business Analyst I position is responsible for the operational support of a client, including responsibility for reporting, data collection, survey setup, and other adhoc requests. The Analyst will lead standardized report design, automation and data administration. They will leverage business and market relevant information to make data-driven decisions that allow Mosaic to achieve its sales and marketing objectives and quickly adapt tactics. They will play a key role in evolving and growing the data-driven discipline within our team and contribute to our shared success.  The Incumbent(s) in this position should exhibit the following values: People Minded – Must show dignity and respect to all people Integrity – Must exemplify the highest degree of ethical behavior Results Oriented – Must show passion, pride and commitment to succeed Trust – Must be honest, sincere and confident Teamwork – Must build trusting relationships Innovation – Must progress through a combination of creativity, common sense and vision Balance – Must maintain an optimistic attitude and keep perspective on what is important in life  Responsibilities: Collect, inspect, cleanse, transform, model and diagram of complex data sets Daily use of various business intelligence and analytical software tools Interpret data, formulate reports and make recommendations to the team Design and build specific research methods such as surveys and market testing Remain fully informed on latest data trends, practice and process Other duties as assigned, such as managing systems access and tracking assets  Qualifications Minimum Qualifications: A Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Statistics, Computer Services, Geography or related quantitative field, or equivalent practical experience 1-3 years of relevant professional experience Intermediate Microsoft Excel skills including formulas, pivot tables and V-lookup Intermediate knowledge of data cleansing and data visualization using systems such as Power BI, Tableau, SQL, and R/Python Preferred Qualifications: Excellent communication skills, with the ability to interact comfortably with peers and leadership both internally and jobdescription.60: Company Description As one of the largest independent technology companies in Atlantic Canada, Mariner has a team of over 200 IT and software professionals working with clients both regionally and across the globe. With extensive capabilities in the areas of analytics, automation software, information security and IT consulting, Mariner has been delivering innovative solutions with a strong emphasis on productivity and customer experience since 2003.  Job Description Mariner is currently recruiting for a Business Analyst to support our Telecommunications clients based both within the Maritimes and also throughout Canada.  Qualifications  Bachelor’s Degree in business administration, information systems, or related field. Experience with BCRIS is mandatory. 5+ years experience working in a Quality Assurance Analyst role. Experience leading business analysis and testing activities on large, complex projects; Experience preparing Business Requirements Documents, including functional/non-functional requirements Demonstrated ability to create, plan, manage, and execute test strategies, plans, and cases to support business process and software development quality assurance; Experience utilizing formal testing methodologies to verify that system and business applications meet specific requirements. Experience using defect management and testing tools. Demonstrated experience working well with an integrated team of both business and technical resources. Experience working in client-based consulting role is highly desirable. Additional Information Why Mariner Partners? We believe in making a positive impact in the communities where we live and work – our team is located in major cities all across Canada, throughout the US and internationally. We are proud to be headquartered here, and are passionate about growing a strong technology sector here in Atlantic Canada and beyond. We offer competitive compensation; benefits packages and training and development. We recognize that empowered employees are more innovative, more efficient, deliver better customer service and can flat out-perform conventional organizations. Our people have built products for national deployments at the world’s largest TV and Internet companies and leading real estate, financial and government organizations. We are looking for passionate IT professionals who are curious about data, who love solving problems for customers and who want to grow their careers. Join our growing team!
jobdescription.61: What is the opportunity? The Senior Configuration Analyst will be a main player on the IT Service Management (ITSM) team with the key role of managing the day to day activities for the Enterprise Configuration Management process. Objectives include setting up the Configuration Management Database (CMDB), expanding use of the CMDB into other IT processes, aid in establishing a Configuration Management process, and establishing relationships with Configuration Item (CI) owners to enforce the process. This role will focus on Configuration Management but will also be involved in other aspects of the ITSM processes such as Asset, Change, Incident, Problem, Availability and Service Level Management. The primary responsibility will be setting up and maintaining the CMDB. What will you do? Configuration Management process improvements/ITSM initiatives: Support the Senior Manager, Enterprise Configuration Management in the implementation of the CMDB Assist the Senior Manager, Enterprise Configuration Management with continual process improvement; lead and deliver key project-based initiatives Collaborate with IT & Process Owners, and Process Stakeholders to gather and analyze needs, translating these needs into requirements; maintain up to date knowledge of industry best practice standard Configuration Management Operational Tasks: Ensure the Configuration Management process is understood and adhered to; assist in identifying and onboarding new CI Types; work with CI Owners to help maintain their data Reconcile the CMDB data when exceptions are noted between CMDB, discovery information, and other authoritative production data repositories Resolve CI duplicates within the CMDB; work with CI Owners to identify and understand CI relationships; build, maintain and validate CI relationships within the CMDB Work with Discovery/CMDB administrator to enable Discovery services or implement scripts required to process data feeds to update the CMDB; establish and support controls and procedures to review, assess, prioritize, & track compliance to requirements incorporated into tool and process designs; maintain operational procedures and knowledge base; assist with process documentation and user guides Metrics, Reporting and Governance Develop reports for management on KPIs to improve the process effectiveness, efficiency, and data accuracy; perform CMDB audits to ensure data completeness and quality; enable process adherence through reporting and dashboards What do you need to succeed? Must Have: Bachelor’s Degree or Diploma in Computer Science, Information Systems or related field along with 5 to 7 years Configuration Management experience Experience in data analysis and management utilizing advanced Excel techniques Familiarity with Agile and SCRUM methodologies Experience in a large IT shared services organization Excellent interpersonal, communication, collaboration and documentation skills Ability to interact effectively with geographically and culturally diverse teams Understanding of Service Management processes Passion for learning and knowledge transferAbility to interact effectively with geographically and culturally diverse teams Nice to have: ITIL v3 Foundations Certified Learn more about RBC Tech Jobs  Join our Talent Community Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.  Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers. jobdescription.62: Position Title: Supply Chain Analyst Intern (Temp) Requisition ID: 13021 Career Group (ADSP): Distribution Center Division: Supply Chain (80190525) Department: Logistics and Distribution Work Location: METRO ON - 5559 DUNDAS STREET W (#A-DUND) Province: Canada : Ontario Position Type: Intern/Student Summary  A Supply Chain Intern at Metro Ontario is responsible for supporting the Supply Chain Integrated Planning team in planning and optimizing functions in the supply chain, contributing with detailed definition of business requirements, design of distribution solutions, continuous improvement initiatives and analysis to support business strategies as well as supporting the stores and business services team. This is an exciting opportunity for an intern to support project management and execution of changes to supply chain to improve item availability, service levels, and reductions in total cost-to-serve. Projects can include distribution center capacity assessment, layout and design as well as network optimization and network strategic analysis. The industrial engineering intern is responsible for data analysis, time studies, process mapping and KPI reporting through to presentation of solutions, mapping new processes and simulation of results. Responsibilities Provide design and engineering support for new automation process, with focus on productivity improvement and maximizing return on capital investments Perform detailed analysis and research to conduct feasibility studies in support of the development of project business case analysis Build project requirements and manage the successful execution of a range of selected tactical projects in collaboration with stakeholders and cross functional teams Support the development of short and long-term planning including automated network design and optimization. Support the project and implementation team with analysis, KPI reporting performance improvement.  Qualifications Industrial Engineering/Supply Chain Management/Business undergraduate student (or equivalent) Ability to model operational problems Excellent communication, interpersonal and presentation skills Highly proficient PC skills including MS Excel, Access, Visio, and Project (an asset) Self motivated, capable of managing multiple projects and strong data mining skills Moderate travelling between Ontario’s Distribution Center’s is needed and travel between Ontario and Quebec may be required Bilingual (French, an asset) Metro values, respects and leverages the differences and competences of all employees from a variety of different backgrounds. We will consider all qualified applicants for employment.  Metro is committed to accommodating applicants and employees with disabilities. Should you require an accommodation or wish to receive this application in an accessible format, please advise.  Only applicants that meet the qualifications will be contacted. jobdescription.64: HSBC Global Services Canada Limited (HGCA), is a subsidiary of HSBC Global Services Limited, owned by HSBC Holdings plc. HGCA provides operational services to countries across the HSBC Group which is the largest and leading international bank in the Canada. We help companies and individuals across Canada to manage their finances through three global business lines: Commercial Banking, Global Banking and Markets, and Wealth and Personal Banking. It’s this global connectivity that you will find yourself inspired and collaborating with colleagues not just locally but also across continents and cultures. About Global Banking & Markets, IT Global Banking and Markets (GBM) provides financial services and products to corporates, governments and institutions worldwide, building partnerships with them to help them achieve consistent, long-term performance. We use the strength of HSBC’s international network to connect emerging and mature markets, covering key growth areas. Our products and services include advisory, financing, prime services, research and analysis, securities services, trading and sales, and transaction banking. The Global Banking and Markets Technology team is dedicated to supporting Global Banking and Markets by working in partnership with business leaders who rely on us for delivering innovative, robust, stable platforms to enable their investment and financial solutions for clients. Join Global Banking and Markets Technology and be part of the global connectivity, collaboration and team that spans across 20 countries. The total number of successful production releases surpass some of the biggest blue chip tech companies. Canada is a key location in Global Banking and Markets Technology’s global growth strategy and is receiving global attention for its deliveries. Key Objectives for Business Analyst Bloomberg Trade Order Management Solutions and Optitrade Support: Fixed Income normally refers to debt markets under Global Banking & Markets. This role is particularly for Fixed Income projects which facilitate market connectivity, pricing, Request for Quotes and negotiations, processing and persistence of trades electronically for fixed income Cash business covering bonds and derivative products. Senior Business Analyst responsible for Fixed Income Cash Business use of Bloomberg and Operations use of Optitrade for the block and allocation flow. Analyst will be required to assist and investigate issues and questions raised by a variety of stakeholders. These queries will range from functional questions about the use of both systems, queries with system set up, processing issues and data issues. The expectation is the role will extend to assist the Global Team with testing, system changes and ad hoc Maintain the Bank items managed by the Team. The candidate would be responsible to deliver multiple services for the project with quality and efficiency coordinating with global stakeholders. The candidate should be able to work in a techno-functional role as an individual contributor responsible for business communication, requirement analysis and implementing solutions as a hands on contributor. He/she would be required to coordinate with global business/technical team and Production Support teams. Proven track record of delivering high quality, excellent analysis and excellent communication and interpersonal skills are the essentials for the position. Principle Accountabilities: We are looking for an experienced Senior Business Analyst who will join our team supporting Business, development and maintenance of the Fixed Income applications (Trade Order Management Solutions & Optitrade) A successful candidate must have deep knowledge and skills in investment banking with both front-end and back-end applications in order to support various requirements coming from our business partners We expect this person will play one of the key roles in the delivery team - not only when it comes to analysis but self-driven in understanding functionalities across different flows/applications, trouble-shooting on production issues and guiding other members in team Identifying potential issues, reviewing solutions and recommending strategies for solving problems. Provide support to Technical lead responsible for the project delivery Conducting research – business process and strategy – to ensure knowledge of best practice needed to support delivery for business stakeholders The Candidate must be reactive and responsive to queries raised by the Business. The Candidate Have an appreciation of the priority of the issue, who is asking and what the impact of the request is. The Analyst must Always be professional and act with integrity. Seek guidance and support from the Team – always look to gain additional experience and knowledge to be able to better support stakeholders. The Analyst must Develop relationships with Operational users of Optitrade & Always ensure that answers to any queries are concise, directive and correct. Should an answer not be immediately available ensure we communicate this and work with the wider Team to seek guidance. Always ensure that an issue is fully resolved to the satisfaction of the requestor. Be willing and prepared to work limited shift patterns so that we have coverage amongst the Team from Hong Kong Mid-day until United States mid-day. Ensure compliance with all relevant internal instructions (Functional Instruction Manual, Global Standards Manual, circulars), internal control standards and external regulatory requirements, including the management of operational risk and adherence to the Group’s standards of ethical behaviour. Ensure that confluence documentation is fully maintained as and when new solutions, resolution pages are created. Major Challenges are to become system and process flow experts in both Bloomberg Trade Order Management Solutions and Optitrade. Functional usage in Bloomberg is a cross a varied set of users, so queries can range from Trader use, end to end straight through processing queries re trades, files queries around data attributes etc etc. Gaining an in-depth cross functional knowledge will be an ongoing, iterative process, which at times will have to be self-taught. Need to be multi-functional IA Financial provide support and also be able to do Business Analyst and testing to support the full stack pod in ad hoc Maintain the Bank projects. The ultimate aim of this role is to become a fully productive and integral part of the full stack Team. Levels of knowledge across the Team can be at different levels however each resource must show an interest and also a desire to take on more responsibility be self-sufficient and look to increase knowledge of the product, the processes and the systems. Qualifications Knowledge & Experience / Qualifications: Individual Contributor 8-12 years of experience as an individual contributor Experience in Agile projects Participate in production support of Fixed Income application & worked on improvement initiatives like improvement of performance, production stability Self-motivated, enthusiastic and proven rapid learning capability Experience working in fast-paced, collaborative environment Excellent Understanding of Block and allocation flow & Testing experience in FI Cash flow. Evidence of working in a controlled environment. Previous knowledge of Fixed Income products ( cash Trading ) Experience in the use of Bloomberg TOMs would be ideal however Knowledge of Cash Primary trading systems, inherent system functions and a basic understanding of additional PTS functions IE PnL pricing etc etc would be desirable F2b knowledge of cash fixed income processing would be desirable Experience in an automated Production support Team environment would be desirable, one which has used CHAT BOTs and has used Symphony extensively. Experience in JIRA and RTC and some limited knowledge in task automation and Python/scripting language would be desirable. Technical Good To Have Technical exposure to Java. Exposure to industry standard financial production support standareds. L2 production support of BBG-Toms and Optitrade applications Exposure to Automation. Domain Must Have Exposure to Fixed Income Cash and Derivartive products. Understanding of electronic markets, trading terminologies, pricing models, reference data. Knowledge of Block & Alocation flow in FI. Able to go through logs and write basic queries in database Technical exposure to Geneos Monitoring & Maintenance Experience 8-12 Years Qualifications FI Production support experience with Equivalent Qualifications HSBC Proud As a business operating in markets all around the world, we believe diversity brings benefits for our customers, our business and our people. This is why HSBC Canada is committed to being an inclusive employer and encourages applications from all suitably qualified applicants irrespective of background, circumstances, age, disability, gender identity, ethnicity, religion or belief and sexual orientation. If this is not the ideal role for you, we invite you to sign up to our talent community so that we can update you about job opportunities and career events in your area of interest. We are always looking for people with purpose and ambition who can help us build the bank for the future. We encourage all Indigenous peoples of North America and Persons with Disabilities to self-identify in their applications. In addition, we invite you to reach out to Matt Woods, our Diversity Recruitment Relationship Manager at matthew.r.woods@hsbc.ca for support during the selection process.
jobdescription.65: Anheuser-Busch InBev (‘AB InBev’) is looking for an ambitious and driven finance / consulting professional to join their North America (US & Canada) Global Risk Management team and assist in developing innovative ways of solving complex business problems through the use of data analytics and detailed root cause analysis.  You will work with a dynamic and high-performing Global team reviewing all functions of the organization to solve real business problems, understand underlying processes and make recommendations in order to add value to and improve controls of the business.  You will: Develop new ways of solving complex business issues through the use of data, analytical tools, working with the business and understanding various processes. Depending on the review, you will work with a variety of people from different functions within ABInBev.  Act as an owner for your part of the reviews. You will conduct interviews with internal and external stakeholders, understand the key processes and controls, perform in-depth analysis and document your findings and recommendations for presentation to senior management.  Practically use and regularly improve your technical/functional knowledge as well as gain exposure to a variety of other functions within ABInBev.  Be required at times to step out of your comfort zone and develop your corporate contact network in a highly dynamic environment.  Take initiative to drive meaningful outcomes from reviews and adopt an Agile project management approach to continuously prioritize and align focus areas.  Primarily focus on reviews of ABInBev’s US & Canada business units but have periodic exposure to reviews in other ABInBev business units globally  By joining our department, you will have the opportunity to work in a small but truly Global team and perform quarterly reviews focused on key business processes (from Finance to Production including Support Functions, Sales, Procurement, etc.) and controls. You will use your knowledge to bring actionable and value-adding insights to stakeholders and will have the opportunity to develop further your analytical, soft and risk management skills.  Competencies  :  At AB InBev you truly own your (Global) career. We are looking for an ambitious person who is eager to grow, develop her/his technical and management skills and, in time, bring expertise to other functions within AB InBev.  You have a problem-solving mindset to help the team find the root cause of complex business problems in a sustainable way. You can quickly understand processes and highlight financial and operational risks.  You are a good communicator, capable of clearly describing complex problems and recommend solutions to senior management (both orally and in writing).  Experience with Microsoft suite (powerpoint, excel, word)  Experience with data analytics / visualization tools (PowerBi, Tableau etc.)  You are fluent (Oral and Written) in English  You are comfortable working with remote teams  You are willing to travel (up to around 30% of working time)  Job Qualifications  Required Qualifications: University degree  At least 2 years of experience in position(s) where you developed your analytical skills (e.g. external audit, internal audit, due diligence, business analyst, management consultant, business controller, data analyst)  Good to have and/or willing to learn: Knowledge of SAP that you can leverage to perform in-depth analysis during reviews  A good understanding of basic accounting and finance principles  Experience with internal control, external audit and/or internal audit frameworks and methodology  Experience with a programming language (R, Python, SQL) for developing data extraction queries and/or data analysis scripts  Experience with Agile methodology approach to project management

jobdescription.67: Overview:  You’ve got big plans. We have opportunities to match, and we’re committed to empowering you to become a better you, no matter what you do. When you join KPMG you’ll be one of over 200,000 professionals providing audit, tax, advisory and business enablement services across 154 countries. With the support to do things differently, grow personally and professionally and bring your whole self to work, there’s no limit to the impact you can make. Let’s do this. Overview of the opportunity: Our Data Loss Prevention (DLP) Group in Business Enablement Services is looking for a Risk Analyst, to join our team. The DLP Group helps ensure the firm and its personnel are in compliance with KPMG’s Global Acceptable Use and other information policies. What you will do: Monitor and assess potential DLP incidents as they arise Advise relevant stakeholders of required actions as a result of DLP incidents Organize and document incident management from initiation to completion Assess, summarize, and escalate potential breaches to leadership Manage group mailbox as well as internal database used for tracking Assisting partners and staff with related queries Provide support on ad-hoc project work Assist with the development of other operational/project documentation Provide support to other teams within the broader Risk Management Group, as needed At times, business needs arise and employees are required and agree to work beyond their normal work day or work week to fulfill the accountabilities required for their job. Likewise, people need time to devote to personal matters, and our approach to flexibility provides for this. What you bring to this role: Undergraduate degree Self-motivated, intellectually curious, diligent, able to respond promptly and professionally to all requests and inquiries. Strong verbal and written communication skills; comfort interacting with individuals in high-level roles within the firm. Takes initiative and has strong organizational, research, and analytical skills Must be able to work independently and flexibly Ability to build and maintain professional relationships Proficient with Excel, Research via the Internet and comfort with online tools Must be able to manipulate spreadsheet and database information for analysis Familiarity with various software packages and databases Be aware of the sensitivity of information received and treat it appropriately Our Values, The KPMG Way:  Integrity, we do what is right | Excellence, we never stop learning and improving | Courage, we think and act boldly | Together, we respect each other and draw strength from our differences | For Better, we do what matters KPMG in Canada is a proud equal opportunities employer and we are committed to creating a respectful, inclusive and barrier-free workplace that allows all of our people to reach their full potential. A diverse workforce is key to our success and we believe in bringing your whole self to work. We welcome all qualified candidates to apply and hope you will choose KPMG in Canada as your employer of choice. If you have a question about accessible employment at KPMG, or to begin a confidential conversation about your individual accessibility or accommodation needs through the recruitment process, we encourage you to contact KPMG’s Employee Relations Service team for support at email: cdnersteam@kpmg.ca or phone: 416-777-8002 or toll free 1-888-466-4778 Option 3. For general recruitment-related inquiries, please contact the HR Delivery Centre at cafmcdnhrsthotline@kpmg.ca.
jobdescription.68: Header:  Position Summary: As one of Canada’s largest Restaurant Equipment Suppliers and fabricators, Trimen Food Service Equipment Ltd is looking for an ESTIMATOR to support our sales, project management and business development teams in our Bid & Tender segment, Multi Unit Chain Restaurant business, and our Independent Street Business initiatives. Based at our Head office at Trimen Toronto, this position will report into the Director of Purchasing and Supply Chain. This role will require the successful candidate to take proactive action to estimate all projects from start to finish, including the creation of the initial quote, manage the addendum process up to and including bid submittals. We are looking for a creative individual who strives in a collaborative environment, but is also comfortable working with a degree of autonomy where/when required. We expect this individual to build a growth strategy from the ground up and successfully execute upon our ambitious goals. Responsibilities & Qualifications:  Roles and Responsibilities: Accountable for the entire estimating process - from RFP receipt and acknowledgement through to submission. Ensure alignment with divisional goals and objectives as related to pricing and margin needs Use industry costing tools to prepare estimates Follow CCDC guidelines with 11-400 category focus for Bid & Tender Maintain consistency for our chain business Manage Project Cost Control and job overruns Manage Customers Order process in conjunction with our Project Managers teams Project forecasting and analysis as well as conduct job costing analysis from time to time Conduct peer reviews with PM teams to ensure accurate and timely submittals Building and maintenance of client and supplier relationships Reviewal of all tender documents and ensuring accuracy and timelines of tender submissions Coordination and ongoing support to our sales and business development team Develop and utilize exception reporting to provide accurate and timely recommendations to leadership regarding pricing and margin issues. Participates in the development of training activities around pricing Participates with the category teams in the establishment of cost Development of ‘best practices’ with regard to Trimen program pricing The successful candidate should demonstrate: Proficient communication skills - both written and verbal - to communicate effectively with a broad-based team including diverse internal stakeholders Excellent internal customer service, interpersonal and communication skills. Must be able to develop, refine, communicate, and implement plans and to set goals. Industry, and segment knowledge preferred, and able to analyze and interpret data. Must have excellent time management, administration, and organizational skills with attention to detail. Must be able to build relationships, network, influence and link resources to plan and execute business practices. jobdescription.69: Company Bio IMAGINE a hospital where everyone is committed to excellence. We did. We are. From boardroom to bedside, we go above and beyond to offer the best and safest patient care. At North York General Hospital (NYGH), we put our patients first in everything we do. We are achieving a new standard of excellence in integrated patient-centered care and as one of Canada's leading community academic hospitals, we are building on our academic foundation through enhanced education, research and innovation. North York General Hospital is part of North York Toronto Health Partners, a collaborative partnership with patients, primary care, and community partners, a first- generation Ontario Health Team, driving the development of a locally integrated health system to serve the community. As part of our dynamic team, you too can stand out and be amazing! At North York General, our team is making a world of difference. Position Summary Research Data Analyst, Research and Innovation Research & Innovation at North York General Hospital currently has an opening for a Temporary Full-Time Research Analyst. The contract is for one year with the possibility of renewal. Reporting to Dr. Katie Dainty and her team, this role will support a growing research portfolio of projects related to patient-centred outcomes, patient and family experiences of health and health care, and quality improvement in health care settings. We are seeking a highly motivated individual with strengths in qualitative health research and familiarity with quantitative and literature review methods. The ideal candidate will have experience with qualitative interviewing, qualitative data analysis (including coding, writing memos and analytic notes), and use of NVivo or other data management programs. Additional experience with survey-based data collection and analysis are considered assets. On a practical level, you will  Assisting with the day-to-day operations of ongoing qualitative and survey studies, including:  Liaising with patients, family members, and other stakeholder groups (e.g., clinical staff, decision-makers, etc.), to arrange research interviews.  Liaising with other investigators and research team members to facilitate recruitment and ensure the consistency and quality of all study procedures.  Conducting participant recruitment/enrollment and informed consent processes.  Monitoring project requirements to ensure that data and procedure flow in accordance with study protocols.  Maintaining ongoing records of participant recruitment, data collection, and analysis files in an organized manner that is easily accessible by other research team members.  Supporting interview and survey data collection, management, and analysis.  Contributing to the writing of final reports and manuscripts.  Supporting literature reviews (e.g. basic, scoping, systematic).  Scheduling and attending research meetings, including preparing agendas and meeting minutes. Qualifications  At minimum, completion of a Bachelor’s degree in health sciences, social sciences, or related fields that include formal training in the qualitative methodologies. Master’s degree strongly preferred (complete or in progress). Formal training and/or education related to qualitative research methods is required.  A minimum of two (2) years of qualitative research experience in an academic/health care/scientific environment.  Experience conducting qualitative interviews, analyzing qualitative data, and writing research reports is required.  Advanced written and verbal communication, critical thinking, analytical abilities, and interpersonal skills.  Demonstrated ability to work independently and as a team member and set priorities for delegated tasks  Excellent time management and organizational skills with attention to detail.  Previous word-processing, database and qualitative data management experience in a Microsoft Office environment, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and NVivo. Experience working online with video conferencing technologies (e.g. Zoom, MS Teams) an asset.  Knowledge of ICH/GCP regulations and guidelines.  Ability to produce high quality work in accordance with Hospital standards.  Ability to maintain confidentiality and strong knowledge of clinical ethics regulations.  Must be flexible to work Monday to Friday from 8:30 am to 4:30 pm with occasional evening/weekend hours required for data collection. This will be an off-site position pending pandemic conditions.  Bilingualism in French/English an asset What We Offer Working at NYGH means working with a dynamic team of fellow healthcare providers, staff, and volunteers in one of Canada’s leading hospitals. This is a Full-time Temporary Position (approx. 12 months), with 75 hours bi-weekly, 8 hour shifts, Days, in Research & Innovation. We offer a highly competitive total compensation package which may include benefits, pension, vacation pay, or pay in lieu of benefits, when applicable. If you were searching for more reasons to consider joining the wonderful team at NYGH, check out some features of our Total Rewards package by visiting nygh.on.ca How to Apply  Think you're the right person for the job? Here's your first chance to show us why: Ensure to meet the deadline - only applications received by the closing date will be considered. We will review all applications and will contact those selected for an interview. Closing Statement  At North York General, we are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the community in which we live, including those with disabilities. North York General is committed to providing accommodations in all parts of the hiring process. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.
jobdescription.70: Address: 55 Bloor Street West Job Family Group: Data Analytics & Reporting Description The Channels Analyst is responsible for developing automated, scalable reporting and analytics solutions for Canadian P&BB. This position will support omni-channel analytics through delivery of reporting, insights and measurement in line with Enterprise strategy and Digital Acceleration. The incumbent will act as reporting and analytics subject matter expert for the Digital Channels portfolio while also supporting NACCC, combining both business and technology acumen to generate and maintain reporting in various forms (ad-hoc analyses, data visualization, self-serve BI). Specific Accountabilities Build Power BI Dashboards from scratch and maintain existing reporting Data curation – extracting data from multiple sources, manipulating and validation using database tools. Must have SAS, SQL skills and experience Identify, analyze and interprets trends of patterns in complex data set. Analyze data to drive business decisions and actionable recommendations Assimilate and analyze information from a variety of sources, make recommendations and present information in an easy and understandable manner Develop in-depth understanding of BMO data and systems (IDP, CAD, CDW, Adobe) Comfortable with ambiguity – self-learner able to independently navigate complex data Work proactively and collaboratively with key clients and stakeholders to continuously enhance reporting Quality check key deliverables, ensuring they are delivered accurately and to the highest quality Qualifications The ideal candidate will have the following: 3+ years experience in business intelligence/ ETL, analytics 3+ years experience in Finance industry Strong experience within data preparation, data analysis, and statistical tool sets including but not limited to SQL, SAS, R/Python Experience implementing data visualization (Power BI, Spotfire, Tableau) Strong logical thinking, analytical and problem solving skills; Willingness to learn and being curious; Ability to perform on multiple projects simultaneously and deliver under tight timelines Experience with BMO data and familiarity with BMO products and operations Requirements A university degree in mathematics, statistics, economics, econometrics, engineering, computer science, physics We’re here to help At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world. As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset. To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en . BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. jobdescription.74: The Opportunity Job Posting Number: 2021-055 (TEMP)  Position: Temporary Business Analyst – 12 Month Contract  Location: Vaughan (Cityview) Reports to: Head, Grid Innovation  Business Unit: GRE&T Centre Division: Grid Innovation  Hours per Week: 35 Rate of Pay: Commensurate with range and candidate’s experience  Number of Openings: 1 Union: No  Open: March 4, 2021 Close: March 18, 2021  Position Purpose: The Alectra Green Energy & Technology Centre (GRE&T Centre) makes energy innovations come to life by identifying, evaluating, developing and accelerating the commercialization of emerging, clean, and customer-friendly energy solutions, creating sustainable values for customers, shareholders and communities it serves. The Grid Innovation team at the GRE&T Centre is focused on enabling a more sustainable electricity grid, by unleashing the potential of grid modernization technologies and integrating distributed energy resources (DERs) into local electricity grid. The Business Analyst will provide support to the project initiatives undertaken by Grid Innovation team. The incumbent will work closely with the Grid Innovation team and provide technical support in delivering pilot projects such as Non-Wires alternative (“NWA”) project aimed at designing and operating local distribution energy market that enables distributed energy resources (DER) to participate in grid services; defer or reduce the need for wires investment on distribution grid. Responsibilities: Participate in daily project development meeting with the software system vendor; document, update and maintain issues tracking system, capturing live issues and progress on software development. Analyze business functional requirements to identify information, procedures, and business rules; review and update functional specification documents as necessary to ensure it is up-to-date and address business requirement changes. Assist with the solution design discussion including database structure, user interface, customer experience etc. Ensure that changes and features to the system development are properly submitted, updated, assigned, escalated in the current development ticketing system. Create, deliver, and maintain user stories, process workflows, mockups and system test cases. Conduct user acceptance testing, system integration testing, regression testing and all other Q&A testing, ensuring system is functioning as designed. Discover, record and log system issues, defects and resolutions; participate in debug solutioning, fix and QA testing. Identify areas for improvement and make appropriate recommendations to the project team pertaining to best practices, processes, templates, workflows and methodologies. Coordinate and support the project teammates and management to ensure alignment of projects and timelines. Ensure deliverables and feedback needed by project team and vendor software development teams are provided in a timely manner to ensure overall delivery of projects on-time and within budget. Collaborate and interact with a variety of team members and business units to coordinate project activities; perform demos and customers/users support to the system. Perform qualitative and quantitative analysis of new and existing data sets and research reports, including advanced modelling and analysis through Excel or similar tools, and develop recommendations based on findings. Develop written reports and presentations as required to communicate project updates, share research findings and provide topical backgrounders for internal and external stakeholders. Maintain collaborative working relationships with vendor project team members and support collective efforts on projects delivery. Provide project support as needed to support the achievement of departmental objectives and other initiatives being carried on within the GRE&T Centre Other duties as assigned  Education & Specialized Knowledge: Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science or related discipline from an accredited institution field Direct experience with both classical waterfall software development lifecycle (SDLC) and agile methodologies (i.e. scrum) High level of proficiency with MS Office applications including MS Project, Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Visio, etc. General knowledge of the energy markets and utility industries Experience: Minimum of 3 years of business analyst or related work experience demonstrating the range of duties expected for this position Experience in Azure DevOps system environment Experience in project management on web-based software development project Knowledge of energy policy and regulation, especially related to distributed energy resources is a strong asset Experience working in Energy/Utility and/or Data Analytics sector is a strong asset  Skills/Abilities/Competencies: Strong analytical, problem resolution, technical, application/system troubleshooting skills with the ability to think clearly and resolve issues efficiently under pressure. Excellent organizational and time management skills with high attention to detail in a demanding, deadline-driven environment. Ability to successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously. Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and collaborate effectively with other team members as needed. Excellent data gathering techniques supported by strong interpersonal skills. Demonstrated ability to use creative and strategic thinking to identify and develop solutions for customers Demonstrated skills in research and planning to support strategy development and commercialization planning Ability to build and maintain strong collaborative and collegial working relationships with team members, and internal and external stakeholders Strong oral, written and presentation skills, with the ability to learn, apply and explain information in an organized and concise way Self-motivated; ability to work both independently and as a team player Strong results orientation, with excellent attention to detail Must hold and maintain a valid class “G” driver’s license How to Apply If you would like to be considered for this position and meet the qualifications, please submit your resume by clicking on the button below. Should you have any questions regarding this opportunity, or need assistance in applying for the posting, please send your inquiry to careers@alectra.com . You can also submit a resume for us to keep on file and review as new opportunities arise that might be the right fit for your skills and experience. Alectra is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing a recruitment process that respects the dignity and independence of all candidates. Should you require accommodation at any stage in the recruitment, assessment and selection process please consult with Alectra’s People Team. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career with Alectra. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
jobdescription.75: Category: Business Analysis (functional and technical) City: Toronto, Ontario, Canada Position ID: J0121-0553 Employment Type: Full Time Position Description: CGI is a global business and technology service provider with $11.5B in revenues. CGI is on a mission to help financial services organizations focus on servicing their clients. CGI supports 15 of the top 20 banks worldwide and our top 10 banking clients have worked with us for 26 years on average. Our clients have seen the value and commitment we bring through our products. This is why nearly $1.6 trillion in assets managed through CGI’s portfolio management, investment fund and asset management solutions. You will be joining our consulting organization at pivotal point. We have ambitious growth plans and are looking for motivated people to join us.  As a Business Analyst, you will be given the tools to solve business problems, but it’ll up to you to make it happen. As an experienced analyst, you will be expected to mentor our junior analysts.  Your future duties and responsibilities: Diagnose. Be curious. Learn from others – peers, development team, and management. Read about new regulations, follow industry forums, think about how to build new solutions and improve what we have built. Identify what we do well and what we can do better.   Solution. Solve complex problems working with your team. Understand regulatory and business requirements and come up with scalable solutions. Ask questions and think about if solutions others have in mind really address the core problem. Cut out anything that is not needed. Work with developers to implement the solution and automate testing. Test it and make sure it works as we expect it to.   Mentor. Help your team get better. Work with junior analysts to improve their contribution to the team. Build a sense of community.   Who are you?  Quality first. You believe quality is into every step of the development cycle, not bolted on at the end. You believe in automating as much as possible. You believe we should be open-minded and logic should prevail where the best solution given constraints wins.   Team player. You believe a strong team will achieve more than a few heroes. You believe humility is strength and that no one, including yourself, is above any task to achieve a team goal. You try to foster an environment in which teammates can constructively challenge anyone for the betterment of the team.   Continuous learner. You are open-minded and are excited about being challenged and solving complex problems. You can empathize with and mentor junior analysts to solve business problems. You get excited at the opportunity to work on new and complex problems. Required qualifications to be successful in this role: You need to have:  experience as a Capital Markets business analyst for at least 5 yearsexperience working in an agile environmentknowledge of Client Onboarding, Account Management, KYC, Anti-Money Laundering initiatives or Capital Markets regulatory initiatives strong analytical and communication skillsstrong technical skills including SQL, data analysis and systems analysisIt would be nice if you have experience with: Fenergo product knowledge - Experience with testing - Design test scenarios, test cases and test scripts, Test Execution, Defects Management  Experience working with FPML and FIX protocols TDD/ATDD experience Here's how we work: -  We work very hard to meet tight timelines to keep our clients regulatory compliant.  We deliver in increments through bi-weekly sprints to continually address the top priorities of our clients. We foster an environment of entrepreneurship in which cross-functional teams are given autonomy to make decisions. We have multiple teams that work on the product and each team is given flexibility to find a way that best allows them to thrive. We try to keep the static teams to less than 10 to form a micro-team culture. We encourage team members “swarming” on a single issue instead working on issues in silo.  It will be hard. We have high expectations and our teams are filled with dedicated high calibre members. You’ll need to have persistence, passion and grit. Skills: Business Analysis What you can expect from us: Build your career with us.  It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change—supporting our clients’ digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.  At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.  Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.  Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.  No unsolicited agency referrals please.  CGI is an equal opportunity employer. In addition, CGI is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities in accordance with provincial legislation. Please let us know if you require a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during any aspect of the recruitment process and we will work with you to address your needs.
jobdescription.76: About Us We are building new digital infrastructure for the mortgage industry. We transform traditional lenders into Fintechs, and our platform gives banks and their teams the tools they need to shine. We use data and design to improve customer journeys, reimagine the borrowing process, and arm lenders with the analytical capabilities that will drive their digital transformations. You will be joining a diverse and tight-knit team that has been building enterprise lending systems for a decade and was the founding technology team at Borrowell. Our company culture is a high performing, respectful, trusting and we like to laugh, a lot. We take pride in our work, thrive on credibility, and celebrate our successes. About the Opportunity You will be the link between our clients, development teams, and testing teams. Communicate with internal and/or external teams to analyze data, business, and functional requirements, and collaborate with various internal teams to design and execute solutions. Solicit requirements utilizing a variety of techniques including interviews, document analysis, surveys, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, and task/workflow analysis. Design, develop and execute quality assurance testing measures to validate business requirements Develop and maintain documentation for all products/programs. Actively participate and collaborate in the planning of projects, product enhancements as well as new program/product releases, issue resolutions, and changes for existing programs/products Effectively communicating your insights and plans to cross-functional team members and management. Monitoring deliverables and ensuring timely completion of projects\sprint work. About the Deliverables Prioritizing initiatives based on business needs and requirements. Create an exceptional client experience Ensuring solutions meet business needs and requirements. Performing user acceptance testing and working with the testing team. Updating, implementing, and maintaining procedures. Serve as a liaison between stakeholders. Managing and prioritize competing resources and priorities. About You A minimum of 2 years experience in business analysis or a related field. Experience working in both Waterfall and Agile projects. Self-motivated and able to thrive in a results-driven environment. Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills. The ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions. Excellent documentation skills. Fundamental analytical and conceptual thinking skills. Experience creating detailed reports and giving presentations. A track record of following through on commitments. Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills. A history of leading and supporting successful projects. Jira experience an asset Added Bonus: Experience in the Lending or FinTech space and experience with engineering or systems. SAVVYY is a team of seasoned technology and financial services professionals with a successful track record of building enterprise lending systems. We pride ourselves on open communication, trust and respect. We work hard and work smart, bring a positive outlook to our work and have fun while doing it! SAVVYY is an equal opportunity employer strongly committed to diversity and inclusion. Join us and build something incredible! The Demand Planning Analyst will also create and maintain forecast models, assist in incorporating business intelligence and forecast information gathered from sales, marketing, finance, and other sources into that demand plan utilizing their analytic and interpersonal skills. Creating reports and automated system alerts to proactively identify forecast exceptions Assisting in the creation of best-in-class processes to improve forecast accuracy and bias Engaging and collaborating with sales teams to ensure better inventory planning, demand Signal Exception Analysis, new business materialization and service level analysis Drive analysis and provide insights related to overall network optimization, stocking analysis, core assortment framework and other related adhoc activities This Job might be for you if: Possess a strong understanding of logistics and distribution gained through 2-4 years of Supply Chain experience College/University education in /Supply Chain Management, MBA is an asset You have strong interpersonal skills with the ability to influence internal and external customers to drive value-added solutions You possess strong analytical skills and proven ability to analyze data trends with the use of reporting tools (ex. Excel, Access) and initiate action from findings. You have the ability to work successfully in a team environment as well as individually Proven ability to handle multiple tasks at the same time and be able to prioritize effectively You have strong facilitation, presentation, and effective communication skills You have knowledge of category management is an asset Cardinal Health is committed to employment equity and encourages applications from women, visible minorities, Aboriginal peoples and persons with disabilities. jobdescription.80: Music Data Analyst Job Description: We are Warner Music Group, home to a broad roster of new stars and legendary artists through a collection of the best-known record labels in the music industry including Asylum, Atlantic, Big Beat, Canvasback, East West, Elektra, Erato, FFRR, Fueled by Ramen, Nonesuch, Parlophone, Reprise, Rhino, Roadrunner, Sire, Spinnin’, Warner Bros., Warner Classics, and Warner Music Nashville, as well as Warner/Chappell Music, one of the world's leading music publishers, with a catalog of more than one million copyrights worldwide. We currently have a fantastic opportunity to join our innovative and highly sought-after Business Development team. A little bit about our team: Warner Music Canada is home to some of the most influential and innovative artists of our time. Our extraordinary roster of new and established recording artists is unparalleled, and our collective influence on music culture is without precedent. With a visionary approach toward discovering and nurturing musical talent, the Warner Music Canada family of labels is currently home to an impressive generation of major artists. As the music industry continues to evolve, Warner Music Canada is always looking for innovative ways to help artists grow and reach their fans successfully. Using data to supplement strategic initiatives, the Music Data Analyst will use data to build models, test hypotheses, and interpret analyses to help key stakeholders achieve strategic goals. If you are highly analytical, a great communicator, and love to solve problems using data in a fast-changing and exciting industry, this role is for you. We are looking for someone who is passionate about data, spreadsheets, and infographics – someone who’s a self-starter, a critical thinker, loves technology, socials, and of course – music! Here you’ll be able to: Serve as a part of a key business function that anchors all data-led analytics initiatives cross-functionally. Leverage data insights by applying learnings and presenting them in a way that can be understood and applied to all levels of the organization. Collect and translate data into actionable insights to help drive business strategy and decision-making process: Dig through multiple data tools and data sets to draw conclusions based on marketing plans Perform artist analyses on streaming, social, content and commerce properties Determine cause and effect of marketing plans on streaming, sales and other channels Analyze the impact of advertising, promotion, radio and other inputs on sales/streaming Perform financial modelling to forecast quantitative impact of pilot and strategic projects. Identify and fulfil ongoing and ad hoc reporting opportunities. Be a storyteller: Liaise and communicate recommendations to solve specific strategic initiatives as requested from various departments. Act as a resident expert on the latest tools and learnings within the music world of streaming, marketing, research & analysis, and CRM/Direct-to-Consumer. Provide ad-hoc analytical support as directed and requested. It would be music to our ears if you also had: 3+ years’ experience as a data analyst required. Bachelor’s degree in business administration, economics, computer science, management information systems, or related field. Master’s an asset. Proven intermediate/advance level experience working with SQL and Excel, a must. Tableau/Python/R an asset. Experience with database query and statistical analysis tools/systems. Experience analysing music industry data (including streaming, and marketing data) an asset. Experience with enterprise-level and start-up analytical tools, including data segmentation, visualization and dashboard tools. May include: Salesforce, Social listening tools and beyond. Familiarity with Nielsen SoundScan/Connect and Mediabase/BDS an asset. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to work with large data sets, while keeping the big picture in mind. Strong interpersonal, visual skills, and creative writing skills. Extremely organized and detail oriented. Why join us? Warner Music Group is all about our people. We are one global company made up of the most knowledgeable, passionate, and creative people in our business. It is the mission of every member of the WMG team around the world to create a nurturing environment for artists, songwriters, and the people behind the music, at every stage of their career. We strive to set WMG apart from the rest of the industry by embracing a philosophy of innovation that is part of our company's DNA. Consider a career at WMG and be a part of one of the biggest forces in music today. Love this job and want to apply? Click the “Apply” link or apply directly with your LinkedIn. Applying with LinkedIn will import all of the information you put in your profile but will still allow you to upload a resume and cover letter. Please note that due to the volume of applicants we receive for a given position, you may not be contacted if you do not meet minimum eligibility requirements for this position. Thanks for your interest in working for Warner Music Group. We love it here and think you will too. We are an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity and will not discriminate against an applicant or employee on the basis of race, religious beliefs, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, age, record of offences, marital status, family status, or any other protected grounds under applicable legislation. We are committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the application or employment process, please send an e-mail to canada.humanresources@warnermusic.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

jobdescription.82: Job Description We are hiring a Business Analyst in our Mississauga, ON location! The Business Analyst will be responsible for operational support, data mining, data analysis and small project work. You will work closely with domain experts, across a wide variety of functions (e.g. Engineering, Finance, Product Management, Sales, Operations) at various levels on a day to day basis. The Business Analyst will support the company’s business intelligence, data warehouse and reporting needs across all business system. You will also derive business, system, user and data requirements, and develop reports and Cognos workspaces to meet the business needs and ultimately achieve the company’s goals. What’s In It for You? Competitive salary Employee benefits program, deferred profit-sharing plan and optional pension program Employee Assistance Program Employee Discount Program, Employee Store and Dell Discount Program Opportunities for community contributions and volunteering Fast paced work environment Opportunity to work in a growing company and industry What You Will Do: Provide day to day operational support across the organization by working with all functions to deliver their data verification and reporting needs. Support the company’s business intelligence, data mining and reporting needs by providing validated data. Provide analytical and technical expertise, collecting requirements and delivering versatile data models and reporting solutions. Understand data and data modelling to deliver experienced business analysis to all functions. Partnering with technical team experts to determine and detail the efficient design (performance and recovery). Apply validated analytical approaches to identify errors or limitations in data and recommend, implement processes to improve data validity. Train and support users in the use of analytic dashboards and reports. Collaborate with business users on the execution of small projects. Assist in documentation of requirements and specifications. Perform daily, month end and Ad Hoc reporting as requested or advised. Who You Are: Experience working with OLAP reporting tools such as Cognos, Microsoft Power BI, etc. 3 to 5 years’ experience crafting reports from centralized datasets that contribute to the company’s decision-making process. Solid grasp of relational database structures and strong SQL query writing capabilities. Ability to write in Visual Basic is an asset. Excellent business analysis and technical capability skills Detail-oriented, knowledge of accounting procedures and financial reporting practices, understanding of software and database systems and excellent verbal and written communication skills Experience crafting or working with automated ETL pipelines. Experience with SSIS. Experience building content and dashboards in business intelligence (Cognos BI or similar) and data visualization tools. Detailed knowledge of finance with an eye for business. Excellent problem solving and analytical skills Strong written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills. Willingness to work a flexible schedule including potentially extended hours during month end reporting and other key times during the fiscal year. Bachelor’s Degree (Business Admin, Computer Science, Science or Data Analytics) and/or an equivalent combination of experience and education is required. At least 3 - 5 years hands on experience in a business analyst position in a mid-sized organization. (preferably a manufacturing environment) Additional Skills Preferred: Knowledge of various SDLC and process methodologies (e.g. Agile, Waterfall) JD Edwards or similar ERP experience Strong desire to innovate and advance internal technologies and processes Proficiency with Microsoft Office applications Continuous improvement approach following best practice analytic principles Understanding of Project Management and Organisational Change principles and methodology Access to a reliable vehicle and the ability to travel to our St. Thomas location (10%) Company Masco Canada Limited Full time Masco Corporation (the “Company”) is an equal opportunity employer and we want to have the best available persons in every job. The Company makes employment decisions only based on merit. It is the Company’s policy to prohibit discrimination in any employment opportunity (including but not limited to recruitment, employment, promotion, salary increases, benefits, termination and all other terms and conditions of employment) based on race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, pregnancy, religious creed, national origin, ancestry, age, physical/mental disability, medical condition, marital/domestic partner status, military and veteran status, height, weight or any other such characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. The Company is committed to complying with all applicable laws providing equal employment opportunities. This commitment applies to all persons involved in the operations of the Company regardless of where the employee is located and prohibits unlawful discrimination by any employee of the Company.
