jobdescription.83: Our student and new graduate programs offer a chance to explore Sun Life from the inside. You’ll make a difference in the lives of our customers and communities, while building the skills and experience that allow you to grow in a meaningful and rewarding way. Job Description: This role within the SLC IT team will collaborate to deliver innovative solutions for SLC Management initiatives. The business Systems Analyst will assist collection and definition of requirements to meet business partner needs in the Front / Middle / Back Office, Distribution, Finance, Risk and Controls teams. What will you do? Build relationships with clients, building trust, inspiring confidence and earning respect. Build system application(s) and business domain knowledge. Collaborate with business partners, vendors, leaders, and technical project teams to deliver quality solutions to business client’s satisfaction. Communicate effectively with stakeholders and team members with different styles, environments and/or cultures. Contribute & maintain quality requirement artifacts. Use a variety of visual techniques such as process models, workflow diagrams, storyboards and use cases, with appropriate guidance. Participate in requirement elicitation sessions contributing in discussions to identify the true business need and associated risks. Identify project risks and issues and communicate to Project Manager. What you need to succeed: University Degree in Business, Technology, Computer Science and Management Experience or Knowledge in Investments, Asset Management and/or Capital Markets Exposure in data analytics and data extraction with reporting tools such as SQL or Tableau. Consultation and facilitation skills application in a school or office setting Preferred skills: Effective and efficient communication in a virtual environment. Customer service focus to achieve valued results with a sense of urgency Organized and flexible individual, comfortable in an evolving environment. Innovative team member with a passion for learning and improving the client experience What’s in it for you? SLC Management is a global institutional asset manager that provides innovative and diversified solutions to meet our clients’ evolving needs. Our history of organic and strategic growth reflects this commitment with over CA$303 billion in assets under management / US$238 billion in assets under management. SLC Management offers the best of two worlds to professionals looking for opportunity, challenge and growth. We are breaking ground with innovative solutions for a growing institutional client base of more than 1200 organizations across North America. As a subsidiary of Sun Life, we are aligned with one of the world’s leading financial services companies, and benefit from the stability and strength of that relationship. Our teams live by a set of core beliefs that put our clients’ needs and goals first. We are looking for talented professionals at all stages of their financial careers: those who are ready to learn and those who are ready to lead. Visit us at https://www.slcmanagement.com/inv For a journey this exciting and complex, we’re looking for someone who can combine expert analysis skills, a strong technical aptitude, a strategic mindset, diplomatic facilitation and leadership skills to elicit and build requirements that enable exceptional solutions. We operate in a world where time-to-market and evolving business priorities drive our plans so the person who fills this role will need to be equally effective in adapting to change. Job Category: Business Analysis - Systems Posting End Date: 09/03/2021
jobdescription.84: TD Description Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward. Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Job Description Job Description  The Analyst will help Fraud Risk Assessment (FRA) manager(s) in collecting data to help conduct the assessment and track the implementation of recommendations at the enterprise level. Successful candidate will create and utilize fraud data to help deliver fraud risk assessments reports to stakeholders. In addition, the analyst will gather data and conduct medium complexity level of analysis and review on assigned areas or topics. Output of analysis/review will be incorporated in the overall assessment of the business unit, product or services or threat vector.  Duties & Responsibilities: Conduct fraud risk assessments with the FRA manager in conjunction with business line managers/staff Responsible for collecting and analyzing necessary data provided by Businesses during assessment Responsible for maintaining the Fraud Risk Assessment tool and adding new products/channels to the product list Quarterly follow-up on the status of action plans from business units and report to management with the progress report. Work with the businesses in closing the action plans on timely manner. Develop/Create reports and metric dashboards on various risk management related topics for various audiences. Must comply with all bank policies and procedures and all applicable laws and regulations. Maintain a culture of risk management and control, supported by effective processes in alignment with risk appetite Participate fully as a member of the team, support a positive work environment that promotes service to the business, quality, innovation and teamwork Support data requests during active audit/regulator engagements, tracking requests and coordinating the collection of documents  Job Requirements Job Requirements Undergraduate degree/college diploma in quantitative field or 2+ years of relevant experience in risk related area Prior Fraud operations or Operational Risk experience is an asset Experience and understanding of second line of defense Exhibit ability to solve complex problems with support from management Manage stakeholder needs and expectations while providing consistent and regular communications with support from management Effectively balance multiple tasks through careful prioritization Work collaboratively with team and business partners to produce a quality work product Proven ability to effectively work with others to deliver projects on-time Excellent organizational and time management skills Excellent communication skills and written skills. Must have the ability to comfortably interact & communicate with all levels of the organization Strong Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) Comfortable using Data Analytics and visualization tools (e.g. Tableau) Proactive approach to problem-solving and escalation to management SharePoint and MS Visio experience considered an asset Ability to work both independently and collaboratively Self-motivated and goal-oriented Digitally savvy, seek innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies by adapting to new tools and trends Inclusiveness At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs. jobdescription.85: POSITION DESCRIPTION  POSITION: Business Data Analyst  REPORTS TO: VP, Finance Cority leverages its cutting-edge SaaS-based technology and broad EHS product suite to partner with organizations around the world to effect meaningful change in the way environmental, health, and safety is managed. Cority stands by its customers as they attain performance goals, reduce EHS risks, enhance corporate productivity, and create a healthier workforce. The company has received many accolades for its strong employee culture and outstanding growth rate including recognition as one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies; being shortlisted for the Canadian Chamber of Commerce’s Private Business Growth Award; and being named by Aon Hewitt as one of the Best Employers in Canada. POSITION SUMMARY:   We are seeking an experienced Business Data Analyst to analyze raw data to create insights, opportunities and make recommendations to improve the access and flow of information to measure performance. You bring your strong analytical and cross functional collaboration skills to engage and interface with business leaders from different business units. The Data Analyst will deliver a range of dashboards, metrics and insights to drive operational excellence.  PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES: Innovatively explore how data can add value to Cority’s finance team. Develop and own reporting and metrics dashboards, culling data from different data sources Work with stakeholders to provide insights, conclusions and action steps. Translate data into insights to measure the company’s performance against key metrics to identify opportunities and/or inconsistencies Apply creative problem solving skills to business questions Generate reports in Qlik, for Executives on a variety of customer/business related data Manage data and data mining as well as translating financial data Support ad-hoc requests and inquiries in a timely manner   QUALIFICATIONS:  Bachelor`s Degree in Business, Finance, Data Analytics or related field 3+ years with BI tools . Must have Qlik experience Strong data and SQL skills Attention to detail to pursue data quality, troubleshoot data validation, and see issues to completion. Excellent interpersonal skills Advanced computer skills: Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, CRM, Teams, Qlik Must have an ability to work independently as well as on a team in a collaborative environment Possess excellent written, verbal communications and presentation skills with a polished presence. Apply for This Job
jobdescription.86: Be a part of a transformational journey with innovative talent and leading edge technologies. Join our team!  Bringing innovation to our healthcare system is a team sport. With over 3000 dedicated team members and several key partners, we are joining forces to develop technology through everyday innovation.  Working in collaborative partnerships with business units across TELUS Health and our partners, you would be part of a dynamic team of highly skilled technical and business members. Our team is responsible for digitally connecting TELUS Health and the Healthcare industry across Canada by innovating, designing and executing on software solutions for complex health care applications. Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together!  As a Business Analyst working on the Digital Health team, you will work in collaboration with the Product Manager and the Integrations team to support in moving our products and projects forward. We are a national team comprised of passionate, driven individuals with diverse and unique experiences and skill sets in clinical workflow, business analysis, project management and health information management. You will work with teams across TELUS Health to ensure operational readiness as Digital Health expands our product portfolio. The successful candidate must possess a unique blend of business and technical savvy, someone who is a natural collaborator and problem solver that can work with multiple stakeholders across the product development and business teams.  Here's how... Contribute to the successful delivery of key Digital Health initiatives by leading a development team Owning and creating the business / product requirements documentation Engage internal teams and/or external parties to resolve issues Demonstrated ability to adapt quickly to change Actively participate in project team meetings and lead when necessary Capable and willing learner who proactively researches solutions to business and technical challenges Excellent verbal and written communication skills; able to communicate with all areas of the company  Qualifications  You're the missing piece of the puzzle 3-5 years in comparable role University Degree or related College Diploma in Health Science, Computer Science or Business/Commerce and/or CCBA or CBAP certification API technology, i.e. SOAP, Rest, AJAX, security & scalability Business analysis, requirement elicitation and documentation skills Agile project management, creating user stories, knowledge of Jira and Confluence Healthcare workflows, data flows, privacy and security concerns, data ownership and sovereignty, and the unique challenges of healthcare connectivity Drive innovation and team collaboration to continuously improve upon best practices and standard processes Nice to have… Experience in digital health products and healthcare data Strong understanding of APIs and their interactions Working knowledge of electronic medical records (EMR) applications Who is TELUS?  We're a high-performing team of individuals who collectively make TELUS one of the leading telecommunications companies in Canada. Our competitive consumer offerings include wireline, wireless, internet and Optik TV™. We also deliver a compelling range of products and services for small, medium and large businesses; and have carved out a leadership position in the health, energy, finance and public sector markets with innovative industry specific solutions.  TELUS Health is an IT leader in Canada that focuses on the health sector. Our mission is to improve the way information is being used along the continuum of care to better the health of citizens in Canada and in selected countries.  Everyone belongs at TELUS. It doesn’t matter who you are, what you do or how you do it, at TELUS, your unique contribution and talents will be valued and respected. Because the more diverse perspectives we have the more likely we are to crack the code on what our customers want and our communities need.  Do you share our passion? At TELUS, you create future friendly® possibilities.  At TELUS, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.  Disclaimer: In accordance with the TELUS Health Solutions Data Center Security Policy, as a condition of employment, all personnel whose job functions require they work at a Data Center and/or have access to detailed knowledge of technology related to client service delivery, are subject to a Personnel Security Screening conducted through the Government of Canada.  Primary Location: CA-ON-Toronto Other Locations: CA-ON-Ottawa, CA-QC-Montreal, CA-BC-Vancouver Schedule: Full-time

jobdescription.88: Position: DAX Senior Business AnalystDuration: PermanentLocation: MississaugaJOB DESCRIPTION:Our Client is actively looking to hire a Senior Business Analyst for Microsoft Dynamics AX. The successful candidate will analyze the AX system processes and data in response to business initiatives to help drive higher productivity and streamlined activities and events. The analyst will be responsible for working closely with the Product Owner to support and analyze their business needs. The analyst must be effective at identifying areas of possible change, defining requirements, and work to improve the overall benefit of the AX system. The analyst must also be able to help the team trouble-shoot production incidents.RESPONSIBILITIES: · Review, map, and analyze business processes and translate them to functional and non-functional requirements.· Identify and recommend solutions to meet the operational needs and goals of the business.· Design and execute solutions for common challenges such as data import mapping, workflow and dialog processes within the context of the AX platform.· Perform daily system monitoring, verifying the integrity and availability of all systems, sub-systems, and processes part of the AX ecosystem.· Work closely with business partners to realize the full capabilities of AX.· Ability to leverage a variety of data sources for analytics, including but not limited to BI Reporting Services, Excel, and Access DB.· Assists with AX system and related process documentation including workflow processes.· Investigate and troubleshoot workflow and data integration issues across all the touch points.· Organize and secure dashboards, reports, documents, etc.· Create custom reports and dashboards as needed.· Manage permissions for reports and dashboards.· Compiles data and provides adhoc-reports as needed for management.· Work on special projects as needed.QUALIFICATIONS: · Post-secondary degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or equivalent work experience· Minimum 7 years of experience working in Information Systems.· Minimum 5 years of experience working with Microsoft Dynamics AX.· Dynamics AX Certification considered an asset.· Excellent written & communication skills, including the ability to follow standards and methodology· Very strong problem solving with a desire to understand.· Strong customer focus, adaptable, flexible and willingness to learn and adapt.· Ability to prioritize work load and meet multiple project deadlines.· Ability to adapt in a dynamic work environment and make decisions with assistance from senior staff· Willingness to work a flexible schedule to accommodate project deadlines.· Experience working with software development teams.· Ability to obtain a security clearance.Technical skills required: · Minimum Dynamics AX 2012. (Extremely useful to have D365 exposure)· Knowledge of programming concepts, design, procedures and practices.· Familiarity with standard design patterns and UML.· Familiar with the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC).· Strong process orientation (ITIL considered bonus).· Experience with Agile development process.· Experience with ticketing systems.· Some familiarity or experience with Dynamics CRM.· Pharmacy industry knowledge and software a plus.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: Up to $100,000.00 per yearAdditional pay:Bonus paySchedule:Monday to FridayExperience:Information Systems: 7 years (preferred)Microsoft Dynamics AX: 5 years (required)Agile development: 5 years (preferred)Work remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19
jobdescription.89: In the 1830s, the May family began raising chickens on a farm outside what is now Brampton, Ontario. They became a pillar of the community, and their proud tradition of hard work, agricultural wisdom, and humble family values inspire and guide us to this day. Role Purpose: The Logistics Analyst has primary responsibility for on-demand analytics (including data mining), providing business recommendations (and support), and leading cross-functional projects. They lead to scope problems/ opportunities, develop potential solutions and reach consensus on the path forward. Projects range from inventory optimization, to cost savings, to process improvement, to supplier management to field execution. Note: This is an 8-month contract only. KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES & ACTIVITIES: Budgeting: prepare, track and manage a budget for the logistics areas of responsibility by conducting analysis & preparing data to support requested budget; ensure compliance of budgeting for logistics teams by validating invoices relating to logistics, live haul and finished goods; monitor the financial performance of area of responsibility against approved budget so that areas of unsatisfactory performance are identified; and yearly freight tender responsibility. Project Management: achieves operational objectives by contributing information and recommendations to strategic plans and reviews; preparing and completing action plans; Implementing productivity, customer-service standards; resolving problems; completing audits; identifying trends; determining system improvements; implementing change; with leadership team, set and monitor targets based on a developed, actionable plan; define action require when results are off target; and provide analysis, strategic planning processes to Leadership Team. Technology Lead: evaluate future needs as it pertains to application, hardware, communication, professional services, and maintenance; develop a technology strategy based on the findings of future needs, best practices and available technology to modernize use of technology in order to improve service and work more efficiently; and provide professional expertise and advice as it pertains to technology. Data Analytics: in collaboration with stakeholders, take lead role to implement data analytics supported by reports and dashboards are required; create processes and methods to gather logistics; run detailed spreadsheets in EXCEL; understand implications of network models; understand use of optimization tools; and score card management. Logistics Optimization: evaluate vendor operations (e.g. freight forwarders) according to quality standards; track KPIs and report on supply chain’s performance; define action require when results are off target; and collaborate with IT professionals to implement effective systems. Policies, Processes & Procedures: adhere/comply with company policies and procedures. KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & EXPERIENCE: One to three years of working experience required; Good understanding of supply chain fundamentals and the ability to embed best practices into the daily operations; Experience with data mining and analysis techniques; Experience in data mining, analysis and reporting; Experience with supply chain processes (e.g., inventory planning, warehouse management); Strong quantitative analytical skills, business acumen and insight; with the ability to understand and synthesize data from various sources, work around data limitations, and form impactful judgments and insights; Desire to -roll up your sleeves - disaggregate complex problems and simplify into executable solutions; Working knowledge of MS Office, relational databases and ERP systems (e.g. NAV). EDUCATION AND CERTIFICATION REQUIREMENTS: Undergraduate degree in Supply Chain Management, Business Analytics, Mathematics or related field required. CLT (Canadian Livestock Transport) certification is an asset. COMPETENCIES: Building Trust - Builds strong relationships on a foundation of trust, loyalty and authenticity. Driving for Results - Relentlessly pursues quantifiable and measurable results: identifies areas for improvement and executes changes as necessary. Communication & Listening - Encourages open and honest communication with the team, communicates messages clearly and concisely and listens attentively to others. Initiative - Proactively seeks new opportunities and challenges; takes ownership and accountability for enhancing results or minimizing problems. Builds Networks - Builds strong relationships with peers, partners and key stakeholders, cultivating meaningful connections. Awareness & Insight - Assesses one’s own abilities, understands how actions impact perceptions and thrives within our culture, climate and organization at all levels. WORKING CONDITION: Office based In accordance with Ontario Human Rights Code, Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005, accommodation will be provided in all parts of the hiring process. Applicants are required to make their needs known in advance. We thank all applicants for applying however only those chosen will be contacted. REQUIREMENTS Data analysis Project management Financial budgeting Intermediate to advanced MS Excel

compliance with collection routes and timing by periodically auditing fleet movementsAssisting with curbside education efforts and customer service complaintsOversee the online sales of garbage tags jobdescription.91: We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients. At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute. To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com Job Description What You’ll Be Doing As an Analyst lead, you will be joining the Internal Audit Data Analytics team. You’ll be responsible for making complex data more accessible, understandable and usable to our users. You’ll also have the opportunity of incorporating design thinking, process design and user experience techniques to create intuitive dashboards for our users for insights and analytics. How You’ll Succeed Project Management and Process Design – Be able to look for ways to optimize and streamline processes to enhance efficiencies. A good understanding of User Interface and User Experience (UI/UX) design is preferred. Be Curious and Creative – Demonstrate the ability to innovate and an aptitude to try new concepts, interpret themes and insights and design an experience that makes complex insights more intuitive for the users. Technical and Data Modelling – Be able to find meaningful insights and design intuitive visualizations. Data Management – Assist the director and the analytics team to source and manage new data sources for projects and ongoing audit engagements. Stay Current with Best Practices in Internal Audit – Constantly look for ways to improve user experience and insights consumption, stay up to date with industry best practices in storytelling/data visualization, user experience, machine learning and big data analytics. Actively identify current and emerging trends, themes and topics in Internal audit analytics to enable our auditors to be effective. Who You Are You can demonstrate experience in areas including but not limited to data design and transformation, web development and UX & UI development. You must have 2 – 3 years of progressive python experience towards analyzing data and for web application design purposes. Experience in languages like PHP, HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Alteryx will also help you to thrive in this role. It’s an asset if you have experience in frameworks within Python incl. IDJANGO and have background in graphical design. You have a degree/diploma in Computer Science, Engineering, and/or a related field of study. You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it's the right thing to do You act like an owner. You thrive when you're empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results You're digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability. What CIBC Offers At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will: Thrive : Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home Connect : Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity Develop : Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training Prosper : Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan What You Need to Know CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit Job Location Toronto-150 York Street, 6th Employment Type Regular Weekly Hours 37.5
jobdescription.92: We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team! The successful candidate has broad exposure to a variety of technologies/concepts and is driven to deliver database solutions for our client’s complex requirements. databases Develop ongoing import and export routines using SSIS packages to interface the Angus AnyWhere system with other applications Assist in the development of an import tool for the direct import of data from standardized templates Collaborate with the Data Specialists and Customer Success Managers to identify client requirements and define project timelines Increase efficiency of conversion tools to expedite deployment onto playground environments and production servers Support and document best practices, processes, and standards Gain in depth knowledge of the Angus AnyWhere data structures, Angus AnyWhere suite of applications, and client usage of applications Who you are: Bachelor degree in Computer Science/Information Systems or equivalent specialized training/certification 5+ years of experience performing data conversions/ETL, data manipulations or database support, preferably within a SaaS company Solid knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server is required Proficient in database modeling, T-SQL, scripting, querying, stored procedures, and SSIS packages Good understanding on the role of databases in a web application stack Experience in developing migration solutions within SQL Server, SSRS, ETL tools, Power BI, PowerShell, data conversions, data deduplication, and data cleansing Familiar with other database systems (MariaDB), IDEs (VSCode), Git (GitHub), API, Docker, AWS, Excel, SharePoint, or SFTP Excellent time management skills to prioritize multiple projects in order to meet project deadlines Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills to anticipate any database issues and consider different approaches to troubleshoot Excellent communication skills (verbal, written, and interpersonal) to engage with both technical and non-technical teams What we offer: An opportunity to work in a stable and exciting work environment with growth opportunities Tuition reimbursement program Medical and dental benefits without a waiting period Three (3) weeks paid vacation Location! jobdescription.93: Our Summer student program is designed to unleash the potential of undergraduate students, giving them valuable and impactful work experiences, and insight into our ways of working and our values-driven approach to business.  The Data Analyst will support the SAP Project team in preparing data for migration from legacy systems to SAP. Ensuring that we have accurate and complete data to support the business needs will be essential for a successful go live.  It’s a great opportunity to be involved in a large transformational project. The student will gain knowledge of SAP, which is used by ~ 24,000 companies worldwide currently, and ~700 companies in Canada. It’s also a great opportunity to learn about Weston Foods through an understanding of the data used to operate the business. The pace is fast and the deadlines are tight. Remaining focused will be key to success.  CORE ACCOUNTABILITIES:  Working closely with a cross functional team of internal and external resources to profile, cleanse, collect and prepare data for migration. Follow established data standards where they exist, but will also have the opportunity to contribute to the development of data standards, where absent, to meet the needs of SAP. Responsible for tracking progress against project timelines ensuring complete and accurate data on time to meet business needs. ABOUT YOU:  Pursuing a bachelor’s degree in business administration, commerce, computer science or engineering Ability to adapt to changing environments, pick up new skills quickly and continuously improve Self-starter with the ability to work independently with minimal supervision in a fast paced, team environment Excellent analytical and problem solving skills with a strong attention to detail and ability to synthesize large quantities of data Effective time management and organizational skills Strong interpersonal skills including the ability to work effectively in a cross-functional team environment Strong communication, organizational and documentation skills Intermediate knowledge of Office365 tools specifically Excel and PowerPoint
jobdescription.94: Job Title: Financial Data Analyst Industry Sector: Nor for Profit Salary: $50,000-$60,000 + great benefits, vacation and w/l balance. Location: Toronto – currently WFH  Our vey busy not for profit client is seeking a Financial Data Analyst to join their small, dynamic team to work on financial modelling and statistical research analysis.  About our client This NPO client is in the philanthropic space has been improving the lives of present and future generations through Education, Research, Healthcare and the Arts for over 30 years. They continue to grow its foundation of members, organizations and programs.  About the role Working closely with the other members of the finance team, and reporting directly into the Controller, responsibilities will include but not be limited to: Perform financial forecasting, reporting, and metrics tracking. Analyze financial data and create financial models for decision support. Report on financial performance and prepare for regular leadership reviews. Analyze past results, perform variance analysis, identify trends, and make recommendations for improvements. Identify and drive process improvements, including the creation of standard and ad-hoc reports, tools, and dashboards. Perform market research, business intelligence, and valuation comps. Reconcile existing transactions through cross-referencing of incoming and outgoing data. Create recommendations to be presented to the CFO/Controller. About you! Bachelor’s Degree and Background in business/commerce, statistics, finance or related field is required 2+ years of experience in data analysis, financial modelling and report creation High proficiency in financial modeling techniques. Experience with Microsoft GP, Advent, Power BI,Tableau, and SQL are preferred. Advanced knowledge with Excel formulas and functions. Numbers and Data are your passion!! You have exceptional quantitative, analytical and data gathering skills and love making sense of it all for a greater purpose. You are a team player, with excellent interpersonal communication and problem solving skills. You love learning and growing and embrace change and challenge. Why Apply? Aside from working with an incredible not for profit foundation that changes peoples lives for the better, you’d be working with like minded, intelligent, fun, dynamic people who love the company they work in and all it stands for! What could be better than that?!  TSSHP #LI-TS1
jobdescription.95: Our student and new graduate programs offer a chance to explore Sun Life from the inside. You’ll make a difference in the lives of our customers and communities, while building the skills and experience that allow you to grow in a meaningful and rewarding way. Job Description: This role within the SLC IT team will collaborate to deliver innovative solutions for SLC Management initiatives. The business Systems Analyst will assist collection and definition of requirements to meet business partner needs in the Front / Middle / Back Office, Distribution, Finance, Risk and Controls teams. What will you do? Build relationships with clients, building trust, inspiring confidence and earning respect. Build system application(s) and business domain knowledge. Collaborate with business partners, vendors, leaders, and technical project teams to deliver quality solutions to business client’s satisfaction. Communicate effectively with stakeholders and team members with different styles, environments and/or cultures. Contribute & maintain quality requirement artifacts. Use a variety of visual techniques such as process models, workflow diagrams, storyboards and use cases, with appropriate guidance. Participate in requirement elicitation sessions contributing in discussions to identify the true business need and associated risks. Identify project risks and issues and communicate to Project Manager. What you need to succeed: University Degree in Business, Technology, Computer Science and Management Experience or Knowledge in Investments, Asset Management and/or Capital Markets Exposure in data analytics and data extraction with reporting tools such as SQL or Tableau. Consultation and facilitation skills application in a school or office setting Preferred skills: Effective and efficient communication in a virtual environment. Customer service focus to achieve valued results with a sense of urgency Organized and flexible individual, comfortable in an evolving environment. Innovative team member with a passion for learning and improving the client experience What’s in it for you? SLC Management is a global institutional asset manager that provides innovative and diversified solutions to meet our clients’ evolving needs. Our history of organic and strategic growth reflects this commitment with over CA$303 billion in assets under management / US$238 billion in assets under management. SLC Management offers the best of two worlds to professionals looking for opportunity, challenge and growth. We are breaking ground with innovative solutions for a growing institutional client base of more than 1200 organizations across North America. As a subsidiary of Sun Life, we are aligned with one of the world’s leading financial services companies, and benefit from the stability and strength of that relationship. Our teams live by a set of core beliefs that put our clients’ needs and goals first. We are looking for talented professionals at all stages of their financial careers: those who are ready to learn and those who are ready to lead. Visit us at https://www.slcmanagement.com/inv For a journey this exciting and complex, we’re looking for someone who can combine expert analysis skills, a strong technical aptitude, a strategic mindset, diplomatic facilitation and leadership skills to elicit and build requirements that enable exceptional solutions. We operate in a world where time-to-market and evolving business priorities drive our plans so the person who fills this role will need to be equally effective in adapting to change. Job Category: Business Analysis - Systems Posting End Date: 09/03/2021
jobdescription.96: Address: 234 Simcoe Street Job Family Group: Data Analytics & Reporting Creates a culture where data is managed as a valuable corporate asset. Provides input to, and follows, data governance standards and processes to improve the quality of BMO data and reduce overall data risk for the designated business/group. Develops and implements data strategies, tactics, products and a curated data model to achieve business objectives. Reviews, designs and implements data governance practices and data management processes within the business/group in alignment with Enterprise Data Governance Operating Directive. Provides guidance on the interpretation of enterprise data governance policies and maintains alignment between data governance practices and the data strategy. Develops data solutions and makes recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs. Supports the assessment, root cause analysis, and formulating proposed solutions/remediation strategies. Performs data profiling and data analyses. Documents and maintains data flow specifications. Conducts needs assessments, identifies gaps and provides suggestions to improve and streamline data management processes based on operational insights. Contributes to the development of business/group data strategies and data governance policies, procedures, and processes. Develops stakeholder communications and training in support of data management process implementation. Supports the resolution of data issues by coordinating stakeholders in the information chain. Performs quality assurance activities to ensure handling, storage, and collection of data complies with Bank Policy and regulatory requirements. Supports the management of BMO’s data as a key asset that facilitates effective decision making. Analyzes structured and unstructured data to support the design and development of a business / group curated data model. Provides advice and guidance to assigned business/group on implementation of data solutions. Identifies and implements the optimum means to collect, process, analyze and report on information and ensure ongoing accuracy, integrity and security. Participates in the timely resolution of operating/technical problems or manages escalation with other BMO technical support groups. Assists in the identification of change impacts through requirements gathering, mapping and documenting current and proposed processes. Provides support to projects and/or manages operational changes including supporting Technology with the validation and testing of systems. Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide insights and recommendations. Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders and ensures alignment. Supports development and execution of strategic initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders. Focus is primarily on Finance and Enterprise Risk Management. Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules. Works independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unique situations. Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed. Qualifications: Typically between 1 - 4 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Skilled in database environments (e.g. Hadoop, Netezza, Oracle). Skilled in working with BI tools such as PowerBI, relational databases and Hadoop-based data mining frameworks. Proficient in working with SQL Technical proficiency gained through education and/or business experience. Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth. Collaboration & team skills - In-depth. Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth. Influence skills - In-depth. Data driven decision making - In-depth. We’re here to help At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world. As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset. To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en . BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.
jobdescription.97: Job Description Minimum Qualifications At least a Vocational Diploma/Short Course Certificate, Bachelor’s/ College Degree in any field At least 2 years of work experience in Quality Assurance in a B2B sales environment At least 2 years of B2B sales experience Team player with great attention to details and ability to drive impactful insights Effective facilitation skills in client and staff meetings Preferred Qualifications Exceptional interpersonal and motivational skills Knowledge of BPO voice and back office performance metrics Excellent computer skills, including but not limited to MS Office and G Suite Effective decision-making skills Ability to provide constructive feedback and identify opportunities for coaching Solid understanding of workflow and Salesforce Deliverables Perform quality and process adherence review of contractor’s agents providing support services to clients customers and end users regarding their interactions with client’s customers and end users and work closely with client to update and implement changes to quality processes and criteria as these changes arise. This includes performing quality evaluations for each agent/ TL in accordance with SLAs Interpret and implement quality assurance standards Before each agent commences insuring and certifying that each agent (including T Ls) is qualified based on minimum requirements guidance and/ or mock calls certification Track, measure and report metrics as per agreement with client Attend and lead calibration sessions Analyze data to identify trends, behaviours and areas of improvement through audits Keep track on the improvement of agents especially outliers Conduct calibration sessions and team huddles focused on quality Partner with Training to identify site/ agent opportunities and trend analysis to help determine training solutions to be done to address the areas for improvement To work closely with Operations to ensure that the agents are able to strategize along with the other departments to ensure that we are meeting the client and company targets Performance Improvement, Process Excellence and Continuous Improvement To the extent that the nature of the services requires supplier to process personal data (as defined by Agreement/s Sow or MSA) supplier warrants that any processing of such personal information will be carried out in compliance with each relevant provision of the data protection law applicable to supplier Problem area identification, suggestions to training to solve for it The role covers a broad set of responsibilities requiring expertise in strategic communications and knowledge of digital and content marketing, as well as communications design, development and execution. Job Types: Full-time, Permanent Salary:$40,000- $42,000.00 per year
jobdescription.98: Requisition ID: 96898  Join the Global Community of Scotiabankers to help customers become better off. Purpose Individual in this role are contributing to the overall success of the Global Brand & Customer Insights (GBCI) department globally. In this role, the Senior Market Research Analyst will conduct full lifecycle market research which includes understanding objectives and requirements, research design, fieldwork/execution, data analysis and reporting. The Senior Market Research Analyst will develop analysis and reporting capabilities and will also monitor performance to identify improvements. The Senior Market Research Analyst ensures all activities conducted comply with governing regulations, internal policies and procedures. Accountabilities  Takes ownership of market research projects assigned for development, execution, fielding and/or reporting.Determines and applies appropriate market research principles and methodology to requests made to GBCI department. This may include research design, sample, delivery of recommendations, as well as occasionally conducting field research.Use market research technology and tools to develop, deploy and manage research. The incumbent then uses superior Excel, PowerPoint, SPSS, Qualtrics, R skills to develop and deliver insights that provides partners with the information they need in the most visually appealing and professional manner. Conducts required statistical and data analysis to determine insights from fieldwork.Liaises with external suppliers to coordinate projects.Present market research results to business stakeholders.Publishes reports or key learnings on the GBCI Hub, a global employee-facing portal that offers self-service access to insights.Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge.Identify trends and opportunities through research and analysis, compiling, reviewing, and interpreting data from multiple sources, to create reports that bring data to life such as the Fact Packs.Maintains relationships with partners by gaining a good understanding of their core business, and to discuss their research needs.Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas in accordance with Scotiabank’s Values, its Code of Conduct and the Global Sales Principles, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational, compliance, AML/ATF/sanctions and conduct risk. Champions a high-performance environment and contributes to an inclusive work environment. Education/ExperiencePost-secondary education in Social Sciences, Statistics, Mathematics, Business or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience. Two to four years of hands-on experience conducting quantitative and qualitative research.Excellent communication skills, written and oral required to prepare documentation, reports, and presentations.Required technical skills: Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Access); statistical analysis tools such as SPSS, R or similar statistical application; Business Intelligence tools such as Tableau; and IMS Clear Decisions or other similar cross-tabbing and media profiling tools. Experience with the Qualtrics platform is an asset.Excellent organization skills to set priorities, plan and execute tasks, meet designated deadlines – often within time restraintsPossess intellectual curiosity and quickness.Spanish language is an asset. Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto As Canada's International Bank, we are a diverse and global team. We speak more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. Our employees are committed to a superior customer experience and use the Bank’s six guiding sales practice principles to ensure they act with honesty and integrity.  At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.
jobdescription.99: Please apply on Isarta  COMPANY :  Belvika Trade & Packaging   POSITION :  Sales strategy analyst   LOCATION:  Mississauga Belvika Trade & Packaging Ltd. is a leading one-stop contract packaging company, specializing in precision packing of dry foods, chocolate and confectionary products from multiple facilities totaling more than 250,000 ft2. Belvika is a 28-year-old, 100% owned Canadian Company and has grown to be one of the largest co-packers of confectionary and snack products in Canada. Belvika uses its extensive experience in managing both manual processes and automated equipment to handle primary and secondary packaging of products for some of the world's best known confectionary brands.  Belvika is an equal opportunity employer; offering competitive wages, shared benefit plan, ongoing training and an interesting and challenging work environment. We will provide the tools and training that you require to excel at your role together with access to Senior Management to provide additional support and guidance. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.  Belvika is currently seeking a Sales Strategy Analyst to maintain the overall quality standards for all products packed and ensuring that the Company's & Client's quality specifications are complied with at all times. The Sales Strategy Analyst will be located in the Mississauga facility.  Position Summary:  The Sales Strategy Analyst will be responsible for compiling and analyzing sales and market data and providing valuable feedback and actionable insights to guide our promotional and sales activities.  Sales Strategy Analyst must be able to analyze large amounts of data, accurately project sales trends, identify sales opportunities, and provide practical guidance to optimize sales strategies and increase market share.  The successful candidate will:  Compiling, analyzing, and reporting sales, forecast and sales pipeline data. Responsible for developing new and existing customer presentation decks; Monitoring and analyzing competitive activity, customer, and market trends. Providing actionable insights to guide the sales. Contributing to the development of sales plans, objectives and strategy. Monitoring and evaluating sales performance. Forecasting demand, revenue, and expenses. Determining sales potential and making recommendations. Regularly prepare reports and presentations for executives. These reports can include data on market performance, competitor research, and general sales trends. Provide advice on increasing revenue, eliminating weaknesses within the company's sales ecosystem, meeting sales goals, and improving marketing and promotional efforts in certain sectors Using data and research, identify markets to target with advertising and promotional efforts or determine how to best set the company apart from its competitors.  Education/Work experience requirements:  Degree in business administration, finance, or marketing. Experience in sales analysis, strategy or marketing. Consumer products or food related background an asset  Key technical & behavioral competencies:  Strong research and data analysis skills. Proficiency in Microsoft Office and CRM software. Strong communication and presentation skills. Projection and forecasting skills. Ability to work independently and with cross-functional teams.  We thank all candidates for their interest; however only those most qualified will be contacted.
jobdescription.101: About Us: Propel (formerly MoneyKey) is an innovative Fintech Company that provides services and unsecured financial products to consumers via a safe and secure online platform. Propel was founded in 2011 in Toronto to remove the complexity and bureaucracy that people often experience while trying to borrow money, and to provide an underserved population with unsecured credit in a respectful way and with extraordinary service. Our goal is to provide our customers with a simple and convenient process!Our amazing team has experienced phenomenal growth and thrives on an entrepreneurial spirit, passion, and top-tier talent. We believe in innovation and in measuring success through results and growing within; talent and hard work never goes unnoticed, and we succeed together.About You: You are a talented professional looking for a career, not a job. You have a passion for numbers and data analytics, with an Accounting background and experience with data analysis tools. You possess an excellent business acumen to develop in-depth knowledge of each product combination offered by the organization and to play a key role in supporting the decision-making process for strategic next steps in the business.You picture yourself succeeding within a vibrant and entrepreneurial organization where your ideas will be heard, and where you will have an opportunity to showcase your talents and great skills. You are motivated by goals, a self-starter, and a hardworking individual who likes to wear multiple hats. We are seeking a proven, driven team player who is looking to join a fast-paced, high growth, energetic and forward-thinking team.ResponsibilitiesPreparing internal and external reporting over product performance metrics (KPIs) and month-end financial results from source system dataWorking with, extracting, validating, and analyzing data from multiple databases and internal systems for the purpose of producing reporting and conducting data/financial analysis that directly affects business decisions. Extensive use of SQL, Excel, amongst other tools required for the above.Documenting data queries, sources, structures, and flows to enable streamlining and knowledge sharing/transfer.Working with and leveraging IT to create and develop reporting tools to manage and track, reconcile, identify exceptions/issues, and report on the flow of transactional data between multiple internal systems and databases.Key contributor towards optimization of various reporting and data processes. Assisting team in creating efficiencies across data flow and reporting infrastructureContinuously analyzing data in real-time as well as historical results, performance metrics and market figures to support the business and enhance profitabilityAnalyzing profitability and performance across all company entities and business units. Based on analysis, providing recommendations to optimize financial performanceDeveloping an in-depth knowledge of the business as well as each product/offering by the organization in the various markets in which it operatesProviding support to the Accounting & Finance team to improve forecasting effectiveness, reporting, and accuracy across the businessWorking closely and supporting Director of Finance with managing and executing all audit or regulatory related requestsAnalyzing profitability, performance and cash flows across all Company entities, products, markets, customer types and various other attributesExecuting on and supporting the Accounting & Finance team at various stages of the reporting process, including P&L, Balance Sheets, Cash Flow, etc.Involvement in product structuring and a key contributor to successfully launching and ongoing performance analysis of new products. Working closely with the PMO teamContributing to the Finance team as a strategic thinker, identifying concerns or potential risks in a proactive mannerConducting ad hoc financial analysis to support various departments across the company.RequirementsBachelor’s degree in Accounting, Business, Mathematics, Finance, Computer Science, Economics, or related fieldCPA designation (or working towards designation) preferred.Working knowledge of Accounting reporting standards (IFRS and US GAAP experience an asset)Solid experience with financial reporting and analysisKnowledge in the use of databases, data analysis/query tools and proficiency in ExcelProficient with SQL tools for data analysis, mining, and verification/integrity.Hands-on experience with creating dashboards and reports on Business Intelligence and Reporting Tools is an asset (e.g. Tableau, Domo, Cognos, or related tools).Hands-on experience with Accounting and ERP systems (e.g. Oracle NetSuite), including GL feeds is an assetPassion for working in a dynamic and fast-paced environmentStrong attention to detail and organization skills, motivated and able to multitaskKnowledge of Fintech Space an asset.We welcome and encourage applications from individuals from all groups, including aboriginal, women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities, regardless of race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, creed, family status, national origin, age and gender.We thank all applications for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted. No agencies or phone calls.Application Deadline: 2021-04-02Job Types: Full-time, PermanentBenefits:Casual dressDental careEmployee assistance programPaid time offRRSP matchSchedule:Monday to FridayEducation:Bachelor's Degree (Preferred)Work remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19COVID-19 precaution(s):Remote interview processVirtual meetings
jobdescription.102: Company Description Torstar Corporation is a progressive media organization with a long, proud history in newspapers and a passion for capitalizing on the fluid world of digital and mobile media. Torstar’s vision for success is driven by a deep customer-centric obsession, continued journalistic excellence, advanced data-driven competency and a culture that is selfless, focused, agile, collaborative and results driven. The successful candidate will be a champion of those priorities while keeping the customer at the heart of all of the creative work that s/he will be doing.  Job Description The Client Data Analyst, reporting to the Manager, Client Research Automation, will assist Torstar advertising sales by producing top quality sales presentations and automated sales tools to provide the best possible support for revenue generation. This position will also provide marketing research support to all departments. Your Responsibilities… Fulfill research requests from all sales teams across Torstar Provide support for sales/marketing specialists to create marketing assets Proactively develop sales tools based on input from Digital Sales, National Sales and Local sales working closely with the Data Engineers and Data Scientists Develop, program, and analyze survey results for research initiatives across Torstar  Qualifications Who You Are… A compelling and clear communicator, able to craft a long-term vision, set goals to meet them and represent your team’s best work to stakeholders with varying levels of technical fluency. A team-oriented highly motivated contributor who is collaborative and demonstrates aptitude and willingness to learn new technologies, methods, and tools to solve complex business problems. Driven to build strong strategic partnerships with key data and analytics professionals as well as internal clients and stakeholders. What You Will Bring To The Team… Bachelor’s degree or diploma in Marketing, Advertising or Business At least 1 year of experience in a similar role, or within the media industry (agency or research supplier) Data analytics experience with SQL, Python or similar Data visualizations skills using Tableau, Power BI or similar Experience working with Vividata, Comscore, Adobe Analytics (Omniture), Google Analytics Experience using data analysis tools like NielsenIMS Clear Decisions or Telmar Advanced presentation and analysis skills using Excel and PowerPoint High attention to detail Highly motivated self-starter Excellent time management skills Strong project management skills Ability to adapt to conflicting priorities Highly organized, analytical and creative thinker Service oriented with excellent communication skills Additional Information Torstar Group of Companies is committed to providing an inclusive and barrier free recruitment process ensuring equal access to employment opportunities for candidates, including persons with disabilities. In compliance with Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and Ontario Human Rights Code we will endeavour to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability during the recruitment process, please notify the hiring manager upon scheduling your interview of your requirements.
jobdescription.103: This position is remote while our offices are temporarily closed.   About the Role!  The Sales Business Analyst is responsible for achieving planned profit and sales goals growth via business management, analysis, data mining, Nielsen & IRI data to insights generation, forecasting, and overall day to day support of the Sobeys National business.  Responsibilities:  Provide team leadership and support best practices in order to grow the business. Support the Key Account Manager on the business with daily, weekly, monthly & quarterly business data, analytics & insights to solution generations. Supporting: account presentation building and delivery where required. monthly merchandising grid development, execution & analytics. monthly forecasting process, drive business analytics to ensure improved forecast accuracy. direct sales management of smaller banners within Sobeys and/or Region. annual business planning for assigned Customer(s) incorporating Brand Plans, Category Management and Shopper Insight. internal administration, including Best In Class Forecasting/TPM Trade Promotional Management system & deduction management. account level trade spend in conjunction with the KAM to support Upfield's overall objectives and strategies within agreed parameters. About You!  University/College degree. Minimum 3 years knowledge of overall sales, analytical, Nielsen/IRI data management and/or trade / customer management experience. Proven leadership and strategic planning abilities combined with strong financial management, organizational and analytical skills are essential. Advanced Excel and data skills. Nielsen experience, IRI experience is an asset. Ability to call on smaller accounts. A valid driver's license in good standing is required.   About Upfield!  We are the largest plant-based company in the world, and we believe in doing what's right for our people, our customers and the planet.  At Upfield our purpose is clear: we make people healthier and happier with nutritious and delicious, natural, plant-based products that are good for you, our planet; and with packaging that's free from plastic. We've got iconic brands like Rama, Country Crock, Blue Band and Flora that people all over the world know and love. We've been a trusted category leader since 1871 and yet we feel like we're only just getting started.  Performance, Passion and Care define who we are as a company, how we work every day, and the responsibility we feel toward our Associates, our consumers, our business partners and our world.  We are a highly entrepreneurial fast-paced team running a multi-billion Euro business across 60+ countries with the mind-set of a start-up! We are agile, creative, fast-to-market and obsessed with customers and consumers.  #LI-KJ1
jobdescription.104: Emplacement: 600-500 Lakeshore Blvd. West, Toronto, Ontario, M5V 2V9 La Banque le Choix du Président (PCF) est une filiale en propriété exclusive de Les Compagnies Loblaw Limitée (LCL) et a été créée pour promouvoir les produits et Services financiers le Choix du Président à l’échelle du Canada. PCF met l’accent sur la prestation de solutions et de services de paiement de tous les jours qui récompensent le quotidien. En collaboration avec la division Services PC de Loblaws Inc., avec qui nous partageons notre bureau, nous offrons des produits et des services dans les segments suivants : Cartes de paiement : La carte de crédit Mastercard Services financiers PCMD offre des points PC OptimumMC pour chaque dollar dépensé, sans frais annuels. Le compte PC ArgentMC est le plus récent ajout aux produits de paiement offerts et exploités par la Banque le Choix du Président. Le compte PC Argent fonctionne comme un compte bancaire et offre des points PC Optimum pour chaque achat, sans frais mensuels. Assurance : Les assurances auto et habitation PCMD sont offertes par l’entremise du Courtier d’assurance PC inc. et en partenariat avec plusieurs assureurs. Télécommunications et cartes-cadeaux : La Boutique Mobile, le service prépayé de téléphonie cellulaire PC, et le secteur des cartes-cadeaux visent à offrir de la commodité et un rapport qualité/prix exceptionnels aux clients de LCL.  LCL est le plus important détaillant alimentaire au Canada et a étendu ses activités dans certaines catégories non alimentaires pour l’ensemble du pays. LCL se concentre sur la vente au détail d’aliments, en ayant pour objectif d’offrir aux consommateurs la crème du magasin multiservices pour répondre à leurs besoins quotidiens en matière d’articles ménagers. Les Services financiers le Choix du Président et les Services PC sont des unités d’affaires importantes de LCL, qui gèrent et élaborent des programmes de produits et de services conçus pour améliorer l’expérience client, maximiser la valeur et fournir une plate-forme permettant d’améliorer tant les données sur les clients que les relations avec ces derniers. Notre vision est de simplifier la vie au quotidien. About the role: Loblaw’s Customer Solutions Centre of Excellence (CoE) works to provide customers with exceptional self-serve resources that provide meaningful solutions, inspire customer confidence, and bolster business growth. As a Specialist, you will provide day to day operational and analytical support for our conversational UI channel, specifically, our customer facing chatbots. As part of the Customer Solutions team, you require a strong analytical and technical background to collect insights , analyze customer sentiment, identify key chat drivers, and recognize themes from the conversation data. You will need to utilize data analysis and BI tools to create impactful and visually appealing reports to drive process improvements and enhance the customer experience. Through collaboration with Customer Marketing, Customer Products & Platforms, and Operations stakeholders we will deliver world class customer experiences through automated customer support. What you'll do: Develop a deep understanding of chatbot functionality, our business, customer needs, and our long-term vision to provide friction-less, automated customer solutions Analyze and interpret qualitative and quantitative data to create insights, formulate reports on conclusions of data analysis, and make recommendations to improve the chatbot customer experience Ability to communicate insights verbally, visually, and written through powerful storytelling Collaborate with Digital team, developers, and chatbot vendor stakeholders to understand impacts and benefits of any technical/system changes, implementations, and/or enhancements that could impact the chatbot experience. Investigate data/process anomalies; propose and implement solutions to improve data accuracy and performance Perform statistical analysis/provide insight into unusual customer trends, design/implement stemming from our chatbots Provide ad-hoc reporting in a timely manner What you'll need: A university degree or college diploma in a business or technical fields such as business management, computer science, statistics or related field Experience with chatbot technology, AI, NLP and Machine Learning, an asset. Strategic and creative thinker who is exceptionally adept with quantitative and qualitative analysis Strong analytical skills with experience in extracting impactful insights from data sets to develop impactful reports Ability to convey complex data in a concise and understandable manner, to relate and engage with stakeholders from both technical and non-technical disciplines Intermediate Microsoft Excel skills including formulas, pivot tables and V-lookup Intermediate knowledge of data cleansing and data visualization using systems such as Power BI, Tableau, SQL, an asset Strong time management skills and attention to detail Customer-focused with a passion for delivering incredible customer experiences Positive attitude and self-motivated with the ability to work independently and collaboratively Rejoignez une équipe gagnante qui fait preuve d'innovation, d'énergie, de créativité et de vision. Nous reconnaissons l'importance d'une main-d'œuvre diversifiée et nous encourageons donc les candidatures d'Autochtones, de femmes, de membres d'une minorité visible et de personnes handicapées. Nous remercions tous les candidats pour leur intérêt, cependant, seuls les candidats sélectionnés pour une entrevue seront contactés. Nombre d'ouvertures: 1 La Financière PC reconnaît la diversité du Canada comme une source de fierté et de force nationales. Nous nous sommes fixé comme priorité de refléter la diversité évolutive de notre pays dans les produits que nous vendons, les personnes que nous embauchons et la culture que nous créons dans notre organisation. Des hébergements sont disponibles sur demande pour les candidats et collègues handicapés. De plus, nous croyons que le respect des lois signifie faire ce qu'il faut. Le respect de la loi fait partie de notre code de conduite - il renforce ce que nos clients et nos parties prenantes attendent de nous. .
