jobdescription.130: This purpose of this role is to design, develop, control, maintain and support business and financial reporting systems; and interpret data to influence and drive decision making as well us produce financial calculations to support business operations and business insight. The role will require an in-depth knowledge of the payment industry as well as analytics best practices to work independently on complex business problems. This role will also involve mentoring and coaching other individuals in the team on technical skills and best practices. Key accountabilities include: Participate and lead client-facing meetings, understand the business problem, devise a solution and mentor/guide a business data analyst to work on the technical solution. Employ data mining techniques to produce financial analysis and business insight to provide conclusions or recommendations on business performance in effort to support decision-making. Work independently, manage and direct activities related to analysis, design and support of technical data management solutions on various projects. Collaborate with business and technology partners to elicit information/data requirement and articulate those requirements in a manner that can be easily understood by team members Provide technical leadership across a broad range of data analysis functions including data modeling, report design (utilizing tableau), structured query language (SQL), data quality, data profiling, metadata enrichment and management, data provenance and lineage and other specialized data management functions Responsible for staying up to date with the changing technologies in the analytics landscape, learning those and then providing coaching to the team on those new technologies. Minimum position requirements: Bachelor or Masters’ degree in an analytical field of study e.g. Engineering, Mathematics, Business Analytics, Finance, Computer Science. 7 to 9 years of similar work experience 3 years of minimum experience with SQL. Knowledge of Python or any other tools for large scale data analysis considered an asset. Data Visualization tools such as Tableau Fluent in English (reading, writing, and verbal). Critical Thinking  Note: We welcome and encourage applications from indigenous people, people of colour, people with disabilities, people of all genders, sexual orientation and intersectional identities.
jobdescription.131: Position Title: Sales Analyst Location: North York, OntarioStatus: Permanent; Full TimeDepartment:  Quality AssuranceWhy join the Johnvince Foods team?Johnvince Foods is recognized as a Platinum Club member in Canada’s 50 Best Managed Companies for over 10 years. We are a family-run Canadian business, with more than 45 years of experience processing, manufacturing and distributing bulk and packaged products across North America. Our nut products, confections and other food products include many of the most recognizable brands enjoyed in households every day, including Planters Peanuts.We are looking for a Sales Analyst to join our team in Toronto.Our offices are currently open, and measures have been put in place to protect the health and safety of our employees, customers and community with COVID-19. This position will be required to work at our head office in Downsview, Ontario.About the opportunity: We are looking for someone to join our team in a new role as a Sales Analyst. The successful candidate will be supporting a team of Key Accounts Managers by preparing reports with Excel and gathering data from various sources such as our AS400 program.The Sales Analyst is a well-rounded role allowing you to be responsible for the collection, analysis, and reporting of sales related data in an on-going effort to increase overall sales productivity.The Sales Analyst will create both standardized & custom reports, conduct quantitative solutions & sales analysis, provide support for internal, retailer & consumer promotions, and assess future needs and data integrity. They must develop standardized tools, methodologies and business processes aimed at improving operational efficiency.What will you be doing?Collect, analyze, evaluate and report data daily, weekly and monthly sales reportsModifies reports to meet the end user needs.Validates information from various systems for accuracyGenerates ad hoc reporting for Sales and Marketing relating to customer sales information or product.Provide customized reporting and recommendations in support of ongoing business decisions or initiativesDevelops models and reporting structure that identify costs (by function, process, fixed, variable) per unit (store, order, script, other) and identify a baseline for actionProvides sales reports required to calculate Commissions for USA and Canadian Brokers.If you have the following background & personal attributes: Completion of Secondary School required1 to 3 years related work experienceProficiency in Microsoft OfficeExpert Level Microsoft Excel SkillsProven analytical skillsExcellent Communication both Written and OralHigh attention to detail and accuracyWe want to hear from you!Like what you’re hearing so far, but still wondering if Johnvince Foods is right for you? We offer: A competitive compensation & health benefits packageEmployee shopping programWork / life balanceCareer growthOffice conveniently located at Dufferin & Finch and accessible to the TTC subway stationInterested in being a part of the Johnvince Foods team? Does this sound like you? If so, we look forward to your application! Johnvince embraces diversity and encourages all qualified applicants to apply.Please inform us if you require any accommodations during the hiring process. Please note that only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.Work might involve exposure to nuts and/or nut-based products.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentBenefits:Dental careDisability insuranceExtended health careLife insuranceOn-site parkingStore discountVision careSchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridayExperience:administrative support: 3 years (Preferred)Expert Level Excel: 3 years (Preferred)Data analysis skills: 3 years (Preferred)Work remotely:No
jobdescription.132: Sommaire du poste Agir en tant que conseiller de confiance auprès des principaux clients internes, en fournissant un aperçu, des opinions et des recommandations sur les principales tendances, occasions et menaces du marché et des performances. Notre objectif principal sera d’exécuter des techniques d’exploration de données, d’effectuer des analyses statistiques et de mettre sur pied des systèmes de prédiction d’excellente qualité intégrés à notre programme CX. Assurer la continuité de la recherche de données, l’analyse des données et la base de référence des indicateurs de rendement clés (IRC) afin de stimuler l’amélioration constante dans un ensemble d’activités opérationnelles. Description du poste Concevoir, développer et publier des analyses grâce à la pile de logiciels SAS, Python et PowerBI. Établir de solides relations clients internes avec les collègues, les principales parties prenantes et les chefs d’entreprise en vue de comprendre de façon proactive les objectifs stratégiques. Fournir une analyse des tendances sur la base des connaissances statistiques et formuler des recommandations sur les politiques et procédures de l’entreprise. Mener la collecte des informations relatives aux exigences commerciales en collaboration avec les partenaires internes et externes. Prendre des initiatives en ce qui concerne les relations de causalité complexe et l’analyse de scénarios au sein de l’équipe Participer aux communications concernant les résultats de rendement et les conclusions d’analyse. Effectuer des recherches et appliquer une analyse comparative et de mesure du secteur, en collaboration avec les autres membres de l’équipe d’analyse de données d’affaires afin de s’assurer que les mesures pertinentes sont incluses dans chaque rapport. Faire la synthèse de grandes quantités de données, identifier les tendances principales, présenter les résultats d’une manière logique et concise et communiquer efficacement les résultats aux parties prenantes. Améliorer des procédures de collecte de données en incluant des informations pertinentes pour la mise au point les solutions analytiques. Procéder au nettoyage et à la vérification de l’intégrité des données utilisées dans le cadre de l’analyse et de la modélisation. Participer aux tests et à la maintenance des solutions de science des données. Contribuer au développement de processus automatisés en vue d’analyser les données à grande échelle. Exigences du poste Baccalauréat en sciences ou maîtrise en sciences dans le domaine de l’informatique, de l’apprentissage automatique, des statistiques appliquées ou des mathématiques. Professionnel agréé en analytique de préférence. 1 à 4 ans d’expérience en tant que professionnel débutant en science de données ou dans un rôle similaire Expérience dans le domaine de la modélisation statistique et des techniques d’apprentissage automatique, un atout Compréhension des techniques et algorithmes d’apprentissage automatique, comme l’apprentissage supervisé et non supervisé, etc. Expérience avec des instruments de science des données courantes, telles que Scikit learn, Azure ML, NumPy, MatLab, etc., de préférence Expérience intermédiaire à avancée dans la programmation dans deux des langages suivants : Python, SAS, JavaScript Connaissance intermédiaire du SQL. Connaissance pratique du SSAS. Expérience dans l’utilisation de GIT pour le développement et le déploiement de CICD. Expérience dans l’application de méthodes de science des données aux problèmes opérationnels, de préférence Expérience dans l’application de méthodes analytiques et statistiques dans le monde des affaires Solides compétences en présentation et en communication, et capacité d’expliquer des analyses complexes Esprit d’équipe et capacité à travailler de manière autonome Capacité reconnue à faire preuve d’initiative, de bon jugement, de tact et de diplomatie auprès de personnes d’autres domaines Bilinguisme en communication orale et écrite en anglais et en français, indispensable Millennium1 Solutions applique une politique d’égalité en matière d’emploi. À ce titre, nous encourageons les personnes handicapées à postuler. Des accommodements sont offerts sur demande pour les candidats qui participent, peu importe l’étape du processus de sélection.  Position Overview: The overall purpose of this position is to ensure that the best service possible is delivered to our customers experience analytics program. This includes leveraging various analytics tool to conduct analysis through call listening, text querying and data analysis. All work is performed in accordance to established program guidelines.  Responsibilities: Design, develop & publish analysis through SAS, Python and PowerBI visualization stack. Build strong internal customer relationships with colleagues, key stakeholders, and business leaders to proactively understand strategic objectives Provide trend analysis by using statistic knowledge and provide recommendation on business policies and procedures Lead business requirements gathering with internal and external partners Lead on complex causality, scenario analysis within the team Assist with communications regarding performance results and analysis findings Research and apply industry benchmarking and metrics, collaborating with the other Business Insights team members to ensure that relevant metrics are included in each report Synthesizing large amounts of data and identify key trends and present the results in a logical concise manner and effectively communicate results to stakeholders. Enhancing data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for the building analytical solutions Process, cleanse, and verify the integrity of data used for analysis and modeling Participate in testing and maintenance of data science solutions Assist in the development of automated processes for large scale data analysis Requirements Participate in testing and maintenance of data science solutions Assist in the development of automated processes for large scale data analysis 1 to 4 years of experience as a Junior Data Scientist or in a similar role Experience in statistical modelling and machine learning techniques an asset Understanding of maching learning techniques and algorithms, such as supervised and unsupervised learning etc. Experience with common data science toolkits, such as Scickit learn, Azure ML, NumPy, MatLab, etc. preferred Intermediate to advanced programming experience in two of the following languages: Python, SAS, Javascript Experience using GIT for CICD development and deployment practice Intermediate Knowledge on SQL, working knowledge of SSAS Experience in applying data science methods to business problems preferred Experience in applying analytical and statistical methods in the commercial world Strong presentation and communication skills with the ability to explain complex analytics Team player with the ability to work independently Proven ability in exercising initiative, good judgement, tact, and diplomacy concepts to people from other fields Bilingual in both oral and written communication for English and French is a must. Millennium1 Solutions is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. INDM
jobdescription.134: At the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, we are working to create a world without disease. Transforming lives by finding new and better ways to prevent, intercept, treat and cure disease inspires us. We bring together the best minds and pursue the most promising science. We are Janssen. We collaborate with the world for the health of everyone in it. Learn more at www.janssen.com and follow us @JanssenGlobal. Janssen Inc. is part of the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies. Digital & Data Science is one of the critical capability levers within our J&J Supply Chain’s Strategy, Innovation & Deployment (SI&D) innovation engine that is essential to building the world’s best supply chain. As our Digital & Data Science team continues to double-down on fact-based management – illuminating greater visibility and analytical capabilities across the key metrics that will drive growth for our business – we must ensure that our energy, resources, capabilities and talented employees are best-aligned to the evolving needs of our business and our customers. The Data Operations team sits within the Digital & Data Science organization with specific accountabilities related to Master Data Management in our global ERP systems, to enable the effective execution of the Supply Chain business activities. Our role is to deliver trusted data to enable the launch & supply of products to our customers. Our key accountabilities include: delivering and maintaining a data operating model that ensures adequate governance that optimizes data quality, timeliness, and effort; applying end-to-end data knowledge and unique insights to drive innovative customer solutions; building scalable partnerships with suppliers to be adaptable to changing needs and demands; utilizing technology to drive innovative data operations solutions; and developing our talent as a distinctive capability. This position will monitor and execute day-to-day operations to support the strategy of the Data Operations function across franchises/business units. Will lead small projects. Will develop solutions to a variety of problems of moderate to fairly intricate scope and complexity, while referring to established policies and procedures. Responsibilities: Monitor and execute the data operations and data quality process. May include coordination of testing, error handling, data conversion and/or validation, and audit/compliance actions (Non-Conformance (NC) and/or Corrective Action Preventive Action (CAPA)). Provide tactical direction to third party team(s) and function as first level escalation. Continuous improvement of existing data design, process and templates by tactically focusing on business outcomes. Implement and monitor tools and processes that maximize data operations execution. Engage with stakeholders on tactical matters. Function as Subject Matter Expert/Data Governance Lead for workstream or functional area. Provide appropriate guidance on data operations. May include completion of complex change assessments and/or project scoping requirements, point of escalation for both internal and external team members, single point of contact for strategic launches and audit/compliance activities, participate in and sometimes lead operational meetings with data owners. Prepare metrics, dashboards, and tracking to facilitate the efficient operations of the Data Operations department. May execute budget and/or value capture protocol within established framework Participate in, and sometimes lead, operational and governance meetings which may include end-to-end, value capture, and third party reviews. Contribute to the creation and maintenance of documentation for area of responsibility. May include Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), Work Instructions (WIs), protocols, data quality catalogs, and other policy and procedure documents. Develop and deliver training to educate stakeholders on documented procedures, data flows, etc. Support the deployment of the Data Management Framework (Governance Maturity Roadmap).  Qualifications  A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience. 4 years of relevant professional business experience along with a minimum of 4 years of data management experience in the context of large ERP platforms is required. Supply chain experience, preferably in master data, operations, or cross-functional business environment. Business and technical knowledge and understanding of all Supply Chain data elements, process, and organizational support models. (E.g. SAP and/or JDE, Winshuttle, Data Quality). A relevant mix of global, regional, cross-sector/industry experience. MS Office Suite (Excel, Outlook, Word). Strong written, oral, and presentation skills. Excellent organizational and prioritization skills. Ability to build strong collaborative relationships, influence multiple stakeholders, and establish common goals and objectives without sacrificing outcomes. Ability to contribute on a diverse, multicultural and remote team. Ability to work in a matrix environment where priorities change rapidly, and tight deadlines exist. This position may require up to 5% of domestic and international (US) travel. Diversity and inclusion are central elements of the shared culture across the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies. Attracting, developing and retaining a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities is essential to our success. We are committed to providing a respectful, inclusive and accessible work environment where all employees have the opportunity to achieve their potential.  Primary Location Canada-Ontario-Markham-200 Whitehall Drive Other Locations United States-New Jersey-Piscataway, United States-Pennsylvania-West Chester, United States-Massachusetts-Raynham, Canada-Ontario-Markham, Canada-Ontario-Toronto, Canada-Ontario-Guelph Organization Janssen Inc. (7710) Job Function Operations Requisition ID 2105903113W
jobdescription.135: Role: Data Analyst - SAS DevelopmentStructure: Contract (6 months)Location: Toronto, ON (remote during COVID)Pay: $52.00 p/h inc.Hours: Monday - Friday (business hours)We currently have an opportunity for a contract for a remoted based Data Analyst - SAS Development working on Banking projects.The required skills for this role will be:4+ years of SASMS Office (Excel & Word)ETL is a nice to haveStrong communication skillsBanking Experience is a nice to have--Please apply with an updated resume and ensure the required skills you are able to speak to for this position are included.For more roles like this please go to www.corgta.com/find-a-job/Contract length: 6 monthsJob Types: Full-time, ContractSalary: $52.00 per hourSchedule:8 hour shift
jobdescription.136: Our Story:  Our small Canadian-born business was founded in 1978 and has become a global organisation that now spans 120 locations across 20 countries. Our expansion has been rapid, but what matters most is the common belief that drives all 5,000 of our people to be a different type of real estate organisation. We believe that the places in which we live, work and play have the power to make us happier and healthier, and we are united by a shared sense of purpose, to have a positive impact on people’s lives. In short, we are a global commercial real estate advisory firm with a simple aim: for real estate to play a leading role in creating vibrant buildings, cities and places that deliver long-lasting social value and economic impact. Why Work for Us: We believe that our industry is changing, and we want our business to be a melting pot of curious minds, passionate hearts and strategic intelligence. Your gender, religion and race are all highly respected, but are less important to us than your ability to step up and change the game. We provide you with a place where you can do just that, with like-minded people. Collaboration is embedded in the way we work – our people have the autonomy to collaborate on client relationships, engage teams across the business, lead operations, work collectively on projects, participate in strategy and are ultimately responsible for our growth. Our distinctive Principal-led, privately-owned model puts us in the enviable position of being able to offer every employee the opportunity to own a share of our business, and inspires and allows anyone to become a Principal. This role carries voting rights so our people have a very real say in the future direction and operation of our business. This means that we are able to attract, engage and retain the best talent from the industry. LOCATION: Toronto Downtown Headquarters OR Chicago Downtown Office (candidates outside of the two areas will be considered but must be willing to move at own expense). Overview:  We are seeking an HRIS Analyst to join our dynamic and energetic Human Resources team. At Avison Young, you will be the go-to person in assuring accurate data are reported on all our people – from titles, hire dates, pay rates, to benefits elections, attrition rates, and more. As a company committed to a culture where we’re “powered by people,” it takes a serious and dedicated person to ensure that our people’s data are “right”. Responsibilities:  The main functions anticipated for this role include, but are not limited to, the following: Analytical Skills: Sort through large amounts of data, analyze, summarize and present conclusions in an appealing and easy to understand format; Thorough knowledge of MS Excel, Word and PowerPoint required Monthly, quarterly and annual business metrics reporting to assist with business decisions HRIS database and systems; Perform system maintenance and production support activities in both North American HRIS systems (Ultipro and ADP) Serve as a key contact for the Learning Management System (LMS), 401(K) program, and the HRIS systems, among other programs Standardized Operating Procedures: Documenting processes, identifying HR concerns, and compiling data analysis reports HR Initiatives: Assist with various HR initiatives as assigned including data transfers to and from various vendors for systems upgrades, integrations and implementations This is a high demand environment in terms of which requires keen attention to detail and focus on accuracy; and the successful candidate top performer will be one who keeps cool when the going gets tough. Qualifications:  You will be: Data driven and detail-oriented to ensure accuracy of data and reports Highly pro-active and self-motivated Collaborative team member with effective written and verbal communication skills Analytical and have experience with people metrics to influence decision-making Advanced in the use of the Microsoft Office Suite of products, with a specific focus on Excel, PowerPoint and Word Clear, concise and experienced with providing relevant and accurate information in formats suitable for the audience receiving the information Education/Certifications Bachelor’s degree Finance or Economics degree with an interest/specialization in HR or related work experience 3 years of work experience with exposure to working with at least one HRIS System Implementation experience HR certification in either Canada or United States is preferred Our Equal Opportunity Commitment:  Avison Young practices as an equal opportunity employer in all services locations around the world. We are committed to building and maintaining a workforce diverse in experience, skills and knowledge with uniformity in service excellence, commitment and integrity. The firm maintains a strict policy to ensure employment opportunities are equal and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, protected veteran or military service status, or any other elements protected by law. For those requiring assistance with disabilities, information relating to the need for accommodation and accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially. Avison Young is committed to employing the best talent with the most fair and equitable recruitment practices. Apply with us TODAY!
jobdescription.138: Company Description Torstar Corporation is a progressive media organization with a long, proud history in newspapers and a passion for capitalizing on the fluid world of digital and mobile media. Torstar’s vision for success is driven by a deep customer-centric obsession, continued journalistic excellence, advanced data-driven competency and a culture that is selfless, focused, agile, collaborative and results driven. The successful candidate will be a champion of those priorities while keeping the customer at the heart of all of the creative work that s/he will be doing.  Job Description The Geospatial Data Analyst will report to the Manager, Revenue Analytics and work on the data team and with our sales teams through the delivery of reports and analysis supporting advertising sales, both print and digital. You possess a combination of data analytic skills with geospatial skills and have an analytical mindset with a keen business acumen. You are passionate about delivering analysis with meaningful insights, and impactful business recommendations that enable our sales teams and directly contribute to revenue generation, helping to foster a data-first culture across the organization. Responsibilities Work closely with the Sales and Data teams to deliver geographic, demographic, and sales analysis Conduct analysis using demographic, psychographic, and customer expenditure data and mapping software to determine distribution patterns Work with the Sales and Data teams to ensure advertiser reporting and analysis needs are met Ensure the reporting and analysis we provide is evolutionary, progressive, and easily understood, helping to drive successful business decisions Ensure data presented is inclusive, ensuring consideration of the big picture Audience segmentation Have a high attention to detail, resulting in accuracy Gain a deep understanding of KPIs  Qualifications Geospatial Master or Bachelor Degree in Spatial Analysis, Geography, Urban Planning or Data Analytics Advanced experience using ArcGIS Pro and Online Advanced experience using Environics Analytics’ geo/demo/psychographic data and Envision Trained in programming and ability to create simple custom code/scripts in ArcGIS Sales background is an asset Databases Experience using SQL Experience in creating visualizations through tools such as Tableau Experience with data-management systems, working with large data-sets and creating reporting surrounding the data Knowledge of Google Analytics Plus! Excellent written and verbal communication skills Attention to detail Ability to prioritize and organize Highly motivated independent worker Additional Information Torstar Group of Companies is committed to providing an inclusive and barrier free recruitment process ensuring equal access to employment opportunities for candidates, including persons with disabilities. In compliance with Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and Ontario Human Rights Code we will endeavour to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability during the recruitment process, please notify the hiring manager upon scheduling your interview of your requirements.
jobdescription.141: To support the ongoing development of Global Business Insight capability Dentons is currently recruiting a Global Business Analyst. This position will report to the Director, Global Client Financial Analytics & Reporting; with main stakeholder group being Global Clients & Markets teams, key account client teams, global business leaders and regional business insight teams.  The Global Business Insight Analyst will be responsible for providing support to the business in relation to the analysis and manipulation of client based financial data and the deployment of reporting tools to support global financial and client reporting, as well as other data-related initiatives. The right candidate will also be expected to work closely with the Global Finance Transformation Team, and in particular the Record to Report team to align new metrics, assist in requirements gathering, data collection and data reconciliation. This is an exciting and developing global role, requiring contact with colleagues across the Dentons network. Only ambitious and curious team players will be considered.  Why Dentons is different  The legal profession is changing rapidly and Dentons is leading the way in advancing change for the benefit of our clients. We are driven to challenge the status quo, delivering consistent and uncompromising quality and value to our clients in new and innovative ways. Dentons continues to receive multiple external awards and recognition, including for our ongoing international expansion over the last 12 months; for ground-breaking innovation through the development of Nextlaw Labs and Nextlaw Global Referral Network; and for success in advising clients across multiple regions. Dentons is also a leader on the Acritas'Global Elite Brand Index and a BTI Client Service 30 Award winner. Against such rapid growth and change, this role offers the successful individual the chance to play a significant role and make their mark in driving the successful implementation of a transformative Business Intelligence capability within Dentons.  Key Deliverables Working with the Business Insight team and key stakeholders: Delivery of self-guided analytics to support client, area of law, geography, practice group and sector lines of enquiry Delivery of business insight based on analysis of data, identification of trends, anomalies, deviation from KPI's The provision of ad hoc support to decision makers facilitating Dentons to become a data driven organisation through having access to timely data that is both reliable and able to be interpreted by senior stakeholders Design and execution of ongoing data quality monitoring processes Delivery of a user interface to navigate users to the required reports Key Responsibilities To provide support to the decision makers in Dentons through responding to requests for information/analysis and proactively guiding stakeholders to self-help tools as appropriate To ensure that the process for the extraction of data from underlying systems and the collation of that data into a global database is efficient, monitored and reconciled To understand and work with the wider team to deliver an efficient end to end Business Insight solution, to include the management and control of data, consistent application of the access and security models, ensuring data consistency across all systems To create, manage and deploy dashboards/reporting within the global Business Insight architecture, supporting global and regional team members as required To embrace ongoing change and improve both process and quality of deliverables, providing clear explanations and training as changes are rolled out To work with the technical reporting team to ensure all data is reconciled as it is transformed and regions and global teams have complete transparency of the data back to source systems To produce formats and templates to support client pitches, client facing reports, and client management teams as required by clients and client management teams To ensure all key stakeholders are fully aware of the resources available to them and fully trained in their use To work with the data stewards and wider finance transformation data team to ensure that data clean up activity delivers business benefit to support better decision making To create and manage such documentation and on-line tool support text as necessary To proactively review and incorporate cross regional working data, partner credit data, key performance indicators and global measures into regular reporting and insight To support the process for ongoing data management and governance, understand the current guidelines and work with team members to optimize process and efficiency to deliver a world class solution to Dentons stakeholders To support the investigation of the use of AI within Dentons to leverage information held in unstructured data sources The post holder will also be responsible for identifying (scoping) and collecting (liaising with colleagues globally) regarding the data required to generate new metrics and the definition of those key metrics, working alongside the Global Finance Transformation data and reporting team About You Business international level of English – both written and oral. Demonstrable and progressive experience in the areas of data manipulation and analytics, A passion for providing data driven insight, with the ambition to bring excellence to Dentons A fastidiousness for accurate, reconciled analysis with the personality to not rest until imbalances are found Experience of influencing and engaging stakeholders, including building and managing relationships within a diverse global firm. Ability to work under pressure and manage conflicting demands, to respond to ad hoc requests alongside developing a best in class BI solution for Dentons Strong intellectual rigor and commercial awareness. Strategically focused, results driven and well-developed analytical skills. The individual will need to combine good technical skills with accuracy and the ability to cope under pressure, given the demands of the work involved and business requirements. Problem solving skills, supported by high quality data analysis are critical for this role, along with strong communication skills. Solutions orientated with the ability to address problems by gathering relevant information and formulating alternatives Structured, collaborative, accurate and with a drive to perfection Significant experience and a proven track record in/as: Data analysis, creating and modeling business data using a variety of tools and techniques, to meet the needs of stakeholders; Data warehousing concepts Able to communicate insight derived in relevant business language to enable informed decision making: Working with enterprise wide databases, observing global access and security protocols and assisting in the effective management of global master data Analysing and interpreting market data for an organisation, quickly establishing key metrics/measures to support the Business Development department Strong communication skills and the demonstrable ability to communicate appropriately at all levels of the organization; this includes written and verbal communications as well as visualizations; Strong situational analysis and ability to articulate the true requirements; Must be a team player able to work effectively at all levels of an organization with the ability to influence others to move toward consensus; Be able to identify and understand multiple stakeholder perspectives and "truths" and bring an open mind to understanding and build on the views of others; business development/client data analyst, within a team on international projects; creating both functional and non-functional documentation, including requirements traceability matrices. You will possess: The ability to act as a liaison conveying information in suitably accurate models between the Business and their counterparts within Information Technology. The scope of this information includes business requirements, data constraints, business rules, models of strategy and motivation, processes, accountabilities, and many other business and IT operational needs; The ability to assimilate and correlate disconnected documentation and drawings, and articulate their collective relevance to Dentons and to high-priority business issues; The ability to visualize and create high-level models (rigorous information-rich diagrams) that can be used in future analysis to extend and mature the business architecture; Possess a broad, enterprise-wide view of organizations and varying degrees of appreciation for strategy, processes and capabilities, enabling technologies, and governance. Skills to create and amend SSRS reporting as well as to administer Reporting Services Essential Qualifications / Experience Experience of working as a data/business analyst for an international organisation /international project, Experienced in creating both functional and non-functional documentation, including requirements traceability matrices, specifications documents and training materials Data Analytics tools, Microsoft tools expertise, to include Office, in particular Excel, and PowerBi. MS Azure SQL; Visual Studio Experience of working with Thomson Reuters 3E, Data Insights and PowerBi Applications from current residents in the following cities, will be considered:  Scotland, Toronto, or Warsaw or Remote (attendance at a Dentons office will be required periodically)  Disclaimer: Please ensure when applying for this role that you are legally eligible to work/live in your preferred location. Visa sponsorship or relocation costs will not be provided  Diversity & Inclusion  Essential to our success as a global law firm is our ability to attract and retain the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds. We want a work environment where everyone can reach their potential and we have an inclusive culture which respects individual differences.  Equal Opportunities  Dentons is committed to providing equal opportunities for all.  Reward and Recognition  Remuneration and befits package will reflect the successful candidates experience and country where hired.  Applications from individuals directly, should be sent to Global Recruitment Team: Global.Roles@Dentons.com
jobdescription.142: ABOUT US CI Financial Corp. (TSX: CIX) is an independent Canadian company offering global asset management and wealth management advisory services with total assets of $231.8 billion as of January 31, 2021. Its primary operating businesses are CI Global Asset Management, CI Assante Wealth Management and CI Investment Services. POSITION: Investment Policy Analyst, Managed Solutions LOCATION: Toronto, ON. STATUS: Full-time JOB OVERVIEW We are currently seeking an Investment Policy Analyst to join our Operations team. In this role, the successful candidate is responsible for providing prompt and courteous service to financial advisors and internal departments as it relates to clients’ Evolution portfolios and investment policies. WHAT YOU WILL DO Produce manual asset allocation instructions according to our established portfolio optimization methodologies Adjust Evolution portfolios and accounts to correct internal and external errors Provide support to Client Services, Compliance, Evolution processing team and other internal departments on trade and portfolio related inquiries Investigate, analyze, and resolve trade-related issues relating to clients’ determined asset mixes Support Client Services and Sales teams by providing trade or portfolio related analyses and estimates Review and analyze data to provide accurate maintenance of client transactions Support team with quality control efforts WHAT YOU WILL BRING Minimum 3 -5 years’ experience within financial services industry Knowledge of investment management philosophies Post-secondary degree Completion of the Canadian Securities Course is mandatory Enrollment or completion of the CFA Charter or CIM designation is an asset Knowledge of mutual funds, stocks, bonds, derivatives, GIC’s, etc. Ability to work independently and as part of a team High degree of accuracy and attention to detail Excellent interpersonal and communications skills, both written and verbal WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US Our dedication to the Employee Experience at CI is aimed at supporting, empowering and inspiring our talented team through: Recognition & Compensation Training & Development Health & Well-being Communication & Feedback If you are a passionate, committed and dynamic individual, please submit your resume in confidence by clicking “Apply”. Only qualified candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. CI Financial Corp. and all of our affiliates (“CI”) are committed to fair and accessible employment practices and we are committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities. If you require accommodations in order to apply for any job opportunities, or require this posting in an additional format, please contact us at accessible.recruitment@ci.com, or call 416-364-1145 ext. 4747. If you are contacted by CI regarding a job opportunity or testing and require accommodation in any stage of the recruitment process, please use the above contact information. We will work with all applicants to determine appropriate accommodation for individual accessibility needs. Postings Tags: IND# #LI-POST
jobdescription.143: IO’s Real Estate Enterprise Team manages the province’s portfolio of government buildings and land, which is one of the largest and most diverse in Canada. The team oversees the day-to-day operation and long-term maintenance of these facilities through partnerships with private-sector service providers, ensuring provincially-owned real estate is used in the most optimal way. Finding innovative ways to reduce and revitalize the government’s building and land holdings is central to its business and integral to the value provided Ontarians. Position Purpose: The Business Planning Analyst will provide process documentation, system, planning, and strategy support to the Capital Planning department and to our business users. The role will leverage our VFA software license and work with IT staff and outside service providers to effectively develop and service the assigned business areas. The role will work towards the potential migration of our asset data from VFA to another Asset Management Information System. What You Will Do: Provide analytical and system support in all aspects of the VFA (Accruent) contract i.e. training, data validation, invoice reconciliation, development of new tools, integration Work collaboratively with internal IO and ministry team members, coordinate and identify opportunities and consistencies between IO programs Responsible for delivering ad hoc reports to internal and external clients including but not limited to asset performance measures Undertake and coordinate asset management planning issues (i.e. benchmarking, data requirements, organizational and operational efficiencies, etc.) Identify opportunities to improve quality of data within IO and in VFA by carrying out physical and data audits Identify, document, implement and communicate all processes within the Capital Planning Program and its interconnected relations to the rest of the organization Liaise with internal and external stakeholders to source accurate and reliable assumptions for life-cycle planning models across applicable product types and sub-markets Effectively plan and deliver process mapping sessions to acquire necessary information from different levels in an organization Review domestic and international market reports and studies to remain current on industry trends as it pertains to capital reinvestment models, component inventorying, condition assessment, life-cycle assessment, condition indices and performance metrics Develop various types of real estate and other business analyses (cost/benefit, expenditure/condition modeling and analysis, quantitative vs. qualitative benefits, etc.) for capital reinvestment Create reports and presentations to assist both senior management and applicable ministry management in decision making Interact with internal experts and project stakeholders for the purpose of coordinating tasks and collecting data/information where needed Who We’re Looking For: Over 2 to 5 years of experience in the real estate industry (i.e. property/facility management, project management, corporate real estate, planning/consulting etc.) Post-secondary degree in business, engineering or related field Experience in developing and maintaining medium size business systems Experience analyzing and preparing financial reports and technical data Experience in writing business plans, processes and identifying opportunities for improvements Knowledge of financial analysis and/or capital investment planning Knowledge of asset/land/building related legislation would be an asset Knowledge of ISO 55000 would be an asset Employment in the Real Estate Division is conditional upon obtaining security clearance through the Program & Policy Enablement Branch, Supply Chain Ontario of the Ministry of Government and Consumer Services Infrastructure Ontario is an inclusive employer, we encourage applications from all qualified candidates. We will accommodate your needs under the Ontario Human Rights Code. We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. By submitting your application you are granting Infrastructure Ontario permission to process your personal data during the recruitment process and for keeping records of the process. Infrastructure Ontario may share your personal data internally to appropriate persons involved in the recruitment process and to third parties where there is an administrative or lawful basis for doing so. Provided that Infrastructure Ontario does not have any lawful reason to continue processing your personal data, you may make a formal request to rectify, erase or restrict (the processing of) your personal data.
jobdescription.145: TD Description Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward. Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Department Overview The Marketing Technologies, Analytics & Insights (MTA&I) function within Marketing is a central source of internal and external consumer insights and data analytics which supports both corporate and business unit strategies for TD Bank Financial Group Canada and TD Bank, America’s Most Convenient Bank. The MTA&I team mission is to be influential change agents and consumer advocates to help deliver the better bank and to drive shareholder return through optimizing the impact of marketing. We do this by delivering hindsight (what happened), insight (why), and foresight (future actions) on how to best reach consumers, who to target, what to say, and build intelligence on the market and competitive landscape. The group seeks to deliver excellence in analytics and insights to support short-term business success as well as long-term strategy of the bank. The MTA&I team brings together a diverse range of technical and business expertise including market research, business analytics, data science and modelling, business intelligence, data strategy and governance, data management, campaign targeting and delivery, and visualization. Job Description The successful candidate will be responsible for Campaign Analytics within the broader Marketing Analytics group. This individual will execute the account management campaigns for Personal Savings & Investing and Direct Investing. If you are driven by helping stakeholders understand data, love when the latest direct-to-consumer marketing campaign results are available, and continually strive to challenge the "process status quo" to make workflows run as efficiently as possible – this is the role for you! Success in this role will be achieved by: Translating key business objectives into insight rich experiments that drive marketing ROI Ensuring execution (i.e., list creation) is done efficiently and with excellence Designing campaign results can be actioned by providing high value campaign reporting Work in a consultative role to provide "value-added" insights in the form of analysis, interpretation and advice of campaign reporting Your success will be predicated on your ability to forge strong partnerships, communicate effectively, deliver on-time, and continuously strive for increased efficiency. Responsibilities Design/execute/measure high impact direct to consumer marketing experiments Continuously improve campaign design and delivery by leveraging any and all analytical tools/techniques at your disposal Execute with excellence Manage your project pipeline to ensure agreed upon timelines can be met Proactively provide analytical guidance to key stakeholders, based on deep understanding of the businesses, to understand and enhance marketing ROI Maintain a culture of risk management and control, supported by effective processes and sound infrastructure Skill Sets Familiarity with direct marketing principles (Predictive Models, Experiment Design, A/B testing, Sample Size calculations, Net Performance Measurements, etc.) Good knowledge of Mutual Funds, Direct Investing and other banking products and transactions; Technical and detail oriented Knowledge of how campaigns are created by leveraging customer data from internal data warehouses through the use of programming tools such as Unica and SAS A project management mindset to help deliver on time to specifications Team player while able to work independently Pragmatic decision maker blending a mix of intellect, experience and street smarts A profit driven mindset Job Requirements 1-2+ years of relevant experience in a direct marketing, consulting, analytics, or agency-side role in financial services/telecom (or other high volume direct marketing industries) Significant experience with IBM Campaign (Unica) Knowledge of SQL and SAS; knowledge of databases and data structures; knowledge of vendors and file format requirements Experience designing and executing successful direct marketing experiments, including channel tests Familiarity with concepts such as "next best offer" and "always-on" an asset Degree in business, science, statistics, engineering, or other quantitative discipline Track record of delivering successful initiatives on time and on budget Inclusiveness At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs. Job Family General Job Category - Primary Marketing Job Category(s) Marketing Hours 37.5 Business Line TD Canada Trust Time Type Full Time Employment Type Regular Country Canada **Province/State (Primary) Ontario City (Primary) Toronto Work Location TD Centre - North - 77 King Street West
jobdescription.146: Company Description  As one of the largest independent technology companies in Atlantic Canada, Mariner has a team of over 200 IT and software professionals working with clients both regionally and across the globe. With extensive capabilities in the areas of analytics, automation software, information security and IT consulting, Mariner has been delivering innovative solutions with a strong emphasis on productivity and customer experience since 2003. Job Description  Mariner is currently recruiting for a Business Analyst to support our Telecommunications clients based both within the Maritimes and also throughout Canada. Qualifications  Bachelor's Degree in business administration, information systems, or related field. Experience with BCRIS is mandatory. 5+ years experience working in a Quality Assurance Analyst role. Experience leading business analysis and testing activities on large, complex projects; Experience preparing Business Requirements Documents, including functional/non-functional requirements Demonstrated ability to create, plan, manage, and execute test strategies, plans, and cases to support business process and software development quality assurance; Experience utilizing formal testing methodologies to verify that system and business applications meet specific requirements. Experience using defect management and testing tools. Demonstrated experience working well with an integrated team of both business and technical resources. Experience working in client-based consulting role is highly desirable.   Additional Information  Why Mariner Partners? We believe in making a positive impact in the communities where we live and work - our team is located in major cities all across Canada, throughout the US and internationally. We are proud to be headquartered here, and are passionate about growing a strong technology sector here in Atlantic Canada and beyond. We offer competitive compensation; benefits packages and training and development. We recognize that empowered employees are more innovative, more efficient, deliver better customer service and can flat out-perform conventional organizations. Our people have built products for national deployments at the world's largest TV and Internet companies and leading real estate, financial and government organizations. We are looking for passionate IT professionals who are curious about data, who love solving problems for customers and who want to grow their careers. Join our growing team! I'm interested
jobdescription.149: Our Summer student program is designed to unleash the potential of undergraduate students, giving them valuable and impactful work experiences, and insight into our ways of working and our values-driven approach to business.  The Data Analyst reports to the Senior Manager, Shared Services in Master Data team, whose chief mandate is to support and improve processes to enable the team to be customer and solution-oriented. The Data Analyst plays an important role in the Weston Food customer, vendor, material and pricing setup process and is responsible for the assortment of all new and maintenance of existing data under all banners and against all categories in SAP and Legacy Systems in adherence to process guidelines. It will be a great opportunity for someone who is eager to learn operational side of Master Data as well as to get exposure in process improvement & reporting.  CORE ACCOUNTABILITIES:  Process requests including set-up, modification or inactivation of customer, vendor, material and pricing master in SAP and Legacy Systems. Support the development of key performance indicators to measure the strength of end to end processes Extract and manipulate data from various systems (e.g. SAP, SQL, Cognos) to build insigful views for management to make sound decisions Develop and maintain cross functional relationships with the other teams in the business Assist in the data cleansing before implementation of SAP in various stages of the go-live Ensure effective documentation of business requirements, process and training content to ensure the successful implementation When needed, provide appropriate teams direction for corrections to ensure accurate and timely issue resolution Think through new problems, and proactively develop plans for issues not addressed by established procedure ABOUT YOU:  Post-secondary education preferably in Business or Data Science Able to build and maintain effective working relationships with internal partners and team members Advanced MS Excel, MS Access, MS PowerPoint & Sharepoint Skills Programming skills in various languages (VBA, SQL, SAS) are considered assets Experience in Power BI, Cognos or other reporting tools Experience/knowledge with SAP is an asset Excellent communication and presentation skills Team player with strong problem solving and interpersonal skills Positive attitude, willing to learn and be coached.
jobdescription.151: Requisition ID: 97205 Tangerine is Canada’s leading direct bank. We offer flexible and accessible banking options, innovative products, and award-winning Client service. The reason why Tangerine employees come to work each day is to help Canadians live better lives. We focus on making a difference in our communities, and that includes our own internal community. It’s important to us that our employees feel empowered and enthusiastic about belonging to our Orange culture. Department Summary: The Risk Management mandate is to provide oversight, monitoring and reporting of all operational, credit and market risks, including fraud exposures on an enterprise-wide basis. It is comprised of four well-defined functions: Operational Risk Management, Retail Credit Risk Management, Wholesale Credit Risk Management and Market Risk Management. Role Purpose: This role supports the Senior Manager of Strategic Initiatives and Portfolio Oversight and the overall Risk Management Team in identifying critical financial information typically from the bank’s Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW). The primary responsibility of this role is to assist the senior manager in developing and maintaining a risk reporting framework, support on credit risk strategy initiatives and other ad-hoc analysis will be required as necessary. Accordingly, the role requires strong data programming skills including SQL and SAS. The Senior Analysts generally works within the established framework to carry on responsibilities under the supervision of the Senior Manager of Strategic Initiatives and Portfolio Oversight. A high degree of self-assurance, initiative and business sense is required of the Senior Analyst in order to carry out the position responsibilities proactively in a timely and effective manner This role will allow the Senior Analyst to gain insight into the bank’s financial systems, economic drivers and regulatory reporting environment. The candidate should be naturally inclined toward mathematics and have a curiosity to learn complex systems. A background in business, statistics, economics, finance or accounting is desirable. Job Responsibilities: Maintain the monthly Local Risk Credit Committee deck for review by senior management Provide key access to data via SQL/SAS/Python and other data retrieval techniques. Identify data sources, and develop process required for the preparation of standard reports. Assist in providing financial information related to the expected loss component of the provision for credit loss and other portfolio insight in actively managing credit risk of consumer lending portfolios. Support for strategy , product and analysis teams as required Support the development and implementation of credit risk and loss mitigation plans and provide insight to the management team through ad hoc requests, projects and initiatives. Cross-train and share risk analytic knowledge with team members to foster a strong risk discipline environment. Ad-hoc duties as assigned by senior management Job Requirements: Education/Experience University Degree with a business, analytical, mathematical or statistical focus (Economics, Finance, Accounting or Statistics) Minimum of 6 months to 1 year of experience working with data analytics Specialized Knowledge Knowledge of OSFI guidelines is an asset Knowledge of Basel regulatory requirements on capital adequacy, liquidity risk and interest rate risk would be considered an asset Technical Skills Strong technical solution management experience and skills Strong analytical skills including SQL/SAS/Python Strong skills in reporting tools such as Tableau MS Office – Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Access Abilities Aptitude for innovation and readiness to “roll up sleeves” and do what is necessary to deliver on business objectives Strong capability to work with cross functional team members and collaborate effectively in high pressure environments Ability to work in a dynamic environment where processes and procedures are consistently refined Ability to work autonomously under tight timelines Ability to work on multiple ad-hoc tasks with a sense of urgency Attributes Strong verbal and written communication skills Strong attention to detail Strong organizational skills Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto At Tangerine we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the team, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know.
jobdescription.152: Experience 1 year to less than 2 years  Business Equipment and Computer Applications Microsoft Visio, Microsoft Visual Studio  Specific Skills Confer with clients to identify and document requirements. Conduct business and technical studies, Design, develop and implement information systems business solutions. Provide advice on information systems strategy, policy, management and service delivery, Assess physical and technical security risks to data, software and hardware. Develop policies, procedures and contingency plans to minimize the effects of security breaches. Develop and implement policies and procedures throughout the software development life cycle. Conduct reviews to assess quality assurance practices, software products and information systems.  Education Bachelor's degree  Personal Suitability Client focus, Organized, Effective interpersonal skills, Team player, Excellent written communication, Initiative, Judgement, Accurate  Intended job posting audience Anyone who can legally work in Canada can apply for this job. If you are not currently authorized to work in Canada, the employer will not consider your job application.
jobdescription.154: Company Description We are a global team of dedicated and experienced architects, engineers, planners, designers and technology professionals who share a common desire – to help our clients create liveable, sustainable and advanced urban environments. From high-rises to industrial buildings, schools to state-of-the-art hospitals, transit stations to highways, airports to toll systems, bike lanes to parks, we design every aspect of a truly integrated city for people to live, work and play. Our collaborative and combined approach focuses not only on creating the best solutions today, but also determining the right solutions for tomorrow. We believe cities in the future must be designed with intelligent systems, sustainable buildings, efficient infrastructure and a human touch.  At IBI, we’re defining the cities of tomorrow  Job Description Overview: The Information System Data Analyst will be part of a design and development team that includes business analysts, data base developers, data architects and process automation team. The mission will be to develop and maintain data analytics tools using Microsoft Power Bi, Microsoft Power Apps, Microsoft SQL Server and other data management tools.  Most of the things you'll be working on:  Assist in designing and developing data analytics solutions using Microsoft Power Bi. Creating analytics models which consume data from different sources like relational data base, Sharepoint and other Microsoft tools. Manage system / data tool security based on industry best practices. Participate in reviews and enhancements of analytics tools developed by peers [QA / QC]. Assist in the process of improving data analytics models with adherence to best practices related with performance and reliability. Properly documents functionality and technical specifications of the analytics products under their scope. Capable of delivering complete full life cycle development of analytics tools, including identifying user requirements, connecting to various data sources, testing and deployment, etc. Participate in and contribute to the design and development of best practices for data analytics models. Research new products and technologies to enhance the process of development, testing and deployment of data analytics models. Understands the interactions and dependencies among data and process components. Identifies and documents enhancements to modeling techniques. Enhance, connections and calculations to improve performance of models and outputs. Works collaboratively with Manager and team to forward plan workload. Maintains awareness of multiple asks / competing priorities and proactively requests input from others (specifically immediate team / manager) to speed up or slow down various Epics within workload  Qualifications You'll need yo have: 2 to 3 years of experience using Microsoft Power Bi building dashboards and visualizations Knowledge of data warehouse concepts and architecture Exceptional analytical skills Proficiency using Microsoft SQL Advanced level of Excel: pivot tables, Power Pivot, Macros (VBA is an asset) Working experience creating analytics using data coming a well-known ERP application Additional Information Additional information We are currently in a work from home model during COVID-19, but when we do return to the office we're located at 55 St. Clair Ave West, this office is steps away from St. Clair station and is easily accessible by bike, TTC and car.
