jobdescription.177: Address: 100 King Street West Job Family Group: Data Analytics & Reporting The Senior Business Analyst, Treasury Payments & Solutions will consult on analytical solutions to understand, analyze, and synthesize requirements, goals and objectives relative to data and business intelligence needs and to enable high-quality, fact-based business decisions to drive better business outcomes. Provides advice on the configuration, functionality, applicability, and usability of data management, data analytics, and data visualization technology solutions. Supports the development of the strategy and roadmap for data quality and data analytics, data modeling, reporting, business intelligence, and the design and development of sophisticated decision support tools. Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders. Leads/participates in the design, implementation and management of new analytics & reporting solutions. Designs, develops, and implements innovative analytical solutions. Designs and produces regular and ad-hoc reports, and dashboards. Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide subject matter insights and recommendations. Structures and assembles data into multi-dimensions with various granularities (e.g., demographics, customers, products, transactions). Monitors and tracks tool performance, user acceptance testing, and addresses any issues. Integrates information from multiple sources to enable more efficient processes, enhanced analysis and/or streamlined reporting. Designs, develops, and implements innovative analytical solutions. Designs and produces regular and ad-hoc reports, and dashboards. Builds reports and visualizations to effectively communicate data driven insights to users for a variety of audiences e.g. visualization solutions of data into reports, graphics, dashboards to illustrate facts, trends, and insights. Develops solutions and makes recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs. Supports development and execution of strategic analytics & reporting initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders. Analyzes data and information to provide subject-matter insights and recommendations. Develops tools and delivers training programs for use of reporting tools and self-serve analytics by non-analytical end users; may include delivery of training to audiences. Documents and maintain operational procedures and processes relating to analytical and reporting processes. Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders. Collaborates with internal and external stakeholders in order to deliver on business objectives. Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus. Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules. Works independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unique situations. Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed. Qualifications: Typically between 4 - 6 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Knowledge and experience in data preparation, data analysis, and statistical tool sets including but not limited to: Power BI Business Objects SQL (must have) SAS (must have) R (nice to have) Python (nice to have) SPSS (nice to have) Excel & Access (Expert) Technical proficiency gained through education and/or business experience. Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth. Collaboration & team skills - In-depth. Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth. Influence skills - In-depth. Data driven decision making - In-depth. We’re here to help At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world. As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset. To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en . BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. To whom: Project Manager, team members  When: Knowledge Transfer to occur throughout the project life cycle. 1:1 meetings / team meetings / documentation on SharePoint site  The Office of the Public Guardian and Trustee (OPGT) is responsible for protecting the property and personal interests of over 10,000 incapable adults who have no one else to help them, investigating allegations of abuse of mentally incapable adults, protecting the public's interest in charities, administering intestate estates, searching for heirs, investing perpetual care funds for Cemeteries, and dealing with dissolved corporations. The Accountant of the Superior Court is responsible for managing funds, mortgages and securities that are paid into court pursuant to judgements and orders of the court under various statutes on behalf of minors and litigants. The OPGT has embarked on a modernization and transformation initiative to help address rapidly increasing workload and caseload pressures, modernize business processes and business-critical tools in order to improve service delivery to vulnerable Ontarians.
jobdescription.179: Date Posted: 03/02/2021 Req ID: 2700 Faculty/Division: UofT Scarborough Department: UTSC:Dept-Management Campus: University of Toronto Scarborough (UTSC) Description: About us:  The University of Toronto Scarborough is a place of energy, enthusiasm and passion. Our commitment to inclusive excellence attracts the brightest learners, scholars and employees from around the globe. Our success has been made possible by the opportunity given to us by our Indigenous hosts to operate on their territory, and we cherish our continuing partnerships with these communities. The University of Toronto Scarborough is an exciting campus with unlimitedpotential. Join us on our journey.  UTSC Management is a world leader in providing business education that is heavily influenced by experiential learning and internationalization. The goal of UTSC Management is to create opportunities for our students to learn and experience leadership by applying the latest management theory to real-world problems both inside and outside the classroom.  Your opportunity:  Reporting to the Managing Director, Department of Management, the Business and Data Analyst will support the Department of Management by proactively gathering and synthesizing information from various internal and external sources to support decision making by senior management. The position is responsible for providing accurate and timely information for a multitude of purposes relating to the department of Management, in both graduate and undergraduate units. Data is to be collected in key areas of the department, which includes but is not limited torecruitment, application and admission, student services (including co-op) and student enrolment (courses and programs).  Your responsibilities will include: Analyzing the effectiveness and efficiency of existing systems and developing technical solutions for systems improvements Researching and identifying new software solutions to improve workflow and support Management team members in their duties Advising on data structure designs to ensure data integrity and valid report generation Providing detailed information on data analysis findings to stakeholders Designing and optimizing databases to meet the ongoing and changing needs of the department Planning and collaborating on components of projects specifically in the area of software implementation Maintaining information on digital platforms to ensure data integrity Tracking progress of student work-integrated experience applications, interviews andrecruitment Essential Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree relevant to research methodologies and statistics or a related field or acceptable combination of equivalent experience Minimum four years of relevant experience with advanced data management and analysis (e.g. data visualization, database set-up and familiarity, advanced data report generation etc.) Experience using business intelligence software and data visualization tools to create dashboards in order to facilitate data-driven decisions Data analysis skills, including designing and generating reports; analyzing data and identifying meaningful trends and results; developing projections to support strategic planning; presenting information in a user friendly way and supporting continuous improvement activities Ability to carry out a variety of descriptive and inferential statistical analysis including regression analysis and other techniques Strong oral and written communication skills to explain complex statistical analysis to decision makers, probe for information to establish needs and respond to requests, and communicate data query requirements to other analysts or non-technical users Ability to work independently or as part of a team, demonstrates initiative, creativity, curiosity, and attention to detail balanced by ability to see the big picture Excellent interpersonal skills, able to build effective partnerships with colleagues and students Highly motivated, self-starter with creative thinking skills Must be able to stay organized, multi-task and meet deadlines; and exercise accuracy. Applicants are also expected to show evidence of a commitment to equity, diversity, inclusion, and the promotion of a respectful and collegial learning and working environment Assets (Nonessential): Ability to independently formulate and test hypotheses concerning data in the context of the enrolment matters Strong working knowledge of survey development, administration and analysis Advanced knowledge of the structure and meaning of student data housed in various systems Understanding of complex relational databases and strong working knowledge of software reporting tools Experience working with complex data within a higher education environment To be successful in this role you will be: Adaptable Communicator Diligent Organized Problem solver Resourceful Note: A copy of the full job description is available upon request from the UTSC HR Office. Thisis a 12-month TERM position starting April 2021. Please ensure to include a cover letter with your application. Closing Date: 03/14/2021, 11:59PM ET Employee Group: USW Appointment Type: Budget - Term Schedule: Full-Time Pay Scale Group & Hiring Zone: USW Pay Band 12 - $69,730 with an annual step progression to a maximum of $89,172. Pay scale and job class assignment is subject to determination pursuant to the Job Evaluation/Pay Equity Maintenance Protocol. Job Category: Administrative / Managerial

Provides support for site operations and WMS, Performs application maintenance necessary to update records, specifications, and operating procedures of site specific systems. Job Description Collects and analyzes operational data. Assists in the design, development, and implementation of data gathering and reporting methods and procedures within Operations. Recommends procedural changes to improve efficiency of operations. Functions as technical coordinator and internal consultant regarding needs and requirements of Operations data processing. Responsible for tracking, analysis, and forecasting of storage capacities, inventory levels, equipment and/or manpower requirements. jobdescription.181: Purpose: Service Excellence is an institutional initiative that will lead to a more effective, efficient and sustainable institution through the review and re-engineering of administrative processes at the University. Support may include generating reports, undertaking research related to the initiatives, analysis of relevant data and metrics, tracking of initiative benefits realization, as well as developing process mapping and documentation and business requirements development at a pan university level. The incumbent will be required to support multiple service areas and initiatives within Service Excellence.The incumbent requires access to HR, Finance, UIT, Facilities Services and Student Services data, UF Analytics and Benchmarking dashboards and reports, and Manager Resources to be able to perform the analysis required by the job function.At the direction of the Director, PMO, the Business Analyst will lead some smaller projects ? these projects will have a defined scope, operating parameters, and desired outcomes. Guidance and support will be provided to the incumbent as required. Additional Notes: - Office environment primarily.- Significant interaction with team members on one-on-one meetings as well as participating in/support work shops- Computer work - developing process maps, analyzing data, drawing conclusions, - Computer work - research on best practices in the PSE sectorPlease note: This position requires the candidate to produce a verification of degree(s), credential(s) or equivalencies from accredited institutions and/or international equivalents at the time of interview. jobdescription.183: Toronto- Remote, ON Operations Full Time Feb 23, 2021 Business & Integration Analyst (Technical Business Analyst) Full-time/ Contract 3- 6 months Remote Overview The Business and Integration Analyst role will support delivery for one of our major clients. The Business and Integration Analyst is primarily accountable for the collection, analysis and documentation of customer requirements. Our implementation projects are highly technical in nature, but the Senior Business Analyst must be able to work equally well with both technical and non-technical teams. What you’ll do Drive requirements gathering, process redesign and gap analysis for both front end solutions and integrations with Smile CDR’s FHIR-based clinical data repository. Demonstrate empathy for your customers’ requirements, linking requirements to project objectives and priorities. Produce documentation to a high standard, including high quality reports and presentations. Own and deliver work packages of moderate to large size and complexity. Collaborate and communicate with stakeholders at all levels and departments to build and maintain strong relationships and ensure smooth transition of solutions throughout the project lifecycle. Use individual judgment to solve problems, identify risks, and address issues. Apply change management techniques within a complex stakeholder environment to facilitate positive change. Understand capabilities of Smile CDR’s products and services and how they can deliver value to our customers. Collaborate with product leads and designers to deliver the best possible solutions for our customers. Advocate for our customers’ requirements within the Smile CDR organization Develop strategies for continuous improvement of our projects and processes. Learn about industry trends and best practices to help set direction for projects and products. Mentor other project team members Assist with or lead RFI/RFP development and evaluation. Take on the role of scrum master within a project team as required. What we are looking for Minimum 3- 5 years of experience in Business Analysis or Systems Integration Working experience in business systems and workflow analysis Excellent problem recognition and problem-solving abilities Excellent analytical, interpersonal, prioritization, and organization skills Demonstrated ability to work in a team and interact effectively with teams, stakeholders and clients Excellent communication skills, both written and oral - you’re comfortable leading meetings, documenting your ideas and able to persuade others. Proven knowledge and judgement in escalating issues when needed Experience with Agile, Scrum, waterfall and iterative methodologies; Agile or Scrum certification is an asset. Familiarity with HL7 v2 and FHIR formats an asset Experience in the healthcare industry or health insurance industry an asset Successful completion of an undergraduate degree required in Health Informatics, Computer Science, Engineering or related field an asset Bonus points Experience in the healthcare industry or health insurance industry an asset
jobdescription.184: Statistician & Research Analyst  - (16607)  Find Your Spot at Humber If you are interested in higher education and are looking to contribute to the largest polytechnic College in Ontario as we shape the future of our students and communities, here is your opportunity to join our team. At Humber, our career paths open up a world of infinite possibilities for you to explore. People are at the heart of the Humber experience. Here, every day we work shoulder to shoulder to deliver excellence, and in doing so, we redefine what it means to be a leader in polytechnic education. Humber employees are a diverse group of committed, caring and fun-loving people. We learn and grow together. We take finding and growing the right talent very seriously. We strive to find and nurture extraordinary employees who bring their best each day. Humber is a place like no other. Here you will “Find Your Spot” and build a career and future that grows as we grow. In this rich, diverse workplace, we encourage innovative ideas. We support you to find deep meaning and purpose so that you can be proud of what you do and where you work. Visit www.humber.ca for more information.  Statistician and Research Analyst Role Profile Under the direction of the Associate Director, Institutional Research, the Statistician and Research Analyst will independently perform a wide variety of statistical and analytical functions to support College leadership and evidence-based decision-making, including data-mining, statistical analyses, statistical modelling, analyzing data for short-range and long-range planning and supporting institutional data stewardship processes. The incumbent will have extensive experience in the use of statistical software and performing of data mining strategies; they will be creative and nimble with the ability to rapidly learn new technologies and data sets.   Qualifications The successful candidate will possess a Master's Degree in Mathematics, Statistics or a similar field in addition to three years relevant experience in the use of statistical software such as R, SAS, and SPSS. Experience in the use of visual analytics platform such as Tableau is an asset. The incumbent will have a minimum of three years of practical work related experience. Additionally, the incumbent will possess strong verbal and written communication skills; a demonstrated ability to work professionally in a team environment; and ensure confidentiality of information.  We thank all applicants for their interest in this position. Only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. Consideration for Support Staff and Academic positions will be given to internal employees in accordance with the respective collective agreements. Humber is committed to a workforce that reflects the diversity of our students and our city. We actively seek qualified individuals from equity seeking groups with demonstrated skills and knowledge to deal with all aspects of equity, diversity and inclusion in a post-secondary environment. Humber College is committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process, in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Our HR Generalists will work with applicants requesting accommodations at any stage of the hiring process. This document is available in alternate formats upon request. jobdescription.186: Business Analyst As Canada’s largest provider of integrated community healthcare services, CBI Health Group is dedicated to improving the health and enriching the lives of Canadians. What sets us apart is our ability to work as a unified network dedicated to the ongoing learning that allows us to foster best practices, improve access to care and create better results for our patients. CBI is uniquely positioned to support the evolving health needs of Canadians through its 13,000 clinical and administrative staff in 250 facilities and over 100 transitional/residential homes across 800 communities. Corporate IT within CBI Health Group plays a key role in ensuring that we have the application systems in place to enable all end users – from care providers to support staff – to perform their duties effectively and, ultimately, ensure the delivery of excellent patient care. The Business Analyst gathers, analyzes and documents all business requirements related to CBI Health Group’s development initiatives. The Business Analyst works directly with key stakeholders to understand the needs and work with members of the solution development team to transform the requirements into actionable solutions. CBI Health Group Business Analysts produce and support the development of Business Case documents, change request documents (CRD), Business process workflows (BPW), data flow diagrams (DFD), and business requirements documents (BRD). These artifacts are the foundations for solution discovery and development and are used to validate and manage the implementation. Take an inside look at what you’ll do each day Elicit and document business requirements by engaging the right stakeholders with appropriate requirement gathering techniques; Analyze, model and communicate business requirements. Depending on the nature of the work, the following may be documented and analyzed as needed: Scope of problem, opportunities, risks, constraints, goals, objectives, strategies and needs of stakeholders, functional and non-functional requirements, future considerations. Breakdown complex business problems using diagrams that best fits the nature of the problem (e.g. DFDs, swimlanes, workflows, etc.); Identify and document business needs from different perspectives (e.g. technology, people, process, data, report, application, etc.); Communicate and obtain consensus from stakeholders on requirements; Work closely with stakeholders and business units to develop business cases in support of the business requirements; Maintain quality documentation throughout the requirement lifecycle. This includes updating artifacts during and after work or project is closed; Assist in identifying solutions across organization with development and architecture teams; Assist in the assessment, qualification and validation of the proposed solutions and bring alignment with business needs and requirements; Liaise and communicate requirements and expectations with the appropriate testing stakeholders to deliver quality business solutions; Work with the business and system integration team, devise test plans and utilize best testing approaches when necessary; Ensure the appropriate stakeholders address all issues discovered during testing; Communicate changes in deliverables to appropriate stakeholders because of testing; Ensure implementation teams and training teams are aware of release and application updates; Work in unison with training team to develop release notes to communicate changes to users; Liaise with implementation team, training team and business to ensure adequate scheduling for any rollout; Collaborate with change management personnel to devise rollout strategies and assess adoption readiness of business in anticipation of software and/or process changes; Maintain and promote best business analysis practices within CBI Health Group. Here’s what you’ll need to be successful 3-5 years of experience in a Business Analyst role; Experience with Electronic Medical Record (EMR) an asset; Excellent verbal and written communications; Detail oriented when documenting information and decisions; Experience using various techniques for eliciting requirements; Applies critical thinking to evaluate potential change requests and needs; Ability to grasp and understand complex problems and re-engineer business processes; Ability to explain and simplify complex business problems in layman’s terms; Understand the Project lifecycle and project approaches; Understanding of project definition and scoping principles; Understanding change control processes in relation to requirements documentation; Ability to effectively identify and document project risks, issues, assumptions and dependencies; Experience using various requirement prioritizing techniques; Ability to use BA mock-up tools such (ex. MS Visio); Communicate with tact and able to negotiate and resolve conflicts. Join us at CBI Health Group – where working together makes great things happen. To learn more about CBI, please visit www.cbi.ca Check out CBI on Facebook at facebook.com/cbihealthgroup and on Twitter at twitter.com/cbihealthgroup In accordance with the Human Rights Code, Accessibility for individuals with Disabilities Act and CBI Policies on Accommodation, a request for accommodation will be accepted as part of our hiring process. Please inform your recruiter if you have any accommodation requests.
jobdescription.187: Junior Business Analyst - Digital Solutions On behalf of our client in the Banking Sector, PROCOM is looking for a Junior Business Analyst - Digital Solutions. Junior Business Analyst - Digital Solutions – Job Description Facilitating requirements gathering with stakeholders Analyzing the user needs and finding the solutions to address them Creating the requirements in the form of user stories with appropriate acceptance criteria If in case the user stories have been already created by the product owner (with acceptance criteria), then reviewing them to make sure that every business rule is covered, and the acceptance criteria meet the user story functionality Grooming the product backlog based on the prioritization provided by the product owner Working with the product owner and the stakeholders to understand the scope, suggest improvements to the requirements, etc. Preparing documents like process flows, user journeys, data maps Reviewing data feeds and mapping data to existing formats and / or working with technology team to define new data formats Test developed outcomes to ensure it meets the requirements both for functional and business acceptance Utilizing, building & testing API based services  Junior Business Analyst - Digital Solutions – Mandatory Skills 1-4 years’ experience in Financial Services, preferably in Wealth Management (Mutual Fund or ETF space) 0-4 years’ experience as a Business Analyst Bachelor’s degree specialization in Business, Finance, Engineering, Math or Sciences is ideal Strong understanding of Financial Products and associated data (performance, asset mix etc.)  Junior Business Analyst - Digital Solutions – Nice to Have Skills Experience in Data Analytics and Reporting Business Analyst designation Experience in software development (web, desktop, mobile and / or downloadable application) Previous experience in an Agile work environment (writing stories, agile practices) Previous experience with APIs (understanding or and ability to work with JSON structured data)  Junior Business Analyst - Digital Solutions - Assignment Start Date ASAP – 6 months to start Junior Business Analyst - Digital Solutions - Assignment Location Toronto, ON – Work Remotely
jobdescription.188: Reporting to the Director, Technology Platform Design & Management, the Workday Business Systems Analyst/ Testing Lead will act as a technical lead for the Workday platform and will support the implementation of Workday. The incumbent is responsible for ensuring the implementation of Workday drives business alignment, maximizes business performance and optimizes user experience. As a key member of the Workday deployment engagement team, the role is also responsible for developing and deploying a Workday testing strategy and plan. The incumbent will maintain an extremely high level of confidentiality. Key Job Responsibilities Business Systems Analyst: Lead the platform experience and work with business groups to elicit, and review requirements. Analyze and translate the business requirements into functional requirements for multiple platforms, always keeping in mind the optimal user experience. Monitor the efficiency and compliance of day-to-day business support with processes, requirements, and criteria; focus on developing business-sound technical solutions such that the day-to-day business support is improved Liaison between IT and business teams to facilitate the development and implementation of process improvement and strategic plans Coordinate various technical and business groups in the development of a technical solution, the effort and duration that will be required to deliver the solution and ensure the appropriate level of testing is planned for and executed before the solution is implemented in production Testing & QA: Lead the development and provide input on the maintenance of an effective QA process within the software group from a technical perspective; provide input on strategies, environment requirements and accurate effort estimates for related QA activities Create QA and UAT test plan and test cases for highly complex functions and execute and verify those test cases as part of the overall testing cycle; analyze, test, document, and verify system change requests (defects, enhancements, new features etc.) Recommend solutions to specific technical / business problems and improvements / changes to processes as and when relevant from a QA perspective Provide technical QA consultation to internal and external development and support teams on solutions to problems discovered during testing Lead and champion the integrated testing methodology and framework Coordinate QA and UAT on execution, report, resource, and application requirements Review and provide guidance to test team members (both internal and external) on QA and UAT test deliverables Education, Designations & Qualifications Bachelor's degree required; or equivalent work experience Minimum 3 years of experience working in a BSA and QA role supporting Human Resources applications Fully proficient in reviewing, analyzing, writing, and maintaining documentation with an emphasis on problem solving and multi-disciplinary coordination and leveraging business data analytics Full proficiency in QA process, best practices, methodologies, Software Development Life Cycle, manual testing and defect management tools Ability to collaborate and deliver results cross-functionally. Highly proficient in engaging/influencing audiences, building relationships, to achieve broader organizational goals. Experience in Workday implementation is an asset
jobdescription.189: Data Analyst (Python) Missisauga, ON  Why We Need You – The Mission  ATP is a global information services and software company that exists to make flying safer and more reliable. Our products help reduce operating costs, improve aircraft reliability, and supports technical knowledge sharing and collaboration within the general and business aviation, military/defense, commercial aviation, and OEM industries. We have deployed solutions for multiple Fortune 100 companies, supporting more than 75,000 aircraft maintenance professionals worldwide. As a global company, ATP has more than 7,500 customers in 137 countries, with nearly 50 years of experience in the information services and software industries. The ChronicX product provides an innovative approach for detecting and managing recurring defects. ChronicX identifies, consolidates, and ranks recurring and potential chronic defects across aircraft fleets, regardless of the aircraft. It is currently in use on 25% of the world’s commercial airline fleet. The ideal candidate will be responsible for working with customers' IT departments to implement data feeds from their existing systems and to cleanse those data feeds for use with our product – which performs knowledge extraction from these data feeds using a variety of Natural Language Processing algorithms backed by general, industry-specific, and customer-specific dictionaries and word lists. The successful candidate will manage and adjust these dictionaries to tweak algorithm performance and eliminate missed incidents and false positives.  What You’ll Accomplish - Your Performance Objectives Performance Objective #1: Within your first 30 days, work with ChronicX senior analyst to build a solid understanding of the data sets required for onboarding and maintaining customers. Work with the customer’s IT department to implement data integration with their existing systems and to cleanse those data feeds for use with ChronicX Learn (or apply existing knowledge of) SQL and Python programming to write and maintain data processing and cleansing scripts used during customer data import into CX Work on deployment procedures of our products to the customers Perform data analysis on large and technical datasets Performance Objective #2 Within your first 6 months, successfully onboard new customers while maintaining current customers through monitoring and support. Perform ongoing application data monitoring and analysis for proactive customer support Identify and resolve incidents through ticketing system and provide business support Work with and attend status meetings with ChronicX customers to support users and identify possible improvements to their instances  Performance Objective #3 Within your first 12 months, innovate and improve current business processes and configurations. Provide suggestions for product improvement to the ChronicX development team, supporting continuous improvement and optimization of the onboarding toolset used by analysts and the ChronicX algorithms. Manage and adjust configurations for ChronicX to tweak algorithm performance and eliminate missed incidents and false positives Data analysis and development to support the setup, deployment, evaluation, and customization, and go-live of SaaS web application Consult and influence design of business processes. Identify process improvements. i.e. customer training, customer experience and customer support. Who We’re Looking For - The Personal Competencies That Matter  Technical Skills: You have experience working in Python  You have experience with s/FTP, AWS and SaaS web applications You have experience with SQL relational databases and capable of writing SQL statements and procedures You have good understanding of data gathering, processing and validation You have experience with data modeling and good understanding of big data engineering You have experience with Jira and Confluence You have knowledge of Java and an understanding for debugging You have experience or interest in Natural Language processing (Regular Expressions), text data processing and machine learning technologies. Interpersonal Skills: Success in this role requires excellent analytical abilities with a keen eye for details to easily identify errors. You should have a technical competency to identify, investigate and resolve complex, technical issues. You must thrive in working in a fast paced environment and have a proven history of delivering top tier customer service. A successful candidate is a team player who has a strong sense of ownership and accountability for their work.  Project Management & Organizational Planning: The best candidate will have excellent project and time management skills. You do exceptionally well at multitasking and juggling several tasks at once. You will be responsible for maintaining and prioritizing your own queue, so you must excel at planning, executing and closing all projects on or before deadlines.  How we work – The Core Values that Define Our Culture  We are at our best when we: are selfless team players. We work together to achieve our goals and we put the team ahead of ourselves.are driven to succeed exceed. We take pride in our work and in exceeding expectations.find a better way. By seeking to understand the challenge, we work to improve the process and solution.are simplifiers (not complicators). We focus on solutions and not obstacles. We take action and ownership. We gather the right people in the room and drive to a solution.
jobdescription.190: Key Responsibilities Analytics & Analysis Analyze historical transactional data to provide insights to support planning and forecast process. Prepares the annual Plan and forecasts for Payments. Timely preparation of monthly variance reporting that compares detailed actuals to Plan and latest approved forecast. Support in completing assessment of metrics to be reported on that adds value and payment insights. Preparation of monthly payment reports. Analyzes, prepares and presents scheduled reports (i.e. key business performance indicators, dashboards and scorecards) and ad hoc reports (i.e. in support of projects or departmental initiatives). Respond accurately and in a timely manner to ad hoc requests for data analysis and reports. Acts as the analytics lead for Payments on internal and enterprise initiatives. Ensures the Payments leadership has the necessary data and information for ongoing daily operations and strategic planning. Contribute to the design and testing of new analytical capabilities and reports generated from our data warehouse. Filters and cleans data by reviewing reports, extracts and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems. Locates and defines new process improvement and automated reporting opportunities. Projects, Initiatives & Support Coordinates the acquisition of data from various, relevant data sources and applies analytical skills to convert data into meaningful information & insights. Establishes strong communication among Payment team members to determine and meet their reporting and analytical needs. Present reporting output in a concise and compelling manner, interpreting insights in a meaningful way. Provide analysis in support of business decisions that are member-centric, cost effective and revenue driven. Research emerging trends / best practices in the industry to determine implications of proposed payment solutions and analytics. Keep current with internal Meridian and external partner/vendor/association system changes and/or projects that may have a direct or indirect impact on payments. Leverage ongoing analysis regarding Payments key performance indicators / metrics to highlight trends and support recommendations that will enhance existing systems, processes and / or products and services. Leadership & Relationship Management Maintain a high level of communication with Payments Specialists to deliver quality support and meet service standards Proactively support and work with external partners: provide/receive/review reporting, ensure process changes are implemented and research additional services available to improve efficiency within the Payments team. Support Payments Specialists with the annual department operating plans, budgets, tracking, variance reporting and reforecasting. Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities 3-5 years of experience in Excel using Power Query and Power Pivot Strong experience using Power BI for data modeling and reporting Understanding of common data requirements within multiple systems environment. Understands the impact of the data models across many functions and departments. Experience in data architecture, data warehousing, enterprise information integration and SQL programming language. Advanced level MS Suite of products Exhibits an analytical, creative, and innovative approach to meeting stakeholder and business needs Excellent communication skills. Proven ability to work autonomously in cross-functional teams, with internal customers and key stakeholders. Initiative, ability to manage competing priorities and attention to detail are critical. Ability to leverage technology to streamline processes tools and analysis. Education, Designations, Training, and Experience A bachelor's degree with a quantitative focus in an applied context (e.g. applied mathematics, economics, engineering or business 3-5 years of relevant working experience in financial services Payment experience with the following products and services is an asset: ATM Debit Cards Interac e-Transfers Cheques Wires Bill Payments AFT Proven experience analyzing, preparing, presenting reports, and business cases (i.e. key business performance indicators, dashboards and scorecards) and ad hoc reports (i.e. in support of projects or departmental initiatives). Experience the Difference! Thank you for your interest in Meridian Credit Union. Please note that due to the volume of applications, only those under consideration will be contacted for an interview. Meridian is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities. Should you require an accommodation, we will partner with you to meet your needs. Follow us on Twitter at @MeridianCareers Connect with us on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/meridian-credit-union/ Education Preferred Masters or better in Business Administration Bachelors or better in Engineering Bachelors or better in Mathematics (All) Bachelors or better in Business Behaviors Preferred Leader: Inspires teammates to follow them Thought Provoking: Capable of making others think deeply on a subject Team Player: Works well as a member of a group Loyal: Shows firm and constant support to a cause Innovative: Consistently introduces new ideas and demonstrates original thinking Enthusiastic: Shows intense and eager enjoyment and interest Detail Oriented: Capable of carrying out a given task with all details necessary to get the task done well Dedicated: Devoted to a task or purpose with loyalty or integrity Motivations Preferred Self-Starter: Inspired to perform without outside help Growth Opportunities: Inspired to perform well by the chance to take on more responsibility Flexibility: Inspired to perform well when granted the ability to set your own schedule and goals Entrepreneurial Spirit: Inspired to perform well by an ability to drive new ventures within the business Ability to Make an Impact: Inspired to perform well by the ability to contribute to the success of a project or the organization
jobdescription.193: At the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, we are working to create a world without disease. Transforming lives by finding new and better ways to prevent, intercept, treat and cure disease inspires us. We bring together the best minds and pursue the most promising science. We are Janssen. We collaborate with the world for the health of everyone in it. Learn more at www.janssen.com and follow us @JanssenGlobal. Janssen Inc. is part of the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies. Digital & Data Science is one of the critical capability levers within our J&J Supply Chain’s Strategy, Innovation & Deployment (SI&D) innovation engine that is essential to building the world’s best supply chain. As our Digital & Data Science team continues to double-down on fact-based management – illuminating greater visibility and analytical capabilities across the key metrics that will drive growth for our business – we must ensure that our energy, resources, capabilities and talented employees are best-aligned to the evolving needs of our business and our customers. The Data Operations team sits within the Digital & Data Science organization with specific accountabilities related to Master Data Management in our global ERP systems, to enable the effective execution of the Supply Chain business activities. Our role is to deliver trusted data to enable the launch & supply of products to our customers. Our key accountabilities include: delivering and maintaining a data operating model that ensures adequate governance that optimizes data quality, timeliness, and effort; applying end-to-end data knowledge and unique insights to drive innovative customer solutions; building scalable partnerships with suppliers to be adaptable to changing needs and demands; utilizing technology to drive innovative data operations solutions; and developing our talent as a distinctive capability. This position will monitor and execute day-to-day operations to support the strategy of the Data Operations function across franchises/business units. Will lead small projects. Will develop solutions to a variety of problems of moderate to fairly intricate scope and complexity, while referring to established policies and procedures. Responsibilities: Monitor and execute the data operations and data quality process. May include coordination of testing, error handling, data conversion and/or validation, and audit/compliance actions (Non-Conformance (NC) and/or Corrective Action Preventive Action (CAPA)). Provide tactical direction to third party team(s) and function as first level escalation. Continuous improvement of existing data design, process and templates by tactically focusing on business outcomes. Implement and monitor tools and processes that maximize data operations execution. Engage with stakeholders on tactical matters. Function as Subject Matter Expert/Data Governance Lead for workstream or functional area. Provide appropriate guidance on data operations. May include completion of complex change assessments and/or project scoping requirements, point of escalation for both internal and external team members, single point of contact for strategic launches and audit/compliance activities, participate in and sometimes lead operational meetings with data owners. Prepare metrics, dashboards, and tracking to facilitate the efficient operations of the Data Operations department. May execute budget and/or value capture protocol within established framework Participate in, and sometimes lead, operational and governance meetings which may include end-to-end, value capture, and third party reviews. Contribute to the creation and maintenance of documentation for area of responsibility. May include Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), Work Instructions (WIs), protocols, data quality catalogs, and other policy and procedure documents. Develop and deliver training to educate stakeholders on documented procedures, data flows, etc. Support the deployment of the Data Management Framework (Governance Maturity Roadmap).  Qualifications  A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience. 4 years of relevant professional business experience along with a minimum of 4 years of data management experience in the context of large ERP platforms is required. Supply chain experience, preferably in master data, operations, or cross-functional business environment. Business and technical knowledge and understanding of all Supply Chain data elements, process, and organizational support models. (E.g. SAP and/or JDE, Winshuttle, Data Quality). A relevant mix of global, regional, cross-sector/industry experience. MS Office Suite (Excel, Outlook, Word). Strong written, oral, and presentation skills. Excellent organizational and prioritization skills. Ability to build strong collaborative relationships, influence multiple stakeholders, and establish common goals and objectives without sacrificing outcomes. Ability to contribute on a diverse, multicultural and remote team. Ability to work in a matrix environment where priorities change rapidly, and tight deadlines exist. This position may require up to 5% of domestic and international (US) travel. Diversity and inclusion are central elements of the shared culture across the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies. Attracting, developing and retaining a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities is essential to our success. We are committed to providing a respectful, inclusive and accessible work environment where all employees have the opportunity to achieve their potential.  Primary Location Canada-Ontario-Markham-200 Whitehall Drive Other Locations United States-Massachusetts-Raynham, United States-New Jersey-Piscataway, United States-Pennsylvania-West Chester, Canada-Ontario-Markham, Canada-Ontario-Toronto, Canada-Ontario-Guelph Organization Janssen Inc. (7710) Job Function Operations Requisition ID 2105903113W

jobdescription.195: Employment Opportunity Business Systems Analyst (1 Year Contract)  TO Live  Toronto, Canada   TO Live has an opportunity in the Information Technology Department for an enthusiastic, organized, and resourceful team player who thrives in a fast-paced environment. Reporting to the Director of Information Technology, the Business Systems Analyst will be responsible for analyzing and studying new and existing technology systems and solutions. This position will also involve working with other departments to determine their future and current software, data, reporting and hardware requirements. A key responsibility for this position will be to provide recommendations to management regarding technology systems as they are analyzed and implemented, and how they relate to overall Information Technology lifecycle expenditures. The Business Systems Analyst will also be required to create detailed documentation, workflows, and flowcharts for both new and existing technology systems.   ACTIVITIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES  Analyze software solutions regarding current business requirements: Foundation Customer Relationship Management Foundation Financials Financial Forecasting and Budgeting Microsoft Office Azure and Intune Microsoft SharePoint Cloud Storage Archives Digitization Project coordination for implementing new systems, existing system changes and/or enhancements. Analyze and evaluate current systems to identify and suggest solutions for process improvements. Maintain existing applications and databases with appropriate patches and security updates. Assist with implementation of the infrastructure lifecycle. Conduct and implement training sessions related to application changes, new software implementations, and business requirements. Proactively collect information that may turn into future projects. Perform introduction and information sessions for users regarding software and equipment use, policies and procedures. Research and address user needs by creating and/or enhancing processes and reports where required that improve user experiences and optimize expenses. Attend educational events and stay up to date with the latest technology and best practices. Backup support as required for days off and/or vacation coverage. Perform other duties as assigned by the Director of Information Technology.   JOB SPECIFICATIONS  Experience working with analyzing and implementing complex and cross-department information technology initiatives. Minimum 7 years of experience in a similar position within Information Technology. Fluent understanding of Information Technology terminology. Fluent understanding of Microsoft Windows Server, Hyper-V and VMware. Fluent understanding of Microsoft Office 365. Strong understanding of ticketing, fundraising, event, CRM and accounting processes. Diligent in training and development of training materials. Solid analytical skills and attention to detail. Ability to work under strict deadlines. Ability to work with cross-functional teams. Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously.   WORKING CONDITIONS  Flexibility in hours and schedules and includes work on nights and weekends as required. Lack of natural light in workplace. Travel between all three TO Live venues as required.   THE ORGANIZATION: TO Live is one of Canada’s largest multi-arts organizations, operating three iconic venues: Meridian Hall (formerly the Sony Centre for the Performing Arts), the St. Lawrence Centre for the Arts and Meridian Arts Centre (formerly the Toronto Centre for the Arts). In addition, TO Live presents a full range of performing arts, theatrical and concert events at these venues in both downtown and uptown Toronto. With these two hubs of creativity and content creation, TO Live has a unique place and perspective to activate creative spaces by inspiring local and international artists, connect audiences and to be the nexus for new ideas, elevate artistic potential, and be the catalyst for creative expression that is reflective of Toronto’s diversity. HOW TO APPLY: Interested applicants should apply through our TO Live careers website at: https://tolive.bamboohr.com/jobs/   No phone calls please. TO Live thanks all applicants in advance. Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.   Together with the Toronto Public Service’s (TPS) initiatives, which TO Lives follows and adheres too, TO Live encourages applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized persons/persons of colour, persons with disabilities, women, LGBTQ2S persons, and others who may contribute to fostering innovative ideas and solutions. We ask that you complete the questions provided as part of the online application to assist us in ensuring our recruitment process and programs are equitable and accessible. Your responses are voluntary and the information that you provide is strictly confidential. We are committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes and a work environment in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). The Human Resources department will work with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of the hiring process.   Date Posted: March 9, 2021  Application Deadline: March 23, 2021  Start Date: ASAP
jobdescription.196: Wattpad is a global multiplatform entertainment company whose vision is to entertain and connect the world through stories. Since 2006, we’ve been on a mission to use the power of community and technology to unleash the full potential of stories to the world. Every month 90 million people around the world spend over 23 billion minutes on Wattpad to share and discover stories they can’t find anywhere else. Our brand banner includes: Wattpad, Tap by Wattpad, Wattpad Labs, Wattpad Studios, Wattpad Books and Wattpad Brand Partnerships. We’re proudly based in Toronto, but our reach is global. Come build the future of entertainment and storytelling, and write your next chapter with us! We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our growing Analytics Practice. The Practice’s main focus is to support all of Wattpad's business units and product squads, from building ad-hoc reporting to metrics creation to forecasting and predictive insights projects. The goal is to advocate for and facilitate data-informed decision-making throughout the organization. In this newly created role, you will need to wear many hats: data miner, analyst, and consultant. Data is critical to how we make content decisions at Wattpad and you will play a key role in helping Wattpad continue to scale! What you'll be doing: Work cross-functionally across the company, helping make sense of our data Develop new and existing KPIs/metrics to help us ensure we know the potential costs and benefits of our decisions Ensure your insights and recommendations are supported by and arrived at through the use of robust statistical methods Define and deliver independent research projects that you think would be beneficial to businesses across Wattpad Extract and analyze complex information from a variety of databases and transform data from large datasets into insights suitable for various audiences Liaise with business leads across Wattpad teams regarding key learnings and their business applications, taking our technical insights (and problems) and condensing them into an understandable format As a part of the Analytics Practice you will work with other analysts to understand how analytics can best be applied at Wattpad, including best practices, recommendations on tools and technology What we're looking for: 2-5+ years working in a data analyst, business analyst, operational analyst, or related analyst role, working in a rigorous data-driven environment or experience grown in a start-up or technology company Experience with statistical modelling, operational modelling, forecasting, and A/B/N testing Functional, hands-on experience with SQL and Python, in a production environment Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills; you’ll be working with different teams to help answer questions, so it is crucial you can communicate your work to multiple stakeholders You take initiative and find creative and scalable ways to solve problems You can deliver, especially under pressure, multi-tasking and meeting challenging deadlines, all while upholding a high degree of quality University degree in Economics, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field preferred Bonus Points: Previous experience with experimental design, Bayesian inference and ways of refining complex priors is a plus (e.g. Experience with Markov Chain Monte Carlo methods) What we offer: Competitive salary Career development; we believe in mentorship and supporting you to achieve your goals Health benefits, fully covered on us! RRSP Contributions Generous vacation and Parental Leave Top-up $200/month Transit and Home Office Allowance, choice of hardware, flexible hours, hybrid office and remote work options Corporate discount for gym membership for you and your family A beautiful office in downtown Toronto, with easy access to transit And a whole lot more! **Update: Wattpad is still actively hiring for this role! We are a robust and growing business; our search for new talent continues.** Due to the current state with COVID-19, Wattpad will conduct all interviews in a distributed manner using applicable third party software where needed and using visual interface tools such as Google Hangouts and Zoom. Our intention is to respect everybody's need for safety and adherence to social distancing. We also want to respect our team's personal needs and capacity for professional commitments during this time; consequently our pace for the interviewing process might be impacted. About Wattpad Who are we? Entrepreneurs and Do-ers. Our vision is to entertain and connect the world through stories, and our mission is to use the power of community and technology to unleash the full potential of stories to the world. What does that mean? We are visionaries, community builders, passionate problem solvers, storytellers, coffee snobs (tea drinkers, too!), curious by nature, and culturally diverse. What are we obsessed with? Our users. Solving complex problems and maximizing flow. Learning constantly. Building the next great storytelling product. Finding the greatest stories ever told. Dogs (and cats), coffee, and good snacks. How do we work? Autonomously, collaboratively, respectfully. Balancing with work, family, and play...and all while having a great time. Culture and Diversity Wattpad is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate. Period. Wattpad welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. We have taken a leadership position on creating a culture and an organization that truly values diversity. We are committed to fostering a global team that reflects the diversity of the Wattpad community. At Wattpad, we believe cultural fit doesn’t mean culturally identical, and diversity of thought helps us to challenge one another to think big and think differently. We consider employment applicants without regard to age, race, colour, national origin, citizenship, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status, marital status, disability status or any other protected status. If you have any special needs or accessibility requirements, please let us know. We will do our utmost to accommodate, in accordance with applicable local legislation.
jobdescription.197: About Oanda  OANDA Corporation is an innovator in computer engineering and financial modeling that provides Internet-based forex trading and currency information services to everyone, from individuals to large corporations; portfolio managers to financial institutions. We are a market maker and a trusted source for currency data with one of the world's largest historical, high frequency, filtered currency databases. We move billions of dollars a day (10 times more money than Paypal!!) in a market with daily capitalization of $4 trillion, dwarfing both the US bond and equity markets!! We continue to experience tremendous growth since our start in 1996, providing unprecedented opportunities for our employees to redefine the forex market with new products we create.  Who we are:  We are an international Product team consisting of product managers and business analysts, who work on a variety of Oanda customer services and business processes. The finance technology area is moving faster than ever before and we are looking for a passionate and experienced colleague to join us.  What you’ll do  Collect project requirements from both internal teams / outsourcing partners and translate these into detailed functional specifications, concrete deliverables, user stories and test plans. Evaluate and document processes and workflows Document relationships with 3rd party partners ensuring commercials and services are clearly defined and understood. Provide insight into and implement optimizations to operational best-practices related to customer facing products and services, client revenue and performance, internal processes, and regulatory compliance Create and maintain system and user documentation Perform system and user acceptance testing Conducts training sessions, software demonstrations and launch activities as new features and processes are introduced Act as a bridge between our development and business teams. Build, refine and maintain product backlogs while working closely with product management to define priorities. Collaborate with cross functional team resources in delivering work in a lean way that builds trust, ownership and accountability.  Who you are  Self-motivated and results-oriented. Excellent communicator and team player Capable of making experiment-tested and data-validated conclusions Demonstrable evidence of analyzing and documenting complex business processes. Continuous improvement and change management mindset, questioning conventional wisdom and driving change to improve processes and client experience  Desired Skills & Experience  Solid experience working in a similar role Systems design and trouble-shooting skills. Working knowledge of Scrum and Agile methodologies and the proven ability to apply them effectively. Experience of integrating and working with 3rd party products and vendors Experience documenting and designing new processes and procedures in a dynamic environment. Degree in Business, Finance, Information Technology, or related experience.   OANDA Global Corporation is a diverse and global team with offices around the world. We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to OANDA. We are committed to creating and sustaining a collegial work environment in which all individuals are treated with dignity and respect and one which reflects the diversity of the community in which we operate. We provide an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. We will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.
jobdescription.198: At Rogers, we connect Canadians to a world of possibilities and the memorable moments that matter most in their lives. Every day we wake up with one purpose in mind. To bring loved ones together from across the globe. To connect people to each other and the world around them. To help an entrepreneur realize their dream. A sports fan celebrate a special moment.  Because we believe connections unite us, possibilities fuel us, and moments define us. As we grow our team, the well-being of our team members remains our top priority. To ensure the health and safety of our team members, including those in the recruitment process, our team members are temporarily working from home. Senior Analyst, Brand/Product Insights The Senior Analyst, Brand and Product Insights works as part of a team of market research professionals to support tracking and custom market research for various Rogers products. The Senior Analyst supports internal business leaders through the provision of customer and marketplace knowledge to ensure business strategies are grounded in consumer foresight. The Brand/Product Insights team is part of the Consumer Insights ‘Centre of Excellence’ within the organization; with team members acting as individual leads that support Rogers’s key brands and business units. What you will be doing: Consumer & Business Insights: Drive consumer insights through the integration of various customer data sources into custom research projects, including syndicated research, data & product analytics, customer experience, social media – to provide a comprehensive understanding of customer needs. Engage in compelling business story-telling and provide meaningful and actionable recommendations to senior leadership team based on insights. Drawing connections between research/data results to business priorities and initiatives Custom Research Design: Quantitative and qualitative research methods that will include various type of research including concept testing and new product development research, pricing/rate card research, understanding triggers and barriers, churn research (understanding triggers of churn and potential solutions) as well as brand and communication research. Project Management: Oversee day-to-day management of multiple simultaneous custom research projects. Manage multiple deadlines and priorities in a fast-paced environment Develop research plans to match business objectives outlining methodology, timing, deliverables Serve as in-house expert on custom research, including all methods of qualitative and quantitative research Assess each research initiative with a critical eye to ensure that it provides incremental learning, actionable insights and a positive customer and company benefit. Know when both to recommend research and when to recommend against research Understanding of effective research & sampling design and tradeoffs of various tactics, techniques and research supplier expertise Ability to manage a research budget and ensure that each project is maximizing value for money Market Research and Data Analysis Expertise: Market Research Study design: sampling strategy, feasibility assessment, questionnaire/screener/discussion guide development Comprehensive understanding and application of statistical analysis: significance testing, multivariate analysis, clustering, factor analysis, regression, etc. Data visualization: report development, dashboard development, data visualization tools and methods Proficiency in SPSS, R or Python as strong asset Relationship Management: Comfort working with and influencing senior level stakeholders and partners Build and maintain strong partnerships with business leaders to understand and influence business tactics and solutions by bringing the voice of the customer to the conversation Work well with cross-functional teams across the enterprise Proven relationship building skills and client interaction experience Leadership: High degree of self-awareness and impact on others Ability to influence others through combination of facts, intuition and common sense An effective listener who seeks to understand first and offers positive/flexible solutions to problems Is a team player and knows the importance of building a winning team and recognizing individual contributions Has a vision for where they want to go and can motivate and empower colleagues to achieve a goal What you have: Undergraduate degree required; Masters level preferred Degree in business, consumer behavior, market research or quantitative discipline (e.g. Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, etc.) 3+ years of experience in marketing research or data analytics Experience both on client and supplier side of market research preferred Solid business acumen Strong interpersonal skills for working with internal and external stakeholders Analytical skills and sound decision-making skills Ability to summarize issues and quickly solve problems Ability to adapt quickly in a highly competitive environment Dynamic, autonomous and customer-focused Excellent presentation and communication skills High proficiency with Microsoft Office (PowerPoint, Word, Excel), Outlook Schedule: Full time Shift: Day Length of Contract: Not Applicable (Regular Position) Work Location: 333 Bloor Street East (012), Toronto, ON Travel Requirements: Up to 10% Posting Category/Function: Marketing & Marketing Research / Analysis Requisition ID: 214444  Together, we'll make more possible, and these six shared values guide and define our work:  Our people are at the heart of our success Our customers come first. They inspire everything we do We do what’s right, each and every day We believe in the power of new ideas We work as one team, with one vision We give back to our communities and protect our environment What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. We work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You matter to us! For any questions, please visit the Rogers FAQ.  Posting Notes: Marketing
