jobdescription.200: HENKEL IS FOR THOSE WHO STEP UP. DO YOU? At Henkel, you can make a difference and craft your career. That’s why you own your projects and take full responsibility from an early stage. Our unique brands in markets around the world open up countless opportunities to follow your convictions and explore new paths. If you have an entrepreneurial mindset that allows you to always think out of the box - take the chance and shape the digital future together with us. YOUR ROLE Position Purpose: The CPFR Analyst position will be responsible for partnering with Sales, Demand Planning, Logistics and Walmart Replenishment, utilizing data analysis and collaborative relationships to provide forecast insights and replenishment solutions to deliver both customer and Henkel KPIs.  Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Collaborate with Walmart replenishment, Sales & Demand Planning on store level and GRS (top line) forecasts. Monitor daily/weekly in-stock. Determine root cause for in-stock issue and provide store level recommendations to correct. Proactively identify sales trends and provide forecast adjustments to maintain availability & WOS targets Monitor Walmart ordering patterns (review orders daily), in-stock/out of stock, fill rate, on-time delivery, returns, mis-ship & lead time review. Align any inventory recommendations with demand/supply chain team on any additional demand of product resulting from promotional inventory YOUR SKILLS College degree in Business, Supply Chain Management, Logistics or related discipline, or equivalent education and experience Exceptional analytical and decision-making skills 5+ years’ experience in a consumer product environment Retail Link and SAP experience preferred
jobdescription.201: Full-time, Calgary, AB or Toronto, ON  Be Boring. Make Money.™ is our investment approach, but we are anything but dull. We are a diverse team of professionals—all with a shared goal: to be the best.  We celebrate our unique and independent culture. We take pride in doing things a little differently than other investment firms. Our pursuit for excellence means that a career with Mawer is demanding; however, interesting challenges are plentiful, and innovative ideas, diverse opinions, and teamwork are expected and rewarded regardless of title and tenure.  The Opportunity The Firm is seeking an Analyst, Institutional Portfolio Management to support senior members of the Institutional Client Management team and respond to requests for proposal (RFPs) from institutional prospects located in both Canada and the U.S.  This position reports to the Director of Institutional Client Management.  Primary Responsibilities Support Institutional Portfolio Managers with client and consultant requests for informationPrepare presentations, related materials, and competitive intelligence research for finalists and other prospective meetingsLead and execute complex client deliverables, including performance reports, due diligence requests, and other portfolio analysisRespond to RFIs and RFPs from consultants and other institutional prospective clients located in Canada and the U.S.Liaise with internal investment professionals to ensure a detailed understanding of the firm’s investment processes and products to maintain accurate and relevant external responsesGenerate and design competitive intelligence reports and make appropriate recommendations to drive business decisionsDevelop and maintain reports in Salesforce that report on Business Development progressUpdate Salesforce and maintain content related to new opportunities and sales activityUpdate and manage RFP content in our RFP database (RFPIO)Support the development and maintenance of marketing collateral for both Canadian and U.S prospectsMaintain marketing and consultant databases, such as eVestmentCommunicate externally with select business partners, clients, and consultantsSupport custom projects for both Canadian and U.S clientsPotentially participate in the production of performance attribution commentary and analysis for investment strategies sent to clients and prospectsPotentially participate in client meetings with Institutional Portfolio ManagersDrive continuous improvement across team processes and written content  Education, Skills & Qualifications University degreeCompletion of the Canadian Securities Course or other industry-related coursesMinimum 3 years of investment industry experience Exceptional communication skills, specifically writing Strong data analysis capabilitiesDetail-oriented Strong computer skills with proficiency in Microsoft Office, specifically Excel and PowerPointStrong time management and project management skills to meet deadlinesAbility to present candid feedback and suggestions to improve processesAbility to perform well under pressureWorks well in a team environmentKnowledge of the institutional investment industry would be an asset  Why Mawer? Directly contribute to the firm’s growth as a global investment manager. Learn and work alongside high-performing individuals, within a team that has consistently delivered exceptional long-term investment results and the highest levels of client satisfaction (our client retention is 99%). Be a part of a meritocracy in which the quality of ideas supersedes hierarchy. At Mawer, talented individuals can progress quickly, regardless of tenure or experience.We offer the potential for ownership over time based on the firm’s selection criteria.We have a unique culture, one that emphasizes integrity, clients’ interests, excellence, teamwork, and long-term thinking.  About Mawer Established in 1974, Mawer Investment Management Ltd. is an independent firm that provides world-class, global investment management services across all major asset classes to a broad range of institutional and individual clients. We are proud of our reputation as one of Canada’s most respected investment management firms and strive to earn such respect by continually delivering long-term investment excellence, developing strong client partnerships, and living our core values. Mawer currently manages approximately $78 billion in assets and employs over 200 people in Calgary, Toronto, the U.S., and Singapore.  Application Instructions Please submit your résumé and cover letter by March 7, 2021. Only applications that include all required materials will be considered.   No telephone inquiries please. We thank all applicants and advise that only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
jobdescription.202: Wattpad is a global multiplatform entertainment company whose vision is to entertain and connect the world through stories. Since 2006, we’ve been on a mission to use the power of community and technology to unleash the full potential of stories to the world. Every month 90 million people around the world spend over 23 billion minutes on Wattpad to share and discover stories they can’t find anywhere else. Our brand banner includes: Wattpad, Wattpad Labs, Wattpad Studios, Wattpad Books and Wattpad Brand Partnerships. We’re proudly based in Toronto, but our reach is global. Come build the future of entertainment and storytelling, and write your next chapter with us! At Wattpad, we have a massive scale and reach across our global users; this is what makes us unique. It’s been an exciting time of growth, change and development for Wattpad. We are expanding our analytics practice at Wattpad and are searching for a Data Analyst Team Lead. The Practice’s main focus is to support all of Wattpad's business units and product squads, from building ad-hoc reporting to metrics creation to forecasting and predictive insights projects. The goal is to advocate for and facilitate data-informed decision-making throughout the organization. What you'll be doing: Provide support and guidance to a driven, passionate and capable data Analytics team Manage and work closely with our Data Analysts on solving business problems and delivering value Plan, develop and scope large, impactful analytics projects in collaboration with the team and business partners Help guide and develop the processes and practices of the Analytics team to continuously improve our ability to deliver valuable insights Help shape the departmental vision and direction of the Analytics practice at Wattpad Promote and support the development of best practices, recommendations on tools and technology, and the overall technology evolution within the Analytics practice Liaise with business leads across Wattpad teams regarding key learnings and their business applications, taking our technical insights (and problems) and condensing them into a digestible, understandable format Extract and analyze complex information from a variety of databases and transform data from large datasets into insights suitable for various audiences What we're looking for: 5+ years’ of practical experience in a data oriented field, with established team leadership working in a rigorous data-driven environment or experience grown in a fast-paced start-up or technology company Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills; you’ll be providing you’ll also be working with different teams to help answer questions, so it is crucial you can communicate your work to multiple stakeholders Experience with statistical modelling, operational modelling, forecasting, and A/B/N testing, experimental design Functional, hands-on experience with SQL and Python, in a production environment You take initiative and find creative and scalable ways to solve problems You can deliver, especially under pressure, multi-tasking and meeting challenging deadlines, all while upholding a high degree of quality University degree in Economics, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field preferred Bonus points: Previous experience with Bayesian inference and ways of refining complex priors is a plus (e.g. Experience with Markov Chain Monte Carlo methods) Please submit a GitHub repo or Jupyter notebook from a project you’ve completed or worked on. Or, share a link to similar work. This can be from an academic or industry project. What we offer: Competitive salary Career development; we believe in mentorship and supporting you to achieve your goals Health benefits, fully covered on us! RRSP Contributions Generous vacation and Parental Leave Top-up $200/month Transit and Home Office Allowance, choice of hardware, flexible hours, hybrid office and remote work options Corporate discount for gym membership for you and your family A beautiful office in downtown Toronto, with easy access to transit And a whole lot more! **Update: Wattpad is still actively hiring for this role! We are a robust and growing business; our search for new talent continues.** Due to the current state with COVID-19, Wattpad will conduct all interviews in a distributed manner using applicable third party software where needed and using visual interface tools such as Google Hangouts and Zoom. Our intention is to respect everybody's need for safety and adherence to social distancing. We also want to respect our team's personal needs and capacity for professional commitments during this time; consequently our pace for the interviewing process might be impacted. About Wattpad Who are we? Entrepreneurs and Do-ers. Our vision is to entertain and connect the world through stories, and our mission is to use the power of community and technology to unleash the full potential of stories to the world. What does that mean? We are visionaries, community builders, passionate problem solvers, storytellers, coffee snobs (tea drinkers, too!), curious by nature, and culturally diverse. What are we obsessed with? Our users. Solving complex problems and maximizing flow. Learning constantly. Building the next great storytelling product. Finding the greatest stories ever told. Dogs (and cats), coffee, and good snacks. How do we work? Autonomously, collaboratively, respectfully. Balancing with work, family, and play...and all while having a great time. Culture and Diversity Wattpad is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate. Period. Wattpad welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. We have taken a leadership position on creating a culture and an organization that truly values diversity. We are committed to fostering a global team that reflects the diversity of the Wattpad community. At Wattpad, we believe cultural fit doesn’t mean culturally identical, and diversity of thought helps us to challenge one another to think big and think differently. We consider employment applicants without regard to age, race, colour, national origin, citizenship, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status, marital status, disability status or any other protected status. If you have any special needs or accessibility requirements, please let us know. We will do our utmost to accommodate, in accordance with applicable local legislation.

jobdescription.204: Adresse : 55 Bloor Street West Groupe de famille d'emploi : Analyses données et rapports Description The Channels Analyst is responsible for developing automated, scalable reporting and analytics solutions for Canadian P&BB. This position will support omni-channel analytics through delivery of reporting, insights and measurement in line with Enterprise strategy and Digital Acceleration. The incumbent will act as reporting and analytics subject matter expert for the Digital Channels portfolio while also supporting NACCC, combining both business and technology acumen to generate and maintain reporting in various forms (ad-hoc analyses, data visualization, self-serve BI). Specific Accountabilities Build Power BI Dashboards from scratch and maintain existing reporting Data curation – extracting data from multiple sources, manipulating and validation using database tools. Must have SAS, SQL skills and experience Identify, analyze and interprets trends of patterns in complex data set. Analyze data to drive business decisions and actionable recommendations Assimilate and analyze information from a variety of sources, make recommendations and present information in an easy and understandable manner Develop in-depth understanding of BMO data and systems (IDP, CAD, CDW, Adobe) Comfortable with ambiguity – self-learner able to independently navigate complex data Work proactively and collaboratively with key clients and stakeholders to continuously enhance reporting Quality check key deliverables, ensuring they are delivered accurately and to the highest quality Qualifications The ideal candidate will have the following: 3+ years experience in business intelligence/ ETL, analytics 3+ years experience in Finance industry Strong experience within data preparation, data analysis, and statistical tool sets including but not limited to SQL, SAS, R/Python Experience implementing data visualization (Power BI, Spotfire, Tableau) Strong logical thinking, analytical and problem solving skills; Willingness to learn and being curious; Ability to perform on multiple projects simultaneously and deliver under tight timelines Experience with BMO data and familiarity with BMO products and operations Requirements A university degree in mathematics, statistics, economics, econometrics, engineering, computer science, physics Ici, pour vous. À BMO, nous sommes animés par une raison d’être commune : Avoir le cran de faire une différence dans la vie, comme en affaires. Cette raison d’être nous invite à entraîner des changements positifs et durables pour nos clients, nos collectivités et nos gens. En travaillant ensemble, en innovant et en repoussant les limites, nous transformons des vies et des entreprises et favorisons la croissance économique partout dans le monde. En tant que membre de l'équipe de BMO, vous êtes valorisé, respecté et entendu, et vous avez plus de moyens pour progresser et obtenir des résultats. Nous vous offrirons les outils et les ressources dont vous avez besoin pour franchir de nouvelles étapes, car vous aidez nos clients à franchir les leurs. Au moyen de formation et de coaching approfondis ainsi que de soutien de la direction et d'occasions de réseautage, nous vous aiderons à acquérir une expérience enrichissante et à élargir votre groupe de compétences. Pour en savoir plus, visitez-nous à l'adresse https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/fr . BMO s'engage à offrir un milieu de travail inclusif, équitable et accessible. jobdescription.205: Description PURPOSE OF JOB The Dropship Merchandise Strategy and Operations Analyst supports the overall process involved in onboarding our online vendors. This position is responsible for effectively creating and maintaining all Dropship skus and supporting the onboarding of online vendors and skus from a merchandising lens. This involves communications with vendors for sku/cost information and content, plus coordination with the Customer Service Team responding to merchandising database and product issues. This individual will partner with the core Merchandising teams to leverage intelligence and help build the merchandising portfolio. PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Vendor and SKU Setup & Maintenance 65% Handles the overall onboarding of drop ship vendors to the website. This involves a strong partnership between the Merchandise and Digital teams who manage the website and back-end. This includes vendor on-boarding process including setup in Staples Commerce Hub, request of vendor number, UPS account and access to Staples Partners Website for domestic and cross-border vendorsFacilitate vendor migration from Staples Exchange to Commerce HubOn-board cross-border trade vendors, verify HS classifications with third party vendor and logistic team, upload and maintain CBT sku setup, HS code, Tariff Treatment and duty %.Collaborate with Staples Compliance Team, roll out Staples.ca Drop-ship Vendor Compliance Program to all vendors.Maintain Dropship Vendor Tracker which comprises various vendor info and terms.Maintain Vendor Information Sheet for all dropship vendors.Create SKU in AS400 and Sunrise manually or thru mass upload.Maintain SKU setup in AS400 and relevant Sunrise flags while communicating regularly with Merchandising teams for the assigned vendors/categories.Investigate and resolve online drop-ship out-of-stock issues with vendors and Merchandising teams.Upload changes to product cost and sku setup in AS400 as required.Handle sku/vendor inquiries from various sources including customer service, internal teams etc.Supports the Merchandise team in understanding processes involved in onboarding vendors.Vendor promotion - Excel dropship skus sell through by initiating cross-category promotions to increase exposure of new assortments and capture a greater value of customer wallet.Shipping audit - Conduct monthly UPS audits to closely monitor shipping expenses and net margin; propose recommendations to Merch for margin improvement and course of action to recoup loss money and avoid service being abused. Product & Vendor Research 15% Conducts research, gathers industry data and trends to assist assortment/vendor expansion and selection.Assists in making decisions about switching FC locations and location of product to maximize margin and customer experience.Supports the process involved in making changes to locations of product/vendor placement.Continuously look for opportunities for process improvement and efficiency, from our internal needs and the customer standpoint. Projects Participate in special projects as needed. Analytics Issue various Drop-ship reports with recommendation for improvement.Assists in making decisions based on metrics and sales opportunity to convert placement of products in our fulfillment centers (FC) network or using drop ship methods.Utilize data to drive insights to identify opportunities to better support our digital customer and grow sales.  Qualifications RECOMMENDED QUALIFICATIONS Knowledge / Skill Requirements: Strong communication and collaboration skills to work with a variety of teams and departments.Has a good understanding of both retail and online merchandising.Ability to handle multiple tasks, problem solving and managing to deliverable datesAdvanced skills in Microsoft Office Suite (specifically Excel, Outlook, Access, Word, PowerPoint, Power BI), SQL and VBA.Big Data Analytics - Ability to provide insights, and/or predict opportunities proactively by extracting information from the data lake into a digestible format.Ability to work in a fast-paced environment to support our transformation and transition to a data driven organization to better serve our customers.Experience with business intelligence/decision support softwareStrong oral/written communication and interpersonal skills, this is a highly collaborative role Experience: 2-4 years of background in merchandising, buying, replenishment, online merchandising or similar. Education: Post-Secondary education in business, retail management, inventory or supply chain management. PHYSICAL DEMANDS / WORKING CONDITIONS Office environment
jobdescription.206: As a leading mobile games developer, Jam City is looking to “level up” our talent for our Bingo team in Toronto. We’re on the hunt for innovators who consider themselves dynamic, collaborative and thrive in a fast-paced environment.  PERKS & BENEFITS Unlimited Vacation, Paid Sick Days & Holidays* 100% Employee Covered Medical, Dental, Vision Plan Base Plan* Life Insurance, RRSP matching, Flexible Spending Accounts & More* Catered Lunches & Well-stocked Kitchens Company Events such as movie night, pub night and more… You'll be equipped with a high-end laptop, monitor and mobile device Convenient location in downtown Toronto’s entertainment and technology districtOnly applies to full-time positions. ABOUT THE ROLE We’re currently looking for a passionate Senior Data Analyst who loves data and has a great mind for surfacing insightful visualizations of their research. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with some of the top creative and analytical talent in a highly profitable mobile game development studio with an array of perks and respect for employee quality of life and personal time. RESPONSIBILITIES Formulates and leads guided, multifaceted analytic studies against large volumes of data. Interprets and analyzes data using exploratory mathematic and statistical techniques based on the scientific method. Coordinates research and analytic activities utilizing various data points (unstructured and structured) and employ programming to clean, massage, and organize the data. Experiments against data points, provide information based on experiment results and provide previously undiscovered solutions to command data challenges. Work with business leaders to identify and define analytical requirements for teams and projects. Using multiple data sources, create reporting and performance monitoring tools and dashboards for end users. Understand and effectively communicate trends and analysis on user behavior, player segmentation, virality, and marketing campaigns. Continuously develop thorough analysis and conclusive insights that drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention, and monetization. Create regular presentations for GM and other team leads to discuss game performance and suggest improvements. QUALIFICATIONS Experience performing the above in a successful tech or game company. Bachelor degree in a business or quantitative discipline (Economics, Statistics) – Master’s preferred. 5+ years of experience analyzing very large, multi-dimensional data sets using SQL, excel, statistical software, etc. Strong quantitative skills, good working knowledge of advanced statistics and predictive modeling. Ability to communicate effectively and combine both technical and business perspectives. Demonstrated ability to use data to influence decision making and reach out to a broader audience. Ability to execute research projects, and generate practical results and recommendations. NICE TO HAVE Experience in top-tier consulting, venture capital, investment bank or social gaming. OUR COMMITMENT TO EQUITY, DIVERSITY, & INCLUSION We believe in creating games that unite people across the world and that showcase our commitment to providing an environment that is both inclusive and diverse for our players and employees. We strive to create a workforce that is reflective of our global player community as we know that we are stronger and better when we play together. To help promote an inclusive culture, we celebrate the visible and invisible diversity of our Jam Citizens through initiatives including Employee Resource Groups, cultural events, trainings, speaker series, and more. Jam City is an equal opportunity employer. We enthusiastically accept our responsibility to make employment decisions without regard to race, age, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, ancestry, religion, ethnicity, marital, or domestic partnerships status, disability, genetic information (including the refusal to submit to genetic testing), predisposing genetic characteristics, military status, veteran status, domestic violence victim status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expressions, or any other classification protected by federal, state, and local laws. Our management is committed to following this policy with respect to hiring, placement, promotion, transfer, demotion, layoff, termination, recruiting, pay, and other forms of compensation, training, and general treatment during employment. ABOUT JAM CITY Jam City is an award-winning mobile entertainment studio providing unique and deeply engaging games that appeal to a broad, global audience.  Led by CEO Chris DeWolfe, former MySpace co-founder and CEO, and COO Josh Yguado, former 20th Century Fox executive, Jam City is the creative powerhouse behind some of the highest-grossing and most enduring mobile games. Jam City’s global franchise Cookie Jam has generated more than half a billion dollars, and Panda Pop has more than 120 million downloads to date.  The company also is the go-to studio for Hollywood, having developed immersive, narrative-rich mobile games around iconic entertainment brands. The company’s popular RPG game Harry Potter: Hogwarts Mystery was the #1 game in more than 40 countries at its launch in April 2018.  Jam City has nine studios located in Los Angeles (HQ), Berlin, Buenos Aires, Bogotá, Burbank, Cedar Falls, San Diego, San Francisco, and Toronto.

Reviewing the requirements of Dodd Frank Supporting the Technology Data Team Identifying & assessing Gaps / Risk on project Working with Process and Controls  Due Diligence of Client Documents Top Skills Details: Experience working directly with OTC Derivatives and Dodd Frank Investigative/Analytical Experience Data Analysis - Looking at large sets of data and interpreting various data points Experience Level: Intermediate Level On this team you will work with "high in demand" software and new regulatory knowledge.  À propos d'Aston Carter: Aston Carter, une division d'Aerotek, est un fournisseur d'envergure mondiale de services de recrutement et de dotation de personnel pour les sociétés à la recherche de professionnels du milieu des affaires hautement spécialisés. Aerotek est une société en exploitation d'Allegis Group, un fournisseur multinational de solutions en matière de talent. Aston Carter s'engage fermement à offrir un service de premier ordre aux clients et aux professionnels du milieu des affaires dans un vaste éventail de disciplines, notamment la comptabilité, la finance, la gouvernance ainsi que la gestion du risque et de la conformité. Avec plus de 60 bureaux en Europe, Asie et Amérique du Nord, Aston Carter offre une expertise locale, régionale et mondiale pour répondre aux besoins uniques de ses clients. Reconnu "best of staffing" par nos clients et le talent que nous recrutons, Aston Carter s'engage à livrer un service hors pair a tous nos partenaires d'affaire.  About Aston Carter: Aston Carter is a distinguished global provider of recruitment and staffing services to companies requiring highly specialized business professionals. As a Best of Staffing® Client and Talent leader, Aston Carter has an unrivaled commitment to delivering first class service to clients and business professionals across a variety of disciplines, including Accounting and Finance as well as Governance, Risk and Compliance. With more than 60 offices across Europe, Asia Pacific and North America, Aston Carter provides local, regional and global expertise to drive value and meet our customers' unique needs. Aston Carter is a division of Aerotek. Aerotek is an operating company of Allegis Group, a global talent solutions provider.  The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.
jobdescription.208: POSITION SUMMARY Reporting to the Dealer Satisfaction & Training Supervisor, the Field Operations Analyst compiles, reviews and analyzes Dealer performance and completed contact reports to benchmark KPIs, identify opportunities for process improvement. This role involves gathering and analyzing data in PowerBI, presenting findings to key internal stakeholders, and making recommendations to the management team to improve overall dealer performance and satisfaction. This role works closely with other internal teams to implement and track process improvement action plans. The Field Operations Analyst will also participate in dealer visits, conference calls, webinars, and regional meetings. KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES Track, analyze and report on dealer parts operations performance using internal databases and aggregated dealer contact report data. Maintain, update and build new data models in PowerBI Prepare month end reports documenting dealer contact reports, trends of dealer sentiment, key feedback, potential concerns, trends over time and recurrent issues categorized by MOBIS operational department. Create business cases and present materials to various stakeholders relating to KPIS, dealer feedback and data analysis. Assist with dealer visit scheduling and coordination with distributors Coordinate monthly dealer focus group conference calls/webinars Assist Dealer Satisfaction & Training Supervisor, and Customer Service Manager with ad hoc report development, data queries and presentations Assist Dealer Satisfaction & Training Supervisor with the development of process improvement action plans Co-ordinate and assist in project management requirements Other duties as assigned REQUIRED COMPETENCIES Minimum 5 years of being awesome or super hero analytical skills Minimum 3 years of experience in an analyst role supporting business intelligence, continuous improvement, customer service, sales or market research Strong computer skills with specific requirement for Excel (Intermediate to Advanced) and PowerBI (Intermediate to Advanced), or similar business intelligence and data visualization experience. Other necessary computer skills include: PowerPoint (Intermediate to Advanced), SQL query building (Novice to Intermediate), Access/Data warehouse (any experience) Degree/Diploma in Business, Statistics, Math, Computer Science, and/or related program Experience with digital media / social media is an asset but not required. Experience with audio/video production, Adobe Creative Suite (Premiere, Audition, Photoshop) is an asset but not required. Bilingual in English/French/Korean an asset Experience in the automotive industry is an asset but not required Strong project management skills Concrete analytical skills with ability to translate complex data into recommendations Strong attention to detail and problem solving skills Must be able to work within a dynamic, fast-paced and deadline oriented environment Must be team oriented and customer service focused Solid organization and time management skills
jobdescription.210: Summer Student, Business Analyst (210068) Job Summary Reporting to the Senior Analyst, Pension Accounting, the Business Analyst summer student is responsible for data analysis, documentation, coordination, and project delivery support on Pension Accounting process improvement initiatives. Contributing to the overall operational effectiveness of the Pension Accounting team, this role will provide a variety of ad-hoc support to report development, streamlining of processes and effective communication between all parties. What you will do: Assist with business process review and gap analysis where required Assist in identifying and documenting all key pension accounting processes Organize and facilitate meetings, track issues, and perform follow-ups on deliverables Perform data analysis and report testing using Excel and BI tools Prepare PowerPoint presentation to facilitate communication Other support to specific ad-hoc operational issues  What you bring: Enrolled in post-secondary education program in accounting, finance or business administration Excellent written and verbal communication skills Quick learner, strong analytical skills, logical and detailed oriented Strong time management skills; ability to plan, and prioritize workload Strong computer skills including Microsoft Office; Excel and PowerPoint. Demonstrates a high level of professionalism. Notice for job applicants  Following the advice of Canadian health authorities, to mitigate the risk of potential spread of COVID-19 and support social distancing, all recruiting activities including interviews and new hire onboarding will be conducted online. While we are doing our best to ensure reasonable response times, please expect some delays during the recruiting process due to the current situation. Thank you for your patience and understanding during these challenging times.  For additional information on our adjusted recruitment process, please email us at hrinbox@hoopp.com.  About HOOPP  Established in 1960, the Healthcare of Ontario Pension Plan (HOOPP) is a multi-employer defined benefit pension plan for Ontario's hospital and community-based healthcare sector. We serve more than 381,000 members who provide valued healthcare services at more than 590 employers across the province. At HOOPP, we exist to provide a stable and reliable pension for our members that starts in retirement and is paid for life. As one of Canada's largest and most respected pension plans, HOOPP's net assets reached $94.1 billion at the end of 2019 and our funded status remained strong and stable at 119%.  HOOPP's core values - professional, accountable, collaborative, compassionate and trustworthy - guide our every interaction with our members, employers and employees. We've become one of Canada's leading pension plans by consistently challenging ourselves and embracing innovation. From our unique investment management approach to our innovative technology and thought-provoking research, we constantly seek to push the boundaries, and we do this by hiring passionate, forward-thinking people.  Our high-performance culture is founded on collaboration, respect and belonging. HOOPP is an equal opportunity employer and we're proud of our diversity. We select applicants for employment solely on the basis of their qualifications. Should you require accommodation because of a disability during the recruitment and selection process, please contact our Human Resources team. We will be happy to consult with you so that arrangements can be made for reasonable accommodation.
