jobdescription.211: A great opportunity to enter into the healthcare field and work with a leading medical group.Summary: Business Analyst/Business System Analyst Manager will work with the team to solve complex business issues, create strategy and implement solutions.*Reporting: VP, Technology and Corporate DevelopmentResponsibilities:Working closely with the business to identify and analyze core business processes and workflowsManage operational projects and deliverables according to requirementsCommunicate with team members and managementMonitor and report on progress and identify areas for improvementDevelopment of procedural documentation as it relates to business processesDevelopment of clear and detailed process maps and business requirementsIdentifying process improvement opportunitiesSupport management and perform administrative tasks throughout the project cyclePerform other duties related to the businessQualifications:2+ Years BSA experience in technology or healthcareEngineering or College degree in Technology, Engineering, or related fieldExcellent analytical, problem solving and decision making skillsExperience in decision making and data analytics reportingPrevious experience in project planningExcellent communication skills, ability to multi-task and willingness to learnAbout Us: Teledact Inc. (Gotodoctor.ca) is a leading telemedicine technology provider that focuses on improving healthcare access and medical resource distribution across Canada. Supported by the renowned primary care clinic, Enhanced Care Clinic, the Company offers complete virtual clinic solutions that conveniently connect patients with physicians. Enhanced Care has also been the Preferred Provider of Physician and Medical Clinic Services for McKesson Retail Banner Group (over 2000 IDA, Guardian, Remedy’sRx and other independent pharmacies) since 2017. The Teledact platform now operates in a growing number of telemedicine clinics, pharmacies, health facilities and senior living centres across Canada. Gotodoctor.ca is also a listed virtual care provider on McKesson Retail Banner Group and Rexall consumer-facing portals.*Job Type: PermanentAdditional pay:Bonus payBenefits:Extended health careSchedule:Day shiftEducation:Bachelor's Degree (Preferred)Experience:BSA technology or healthcare: 2 years (Preferred)Work remotely:No
jobdescription.212: About Us :  Established over 30 years ago, Medcan is a global leader in assessing clients' overall well-being and inspiring them to live well. Medcan has a comprehensive range of diagnostic assessments, which, in combination with innovative programs tailored to specific needs, are designed to successfully reach improved health outcomes. Over 80 physicians and specialists, alongside a broad roster of complementary health care disciplines, provide health and lifestyle management services on site and by video consult for individuals, families and organizations. Our team of 550 staff see clients physically and virtually from our downtown Toronto location. The Role: Business Analyst, MBA Student Co-op/Placement (4 months placement) Come join a dynamic team dedicated to designing and delivering innovative products that are shaping the future of health and wellness. The dermatology product team at Medcan is accountable for curating industry-leading products and services that harness the latest technology focused on our customers’ needs. Medcan is recruiting for a Business Analyst for our growing and innovative Dermatology Business – Refine by Medcan. As a Business Analyst, you will be working directly with Refine by Medcan’s business director and the team to understand the business needs and develop product and market intelligence reports. Your work will support Refine’s leadership in the development of short- and long-term growth strategies by providing actionable, data-driven insights with a focus on marketing and business development applications. This is a 4-month placement for an MBA student The Accountabilities: Design and develop market intelligence reports to help understand Refine’s position in the market and to support business development and marketing strategies Support Refine by Medcan’s expansion planning by providing relevant insights and recommendations driven from market and customer data analyses Analyze customer behavior across different channels against product offerings and provide recommendations aimed to improve the lifetime value (LTV) of individual customers through enhanced engagement and loyalty. Analyze Refine’s retail portfolio and performance (in-store and ecommerce) and provide recommendations on how to optimize offerings. Perform research and analysis to support the development of new product offerings. Act as the point of contact and coordinator between Refine, marketing, and sales teams as needed. The Requirements: MBA candidate or recent MBA grad Superior quantitative and qualitative analytical skills including designing research projects Extensive knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint) is required. Ability to draw out meaningful business insights by synthesizing information from multiple sources. Ability to work independently and as a team Proficient in database software (experience with Salesforce and SQL is strongly preferred). Previous consulting, product management, market research, or business analysis experience is an asset. Ability to listen, voice your opinion, and communicate in a professional manner. Experience in cosmetics, beauty, or wellness industry is an asset. This is a 4-month co-op placement position for an MBA student offering full-time hours. In your cover letter please include why you wish to align yourself with Medcan and how you believe you can add value to our organization. We thank all applicants for their interest; however only those selected for an initial interview will be contacted. No phone calls and no agencies please. Medcan is an equal opportunity employer committed to the principles of employment equity and inclusion. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise your Talent Management Specialist if you require accommodation.
jobdescription.213: Are you a kid at heart looking to build a career with a leading global children's toy, entertainment and digital gaming company? At Spin Master, our unwavering commitment to open mindedness, integrity and innovation is a great part of what has made us an industry leader. How do we stay ahead of the pack? By hiring the best and brightest minds—and that’s why we want you! Job Description: What will you work on? As the e-Commerce Merchandise Analyst, you will support Spin Master’s online growth within the US and Canada with a focus on Marketplace, Mid-Tier US accounts and Canada (ie. Amazon, Walmart. and Toys R Us). Your focus is to deliver best in class EComm experiences across sites, partnering with sales, supply chain, COE’s and brands team ensure timely publishing of all items and accountability for complete and accurate product information. You thrive in a fast-paced environment and are relentless at testing and learning to drive share of voice, rankings and ultimately sales. Ultimately your goal will be to ensure each of your online retailers provide a great consumer experience, while supporting our sales and brand objectives.  How will you create impact? Work with sales and brand teams to support seasonal and annual growth plans. Provide support to develop, standardise, and execute the best in class e-commerce executions in collaboration with colleagues from sales, marketing and COE teams. Work with both internal and external cross-functional teams to ensure all content is pushed, complete and ready to be received by the retailer in conjunction with inventory being received or launch date. Work with translations team to ensure content is proactively created and loaded into Salsify Execute Item set-up in each online retailers’ platform. Submit and manage assets through each online retailers’ platform. Ensure accurate representation and communication of product catalog and availability to customer with a focus on daily management. Audit eCom sites for content integrity, completeness, and optimization Measure customer KPIs on an ongoing basis, establishing a short insight-to-action process to quickly adapt and optimize activities. Optimize product listings for Share of Shelf and Rankings using expertise of keyword research, digital marketing, SEM, online display advertising, and SEO from inception with objective to drive conversion and sales sell-through. Work with the eCommerce team and other account managers to identify opportunities and develop digital activations. Assist and provide the required Ad Hoc reporting including post-mortem reporting for ecom POS sales. Engage with cross-functional subject matter experts to incorporate best practices into the digital shelf. Assist and support Sales Leads with Commercial Planning activities related to product assortment strategy and promotional planning. How will you fit into the team? Comprehensive knowledge of major eCommerce eco-systems (Amazon, Walmart.com, Target.com, eBay), with a proven record of hands on experience working within Vendor Central. Strong project management abilities; capable of prioritizing and handling multiple projects simultaneously under tight time constraints and across multiple cross functional teams/departments. Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Office (ie Excel and PowerPoint) applications and web analytics (ie. Omniture, Google Analytics), SAP Expertise in transforming a strategy and vision into actionable plans Technical understanding of internet technologies Strong attention to detail, organized Strong communication, Presentation and Collaborative skills Strong data analytics, reporting, business modeling & forecasting skills Ability to interpret data and draw conclusions Ability to adapt to changing systems, forms, and standards Open to working in an ambiguous environment. What are your skills and experience? Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing or related eCommerce field required; MBA an asset Minimum 2+ years prior experience in eCommerce merchandising at mass retailers or DTC, preferably with a toy, retail or consumer products company Success with implementing and maintaining Digital/eCommerce systems Knowledge in Supply Chain, Trade Marketing, or Merchandising SAP Experience Understands basic supply chain management and logistics fulfillment business operations What’s it like to work here? Spin Master is a fast-paced, hands-on organization that provides many great opportunities for impactful decision-making; though our challenging start-up atmosphere isn’t for everyone, we have a proven record of opportunities for future advancement and internal transfers for our passionate and results driven team. What you can expect from us: Our mission is to Make Life More Fun with a vision to push the boundaries of innovation, creativity, and fun. From top leadership to new and veteran team members alike, everyone at Spin Master embodies our Core Values: We partner We invent We are open-minded We collaborate We get results We’ve got integrity We are entrepreneurs Follow us on Instagram and Twitter @SpinMaster to stay up to date on Spin Master career opportunities. We do appreciate all interest; however only those selected for interview will be contacted.
jobdescription.214: Dawn InfoTek Inc. is a professional IT consulting team that partners with major financial institutions, investment firms and government sectors. We have been dedicated in delivering cutting-edge consulting services and recruiting all levels of IT positions for our clients.We are currently seeking for competent individuals to fulfill the role of Business System Analyst to join our dynamic team for our client, one of the 5 major banks.Typical Day in Role:- Works with key stakeholders within all business functions to align technology solutions with business strategies- Gathers requirements from business units and translates those to programmers and developers- Prepares cost-benefit and return-on-investment analyses to aid in decisions on system implementation- Demonstrates an informed knowledge of business functions to resolve problems and capitalize on improvement opportunities- Supports one or more highly complex business processes. Works on multiple projects as a project team member.- Serves as a liaison between the business community and the IT organization in order to provide technical solutions to meet user needs- Ability to write requirement specifications, build and execute test plans- Data Analysis – remediate any data quality issues (started with 1500 and have multiple domains including Mrket Risk, Credit Risk etc.) – there is a set of data quality issues that need to come in from technology aspects – someone who comes from Data Governance and can look at multiple source systems to identify data quality – everything will be sent to centralized Repository -Candidate Requirements/Must Have Skills:1) 5 + years’ hands on experience as a BSA in the Capital Markets industry, preferably from a Counter Party Credit Risk and Market Risk2) 5 + years’ experience working with Oracle and SQL databases3) Complete understanding of SDLC and complete documentation from end to end to provide solution (with minimum 5 years’)3) Advanced Microsoft Excel (PowerBI) skills to ensure proper analysis of data quality4) Excellent communication skills to will be required to create business requirements (need technical writing ability as well as liaising with developers for fulfillment of those requirements)Nice-To-Have Skills:- in Dremio, Tableau, and Microsoft Power BI) is required to support this initiative- - Python experience to build out Macros is a plus- US regulation experience is a plusSoft Skills Required:1) Able to adapt with remote work environments2) Self-started3) Communication Skills – be able to communicate clearly and concisely. Written skills should be the same as candidate will need to deal with end users on a daily basis.Degrees: Bachelor's degree in a technical field such as computer science, computer engineering or related field required.Candidate Review & Selection:2 Step Process: 1-2 Microsoft Teams interviewsHiring Manager’s availability to interview: ASAPFor an immediate consideration, please apply today to this posting by submitting your Resume along with your Availability Date and Expected Salary / Expected Hourly Rate .We thank all applicants for your interest and referral. However, only qualified candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.For further information on our company, please visit: www.dawninfotek.comJob Type: Full-timeSalary: $0.00 per hourExperience:BSA: 5 years (Required)Capital Markets industry: 4 years (Required)Oracle and SQL databases: 5 years (Required)Microsoft Excel (PowerBI): 1 year (Required)Unix / Shell scripting: 5 years (Preferred)Python: 5 years (Preferred)Market Risk: 5 years (Preferred)
jobdescription.215: Job Description Founded in 1846, Laurentian Bank Financial Group (LBCFG) is a diversified financial services provider whose mission is to help its customers improve their financial health. The Laurentian Bank of Canada and its entities are collectively referred to as Laurentian Bank Financial Group (the "Group" or the "Bank").   With more than 2,900 employees guided by the values of proximity, simplicity and honesty, the Group provides a broad range of advice-based solutions and services to its personal, business and institutional customers. With pan-Canadian activities and a presence in the U.S., the Group is an important player in numerous market segments.  This role sits within Laurentian Bank, a subsidiary of Laurentian Bank Financial Group.  Reporting to the Assistant Vice-President, Compliance, Financial Crimes and Anti-Money Laundering and Anti-Terrorist Financing (AML/ATF), the Senior Business Analyst, Financial Crimes and AML/ATF, is responsible for developing, deploying and maintaining models for AML/ATF monitoring of transactions and various other support activities related to transaction monitoring and Client Due Diligence processes.  The incumbent helps the Bank's Financial Crimes and AML/ATF business unit implement AML/ATF strategies for monitoring transactions involving current and future products. In addition, he or she actively participates in designing AML/ATF strategies and extensive analyses for the portfolios of the Bank and its subsidiaries.  The position is based in Toronto.  Responsibilities º Serve as an expert advisor for the Financial Crimes and AML/ATF business unit and the business lines in the implementation of new AML/ATF strategies, and support teams in reviewing their AML/ATF monitoring strategies for current products. º Analyse the performance of current monitoring practices and methods and trends related to AML/ATF activities. º Analyse data in order to submit recommendations for modelling AML/ATF scenarios. º Document business rules for developing models. º Work with the development team to ensure that the AML/ATF scenario rules that are deployed meet the specifications. º Submit requests for adjustments to the development team during tests and monitor the adjustments until implementation. º Document analyses, tests and results and prepare periodic scenario performance monitoring reports. º Conduct periodic monitoring of key performance indicators and submit recommendations for optimizing AML/ATF models. º Conduct studies and complex analyses, draw conclusions and recommend solutions. º Ensure data privacy (security profile and access codes). º Optimize the use of strategies and systems by identifying business process improvement opportunities and implementing flexible, reusable solutions. º Coordinate and/or participate in work groups with stakeholders to identify problems and needs and develop a work plan for implementing the appropriate solutions. º Serve as an advisor in his or her field of expertise for managers and senior management. º Support and maintain efficient communication with stakeholders involved in management operations. º Keep updated on current legislation and the Bank's policies, programs and procedures. º Prepare various reporting for management oversight activities º Assist with managing Internal Audit and Regulatory remediation activities.  º Project support including working with project teams to document, review an test business requirements º Assist with change management activities and overall governance controls  º Perform all tasks of a similar or general nature requested by his or her superior or required for the job.  Qualifications º University education in a quantitative field (bachelor's degree in economics, mathematics, finance, statistics or actuarial science) or four years relevant experience in a similar field º Strong knowledge of SAS programming (SAS EG, SAS AML)  º Concrete experience in statistics, data analysis and modelling º Relevant experience and knowledge of AML/ATF regulations in the banking sector º Experience using relational databases and SQL language º Relevant experience and knowledge of fraud and money laundering concepts, issues, systems and prevention and detection strategies º Ability to influence proposed solutions and innovate º Ability to simplify and communicate complex ideas º Ability to make presentations before a non-technical audience º Knowledge of the banking industry º Bilingual (French and English), spoken and written º Talent for interpersonal communication º Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills º Self-reliance and resourcefulness  Additional Information We welcome and encourage applications from individuals from all groups, including aboriginal, women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities, regardless of race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, creed, family status, national origin, age and gender.
jobdescription.217: About Us: Propel (formerly MoneyKey) is an innovative Fintech Company that provides services and unsecured financial products to consumers via a safe and secure online platform. Propel was founded in 2011 in Toronto to remove the complexity and bureaucracy that people often experience while trying to borrow money, and to provide an underserved population with unsecured credit in a respectful way and with extraordinary service. Our goal is to provide our customers with a simple and convenient process! Our amazing team has experienced phenomenal growth and thrives on an entrepreneurial spirit, passion, and top-tier talent. We believe in innovation and in measuring success through results and growing within; talent and hard work never goes unnoticed, and we succeed together. About You: You are a talented professional looking for a career, not a job. You have a passion for numbers and data analytics, with an Accounting background and experience with data analysis tools. You possess an excellent business acumen to develop in-depth knowledge of each product combination offered by the organization and to play a key role in supporting the decision-making process for strategic next steps in the business. You picture yourself succeeding within a vibrant and entrepreneurial organization where your ideas will be heard, and where you will have an opportunity to showcase your talents and great skills. You are motivated by goals, a self-starter, and a hardworking individual who likes to wear multiple hats. We are seeking a proven, driven team player who is looking to join a fast-paced, high growth, energetic and forward-thinking team. Responsibilities Preparing internal and external reporting over product performance metrics (KPIs) and month-end financial results from source system data Working with, extracting, validating, and analyzing data from multiple databases and internal systems for the purpose of producing reporting and conducting data/financial analysis that directly affects business decisions. Extensive use of SQL, Excel, amongst other tools required for the above. Documenting data queries, sources, structures, and flows to enable streamlining and knowledge sharing/transfer. Working with and leveraging IT to create and develop reporting tools to manage and track, reconcile, identify exceptions/issues, and report on the flow of transactional data between multiple internal systems and databases. Key contributor towards optimization of various reporting and data processes. Assisting team in creating efficiencies across data flow and reporting infrastructure Continuously analyzing data in real-time as well as historical results, performance metrics and market figures to support the business and enhance profitability Analyzing profitability and performance across all company entities and business units. Based on analysis, providing recommendations to optimize financial performance Developing an in-depth knowledge of the business as well as each product/offering by the organization in the various markets in which it operates Providing support to the Accounting & Finance team to improve forecasting effectiveness, reporting, and accuracy across the business Working closely and supporting Director of Finance with managing and executing all audit or regulatory related requests Analyzing profitability, performance and cash flows across all Company entities, products, markets, customer types and various other attributes Executing on and supporting the Accounting & Finance team at various stages of the reporting process, including P&L, Balance Sheets, Cash Flow, etc. Involvement in product structuring and a key contributor to successfully launching and ongoing performance analysis of new products. Working closely with the PMO team Contributing to the Finance team as a strategic thinker, identifying concerns or potential risks in a proactive manner Conducting ad hoc financial analysis to support various departments across the company. Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Business, Mathematics, Finance, Computer Science, Economics, or related field CPA designation (or working towards designation) preferred. Working knowledge of Accounting reporting standards (IFRS and US GAAP experience an asset) Solid experience with financial reporting and analysis Knowledge in the use of databases, data analysis/query tools and proficiency in Excel Proficient with SQL tools for data analysis, mining, and verification/integrity. Hands-on experience with creating dashboards and reports on Business Intelligence and Reporting Tools is an asset (e.g. Tableau, Domo, Cognos, or related tools). Hands-on experience with Accounting and ERP systems (e.g. Oracle NetSuite), including GL feeds is an asset Passion for working in a dynamic and fast-paced environment Strong attention to detail and organization skills, motivated and able to multitask Knowledge of Fintech Space an asset. We welcome and encourage applications from individuals from all groups, including aboriginal, women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities, regardless of race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, creed, family status, national origin, age and gender. We thank all applications for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted. No agencies or phone calls.
jobdescription.218: Yorkville University is recruiting for a talented and hardworking Associate / Senior Analyst to join its growing Strategy & Analytics team.  We are looking for a highly motivated, smart, and business savvy individual that would like to solve complex business challenges in an entrepreneurial environment. Under direction from the Director, Strategy & Analytics, you will work closely with various functions across the organization to grow and improve existing programs, evaluate new programs and enhance the student experience.  You will use data to influence decisions on how the business can improve and will support a variety of teams across the organization make sound strategic choices. The role requires a curious mindset and someone who wants to work with a team driving continuous improvement across all areas of the business. About Yorkville University Founded in 2004, Yorkville University is a Canadian university with a national presence. With campuses in New Brunswick, Ontario and British Columbia, Yorkville University offers professional, practitioner-oriented masters and bachelor degree programs, delivered entirely online, in class or a blend of both. Please visit www.yorkvilleu.ca for further information. About Toronto Film School Toronto Film School offers a fast and effective path to an exciting career in film, television, theatre, fashion, graphic design or video games. What sets Toronto Film School apart is that right from the start students begin the transformative process of turning raw energy and creativity into the practical skills demanded by the competitive world of the entertainment industry. Students will be filming, editing, performing, writing and designing in a high-energy environment, preparing for exciting careers within the entertainment industry – with the guidance of industry professionals and supportive faculty, who understand what it takes to succeed. Toronto Film School has three campuses in the GTA: Dundas College, Davisville and Concord. Please visit www.torontofilmschool.ca for further information. Diversity, equity and inclusion are a critical component of life at Yorkville University and Toronto Film School, and we are committed to making these values an integral part of our culture. Toronto Film School/Yorkville University encourages applications from all qualified applicants, including women, persons with disabilities, Black, Indigenous, and People of Colour (BIPOC), people from the Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transgender, Transsexual, Queer, Questioning, Two-Spirit, Intersex, Asexual + (LGBTQ2SIA+) community, and other equity-seeking groups. Yorkville University/Toronto Film School is committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (‘AODA’). If you require accommodation for disability during any stage of the recruitment process, please notify Human Resources at 1-866- 467-0661 ext. 1236. Data Analytics & Reporting Key contributor to the development and implementation of KPI reporting across the organization Support different functional areas with analytics to help solve problems or improve performance (e.g. developing pricing strategies or retention strategies) Provide analytics and insights to the Executive Team and Board of Directors as required Work to improve data definitions and data integrity across the organization Work with private equity ownership, including their in-house data science team Opportunity to be part of the team to build internal AI capabilities to forecast student outcomes Supporting Strategic Initiatives Develop business cases for new programs, campuses, or partnerships Analyse different strategic choices, produce executive-level presentations and support strategic planning Tracking performance against key strategic initiatives and measuring success; working with leaders across the organization to ensure desired impact is being achieved A. Education and Experience Bachelor’s degree preferably in Business Administration 1-3 years of experience, preferably in Business Analytics, Finance or Consulting B. Required Skills and Abilities Excellent written and verbal communication Excellent organization and prioritization skills, with an appreciation for detail Strong knowledge in MS Excel and PowerPoint. MS Excel proficiency to include running simple business models to help influence decision making (break even analysis, market sizing, business line P&Ls, pivots etc) Strong knowledge of core accounting concepts (e.g. reading and understanding financial statements, building a P&L) Ability to respond to changing business priorities and manage multiple workstreams Ability to conduct analysis and draw meaningful insights Creative and innovative approach to solutions and problems C. Desired Skills and Abilities Data Manipulation - Experience preparing, exploring, interacting with, and driving insight from large data sets. Proficiency with standard tools of data manipulation like SQL, R or Python is an asset. Analytics Infrastructure - Previous experience with databases, business intelligence tools, ETL pipelines, and machine learning systems is an asset. Business Analytics - Applies analytical frameworks and algorithms to drive key business objectives. Can clearly translate business needs into models and error-free code.
jobdescription.219: Talent Analyst (3 positions)  - (16764) Find Your Spot at Humber If you are interested in higher education and are looking to contribute to the largest polytechnic College in Ontario as we shape the future of our students and communities, here is your opportunity to join our team. At Humber, our career paths open up a world of infinite possibilities for you to explore. People are at the heart of the Humber experience. Here, every day we work shoulder to shoulder to deliver excellence, and in doing so, we redefine what it means to be a leader in polytechnic education. Humber employees are a diverse group of committed, caring and fun-loving people. We learn and grow together. We take finding and growing the right talent very seriously. We strive to find and nurture extraordinary employees who bring their best each day. Humber is a place like no other. Here you will “Find Your Spot” and build a career and future that grows as we grow. In this rich, diverse workplace, we encourage innovation ideas. We support you to find deep meaning and purpose so that you can be proud of what you do and where you work. Visit www.humber.ca for more information. Talent Analyst 3 positions: 1 full-time permanent position 2 full-time contract positions (12 months)  Role Objective The Talent Analyst is responsible to conduct leading practice research, surveys and data analyses to produce perspectives and recommendations that inform the design and development of talent strategies, programs and projects. The role also takes an active role in the implementation and administration of talent strategies, programs and projects and the monitoring and measuring of effectiveness and impact. Accountabilities Talent Management Research and Analytics Build, track and update various monthly and quarterly talent metrics. Plan and develop instruments for producing talent analytics activities including but not limited to survey design/measurement and assessment development/validation. Identify and interpret trends in data, present findings, and provide recommendations to varying levels of the organization. Leverage internal HR, survey, and/or business data using internal tools, systems, and data sources. Merge data from multiple sources/systems, conduct appropriate analyses, and provide actionable insights. Proactively partner with key stakeholders to address business gaps or opportunities identified through analytics. Create, administer and summarize employee feedback surveys.  Talent Strategies and Programs Create presentations, spreadsheets and graphs. Maintain, organize and implement programs, processes and tools that help with the efficient administration of talent programs and activities. Draft contracts, reports, letters and various correspondence. Conduct research and investigate topics related to various talent and employee related policies and programs. Participate in or execute on various talent initiatives and projects. Research leading practice approaches and present recommendations to talent approaches, programs and projects. Administer processes and activities vital to the operations of existing talent programs. Assist with the development of content, training and deployment of talent strategies. Respond to tickets progressed to Tier 3 from the HR Support Centre.  Supporting Total Rewards Programs, Projects and Activities Data development, sourcing, extraction, manipulation, analysis and presentation supporting compensation, pension, benefits and talent retention programs Program development specific to Talent Retention (included strategies designed to achieve employee well-being, recognition and engagement), and Total Rewards Measurement in the form of surveys, periodic and cadenced reporting, KPI reporting specific to services, programs, and completion of key annual workplan activities Audits and reconciliation related to completion of key annual workplan activities Data cleansing, matching and preparation for annual/cadenced compensation, pension and benefits activities Support the delivery of all talent and total rewards programs and activities Minimum Qualifications Education and Skills Bachelor’s degree or equivalent. 1 - 3 years experience in talent activities.  The Ideal Candidate Demonstrates Broad understanding talent management practice. Advanced MS Excel skills. Strong ability to interpret and analyze data/findings gathered to identify trends and commonalities.  Competencies Communication – oral and written HR practices Data Analysis Business Intelligence tools Client orientation Problem-solving Confidentiality Consulting skills Tact and Diplomacy Consulting skills  We thank all applicants for their interest in this position. Only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. Consideration for Support Staff and Academic positions will be given to internal employees in accordance with the respective collective agreements. Humber is committed to a workforce that reflects the diversity of our students and our city. We actively seek qualified individuals from equity seeking groups with demonstrated skills and knowledge to deal with all aspects of equity, diversity and inclusion in a post-secondary environment. Humber College is committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process, in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Our HR Generalists will work with applicants requesting accommodations at any stage of the hiring process. This document is available in alternate formats upon request.  Hours Per Week 37.5 Position Type FT Administration Work Locations North Campus 205 Humber College Blvd. Etobicoke M9W 5L7 Job Family Human Resources Duration of Need 1 permanent position and 2 contracts 12 for months Deadline to Apply March 17, 2021 Job Posting 3/3/21 Department Human Resources and Organizational Effectiveness
jobdescription.220: The role: Senior Business Analyst – Licensing We are looking for a Senior Business Analyst – Licensing to join our busy and dynamic team in our Toronto, Richmond Hill office. Why we need you:- As Business Analyst, you will work with Compliance and various business stakeholders to investigate, define and execute product changes to support our Compliance level. Whilst also, translating business requirements into detailed requirement documents and work closely with business and technology on accurate implementation. You’ll be required to create and maintain the ‘knowledge base’ of our systems and licenses and provide different business units with compliance gap analysis on requested features. Be the knowledge owner of our different solutions across all licenses. You will also need to proactively raise risks with current and potential functionality and ensure our product is compliant with local regulation. You will be required to manage data requests to allow data driven decisions and map competition landscape by comparing the company's product to competitors' functionality. Who are we looking for:- Relevant experience as a product, business and/or business systems analyst or to have qualification/certification in these areas Intimate knowledge and experience with Operational aspects around Regulated Markets. Demonstrable technical experience with distributed application design and data analysis Strong interest and aptitude in defining business requirements for software development. Understanding of the Software Development Lifecycle. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Superb attention to detail. Strong relationship management skills – ability to relate to business users and software developers. Strong organisational skills and ability to manage multiple simultaneous projects. Ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlines. Creative and analytical approach to problem solving As the ideal candidate, you will have:- Experience in working within regulatory frameworks and compliance and on system integration is desirable. Detailed knowledge of regulatory product requirement across jurisdictions and technical understanding of regulated frameworks is a plus. A relevant degree in computer science or another technology related discipline is advantageous. What’s in it for you? Our experience-based salaries are competitive. Plus, there’s a discretionary annual performance bonus. Your package will include:health and dental insurance for you and your dependentsthe option to join our company pension schemein-house training and development to develop your skills, progressing your careerPaid for lunches, as well as fresh fruit, snacks and drinks around the officeregular on-site yoga sessions What happens next? If you’re what we’re looking for, next up will be a phone interview. And if that goes well, we’ll meet you for a face-to-face interview. The Group PokerStars is part of Flutter Entertainment Plc, a global sports betting, gaming and entertainment provider headquartered in Dublin and part of FTSE 100 index of the London Stock Exchange, which brings together exceptional brands, products and businesses and a diverse global presence in a safe, responsible and ultimately sustainable way. We are an equal opportunity employer that values diversity. We do not discriminate on any protected characteristic as defined by applicable law. We will look to provide reasonable accommodation for applicants with disabilities to participate in the job application or interview process. If you need assistance, please contact: talent@starsgroup.com (mailto:talent@starsgroup.com). Please note we cannot accept general applications; this inbox is just for providing support to those who need it.
jobdescription.221: Mejuri is a direct-to-consumer approach to buying jewellery for the modern woman. We are about making luxury a habit – disrupting the traditional jewellery industry to make fine jewellery affordable and empowering women to purchase for themselves. Series B funded, and one of the fastest growing global digital brands, we are backed by strong VC investors such as Natalie Massenet’s Imaginary Ventures, NEA and Felix Capital. We focus on perfecting every customer touchpoint, creating the best digital and in-store experiences and content that is conversational and engaging. We are a team of designers, writers, technologists and strategists, and we are looking for someone special to join our team and help us make luxury fun and accessible. “Mejuri redefines personal jewelry decisions” – Forbes “75 per cent of Mejuri’s customers are women buying for themselves, and 30 per cent make repeat purchases each month. Among those filling their virtual baskets? Lizzo, Selena Gomez, Margot Robbie and Oprah Winfrey.” – British Vogue At Mejuri, we have a tremendous appreciation for fact-based decision-making. We are looking for a passionate and curious individual to support the growing analysis and business intelligence needs of our marketing team! At a high level, this new role will provide reporting and analyses to our marketing organization, monitoring how campaigns are performing and how to improve. Responsibilities: Produce effective data visualizations, dashboards, and analytical solutions that provide marketing teams access to critical metrics and insights Collect and analyze data; synthesize results of analyses, and communicate the implications with leadership in a concise manner Partner with channel leads to log all relevant data associated with brand and growth marketing activities. Then work with the data engineering team to ensure the data is efficiently and seamlessly captured in a centralized data warehouse environment Perform exploratory data analysis on new data sources to assess quality, reliability and understand key gaps Support annual financial planning activities by building defensible forecasts for revenue and other key business drivers• Automate and streamline dashboard and data analyses where feasible Maintain high levels of accuracy, integrity, process consistency and documentation in planning, forecasting, and modeling approaches The successful candidate will have: 3+ years experience in relevant data analytics or business intelligence roles - preferably in marketing Driven, creative, intellectually curious and able to effectively collaborate cross-functionally, partnering with stakeholders to drive business performance Extensive SQL experience for data extraction, manipulation, and analyses; including stored procedures, complex joins, creation of views, and database scripting. Strong grasp of analytical database design concepts Extensive experience in Visualization tools (preferably Looker) Deep understanding of KPI selection, sales metrics, and business case development Strong understanding of applied statistics skills, such as: statistical testing, regression, mathematical techniques etc Acute attention to detail, excellent written and verbal communication skills for explaining analytic approaches to non-technical audiences Ability to work independently and in a team-oriented environment Familiarity and preferably experience working within Google suite of productivity apps (Google Gmail, Sheets, Docs, and Drive, mainly). Proficiency with spreadsheet-based formulas (eg. Excel/Sheets) is critical. Working at Mejuri = Solid Gold Mejuri aspires to not only inspire and empower our customers, but to build an inspiring, empowering and thoroughly modern workplace.  We offer: Beautiful, light filled plant and dog-friendly office Competitive health, mental health, dental and vision benefits for you and your family Fully stocked kitchen with snacks and drinks Wellness - Private wellness/prayer/pumping room, and a lifestyle spending account for health and fitness needs Parental leave top up program (80% for 4 months)Stay shining with a generous employee discount Mejuri is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Mejuri welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
jobdescription.222: Currently Enrolled in a BA/BS Degree with an expected graduation date of December 2021- August 2022 Experience in the areas of finance, business management and/or sales operations in mid-to-large scale global Sales Organization Experience with the development and implementation of systems, processes and tools utilized for CRM, variable compensation, revenue reporting, and forecasting  Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the leading cloud provider, providing virtualized infrastructure, storage, networking, messaging, and many other services to customers all over the world. AWS runs a globally distributed environment, operating at massive levels of scale. Businesses, educational institutions and governments depend on AWS for secure cloud services and solutions.  This position will be responsible for Sales Operations and Business financial analysis within the Worldwide Public Sector (WWPS) Business Operations organization. The WWPS Business Operations Analyst Intern will work in collaboration and coordination with the sales team they support, along with account teams, service teams, and WWPS Business Operations. This position will be responsible for providing operational support for the WWPS sales teams. The role will include establishing dashboards, operational metrics, and reports to support the rapid growth of the AWS public sector business. A successful individual will have the ability to think strategically, act tactically, write effectively, and display strong analytical and critical thinking skills. The candidate must also be able to build strong cross-group working relationships and demonstrate exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail.  You will:  Support sales teams ensuring timeliness, completeness and accuracy of reporting Develop metrics and reports to manage sales pipeline, billed revenue and quota attainment Develop performance dashboards that encompass key metrics to be reviewed with senior sales directors and WWPS leadership team in order to drive and manage the business Coordinate with corporate teams to influence roadmap for enhanced business intelligence and CRM tools to support the business. Assist with territory planning, account segmentation, and sales vertical cleanup activities Validate account manager compensation plans Manage headcount tracking Help WWPS balance short term tactical goals with long term strategies Experience working within a high-growth, technology company would be beneficial Experience using BI tools and CRM software, Tableau Experience with SQL Querying Self-motivated, action-oriented, multi-tasking individual with a great sense of urgency and follow-through Strong Excel experience and the ability to conduct sophisticated and creative analysis of complex data and translate the results into actionable deliverables, messages, and presentations Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must, as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations. Motivated self-starter who is proactive and action-oriented Able to operate successfully in a lean, fast-paced organization that can scale quickly Exhibits sound business judgment, strong analytical skills, and a proven track record of taking ownership and leading data-driven analyses to find proper solutions.  Amazon is committed to providing accommodations at all stages through recruitment and employment in accordance with applicable human rights and accommodation legislation. If contacted for an employment opportunity, advise Human Resources if you require accommodation, including in order to apply for a position.
jobdescription.223: Gallagher is a global leader in insurance, risk management and consulting services. We help businesses grow, communities thrive and people prosper. We live a culture defined by The Gallagher Way, our set of shared values and guiding tenets. A culture driven by our people, over 30,000 strong, serving our clients with customized solutions that will protect them and fuel their futures.  Position Summary: Primarily focused on mapping data from one system to another, role function involves run in data activities associated with the running, planning and organization of the data as well as supporting data run-in and integration services to ensure efficient and effective business operations while establishing and enforcing standards and procedures.  Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Working with stakeholders to develop implementation plans, Analyzing field mapping Coordinating with 3rd party conversion partners Auditing for errors and necessary corrections. Additional accountabilities include: Ensuring accuracy of data an operational standards are met Reviewing/documenting procedures for accuracy and operational efficiency-recommending changes as required Analyzing complex system problems as needed-making recommendations to ensure against re-occurrence. Seasoned contributor that can provide a high level of both business and technical knowledge of the run-in and integration process. Contributes to the development of functional strategy. May also act as analytical or procedural expert and represent team on cross-functional process or project deliverables. May lead key projects of the highest complexity. May supervise day-to-day work of lower level employees, but does not typically have formal management role.  Required: Bachelor's degree; 5 years related experience. Working knowledge of windows operating systems and Microsoft Office, including Access.  Desired: Strong analytical skills. Excellent oral and written communication.  U.S. Eligibility Requirements: Interested candidates must submit an application and resume/CV online to be considered Must be 18 years of age or older Must be willing to submit to a background investigation; any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background investigation Must have unrestricted work authorization to work in the United States. For U.S. employment opportunities, Gallagher hires U.S. citizens, permanent residents, asylees, refugees, and temporary residents. Temporary residence does not include those with non-immigrant work authorization (F, J, H or L visas), such as students in practical training status. Exceptions to these requirements will be determined based on shortage of qualified candidates with a particular skill. Gallagher will require proof of work authorization Must be willing to execute Gallagher’s Employee Agreement or Confidentiality and Non-Disclosure Agreement which requires, among other things, post-employment obligations relating to non-solicitation, confidentiality and non-disclosure Gallagher offers competitive salaries and benefits, including: medical/dental/vision plans, life and accident insurance, 401(K), employee stock purchase plan, educational expense reimbursement, employee assistance program, flexible work hours (availability varies by office and job function) training programs, matching gift program, and more. Gallagher believes that all persons are entitled to equal employment opportunity and does not discriminate against nor favor any applicant because of race, sex, color, disability, national origin, religion, creed, age, marital status, citizenship, veteran status, gender, gender identity / expression, actual or perceived sexual orientation, or any other protected characteristic. Equal employment opportunity will be extended in all aspects of the employer-employee relationship, including, but not limited to, recruitment, hiring, training, promotion, transfer, demotion, compensation, benefits, layoff, and termination. In addition, Gallagher will make reasonable accommodations to known physical or mental limitations of an otherwise qualified applicant with a disability, unless the accommodation would impose an undue hardship on the operation of our business.
jobdescription.224: Planning Analyst, Modelling & Geospatial Analysis (MOD000N)  Employee Status: Regular  Barganing Unit: Non-Union  Pay Range: 63,958.00 - 87,476.00  Location: Head Office  Closing Date: 14-Mar-2021 Metrolinx is connecting communities across the Greater Golden Horseshoe. Metrolinx operates GO Transit and UP Express, as well as the PRESTO fare payment system. We are also building new and improved rapid transit, including GO Expansion, Light Rail Transit routes, and major expansions to Toronto’s subway system, to get people where they need to go, better, faster and easier. Metrolinx is an agency of the Government of Ontario. We embody our values in everything that we do. We Serve with Passion, Think Forward, and Play as a Team. If you can relate, we want to hear from you! Our Research & Planning Analytics Office is seeking an Analyst, Modelling & Geomatics to conduct technical transportation analysis that supports corporate business objectives and long-term planning that furthers the development and implementation of the Regional Transportation Plan (RTP) for the Greater Toronto and Hamilton Area (GTHA).  What will I be doing? Conducts technical analysis and research that provides critical inputs to the transportation systems and policy planning, project appraisal, infrastructure delivery, and strategic business decisions that support the RTP, corporate planning, and the assessment of transportation infrastructure, transit service, and policy initiatives. Maintains, selects, and applies computer-based analytical tools (e.g. travel demand models, statistical models, spreadsheets, databases, and Geographic Information Systems) to support: Evidence-based assessment and analysis of transportation planning issues and proposals Forecasting of transit ridership, demand patterns, network impacts, and benefits in response to growth, changing markets, policies, service changes, and infrastructure projects/plans Collection, tabulation, trend analysis, and visualization of complex and large datasets Obtains support, shares information, and works closely with internal and external stakeholders (e.g. municipal partners, provincial ministries, and other advisory groups) to achieve Metrolinx corporate objectives and to define, implement, and monitor projects, policies, programs, guidelines, standards, and other initiatives. Reviews and prepares corporate responses to studies, contracts, work scopes, projects, and other proposals by internal and external stakeholders, providing relevant technical commentary, recommendations, and advice. Formulates, evaluates, documents, and presents data analysis, research, and forecasting proposals, results, and associated recommendations for Senior Advisor, Management and/or Board approval and consideration.  What skills and qualifications do I need?  Completion of a degree in Urban and Regional Transportation Planning, Engineering, Land Use Planning, Mathematics, Data Science, or related field or a combination of education, training and experience deemed equivalent. Minimum two (2) years’ experience in transportation planning, preferably in the public sector Minimum two (2) years’ experience in data science, Geographic Information Systems (GIS), or other fields with a strong emphasis on quantitatively based data analysis is an asset. Proven analytical skills with practical experience in technical analysis, undertaking literature and best practice reviews, and conducting internet and survey research using supporting spreadsheets and database applications. Interpersonal and oral/written communication and consultation skills to develop and present research findings and analyses and obtain cooperation with stakeholders and clients. Practical experience with transportation demand modelling software (e.g. EMME, TransCAD, VISUM), statistical analysis software (e.g. STATA, SAS, R), GIS software (e.g. ArcGIS), and/or computer programming languages (e.g. Python) is a significant asset. Knowledge of the theory, principles, research methodologies, and practices of transportation modelling, transportation planning and policy analysis is an asset.  Accommodation: Accommodation will be provided throughout the hiring process, as required. Applicants must make their needs known in advance. Application Process: All applicants must be legally entitled to work in Canada. Metrolinx will be using email to communicate with you for all job competitions. It is your responsibility to include an updated email address that is checked daily and accepts emails from unknown users. As we send time sensitive correspondence, we recommend that you check your email regularly. If no response is received, we will assume you are no longer interested in pursuing the opportunity. Please be advised that a Criminal Record Check may be required of the successful candidate. Should it be determined that any background information provided be misleading, inaccurate or incorrect, Metrolinx reserves the right to discontinue with the consideration of your application. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted. AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER
jobdescription.225: Adresse : 55 Bloor Street West Groupe de famille d'emploi : Analyses données et rapports The Financial Crimes Unit (FCU) brings together our Cybersecurity, Fraud, Physical Security and Resilience Planning capabilities to address the ever-growing and increasingly complex global security environment. It is a highly collaborative effort that greatly enhances BMO’s ability to rapidly prevent, detect, respond to, and recover from all security & crisis threats. This position offers a unique experience to learn from experienced leaders in the industry, join a team building the 21st century model for security and helping grow the good by protecting our customers and communities.  Consults on analytical solutions to understand, analyze, and synthesize requirements, goals and objectives relative to data and business intelligence needs and to enable high-quality, fact-based business decisions to drive better business outcomes. Provides advice on the configuration, functionality, applicability, and usability of data management, data analytics, and data visualization technology solutions. Supports the development of the strategy and roadmap for data quality and data analytics, data modeling, reporting, business intelligence, and the design and development of sophisticated decision support tools. Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders. Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide subject matter insights and recommendations. Designs, develops, and implements innovative analytical solutions. Designs and produces regular and ad-hoc reports, and dashboards. Builds reports and visualizations to effectively communicate data driven insights to users for a variety of audiences e.g. visualization solutions of data into reports, graphics, dashboards to illustrate facts, trends, and insights. Develops solutions and makes recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs. Supports development and execution of strategic analytics & reporting initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders. Analyzes data and information to provide subject-matter insights and recommendations. Develops tools and delivers training programs for use of reporting tools and self-serve analytics by non-analytical end users; may include delivery of training to audiences. Documents and maintain operational procedures and processes relating to analytical and reporting processes. Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders. Collaborates with internal and external stakeholders in order to deliver on business objectives. Focus may be on a business/group. Thinks creatively and proposes new solutions. Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules. Works mostly independently. Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed. Qualifications: Typically between 3 – 5 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Knowledge and experience in data preparation, data analysis, and statistical tool sets including but not limited to Spotfire, Tableau, SQL, SAS, R, Python, MATLAB, SPSS - Good. Specialized knowledge from education and/or business experience. Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth. Collaboration & team skills - In-depth. Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth. Influence skills - In-depth. Ici, pour vous. À BMO, nous sommes animés par une raison d’être commune : Avoir le cran de faire une différence dans la vie, comme en affaires. Cette raison d’être nous invite à entraîner des changements positifs et durables pour nos clients, nos collectivités et nos gens. En travaillant ensemble, en innovant et en repoussant les limites, nous transformons des vies et des entreprises et favorisons la croissance économique partout dans le monde. En tant que membre de l'équipe de BMO, vous êtes valorisé, respecté et entendu, et vous avez plus de moyens pour progresser et obtenir des résultats. Nous nous efforçons de vous aider à obtenir des résultats dès le premier jour, pour vous-même et nos clients. Nous vous offrirons les outils et les ressources dont vous avez besoin pour franchir de nouvelles étapes, car vous aidez nos clients à franchir les leurs. Au moyen de formation et de coaching approfondis ainsi que de soutien de la direction et d'occasions de réseautage, nous vous aiderons à acquérir une expérience enrichissante et à élargir votre groupe de compétences. Pour en savoir plus, visitez-nous à l'adresse https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/fr . BMO s'engage à offrir un milieu de travail inclusif, équitable et accessible. Nous apprenons de nos différences et tirons notre force des gens et de leurs différents points de vue. Des mesures d’adaptation sont disponibles sur demande pour les candidats qui participent à tous les aspects du processus de sélection. jobdescription.227: At Heart & Stroke we have a strong bias for action as we work to promote health, save lives and enhance recovery. For more than 60 years we have been fighting heart disease and stroke and our work has saved thousands of lives and improved the lives of millions of others. We are committed to a culture that exemplifies our core values: CHAMPION Health, PRACTICE Humility, EMBRACE Change, DRIVE impact, LEARN and GROW and BE HEARTFELT Who we need This is a full time, contract opportunity backfilling for a maternity leave (May 2021 - July 2022). The Senior Analyst is responsible for supporting the Direct Marketing, Brand Marketing and Lottery teams with data selection, analysis, segmentation, data and vendor management, as well as helping to develop, execute and report on media campaigns. The ideal candidate is a self-starter, experienced in the running of multi-channel campaigns. They are a critical thinker with a drive to research, explore and analyze data. This individual takes pride in deriving insight from data and has effective communication skills that support the movement of an idea from concept, to design, to implementation. The ideal candidate is results oriented and is motivated by making an impact wherever they find themselves. Working collaboratively with key stakeholders, the role provides analytical insights and campaign support in a fast-paced, fluid environment to ensure data-driven decision-making advances progress toward our mission. How you will make an impact every day Campaign Planning, Data Management, Segmentation and Analytics Collaborate in the planning, execution and evaluation of the Foundation’s multi-channel Lottery campaigns Work with key stakeholders and media vendors to plan media campaigns, track results and provide status updates during campaigns; recommend changes mid campaign to drive results Analyze supporter behaviour, and work with the marketing leads to develop and implement donor segmentation strategies Using data insights identify opportunities to improve donor communication, upgrade, retention and lifetime value Ensure the accurate completion of weekly, monthly and quarterly performance reports For donor segmentation and targeting define and write either directly or through a 3rd party the specifications for the extraction of data from CRM sources, Salesforce Marketing Cloud and Google Analytics databases for lottery and fundraising campaigns Ensure data that is sent to and received from external partners is accurate and timely Document protocols to ensure knowledge sharing and transfer Participation in CRM management including ongoing processes, UAT, QA, changing requirements and enhancements Working within the marketing calendar ensure critical dates related to data are met Build, manage and sustain the internal and external business relationships necessary to support the programs’ objectives, including key suppliers Work across the organization to keep informed of other Foundation programs and activities to identify opportunities for learning, insights and collaboration Build strong lateral relationships with IT team to achieve maximum integrations and synergies, especially the development and use of CRM and other projects that support the advancement of the team Budgeting and Planning Administration Provide data and insights to support the development of program leads’ annual and short-term plans Manage lottery data vendors SOWs and MSA. Assist with development of Media SOWs and Blocking Charts to support Lottery and Brand media campaigns. Monitor, research and share market trends, evolving thinking and technologies and the implications to HSF programs What you bring University degree in analytics, finance or equivalent Minimum 7 years of direct response and/or database management experience in a customer centered organization Experience working with CRM systems Experience working with Google Analytics Knowledge of data-visualization including Tableau and Power BI, or equivalent Experience reporting on mass media campaigns including all digital and traditional media. Solid experience and understanding of data to inform direct response campaigns An understanding of donor experience Understanding of customer file segmentation and strategic planning based on ongoing interactive communication Experience managing external suppliers and consultants Ability to translate complex ideas to layperson language Ceaseless curiosity and an ability to delve into the data to prove/disprove hypothesis Exceptional data querying skills using SQL, SAS, and Excel An extremely strong ability to translate data into action Knowledge of sophisticated data models including donor segmentation Exceptional project management skills and ability to oversee and execute on complex campaign schedules Strong ability to manage multiple demands Must be a team player with strong interpersonal skills including collaboration and consultation Comfort with turning ambiguity into process and action Apply now If you want to join the fight against heart disease and stroke while building an engaged and giving community, apply by March 26, 2021. To learn more about our mission, our values and the difference our foundation makes in the lives of Canadians at every age, visit our website. Candidates from diverse groups are encouraged to apply. We are committed to fostering an inclusive, barrier-free and accessible environment. If you have been contacted for an interview and require an accommodation to participate in the recruitment and selection process, please advise and we will work with you to meet your needs. jobdescription.228: At Rogers, we connect Canadians to a world of possibilities and the memorable moments that matter most in their lives. Every day we wake up with one purpose in mind. To bring loved ones together from across the globe. To connect people to each other and the world around them. To help an entrepreneur realize their dream. A sports fan celebrate a special moment.  Because we believe connections unite us, possibilities fuel us, and moments define us. As we grow our team, the well-being of our team members remains our top priority. To ensure the health and safety of our team members, including those in the recruitment process, our team members are temporarily working from home. Reporting to the Sr. Manager of Analytics, the successful candidate will be a motivated and energetic contributor with expert knowledge of BI & Reporting environments, Data modeling, Profiling, ETL tools, building dashboards and reports. In parallel the candidate will work closely with finance and business primes to understand and evaluate key business trends and to ensure the accuracy and integrity of financial results. What you’ll be doing: Development, validation, monitoring and tracking of key revenue streams & other telco business indicators Use SAS and SQL to extract data from “Big Data” sources Design and implement models that provide insights to usage patterns, seasonality and customer behaviour Perform statistical analysis/provide insight into unusual trends affecting the business Provide ad hoc reporting in a timely manner Keep on top of industry trends with revenue assurance and ensure we adopt best practices Drive continuous improvements in processes as business changes What you have: Masters in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or Analytics required Advanced knowledge of SAS Viya, SAS Enterprise Guide, SAS Visual Analytics, Databricks and SQL Experience in cloud deployments Azure, AWS, or GCP 2+ years' experience building and customizing detailed analytics Strong technical and analytical skills including rating/volume variance analysis as well as leveraging business drivers to better understand results Strong communication skills (verbal, written) and ability to present to senior management Self-starter, highly motivated, detail oriented and relentless in the pursuit of excellence Proven ability to build strong relationships while being viewed as a trusted and fair source of analytics and support Excellent planning and organizational skills and ability to manage multiple projects in a high-paced / performance driven environment Ability to partner with cross-functional operational and finance teams Ability to perform multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment, consistently meeting deadlines with accurate and detailed results As part of the recruitment process successful candidates will be required to complete criminal and credit background checks. Schedule: Full time Shift: Day Length of Contract: Not Applicable (Regular Position) Work Location: 1 Mount Pleasant (083), Toronto, ON Travel Requirements: Up to 10% Posting Category/Function: Finance & Accounting & Business Planning Requisition ID: 213043  Together, we'll make more possible, and these six shared values guide and define our work:  Our people are at the heart of our success Our customers come first. They inspire everything we do We do what’s right, each and every day We believe in the power of new ideas We work as one team, with one vision We give back to our communities and protect our environment What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. We work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You matter to us!
