jobdescription.246: Job Description Given the current circumstances, the resource will be working from home, 100% of time. As working conditions return to normal, they will be expected to be onsite. Business Overview The BI & CRM support group provides support for Customer Relationship Management, Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence applications for Fidelity Investments Canada. What You Will Do You will be responsible for all aspects related to development and support of ETL data integration solutions for Fidelity Canada. This includes analyzing data and developing Informatica Power Center mappings and SQL & PL/SQL code based on specific business requirements; administration of Informatica Power Center tool and IPAAS; working closely with other team members to ensure application availability, system maintenance, and on-call support. The Value You Deliver Work with other BI team members to develop Informatica mappings and PL/SQL code to satisfy business requirements Analyze data requirements and their impact to the system Perform administrative duties for Informatica Power Center application Perform administrative duties in Informatica IPAAS Perform ETL processes in Snowflake Execute unit tests to ensure the accuracy of code changes, and to verify that data integrity and performance requirements are met Participate in team’s on-call support schedule, works on incident and enhancement/maintenance tickets assignments and delivers excellent technical support Create and maintains technical documents, including data models What We’re Looking For University Degree, preferably in Computer Science 3+ years of experience with SQL and PL/SQL development 1+ years of experience with ETL development, preferably with Informatica Power Center 1+ years of development experience with Oracle database. 1+ years of experience with Snowflake data warehouse environment The Skills You Bring Experience in a Data Warehouse/Business Intelligence environment Experience with data modelling tools Development experience in Mutual Funds industry is an asset Strong technical and data analysis skills Excellent problem solving skills Customer service oriented Good communication skills Fidelity Canada is an equal opportunity employer Fidelity Canada is committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. We will consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national or ethnic origin, age, disability, family status, protected veterans’ status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected ground. Accommodation during the application process Fidelity Canada welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in the selection process. If you require an accommodation, please email us at FidelityCanadaStaffing@fidelity.ca . No telephone inquiries or agencies please. We thank all applicants for their interest, please be advised that only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Why Work at Fidelity? We are proud to be recipients of the following: Awards Canada’s Top 100 Employers (4th consecutive year) 2020 Greater Toronto’s Top Employers (8th consecutive year) 2020 Canada’s Top Family Friendly Employer (3rd consecutive year) 2020 Imagine Canada, Caring Company Canada’s Top Employer For Young People National HR Awards - Best Corporate Social Responsibility Program Award, Venngo Healthy Workplaces Award Workplace Benefits Awards – Health and Wellness Program Canadian Compassionate Companies Award Designations A Canadian Compassionate Company An Imagine Canada Caring Company
jobdescription.247: Requisition ID: 96905  Join the Global Community of Scotiabankers to help customers become better off. Purpose Contributes to the overall success of the Data Governance and Analytics team within Risk Management and Business Controls / Global Wealth Management in Canada ensuring specific individual goals, plans, initiatives are executed / delivered in support of the team’s business strategies and objectives. Ensures all activities conducted are in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies and procedures. The incumbent is responsible for the design, execution, and maintenance of reporting and analytics initiatives to meet business objectives with a primary focus mutual funds. The incumbent takes effective ownership of requests from stakeholders and ensures results generate value-added actionable insights pertaining to customer behavior, channel performance, sales productivity, and key compliance/regulatory, financial, and operational risk indicators. Accountabilities Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge. Acts as a subject matter expert for client, transactional, and product data for assigned domains; and proactively identifies opportunities to improve reporting and/or drive the use of analytics. Develops, executes, and maintains reporting dashboards Source, cleanse, transform, and interpret the data needed to deliver reporting needs. Designs and maintains performance metrics for key financial, operational, and risk measures Utilizes business intelligence and visualization tools to distribute reports and dashboards. Maintains periodic Management and subsidiary Board reporting. Leads analytics projects to identify insights to achieve business objectives and manage risks. Source, cleanse, transform, and interpret the data needed to deliver analytics projects. Use statistical and data mining techniques to identify insights and make recommendations Assists stakeholders in identifying and developing analytics solutions to meet business objectives. Prepare and present findings to senior management. Builds effective working relationships within the team and with key business units and corporate functions including Compliance, Finance, IT&S, Enterprise Data Office, etc. Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions. Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational risk, regulatory compliance risk, AML/ATF risk and conduct risk, including but not limited to responsibilities under the Operational Risk Management Framework, Regulatory Compliance Risk Management Framework, AML/ATF Global Handbook and the Guidelines for Business Conduct. Champions a high-performance environment and implements a people strategy that attracts, retains, develops and motivates their team by fostering an inclusive work environment; communicating vison/values/business strategy and managing succession and development planning for the team. Education/Experience Required – University degree in Business Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related discipline. Data mining skills in SQL, SAS, R, Python, HIVE/Hadoop and other tools (must have skills) Experience with business intelligence tools and in building analytics or financial modelling. Excellent mathematical, analytical and problem-solving skills to synthesis and summarize large data sets gathered from multiple sources. Strong communication skills (verbal and written) to present results to senior management. Knowledge of the mutual fund business, distribution channels, and regulatory framework is an asset. Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Torrance As Canada's International Bank, we are a diverse and global team. We speak more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. Our employees are committed to a superior customer experience and use the Bank’s six guiding sales practice principles to ensure they act with honesty and integrity.  At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.
jobdescription.248: OVERVIEW:  JOB PURPOSE: The Business Data Analyst, Client Service Centre (CSC) supports the efficient operation of the CSC, focusing on the activities of the Director and the Senior Business Intelligence Analyst. The Business Data Analyst uses business analysis and data analysis expertise to gather, examine, interpret, evaluate and report on CSC data and processes. This includes having an understanding of the workflow and business processes followed by the departments of the CSC, as well as the data managed by those departments. The Business Data Analyst is responsible for business analysis activities, including process documentation and requirements gathering, as well as data analysis related work such as the provision and analysis of data in response to requests for information from the Executive Director of Client & People Services, the Director (CSC), the CSC management team, other Law Society divisions, Benchers, Committees and Working Groups. The Business Data Analyst facilitates project and task execution as assigned, manages competing priorities, and applies a high degree of professionalism in managing stakeholders and their expectations. QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED: A university degree (preferred) or college diploma in Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Analysis, or a related discipline, coupled with relevant, ongoing education or experience in project management, business analysis, business intelligence, reporting and information systems. A minimum of 5 years of progressive experience in the fields of business analysis and data analysis, preferably in a legal or regulatory environment, which includes the responsibility of data analysis and reporting, as well as requirements gathering, process redesign and documentation. Excellent grasp of delivering superior client service. Knowledge of the rules, regulations and guidelines of the Law Society, Client Service Centre and the business units in the CSC. Strong interpersonal skills related to needs identification, business process consultation and relationship management at all levels of the organization. Strong verbal and written communication skills to facilitate meetings, effectively respond to requests for data and statistics, and to share and document information. Solid understanding of data and analytics. Knowledge and experience with reporting tools. Strong understanding of business unit processes, workflows and management control structures. Speaks in a clear, articulate manner, using audience-appropriate language and terminology, for individual and/or group situations. Advanced Excel skills: knowledge of pivot tables and VLOOKUP required Proficiency in word processing (WORD, Adobe PRO), spreadsheets (EXCEL), database software (AS400, Inspector, IRIS, Access), content management platforms (SharePoint), and the internet and intranet. Ability to conduct complex data analysis and reporting with business intelligence software (IBM Cognos Business Insight Advanced, SAP Crystal Reports). Solid understanding of technology, particularly application of technical solutions to work processes and procedures. Ability to perform data reconciliations between multiple platforms with similar data sets to ensure data quality. KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES:  Client/Customer Service Planning Works closely with the Director (CSC), the Senior Business Intelligence Analyst, and the CSC management team to coordinate the planning, allocation and prioritization of resources with respect to CSC operations. Reviews reports and other documents relevant to data requirements and provides feedback to the Director (CSC). Independently uses business intelligence software to perform analyses of varying complexity in order to respond to internal and external requests for data/statistics. Develops working relationships with multiple level contacts from business units within the CSC, IT, and other departments/divisions across the Law Society. Together with the Senior Business Intelligence Analyst, manages and oversees the UAT testing of complex technology projects, communicates issues, and recommends possible solutions or improvements. The Business Data Analyst is responsible for providing service to licensees and the public related to CSC processes and data/statistics, and for providing technical support and analysis to the Director (CSC) and members of the CSC management team to ensure timely completion of projects or tasks relating to the CSC. Client/Customer Service Delivery Provides effectively, timely responses to internal and external requests/inquiries and leads/coordinates the resolution of concerns relating to CSC data and reports. Contributes to ongoing continuous improvement activities in the CSC. Collaborates with all CSC departments and other departments in Client & People Services, and outside Client & People Services, on issues relating to the CSC. Prepares statistical analyses and reports for the Director (CSC). Performance Goals, Targets and Standards Monitors and reports on the achievement of existing performance goals and standards, and assists the Director (CSC) and CSC managers to establish and monitor departmental and CSC goals with respect to quality and timeliness. Engages in continuous process improvement with respect to the databases and IT systems used in the CSC, tracking and resolving end user issues, identifying and addressing requirements, and managing testing. Works closely with the managers to implement improvements to system capabilities and work processes with respect to electronic capture and communication of information. Works with staff across the CSC to coordinate major projects and Law Society initiatives, including ensuring that appropriate test scripts are developed. Team Membership Is a key member of the Client Service Centre team and ensures that the activities of the office of the Director (CSC) and the CSC occur in a systematic, coordinated and coherent fashion. Collaborates with the Director (CSC) and CSC Managers to plan and align operational requirements with electronic and personnel resources. Works with the Senior Business Intelligence Analyst and the CSC management team to provide support and coordination as required, ensuring that the CSC’s objectives are met. Collaborates with staff from departments/divisions across the Law Society to complete complex data/statistics requests. Works with the Senior Business Intelligence Analyst and IT to complete the analysis and data validation of database functions, with respect to the databases and IT systems used in the CSC. The Business Data Analyst works with the Senior Business Intelligence Analyst to provide leadership to staff in the CSC through guidance, training and problem solving in order for the CSC to provide accurate and timely information to clients accessing the CSC. ACCOMMODATION:  The Law Society of Ontario values and respects diversity. We are committed to creating an accessible, barrier-free and inclusive workplace, in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Please make any requirement you may have for a Code-protected recruitment-process accommodation known when contacted. If you are unable to apply to this position due to the requirement for an accommodation of any kind, please email us at recruitment@lso.ca.
jobdescription.249: We are a technology company that equips organizations to be agile and innovative, and for their people to be productive, creative and happier at work. That means moving them to the cloud, helping them build the workplace of tomorrow, and enabling them to make smarter decisions about their technology portfolio. By doing these things, we create success faster and in circumstances otherwise not possible.  We stand proudly for our people and support their success through career development and advancement. We are recognized and respected for our culture of inclusion and belonging, continuously striving to do what’s good for our people and communities.  The impact you will have:  The Analyst, Risk and Compliance will help safeguard Softchoice by building security awareness, helping with the management of risk and compliance issues and requests, and administering and maintaining Softchoice’s policies and procedures.  What you’ll do:  Security Awareness Provide security awareness training. Help to create educational content using a wide variety of content formats and different distribution techniques. Help deliver the program goals, objectives, and tactics. Work proactively to consider key cybersecurity risks, and how to help address them via training programs and process enhancements. Initiates, facilitates, and promotes activities to increase the level of information protection awareness within the company. Management of Risk and Compliance Issues and Requests Point of Contact to investigate reported information security issues and escalate to appropriate teams within the organization. Forensic analysis/Investigation assistance where required. Produce reports for management related to information security. Analyze data to provide insights and recommendations to mitigate any potential fraud risks. Participate in/or lead Risk and Compliance department transactional investigations. Participate in Incident Response Team as a Risk and Security SME Provide responses to customer security and compliance questionnaires, RFPs etc. as they pertain to supported programs. Create and/or participate in self-assessments, audits and testing exercises to ensure compliance. Governance Assist in the creation and maintenance of Information Security policies, standards, and guidelines. Maintain database of attestations, certifications, questionnaires, and compliance information. Execute program governance as it relates to Risk and Compliance for various programs and certifications. Maintain and update policy and procedure documents as required to meet compliance standards. Liaise with internal departments to obtain compliance data to maintain and update databases on a regular basis.  What you’ll bring to the table:  Foundational understanding of security-related threats and risks Knowledge of quote to cash processes Basic understanding of auditing procedures Exposure to privacy legislation and regulation, including PIPEDA, HIPAA, GDPR, CASL, CPPA Strong research and analytical skills Customer service focus Ability to work with and maintain highly confidential information Highly organized & extreme attention to detail Excellent written, verbal, communication, and reading comprehension skills Ability to work independently and in a team environment Demonstrated initiative Ability to manage a high volume of work, including ability to multi-task and prioritize workload; Technology experience – Computer proficiency; able to use Microsoft suite of tools effectively (e.g. Word, Excel) with aptitude to learn new software quickly.  Some reasons why our employees love working here:  Softchoice has been recognized as a Best Workplace in Canada by the Great Place to Work Institute for 15 consecutive years. Softchoice has been certified as a Great Place to Work in the United States for several years. We offer meaningful work that drives professional development. Our team members have 2 paid volunteer days per year to give back to a cause of their choice. We offer an opportunity to build a career in the technology industry. We have raised over $3 Million through our team member run charity Softchoice Cares. You will have the opportunity to take an ownership position here at Softchoice. Inclusion & Equal opportunity employment:  We are an equal opportunity employer committed to Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging. Individuals seeking employment at Softchoice are considered without regard to any protected category including but not limited to, race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, disability, veteran status, gender identity, or sexual orientation.  Require an accommodation? We are ready to help:  We are proud to provide interview & employment accommodation during the recruitment and hiring process. If you require any accommodation to apply or interview for a position, please reach out directly to asktalentacquisition@softchoice.com. We are committed to work with you to best meet your needs.  Our commitment to your experience:  We are committed to the safety of all candidates and team members. With that in mind, we have implemented virtual interviewing for all candidates. We understand that you may need to interview with distractions around you (such as children or furry friends) and we will most likely be doing the same.  For team members joining Softchoice, you will be onboarding remotely. Rest assured, offering a human and inspiring onboarding experience is our top priority.  Prior to commencing employment:  Completion of a satisfactory criminal record check, education verification and reference checks are required for employment.  EoE/M/F/Vet/Disability #LI-TB1
jobdescription.250: Requisition ID: 96272  Join the Global Community of Scotiabankers to help customers become better off. As a Analyst, Digital Sales Strategy, you will be responsible for measuring, analyzing and managing performance of Digital Sales across multiple business lines to drive towards our strategic sales targets for Canadian Retail Banking. You will also be responsible for understanding how marketing, seasonality, campaign cycles and processes impact digital sales across all digital sales channels, including Authenticated (owned) and Public channels. As a member of the Digital Sales Growth & Engagement team, you will be involved in supporting digital sales reporting, in-year sales performance management and identifying opportunities to drive value through strategic initiatives.  Is this role right for you?Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge.You will partner with Business lines, Digital Journey Managers, Digital Acquisition Specialists and other Marketers to ensure that Scotiabank positively performs to our annual and strategic digital sales targetsYou will partner with Digital analytics to support monthly reporting and ad-hoc requests to generate insights in an effort drive performance management across multiple business lines and Digital Sales overallYou will partner with Product teams and Business Partners to provide a digital sales lens for ongoing and upcoming initiatives as a SME You will help identify opportunities to drive digital sales in both the short term and long term You will develop frameworks and processes to manage roadmaps and strategic initiatives Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas in accordance with Scotiabank’s Values, its Code of Conduct and the Global Sales Principles, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational, compliance, AML/ATF/sanctions and conduct risk. Champions a high-performance environment and contributes to an inclusive work environment Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed? You have a bachelor’s degree, or related relevant work experience within digital sales environmentsYou have strong familiarity working with data sets and can effectively derive insightsYou have 2 or more years of experience in Banking, Data Analysis and Reporting, or Business StrategyYou know how to identify opportunities through insights to drive performance for digital sales You are experienced with building relationships and influencing decision making at senior levels of engagementYou have strong written and verbal communication skills with attention to detail.You are passionate about aligning strategy to business goalsYou have proven success working collaboratively within cross-functional and distributed teams based on strong team spirit, solid work ethic and good communication skillsStrong knowledge of Tableau and Adobe Analytics is considered an asset What's in it for you? We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity and curiosity and celebrates success!We provide you with the tools and technology needed to create meaningful customer experiencesYou'll get to work with and learn from diverse industry leaders, who have hailed from top technology companies around the worldWe hire you for your talent — not just a job — so you can grow with us. We’ll equip you for success not only in your role, but also in your career as a wholeDress codes don't apply here: being comfortable doesOur work from home social channel offers weekly virtual yoga, social events, learning opportunities, and contests to share current experiences & promote wellbeing in our new remote environmentAccess to thousands of online and in-person courses so you can hone your current skills, or learn new onesA competitive rewards package that includes a base salary, a performance bonus, company matching programs on pension and profit sharing, paid vacation, personal & sick days, medical, vision, and dental benefits that start from day one and much more!Free shuttle service to and from Union Station, onsite subsidized cafeteria with a chef, and an onsite fitness center *Some of our perks & onsite offerings will be offline as we continue to monitor federal and provincial regulations around COVID-19. Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto As Canada's International Bank, we are a diverse and global team. We speak more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. Our employees are committed to a superior customer experience and use the Bank’s six guiding sales practice principles to ensure they act with honesty and integrity.  At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

jobdescription.252: Bring your ambition, talents and analytics experience to CDW, where you can have a greater impact, be inspired by our mission and be excited about your job and future. A Fortune 200 leader, we’re the driven professionals and technology experts’ Canadian companies turn to most to solve all their IT challenges.   The Sales Analyst analyzes and interprets sales performance by geography, brand and product type and provides recommendations on areas of opportunity to the Management team including Senior Leaders. This role focuses on providing rich and actionable insights on sales data to increase productivity and effectiveness of the Canadian sales teams along with Salesforce administration. This includes responsibility for managing various sales and account system activities to ensure operational efficiency. What you’ll do Design and produce in-depth sales reports on a daily/weekly/monthly/annual basis Participation in weekly forecast meetings with sales leadership Consult with sales leadership to identify standard reports and frequency in addition to reviewing ad hoc requests for reporting and analysis Reporting and data visualization using Salesforce and PowerBI Salesforce administration Perform analysis by individual Account Managers (AM), teams and regions by customer, category, vendor or other criteria to identify opportunities and make recommendations to sales leadership Complete complex data analysis projects to support various company initiatives. Perform account coding at the AE/AM and FAE level Support projects and process improvement as required  What you need to succeed  Must-have  Bachelor’s Degree (preferably in Business, Finance, Economics, Accounting, or Math) 2+ years in Data Management/Analytics field 3+ years analyst experience with sales analysis or support, financial analysis, econometrics, or statistics Business intelligence tool experience Salesforce experience Data warehouse experience Nice-to-have  Excellent analytical skills. Demonstrated ability to analyze large volumes of raw data, draw conclusions, and develops actionable recommendations. Strong organizational skills and attention to detail Excellent verbal and written communication skills proven ability to build and maintain strong cross functional relationships Proficient in Microsoft Office applications Expert-level Excel skills History of balancing multiple time-sensitive priorities simultaneously with the ability to adapt to the changing needs of the business while meeting deadlines Self-starter with ability to work independently with little supervision SQL Server Management experience Project management experience Who we are  CDW is a leading technology solutions provider to business, government, education and healthcare organizations in Canada, the United States, and the United Kingdom. Our fingerprints can be found on technology in workplaces of more than 250,000 companies; from fresh-faced startups to international conglomerates. With the breadth of products and services we offer, combined with the expertise of our specialists, there is no request too big or too small. A unified team of challenge takers, diverse thinkers and problem solvers, we believe when you enjoy what you do and who you do it with, you do your best work. And that means everyone wins. Awards and Recognitions  #178 on the Fortune 500 list  #81 on Glassdoor's Best Places to Work  #1 on Channel Daily News’ Top 100 Solution Providers List across Canada  Fortune’s Future 50, an index that evaluates the long-term growth prospects of major public companies Our Benefits  CDW offers a variety of benefits, perks and development programs that enable coworkers to perform at their best personally and professionally. We understand the importance of work/life harmony and strive to help our coworkers achieve it. Core benefits include:  Comprehensive package: healthcare, dental, vision, paid vacation time and sick days  Coworker stock purchase program  Coworker discounted purchase program  Tuition reimbursement for those wishing to further their education

jobdescription.254: At Aecon, we’re building the future and our people are at the heart of everything we do. We're always looking for exceptional talent to work on our exciting and ever-expanding project portfolios. We are focused on being the #1 Canadian Infrastructure Company and the first choice employer in our industry.   Position Overview Faster. Smarter. Safer. This is how Aecon Utilities is committed to delivering projects. We simple do it better. We are Ontario’s premier utility contractor and are ready to become Canada’s #1 utility construction provider.  Reporting to the Project Manager, the Data Analyst will be a key member of the project team working on the development and implementation of the Aecon Utilities digital footprint. Post-implementation, the focus of this role will shift to the development and maintenance of all in field data collection, dashboards, KPI's and predictive analytics in support of improving operational efficiency, utilization, and productivity. The ideal candidate will have a combination of technical and analytical capability, as well as experience and knowledge in construction operations.  Key Responsibilities Key member of the project team accountable for the development, setup, and implementation of a Telematics system and digital solutions across several Aecon divisions Accountable for the design, development and ongoing monitoring of KPIs, productivity reports, dashboards and predictive analytics to improve operational efficiency and productivity. “Makes sense of the data” in a way that can be read, understood, and actioned by Operations teams. Conduct detailed analysis of data to identify anomalies and patterns and make recommendations for outcomes. Utilizes data to anticipate gaps, identify unknowns and develop solutions. Maintain the quality, accuracy and consistency of our system configuration and data. Responsible for the creation, maintenance, review and improvement of processes and training documentation Work collaboratively with the Operations, Fleet and AeconONE teams to understand business requirements and develop best practices and processes. Participate in the planning and implementation of future system enhancements. Provide practical assistance and technical support to operations, as necessary.  Required Knowledge and Experience Post-secondary education [Specific requirement?] coupled with a minimum of 3-5 [?] years of related work experience. Experience in construction operations, with a solid understanding of equipment and fleet requirements, including tracking, production, utilization, etc. Strong computer skills – MS Office, SAP and Power BI Applications Strong ability to translate business requirements into practical solutions. Strong research, analytical, and problem-solving skills Strong oral, written and interpersonal skills. Experience with Telematics / Fleet Management systems is an asset. Experience developing dashboards, KPIs and analytics in support of business operational excellence. Ability to foster a cooperative environment between different operational groups and functions. Ability to see a task from conception to implementation. Ability to work independently, accurately and under pressure. Willingness to travel as required.
jobdescription.255: Position: Media Data AnalystPosition Type: Full-time, PermanentLocation: Toronto, ONDivision: Postmedia DigitalThe Company: Postmedia is a Canadian newsmedia company representing more than 120 brands across multiple print, online and mobile platforms. Award-winning journalists and innovative product development teams bring engaging content to millions of people every week whenever and wherever they want it.This exceptional content, reach and scope offers advertisers and marketers compelling solutions to effectively reach target audiences. We are always on the lookout for talented individuals to join our team.The Opportunity: Postmedia is seeking hands-on, detail oriented and motivated Data Analyst to join our team, supporting the measurement and development of Audience, Advertising and Editorial products for the Postmedia network. This position is based in Toronto.In this role, the Data Analyst will be responsible for developing goal-driven reports for multiple verticals, products, and teams. The successful candidate will be able to turn data into insight, with a focus on thoughtful analysis and actionable intelligence for stakeholders.We are looking for a data storyteller who can identify and interpret trends from a variety of sources, and give meaning to the numbers. The data analyst will also focus on how to tell the story of user journeys through our network through dashboards, reports and discussion with stakeholders.To do well in this role you need a very fine eye for detail, 3+ years practical experience as a data analyst, and a solid understanding of popular data analysis tools and databases. You will also need to have a strong background in using SQL to query, join and make sense of very large, disparate data sets. Media or agency experience is a bonus.What you’ll do:Collect and understand reporting requirements from editorial, product, sales and executive groups. Develop goals and KPIs in conjunction with each group.Observe and evaluate trends of campaigns and provide recommendations for optimization and plans to drive effectiveness.Proactively analyze data to answer key questions from stakeholders or out of self-initiated curiosity. Know your data and what it’s telling you.Data cleaning, quality control and maintenance with attention to accuracy.Documentation of analysis processes, and identify issues and solutions where needed.Create and maintain daily, weekly, and monthly reports accurately and with adherence to stakeholder deadlines.Follow established guidelines for data stewardship, report visual standards, and general best practices.Support initiatives for data integrity and normalization.Who you are: Skilled working with large data sets, using big data tools and scripting languages such as: Excel, SQL, Python3+ years’ experience with visualization tools such as Looker, Power BI or TableauFamiliar with different analytical methods such as modelling and forecastingStrong data auditing skills – being able to spot errors or relationships in the dataAbility to manage multiple priorities, ad hoc demands, and meet tight deadlines without compromising data quality and accuracyStrong verbal and written communication skills, able to effectively present results and recommendations to management and stakeholdersProven success in a collaborative, team-oriented environmentBS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics preferredShould you be interested in this opportunity please apply with a cover letter and resume in one document.Application Deadline: February 24, 2021We thank in advance all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates under consideration will be contacted. Only candidates legally eligible to work in Canada will be considered. No phone calls or agencies please.________________________________________________________________________Postmedia Network Inc. is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities in all areas of the hiring process. jobdescription.257: We are a fully remote company based in Canada. We are looking for a data analyst to handle all our data operations. We are currently using hull.io to fetch data from our MySQL database, hubspot, chargebee and intercom. We need someone to manage this operation to unify and map our data across these platforms. In addition to keeping our data accurate, we would also require visualizations and workflows to be created in HubSpot. Experience with hubspot is necessary as well as the ability to write MySQL queries. This position is for Canadians only and is fully remote.ResponsibilitiesCreate MySQL queries to retrieve metrics from our databaseUse hull.io to fetch, unify and push dataManage properties from intercom and hubspot that need to be fetched and pushedCreate workflow automations in hubspot as directed by marketing and salesCreate dashboards in hubspot to efficiently analyze dataWork with engineers to ensure proper JS snippets and webhooks are executing to track dataCreate a system to monitor and keep data organizedExperience RequiredExperience writing MySQL queriesExperience creating workflows, deals and dashboards in hubspotCollege / university degreeExperience using Hull.io (bonus)Job Type: Full-timeSalary: From $70,000.00 per yearBenefits:Dental careExtended health careFlexible schedulePaid time offProfit sharingWork from homeSchedule:Monday to FridayWork remotely:Yes
jobdescription.258: Location: Remote, North America. Eastern Time Zone preferred. TradeRev has changed the automotive industry with its revolutionary product. Built as a multi-platform live auction app, TradeRev’s online automotive remarketing system has made a huge impact in the industry and has acquired quick user adoption with a fast-growing client base. As a subsidiary of KAR Auction Services, Inc. and partnering with our sister company ADESA, we are continuing to expand TradeRev’s footprint in the dealer-to-dealer online space in the US and Canadian markets.  Why Work with Us?  Whether your Fun is in working with new technology, learning skills, collaborating with awesomely talented people or growing into a Specialist, Team Lead or People Manager, we want to feed this fire in you. If you have the work ethic, skill and motivation, we will help you find a path that leads you where your passion wants to go. So come on; let's have Fun together.  Our Core Values: We are FHAB. Fun. Honest. Accountable. Brave.  Take a look at our other benefits here: http://work.traderev.com/  Position Overview  We are seeking a Product Growth Analyst who will understand TradeRev’s business goals and clearly translate them into product requirements. You will be working closely with brilliant individuals including developers, product managers, project managers, designers and stakeholders (internal and external). Not only will you bridge the gap between business and technology, but you will be heavily contributing to design solutions that will enhance the customer experience. Responsibilities and Duties: Work alongside internal and external stakeholders to gather, define and review requirements, solution designs and user specifications Clearly document business requirements as an active participant in both discovery and product development process using Confluence Partner with Product, Design, Engineering, and Data Science teams to create solutions to operation problems, influence product roadmaps, and solution new products and processes Take ownership of the internal product documentation systems and processe Perform ad hoc data analysis to remove roadblocks and keep operations running smoothly Identify opportunities by researching and analyzing customer segments and global market conditions Qualifications & Education Requirements: A Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Business/Marketing, Finance, Computer Science, or other technical or quantitative field strongly preferre 2+ years experience in data analysis (at a software company, preferred) 2+ years experience doing quantitative analysis or statistical modeling Experience designing experiments A team player with an emphasis on building trusting relationships with others A tech savvy individual who understands technical terminology Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to present complex information clearly and concisely to varying audiences both internally and externally. Detail oriented and able to look at a wide array of choices to identify what will create the most impact for our users Problem solving skills are a must. Identify opportunities to innovate and execute against them High degree of competency using SQL queries to extract and manipulate data Experience working with Data Visualization tools (e.g., Tableau) We thank all applicants for their interest. Only candidates selected for an interview will be considered.  TradeRev is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity. TradeRev is committed to providing employment in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Any assessment and selection materials or processes used during the recruitment process will be available in an accessible format to applicants with disabilities, upon request. If contacted for an interview, please advise Human Resources if you require disability-related accommodation.

jobdescription.260: TD Description Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward. Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Department Overview TD Direct Investing is Canada’s largest direct investing brokerage, empowering over 1 million self-directed investors and traders with its full spectrum of powerful solutions and innovative tools to manage their investments with ease and confidence. As a member of the TD Direct Investing Product & Strategy team, you have the opportunity to work with results-oriented, curious, innovative, and adaptable people who share your passion to help our clients, and one another, to succeed. Job Description Reporting to Senior Manager, Strategic Insights & Analysis, and working alongside a team of analysts, this role will help drive and support TD Direct Investing's client engagement and acquisition initiatives from an analytical, process development, and execution perspective. This role will primarily focus on providing data-driven insights and decision support to various business initiatives, acquiring data in support of such work, as well as helping to develop robust processes and procedures, and executing thereon. Key accountabilities include: Developing expertise in querying various DI and pan-Wealth data-sources, and work with Wealth and Enterprise partners to obtain relevant data, to enable deeper analysis and the generation of value-added insights Building understanding of DI business results and underlying drivers based on client segments and also along demographic, geographic, platform and product-based lines. Performing and evolving DI's client segmentation analysis to support targeted organic growth initiatives and value proposition enhancements Analyzing, modelling, and forecasting internal KPIs, considering variables of profitability, behaviour, attitudes, channel preferences, demographics, and values Building robust processes in support of client acquisition and engagement initiatives, including auditable procedural documentation Executing on established procedures and control requirements, and ensuring proper documentation Liaising with business stakeholders on project needs, data specifications, timelines and priorities Contributing to a culture of continuous improvement (through process improvements, automation, improved documentation, etc.) Job Requirements Post-secondary undergraduate degree, preferably with a business/accounting, mathematics, engineering, or computer science focus Post-undergrad work experience in business/product roles, finance/accounting, and/or analytics/data science Familiarity with self-directed investing and/or the broader wealth management industry, a plus Experience with data extraction, manipulation, and visualization tools (e.g. SQL, Python, Alteryx, Tableau) preferred Proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint, including experience developing business documents and executive presentations with clear, compelling communications Ability to understand business questions and issues, think strategically, synthesize information quickly Strong analytical and communication skills, with the ability to communicate clearly and concisely Comfortable in operating in a dynamic, fast-paced, and sometimes ambiguous environment Ability to independently manage deadlines while multitasking between different projects Inclusiveness At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs. jobdescription.262: Janssen Inc. a Johnson & Johnson company is looking to hire a Senior Corporate Accounts & Operations Analyst to be located in the Toronto office.  At Janssen, we are dedicated to addressing and solving some of the most important unmet medical needs of our time in oncology, immunology, neuroscience, infectious diseases and vaccines, metabolic and chronic diseases and women's health. Driven by our commitment to patients, we bring innovative products, services and solutions to people throughout the world. Janssen Inc. is a member of the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson. Please visit http://www.janssen.ca/ for more information. Position Overview This position is responsible for managing trade activities and drive distribution operation strategy at Janssen. This person is a subject matter expert at an operational and tactical level. This position will also serve as the primary point of contact for internal and external dealings pertaining to our direct trade partners and supply chain operations. The main purpose of this role is to develop, maintain and oversee good working relationships with wholesalers, other industry partners and internal cross functional partners. This position will play an important role in the creation and execution of the wholesale distribution strategy allowing the delivery of strong business results, with high corporate compliance, against Janssen commercial objectives. Core responsibilities: Trade Account Management - Leads and manages the operational business relationship with Direct Trade Partners executing monthly meetings, facilitating quarterly business reviews; publishing performance metrics, areas of focus, and joint action plans. Report Direct Trade Partner adherence to Distribution Services Agreements (inventory plan execution, service fees, distribution service value, trade data and market share). Hold Trade Partners accountable for performance. Ensure data integrity and adequate data flows between Trade Partners and Janssen. Leverages Trade Partner relationships and knowledge to analyze & interpret trade data, identifying actionable insights to develop/create innovative business opportunities, driving value back to Janssen. Janssen Business Unit Partnerships – Interacts and collaborates with internal business partners across functions (co-lead S&OP’s providing market inventory position and wholesaler shipments to pharmacies), creating a partnership environment around delivering shared defined business objectives to influence and maximize financial outcomes for Janssen to enable market growth. Member of the new product launch, acquisition and divestiture teams; develop pipeline launch distribution strategies and ensure products are distributed successfully and on-time. Provide feedback on market demand, inventory and other relevant information to the launch team. Data Analytics and Insights - Review and monitor daily Trade Sales to ensure purchases are aligned with individual Brand demand. On a monthly basis; executes the delivery of accurate, relevant and “real time” demand analytics that deliver insights that help to shape quarter end and year end approach. Publish monthly BUD decks and shipment reports, delivering key updates and insights to month over month changes. Ensure integrity of information flowing from wholesalers into the Qlik environment. Distribution Operations - Executes Janssen supply chain processes to deliver product to Trade Partners/Pharmacies/Patients, in full and on time; ensuring standardized workflows. Leverage Trade Partner data to monitor, measure, validate and analyze rebates, distribution fees, provincial pricing adjustments, inventory levels and sales. Understand and identify variances, escalate to management when necessary; collaborate with partners to resolve discrepancies and maintain process efficiencies. Part of a cross functional team responsible for executing efficient and precise delivery of corporate ME/YE commitments. Identify and execute new innovative and disruptive solutions to a variety of complex problems in an evolving market (returns, contracts, cross border trade, etc..).  Qualifications  University degree is required. A minimum of 3 years relevant experience is required. Healthcare-related experience is preferred Supply chain experience and /or commercial experience is preferred Results and performance driven, who demonstrates personal ownership and accountability for delivering business results and disruptive innovation Strong analytical skills, generating easy to interpret reports. Use statistical methods to identify areas for operational improvements and suggested market insights to Business Units. Working knowledge of Supply Chain and Customer Account Relationship Management is preferred. Strong communication skills, ability to influence change with diverse audiences at multiple levels is required. Strong project management skills is highly preferred. Demonstrate ability to self-direct, act with sense of urgency and agility Strong attention to detail Bilingualism in French and English is an asset Diversity and inclusion are central elements of the shared culture across the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies. Attracting, developing and retaining a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities is essential to our success. We are committed to providing a respectful, inclusive and accessible work environment where all employees have the opportunity to achieve their potential.  Primary Location Canada-Ontario-Toronto-19 Green Belt Drive Organization Janssen Inc. (7710) Job Function Sales Requisition ID 2105902884W
jobdescription.263: Are you a business student or come from a STEM program? Are you itching to find a paid co-op this summer that will allow you to make an actual impact to the bottom line and be able to put what you’ve learned in school or online to good use? Here at Humi - we understand the importance of utilizing data to drive our business forward. We are looking for someone who is data and customer obsessed to join us this summer as a Client Experience Analyst Co-op. In this role, you will have the opportunity to help build a foundational reporting structure to empower the Client Experience team to make more informed decisions with data. Who we are? Humi’s mission is to help organizations throughout Canada foster their greatest asset – their employees. Starting with a powerful yet intuitive HR, Payroll, Benefits, and Insurance platform, Humi has established a leadership position as the only company addressing all of these needs in one place. With a potential reach spanning every business in Canada, and a platform that touches every employee at every business that uses it, Humi is reimagining the future of work. Humi is backed by the same group who funded Slack, Carta, and more (Tribe Capital), the top value-based U.S. accelerator (Y-Combinator), as well as several of the world’s leading angel investors. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We strive to create a culture that does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Why join the Humi Family? As a team that services the HR world, we are a team that understands you perform best in an environment that cares about their employees Be part of high performing team of critical thinkers that thrive on problem solving Opportunity to do meaningful work that will impact the business and not just busy work Continuously grow through formal and informal development opportunities and learn to work in a flexible, dynamic, innovative, and fast paced start-up environment https://www.humi.ca/about What you will be doing as a Client Experience Analyst Co-op? During your co-op, you will be working closely with the VP of Client Experience and the Data Infrastructure team to build the foundational structure for data and metrics reporting for the Client Experience team. You will be reviewing and evaluating all current data source processes to identify gaps and opportunities to increase efficiencies You will propose and contribute to the creation of a new KPI reporting structure for the Client Experience team You will advise and onboard Client Experience team members on the the new KPI reporting structure and tools You will ensure a high utilization of the new KPI reporting processes through coaching and troubleshooting any questions from team members You will work cross-functionally with different departments to ensure there is synergy with the central data reporting structure You’ll have the opportunity to develop and refine the following skills while completing your co-op with us: Pendo Zendesk Excel and SQL HubSpot data analysis and the ability to extract meaning and advise on action items from data how to improve data processes and utilize data visualization understanding and reporting on KPIs and key business metrics exposure to different departments and stakeholders develop your soft skills such as written and verbal communication, working within a team, problem solving, critical thinking and presenting What are we looking for in a Client Experience Analyst Co-op? You are working towards a post secondary undergraduate degree in business, STEM, or a related field You are highly proficient in advanced functions in Microsoft Excel You have familiarity or experience working with SQL You have strong data visualization skills and are able to grasp different data infrastructures You have a strong sense of curiosity with a thirst for knowledge and is continuously tinkering with new technologies and applications You are a strong communicator and are able to deliver complex information in a confident and convincing manner that is appropriate to different stakeholders You are a self-starter that has a can-do attitude who thrives in team environments You are resourceful, analytical and solutions oriented Nice to Have Skills: You have experience working with CRM (customer relationship management) platforms such as, HubSpot and Zendesk You have previously worked in a startup environment Please note that all successful candidates will only receive offers through the Humi platform and we do not issue offers outside of our platform. We do not make any offers of employment via social media. Please see our resource library for the best ways to detect fraud and fraudulent activity. wbeIfSGJiC
jobdescription.264: Company Description Make an impact at a global and dynamic investment organization When you invest your career in CPP Investments, you join one of the most respected and fastest growing institutional investors in the world. With current assets under management valued in excess of $450 billion, CPP Investments is a professional investment management organization that globally invests the funds of the Canada Pension Plan (CPP) to help ensure long-term sustainability. The CPP Fund is projected to exceed $1.5 trillion in the next two decades. CPP Investments invests in all major asset classes, including public equity, private equity, real estate, infrastructure and fixed-income instruments, and is headquartered in Toronto with offices in Hong Kong, London, Luxembourg, Mumbai, New York City, San Francisco, São Paulo and Sydney. CPP Investments attracts and selects high-calibre individuals from top-tier institutions around the globe. Join our team and look forward to: Diverse and inspiring colleagues and approachable leaders Stimulating work in a fast-paced, intellectually challenging environment Accelerated exposure and responsibility Global career development opportunities Being motivated every day by CPP Investments’ important social purpose and unshakable principles A deeply rooted culture of Integrity, Partnership and High Performance If you share a passion for performance, value a collegial and collaborative culture, and approach everything with the highest integrity, here’s an opportunity for you to invest your career at CPP Investments.  Job Description The Active Equities (AE) department primarily invests in common equity of publicly traded companies across sectors, geographies, and size. The department’s strategies are deployed across five investment teams spanning the Americas, Europe and Asia. The AE Business Management group leads the business management activities for the department including supporting the operational, administrative and financial aspects of the department. We are recruiting for a Senior Analyst/Associate to join the Business Management team within the Active Equities department. The Senior Analyst/Associate will contribute to key deliverables and initiatives in addition to core business management functions and responsibilities. The role is based in Toronto and will report to the Senior Manager, Business Management. Role-Specific Accountabilities: Reporting: Build automation and efficiencies in reporting processes Assist with Board and intra-department reporting and presentations Support review of operating performance for the department (e.g. analyzing operating expense and transaction cost) Assist with business planning and budgeting Execute on ad-hoc reporting and analysis to support business management and investment decisions Business Management / Operations Update and maintain department policies and procedures Manage the coordination of departmental data requirements (e.g. market data and subscriptions, marketing materials, internal websites) Coordinate orientation sessions for new hires in the department Support headcount planning and tracking recruitment activities Coordinate requirements gathering and provide testing support for new departmental systems and tools Assist with the preparation of the department offsite Other relevant duties and projects as assigned Equity Research Budget and Broker Relationship Management Prepare the annual equity research budget at the department and group levels Work with the senior investment team members on allocating the annual budget at the broker level Coordinate the mid-year equity research review Work with senior team members to collect broker feedback Work with the Trading and Execution team and Operations on tracking broker payments Develop and maintain a broker scoring process to ensure AE is obtaining quality research compared to payments made Support broker relationship management  Qualifications If you possess the following, we’d like to hear from you: Undergraduate or graduate degree in Finance, Commerce, Economics, Accounting or other related discipline. 3-6 years of finance and /or investment related experience; Experience in financial/management reporting, databases and/or investment-process management is a definite asset. Highly organized, proven attention to accuracy and detail and an ability to produce high-quality work under pressure and with time-sensitive deadlines. Ability to effectively and efficiently prioritize and manage multiple projects. Extremely motivated, takes initiative and proactively seeks opportunities to add value. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to think critically and creatively to solve multi-dimensional problems. Self-motivated, flexible and adaptable to changing priorities and new challenges. Understanding of investment operations and processes, including IT platforms and analytic tools that support investments. Proven experience in Tableau dashboard development would be an asset. Experience with data-driven IT projects; programming skills (e.g. SQL, Python and Excel VBA) would be an asset. Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to build relationships effectively with people at all levels. Proven ability to work independently as well as to perform effectively in a team-oriented environment. Highly proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, Outlook and Excel), and keen on learning new systems and applications. Exemplifies our Guiding Principles of Integrity, Partnership and High Performance. Additional Information Visit our Linkedin Career Page or Follow us on Linkedin. #LI-AF1 At CPP Investments, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability. We thank all applicants for their interest but will only contact candidates selected to advance in the hiring process. Our Commitment to Inclusion and Diversity: In addition to being dedicated to building a workforce that reflects diverse talent, we are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible experience. If you require an accommodation for any part of the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms, etc.), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs. Disclaimer: CPP Investments does not accept resumes from employment placement agencies, head-hunters or recruitment suppliers that are not in a formal contractual arrangement with us. Our recruitment supplier arrangements are restricted to specific hiring needs and do not include this or other web-site job postings. Any resume or other information received from a supplier not approved by CPP Investments to provide resumes to this posting or web-site will be considered unsolicited and will not be considered. CPP Investments will not pay any referral, placement or other fee for the supply of such unsolicited resumes or information.
jobdescription.265: What is the opportunity? This position reports to the Senior Manager, Business Systems Analysis. This is a key project role that works with Business and Technology stakeholders and third party vendors. This person is responsible for documenting business analysis information, i.e., requirements, Use Cases, business rules, and others that support the Identity & Access Management (IAM) Program. The role will plan and execute elicitation of business analysis information on new complex systems or modifications to existing IAM systems through workshops, Process Owner interviews, and other methods. This position is part of the Delivery Team that collaborates closely with the Strategy & Design, Engineering, Quality Assurance, Support and Operations teams within the IAM program in the delivery and management of Identity and Access Management (IAM) services. The ideal candidate is passionate about collaborating with various teams, performing business analysis tasks, and has experience with IAM related projects. What will you do? Partners with the various IAM Teams to execute the vision, strategy, and roadmap within the unit. Define and develop, with guidance, detailed business requirements while identifying, tracking and resolving business systems issues. Assess, research, analyze and document sponsor/stakeholder needs in accordance with Project Life Cycle utilizing reporting tools, requirements gathering methodologies, process models, data models and prototypes. Recommend business solutions that satisfy sponsor/stakeholder needs continually exploring and assessing options for value-add for clients. Works with Project Manager to identify tasks and scheduling which feeds into the overall project plan. Complete end user documentation and collaborate with Change Management in the preparation of materials such as training guides, operations manual, and others. Develop and execute test plans to ensure quality of work, particularly for the User Acceptance Testing phase Lead and facilitate small group meetings and one-on-one interviews. What do you need to succeed? Must-haves Bachelor’s degree in computer science/engineering or equivalent work experience Experience as a Business Systems Analyst eliciting functional and non-functional requirements within Identity and Access Management (must have) Demonstrated Identity and Access Management project experience (Business roles, entitlements catalogue, User Access Provisioning, Privileged Access Management) Experience in validating system or process needs, changes, gap analysis, UAT, User cases and stories, process mapping Experience using Visio, MS Project, HP ALM, Confluence, Jira Nice-to have SailPoint IdentityIQ (IIQ) or CyberArk experience Cloud suite and services experience - AWS, Azure Certified CBAP/CCBA/ECBA Agile project experience What’s in it for you?  We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual. A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses, flexible benefits and competitive compensation Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities Opportunities to work with the best in the field Ability to make a difference and lasting impact Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team A world-class training program in financial services Flexible work/life balance options Learn more about RBC Tech Jobs
jobdescription.266: Health Services Branch (HSB) has the mandate to manage the operational and accountability programs for physicians and practitioners who provide insured services through fee for service or other contractual payment programs. HSB has a challenging opening for a program analyst to conduct program research and analysis, respond to program inquiries, and participate in the development and implementation of operational policies, programs, procedures and guidelines relating to health service provider payment programs.  NOTE: The headquarters for this position is located at 49 Place D'Armes in Kingston, East Region however, the successful candidate may work from 438 University Avenue in Toronto.  What can I expect to do in this role? In this role you will:   Conduct program research and analysis Monitor and assess the effectiveness of programs, policy, agreements and services Assist in or provide issue coordination services and products to manage and resolve program issues. Conduct ongoing monitoring and review of programs to ensure performance and enforce accountability, and maintain effective relations with external stake holders. Participate in the development and implementation of operational policies How do I qualify? POLICY PLANNING /PROGRAM ANALYSIS /ANALYTICAL SKILLS/PROBLEM SOLVING SKILLS:Proven judgment and program planning skills to research and analyze program information to assist in the development of payment program policies, procedures, guidelines, and operational requirements. Demonstrated analytical and evaluative skills to assess compliance and accountability Demonstrated analytical, research and problem solving skills to identify, analyze and recommend solutions to complex or contentious program issues COMMUNICATION SKILLS:Demonstrated written communication skills in order to develop and/or contribute to reports, funding agreements, policy manuals, briefing material and correspondence. Verbal communication and consulting skills to provide information and advice related to provider payment programs. INTERPERSONAL & RELATIONSHIP MANAGEMENT SKILLS:Proven interpersonal skills to develop and maintain effective relations with internal and external stakeholders. Demonstrated ability to respond to clients, providers and other external inquiries to provide information related to program policies and procedures. Demonstrated ability to manage and defuse contentious issues and inquiries. KNOWLEDGE:Knowledge of or the ability to learn about the health care system, Ministry health care programs and health provider payment programs, including fee for service and contractual payment programs and related funding mechanisms. Ability to interpret Ministry policies/procedures and applicable legislation/regulations (e.g. Health Insurance Act, Personal Health Information Protection Act, Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act, Canada Health Act, Immigration and Refugee Protection Act) Knowledge of performance measures and financial modeling and research and data analysis methods to support the development and coordination of policies, guidelines and procedures. Knowledge of program analysis and evaluation techniques to assess the effectiveness of new/changed policies and programs TECHNICAL SKILLS:Working knowledge of a variety of computer software such as MSOffice (Word, Access, Excel, Outlook) and Internet search. Additional Information: Address: 1 Temporary, duration up to 12 months, 49 Place D'Armes, Kingston, East Region or 438 University Ave, Toronto, Toronto Region  Compensation Group: Association of Management, Administrative and Professional Crown Employees of Ontario  Understanding the job ad - definitions Schedule: 6  Category: Administrative and Support Services  Posted on: Wednesday, March 3, 2021  Note:  W-HL-161182/21 The information that you provide for the purpose of this competition and the results from this competition may be used to fill other positions These positions may be of various tenures including short-term assignments. Your information and the results from this competition will be retained for the purpose of filling vacancies in accordance with the applicable collective agreement or policy provisions.

jobdescription.270: On behalf of our Client, one of Canada’s largest banks and one of the largest banks in the world by market capitalization, Equality Street is looking for a highly skilled Digital Marketing Analyst to join their Digital Marketing & Sales Team to support them to leverage data and drive performance by providing actionable, innovative and elegant visualization solutions.  The Digital Marketing Analyst is responsible for the design and development of visual analysis tools, dashboards and reports This individual works closely with internal team members and leverages data to solve business issues and support business decisions and projects.   This is a contract role with an immediate start for 12 months with high chance to be extended.  Location: Toronto, ON (temporarily remote due to Covid-19)   MUST HAVE SKILLS FOR THIS ROLE: proficiency in Tableau, Data Studio, Google Analytics and/or Adobe Analytics   Responsibilities will include but not limited to:  · Take the lead on the visual design for all digital marketing projects in order to design and develop usable, elegant and highly interactive dashboards , reports and analysis tools  · Identify insights and trends through deep-dives into behavioural and client data to understand user experience and find opportunities  · Design, develop and implement performance metrics to support campaign measurements, analysis, and reporting  · Work closely with internal stakeholders to ask relevant questions, understand their key business challenges and identify opportunities for data analytics to make a meaningful impact  · Proactively identify creative solutions, visualizations and analysis. Communicate and present solutions to non-technical business users   You will be successful in this role if you have following skills and abilities: Strong inter-personal, oral and written communication, presentation and collaboration skills with the ability to work, influence and make an impact in a cross-functional environment with all levels of the organization Ability to anticipate, identify and find solutions to challenges that impact team and individual deliverables Passion for data visualization, design and software development. Strong attention to detail Ability to work in a fast paced environment and ability to effectively respond to rapidly changing business needs Creative mindset and ability to introduce disruptive thinking in the design and implementation of visual solutions Solid analytical, problem solving and decision-making skills Strong business acumen and ability to understand the linkages between your deliverables and customer values, customer first mindset Ability to work independently as well as part of a larger team   Requirements Professional qualifications:  3+ years experience in data visualizations, including a rich portfolio of dashboards, reports and visualizations of digital data in a business context  3+ years experience using Tableau, Data Studio, Google Analytics and/or Adobe Analytics (or other BI tool) for developing and designing dashboards and reports, ideally in data-rich and complex business environments  Previous experience in digital data analysis and visualization in a large corporate environment (preferably banking, financial) is highly desired  Demonstrated proficiency conducting detailed data analysis  Experience with other visualization platforms and/or business intelligence tools  Experience using SQL and other data manipulation languages to conduct business analysis is considered an asset   If you meet the above requirements, we encourage you to submit your resume to the EQS team for further discussion.  We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.  Professional qualifications: 3+ years experience in data visualizations, including a rich portfolio of dashboards, reports and visualizations of digital data in a business context 3+ years experience using Tableau, Data Studio, Google Analytics and/or Adobe Analytics (or other BI tool) for developing and designing dashboards and reports, ideally in data-rich and complex business environments Previous experience in digital data analysis and visualization in a large corporate environment (preferably banking, financial) is highly desired Demonstrated proficiency conducting detailed data analysis Experience with other visualization platforms and/or business intelligence tools Experience using SQL and other data manipulation languages to conduct business analysis is considered an asset If you meet the above requirements, we encourage you to submit your resume to the EQS team for further discussion.
