jobdescription.271: Business Analyst - Data Transformation Projects On behalf of our client in the Banking Sector, PROCOM is looking for a Business Analyst - Data Transformation Projects. Business Analyst - Data Transformation Projects – Job Description Project Governance & Reporting - Leads the Data Transformation Program in the Data Office. Assist with the Data Transformation group, Business Lines in all different business areas with their Data Initiatives to aligns with the Enterprise Data Strategy. Project: On going initiatives – BA will act as an intake/triage to understand what the request coming in is about and document the very high level ask. Looking at Data Initiatives across the bank, initiatives are coming to the Enterprise Data office for help on the data components, which require guidance from the Data office. BA will complete pre-screening of all initiatives, find out the ask, and determine where the initiative should be directed to. The work can be very complicated, every data initiative is different due to the business outcome the BL wants to achieve, along with the different Regulatory Requirements. Reason for request: Additional Workload/Initiatives – manager is looking for someone on the Senior end. Understand what type of request has come in, and the complexity. Understand what kind of service offerings the data office is providing. This role has a big documentation component - manage mailbox, assign intake ID, do pre-screening call, schedule discovery session, figure out what the actual requirement is, document into database, update meeting minutes A lot of coordination work involved - for audits, for someone else to pick up engagement. 50% of the time would be documentation and reporting - need to know the volume of engagement request received. 50% in meetings, calls, BA BAU work.  Business Analyst - Data Transformation Projects – Mandatory Skills 3 + years Working at a Data Office for a large organization - enterprise data office, particularly experience with Data Transformation Projects 7 + years of experience Business Analyst for a large organization – must have strong documentation skills 5 + Analytical Experience - analyze data, trend volume, different paths, reporting. 5+ Years – Customer Service Experience – understand how to resolve conflicts/issues Excellent Communication Skills – Verbal and Written Interpersonal Skills Ability to work with multiple colleagues, in and out of department Work in a fast environment Work Independently Multitasker, Problem-solver, conflict management Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Technology, or a related field  Business Analyst - Data Transformation Projects – Nice to Have Skills Previous experience as part of intake/triage team would be ideal. Have knowledge of JIRA/Confluence, Sharepoint, Tableau Experience with Creating Deck Presentations Financial Industry Experience PMP, Certified Product Owner, ScrumMaster Certification  Business Analyst - Data Transformation Projects - Assignment Start Date ASAP – 6 months to start Business Analyst - Data Transformation Projects - Assignment Location Toronto, ON – Work Remotely
jobdescription.272: The Master Data Analyst will play a key role in setting up and maintenance of master data in ERP system(s) and the processes that support data quality, data integrity and developing the documentation to support it. The individual will be responsible to ensure data accuracy, completeness, consistency, and conformity according to Business requirements. Analyze and resolve all EDI issues in processes and maintain accuracy in all inbound and outbound documents and perform troubleshoot on processes and analyze all errors  Specific Key Responsibilities & Duties  a) Data Governance: Defines, designs, and builds data, data structures and processes to meet business needs Promotes data governance by ensuring quality and accuracy of including but not limited to customer/material/supplier master data through execution of the annual governance plan where scheduled checks and balances are performed  b) Data Management: Responsible for data collections, entry, and loading master data into ERP(s) Identifies areas for data quality improvements and helps to resolve data quality problems through the appropriate choice of error detection and correction, process control and improvement, or process design strategies In collaboration with subject matter experts and department leads, defines and implements data strategy, policies, controls, and programs to ensure the organizations data is accurate, complete, secure, and reliable Manage all request for changes and creations to Master Data records to ensure proper approvals were provided following Business Validation processes  c) EDI  Responsible for troubleshooting, researching and analyzing error handling and exception reporting and reprocessing EDI activities as needed. Participate in EDI related projects, implement and monitor EDI systems, including data mapping, translation and interface Develop and maintain EDI documentatio  Knowledge, Skills & Abilities Requirements Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience. Bachelor's degree in information science, data management, computer science or related field preferred. Experience in ERP or MRP systems in a manufacturing environment. 5+ years’ experience in master data Ability to manage priorities in continually changing environment, and to solve problems with high attention to detail. Great communication skills to facilitate projects with the ERP vendor, team members, external data providers, and management. Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office applications (Outlook, Word, Excel etc.) Good analytical and problem-solving skills. jobdescription.273: Create better business outcomes with your analytical acumen and creativity. .Join our team We are the Digital Strategy (Channel & Customer Experience) team, and we have one single objective - using technology to deliver the very best possible user experience. Whether you’re a customer exploring our products and pricing online, a sales rep providing a quote, or a dealer submitting an order, our team is committed to ensuring your experience with our systems is seamless. We sit within the TELUS Business Marketing team, and we support everything from small to mid-market businesses, as well as both our wireless and wireline suites of products. Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together Are you passionate about using data to drive customer experience improvements? By generating insights and recommendations, you can help us meet the needs of our customers: small to mid-market business owners. As a Senior Business Analyst on the Experience Strategy team, you will use your aptitude for analytics, expertise with data visualization tools and creative thinking, to pinpoint pivotal opportunities for improvement to our customer and channel journeys, which will then guide key strategic recommendations. Here's how You will be the team’s customer analytics muscle - identifying, tracking and driving on key user experience metrics such as L2R, digital adoption and automation rate You will help senior leaders visualize and understand our customer experience opportunities by building dashboards and presentations that showcase customer experience metrics You will be a data champion, advocating for data driven decision-making and helping guide the team with your insights; you are an integral part of determining what the team will focus and deliver on You will own the complete L2R insights program for small and mid-market business, including preparing/auditing the data, analyzing the results and sharing insights with the team Qualifications  You're the missing piece of the puzzle Data Miner You love digging into a new set of data; you’ll analyze it, pivot it, and seek out new trends - all in pursuit of getting the best possible market insights You are an Excel whiz and are comfortable with data visualization tools (e.g. Domo, Tableau etc.); as well RStudio and/or you are well-versed in R Detective You love investigating the “why” or “so what” behind the data, and your intense curiosity drives you to ask questions and get to the true heart of the issue Self-Driven You do this because you love the data and you want to understand what it’s telling you and how it can help us improve customer experience Storyteller You are able to use data to tell a compelling story, and are excited to share your insights to help drive decision making Customer Experience Focus You care deeply about our customers and are driven to uncover ways to improve the customer experience, big or small Who is TELUS?  We're a high-performing team of individuals who collectively make TELUS one of the leading telecommunications companies in Canada. Our competitive consumer offerings include wireline, wireless, internet and Optik TV™. We also deliver a compelling range of products and services for small, medium and large businesses; and have carved out a leadership position in the health, energy, finance and public sector markets with innovative industry specific solutions.  Everyone belongs at TELUS. It doesn’t matter who you are, what you do or how you do it, at TELUS, your unique contribution and talents will be valued and respected. Because the more diverse perspectives we have the more likely we are to crack the code on what our customers want and our communities need.  Do you share our passion? At TELUS, you create future friendly® possibilities.  At TELUS, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.  Primary Location: CA-ON-Toronto Other Locations: CA-QC-Montreal, CA-AB-Calgary, CA-BC-Vancouver Schedule: Full-time

jobdescription.275: Miipe is a dynamic organization that fosters creativity and growth. We offer opportunities to learn and challenge yourself in a fast paced software consulting firm, working alongside large Fortune 500 clients in a myriad of industries, such as banking, telecommunications, insurance, utilities and technology. As a leader in our field, we are rapidly growing and looking for bright and talented individuals to join our team. In addition to working with great people in a supportive work culture, we offer competitive compensation, a comprehensive benefits package, and a company culture that values each member and encourages professional growth and development. If you are interested in working for an innovative and dynamic organization, then Miipe is the right place for you! We are currently looking for a Intermediate Business Analyst to join our team. Responsibilities: Gathering and documenting the business requirements and then ensuring that the deliverables produced by the development effort conform to the business requirements. Beyond the facilitation of the up-front business requirements and system requirements gathering sessions and resulting documentation, the role also involves driving the system functional testing and user acceptance testing process, including preparation of acceptance criteria, review of the test plans and scenarios, review of test results as well as taking responsibility for end to end testing. In some cases the Business Analyst also executes test cases and directly ensures system integrity. The management of the normalization period - defect management and communication to the operational team The Business Analyst is also involved in reviewing key development and design deliverables, including interface specifications, integration requirements, data schemas, and design documentation, as well as the business’s implementation and conversion strategies and plans. Contributing to the project planning and administration. The Business Analyst assists in developing the project charter documentation, business requirements documentation, solution design reviews, process documentation, test plan and test case creation. In addition, the Business Analyst helps co-ordinate the project by arranging project meetings, resolution of roadblocks, following up on issues and sign-offs, producing status documentation and informing team members of decisions made. Essential skills and competencies: Bachelor’s degree 4+ years of work experience as Business Analyst Experience with payment processing/ insurance Multi-tiered application development, infrastructure and networking concepts and practices Dealing with multiple vendors in the creation of end to end solutions You are analytical and understand the basic principles of working with large and complex data sets You have the ability to leverage insights from data and metrics to make recommendations You have knowledge of, and preferably experience with, visualization tools You are able to manage multiple projects and priorities You are a self starter who is comfortable working with and presenting to all management levels (up to Executive VP) Excellent verbal and written communication and negotiation skills Leadership experience defining requirements and solutions related to operational processes Absolute ability to see the business problem and business solution in the eyes of the customer Computer proficiency with Microsoft Office tools (Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Project, Visio) Due to high volume of applications, only qualified candidates will be contacted. Applications will not be acknowledged in writing. nUeXzU1nrL
jobdescription.277: Analyst, Planning Analytics (PLA001J)  Employee Status: Regular  Barganing Unit: Non-Union  Pay Range: 63,958.00 - 87,476.00  Location: Head Office  Closing Date: 14-Mar-2021 Metrolinx is connecting communities across the Greater Golden Horseshoe. Metrolinx operates GO Transit and UP Express, as well as the PRESTO fare payment system. We are also building new and improved rapid transit, including GO Expansion, Light Rail Transit routes, and major expansions to Toronto’s subway system, to get people where they need to go, better, faster and easier. Metrolinx is an agency of the Government of Ontario. We embody our values in everything that we do. We Serve with Passion, Think Forward, and Play as a Team. If you can relate, we want to hear from you! Our Planning Analytics Office is seeking an Analyst, Planning Analytics to carry out research and analytical studies related to the development of business cases for transportation projects.  What will I be doing? Creates and updates economic and financial models using Excel and other tools to determine costs and benefits of transportation projects Conducts comprehensive research and analytical studies to develop Metrolinx business cases for assessing major capital projects and supporting implementation of the Greater Toronto-Hamilton Area (GTHA)’s Regional Transportation Plan Provides advanced, current information regarding emerging policy issues Reviews and analyses studies from internal and external sources (e.g. Ministry and municipal partners, consultants, non-government organizations, and academic sources) to ensure accuracy, consistency and validity of data analysis and findings Assists in the development of briefing notes, presentations and reports with analysis and recommendations while ensuring consistency with government transportation goals, objectives and guidelines Conducts research and prepares input that addresses transportation project evaluation issues raised in the Chair, President & CEO and Chief Planning and Development Officer’s correspondence and/or external reports and studies related to transportation, project evaluation and business case analysis. Conducts detailed analysis to develop recommended approaches for negotiations that identify and support the interests of all affected parties and avoid compromising Metrolinx’s transportation objectives  What skills and qualifications do I need?  Completion of a university degree in Urban Planning, Economics, Applied Sciences, Transportation, or related field or a combination of education, training and experience deemed equivalent; Master’s level education is preferred Minimum four (4) years’ experience in analytical research and statistical analysis methods and techniques to develop study designs and procedural methods, evaluate study results and recommend transportation concepts Transportation economics theory and principles, transportation financial and policy analysis, including project assessment, evaluation and planning processes, land use, transportation planning and transportation modelling Land use planning, multi-modal transportation theory and environmental issues and processes to assess regional transportation requirements in accordance with Metrolinx objectives and determine social, economic and environmental impacts Data gathering and modeling techniques to conduct and facilitate data gathering and analysis, ensuring validity of data and consistency with government guidelines Current transportation/transit landscape with respect to various provincial, municipal and transit agency and stakeholder actors Research, analytical and problem solving skills to assess research requirements, determine data sources and appropriate analytical techniques, assess implications of findings on the business unit and organization and assess relevance of latest developments in statistical analysis for Metrolinx applications Communication and stakeholder management skills to maintain liaison with internal and external contacts, provide advice to program management, and participate in technical projects and task groups Computer skills to analyze and present data, prepare reports, correspondence and graphical presentations  Accommodation: Accommodation will be provided throughout the hiring process, as required. Applicants must make their needs known in advance. Application Process: All applicants must be legally entitled to work in Canada. Metrolinx will be using email to communicate with you for all job competitions. It is your responsibility to include an updated email address that is checked daily and accepts emails from unknown users. As we send time sensitive correspondence, we recommend that you check your email regularly. If no response is received, we will assume you are no longer interested in pursuing the opportunity. Please be advised that a Criminal Record Check may be required of the successful candidate. Should it be determined that any background information provided be misleading, inaccurate or incorrect, Metrolinx reserves the right to discontinue with the consideration of your application. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted. AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

Ingram Micro Cloud, a business unit of Ingram Micro, powers the world’s largest cloud marketplace and is committed to helping our partners accelerate their digital business success by leveraging our hyper-scale platform technology, an infinite ecosystem of cloud solutions from the biggest innovators in the tech industry, and go-to-market support and resources to increase adoption and growth. With proven proficiency in SaaS, IaaS, IoT, security, and XaaS technologies, we invite visionaries to join our team and make an impact on this fast-growing industry. Data analytics and collection, provide trending analysis and drivers Create and maintain Reports and Dashboards Understand internal and external data sources. jobdescription.279: SOTI is committed to providing its employees with endless possibilities; learning new things, working with the latest technologies and making a difference in the world. Job Title: Business Partner Data Analyst Location: Mississauga Who We Are At SOTI, we are committed to delivering best in class mobile and IoT device management solutions. We are looking for out of the box thinkers that appreciate the art of creating great software. To us, being visionary is more important than doing things the way they’ve always been done. What’s in it for you? The People - From our humble origins in our founder’s basement, to our industry leading position today, SOTI has worked hard to foster a company culture that we can all believe in. A culture that emphasizes personal growth, continuous innovation and fun. The Growth - Our environment fosters new ideas, fresh perspectives, and the ability to take them over the goal line. SOTI is a fast-paced environment with a global reach that encourages you to make your mark and be part of something big! The Technology - You’ll get the chance to work with leading edge technologies and take on complex and interesting projects, as part of highly collaborative and agile teams. You will work alongside SOTI’s partners which include leading tech giants that will keep you on the cusp of emerging technologies. What You’ll Do You will be a business partner analyst working closely with different departments across SOTI to understand their business processes and reporting needs and understand data captured by sources/systems used by business units. Ability to translate and document business requirements into technical documentation, supporting document management and knowledge sharing Ensure assigned deliverables are within business / audit control requirements Take ownership of end-to-end design and all aspects related to development and ensure design and development standards and followed Create project documentation (Detailed design, Source-to-target mappings, Implementation plans, etc.) Develop data and database-oriented solutions in order to solve complex business problems leading to data driven decision making Develop data integration processes to integrate disparate data sets into a cohesive data model in support of BI and analytical requirements Works closely with data architecture to ensure proper adherence to architectural guidelines and principles Experience You’ll Bring: Excellent analytical, troubleshooting, problem-solving and research skills. Must be able to multitask and have experience with interacting within a diverse user/customer base 2-3 years of experience designing and developing reports and dashboards 2-3 years of experience using SQL or Python or similar languages to query data to do analysis. 2-3 years of experience with MS SQL Business Intelligence Stack (SSAS, SSIS, and SSRS). 2-3 years hands-on advanced experience using Power BI or similar visualization BI platforms. Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills 1 year experience with Data Warehouse concepts, including the use of Extract, Transform, and Load (ETL) tools. Experience using Cloud architecture, NoSQL databases and R/Python is a plus. Experience using building data pipelines to integrate with unstructured data sources is a plus. Experience in designing and building unstructured data stores using Azure or AWS technologies is a plus. Finance/business background is plus. About SOTI SOTI is the world's most trusted provider of mobile and IoT management solutions, with more than 17,000 enterprise customers and millions of devices managed worldwide. SOTI's innovative portfolio of solutions and services provide the tools organizations need to truly mobilize their operations and optimize their mobility investments. SOTI extends secure mobility management to provide a total, flexible solution for comprehensive management and security of all mobile devices and connected peripherals deployed in an organization. At SOTI, we celebrate the uniqueness of our global teams and are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are curious problem solvers who are committed to bringing the best mobile and IoT management solutions to market. We offer careers with #EndlessPossibilities. What are you waiting for? Apply today: https://www.soti.net/careers If you want to bring your ideas to life, apply at SOTI today. We are committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the requirements under the Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If you require accommodation during any stage of the recruitment process, please notify People & Culture at careers@soti.net . Please note that SOTI does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Services Agreement with agency/recruiter, SOTI will not consider or agree to payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee.
jobdescription.281: SITE SPECIFIC OVERVIEW: Role Purpose / Position Summary Maintains account activities of transactions and generates management reports. Follows evaluation processes to determine effectiveness of current operational activities and determine problem areas and develop solutions. Provides support for site operations and WMS, Performs application maintenance necessary to update records, specifications, and operating procedures of site specific systems. Provides product and systems support, configuration, and training. Key Accountabilities / Primary Duties & ResponsibilitiesProvides recommendations to improve efficiency of operations.Assists in the design and development of requirements for systemic enhancements that identify areas for improving service levels, reducing costs, and enhancing operations.Trains site staff on the use of systems and tools to ensure compliance with standard operating procedures and improve productivity.Analyzes discrepancies and assists in the design of procedures to reduce/eliminate site impact.Perform data analytics using SQL, Excel and Power BIInterfaces with Operations staff to review operating procedures and maximize system efficiencies.Provides operating support for site database systems, such as Warehouse Management Systems (WMS)Trains associates on using warehouse management system (WMS) and serves as site expert on WMS logic and functionality.Support and improves operations process flow and space utilization.Ensures operational system integrity, including setup and control processes.Coordinates with Information Technology to ensure site technical issues are being identified, addressed, and resolved within SLA.Monitors system performance, performs maintenance and backups as needed.Interfaces with customers to identify and resolve systems issues and maximize productivity.Performs other duties as assigned. Are you an innovative thinker who can easily prioritize and communicate key points quickly? Do you want to have a direct impact on customers and the overall business strategy? Do you enjoy managing multiple projects at the same time with the responsibility to keep them on-time and on-budget? Do you feel that your skills of thinking outside the box and working across multiple teams, functions, etc. are in need of a new home? If so, DHL Supply Chain has the opportunity for you. Job Description Collects and analyzes operational data. Assists in the design, development, and implementation of data gathering and reporting methods and procedures within Operations. Recommends procedural changes to improve efficiency of operations. Functions as technical coordinator and internal consultant regarding needs and requirements of Operations data processing. Responsible for tracking, analysis, and forecasting of storage capacities, inventory levels, equipment and/or manpower requirements. Follows established evaluation processes to determine effectiveness of current operational activities and determine problem areas and develop solutions. Serves as primary site liaison for Information Technology, ILD, LMS teams, and other internal departments as required by the site. Provides regular communication to site Operations and internal departments regarding operational issues, process flows, customer requirements, account specific issues, etc. Includes analysis, insight, and recommendations. Uses spreadsheets, databases, and other tools to provide ongoing analysis of operational activities (such as freight flow, storage capacities, transportation solutions, etc.). Assists site operations in identifying areas for improving service levels, reducing transportation costs, and providing other operational enhancements. Coordinates with Information Technology groups to ensure technical issues and problems are being identified, addressed, and resolved in a timely manner. May coordinate with ILD group on issues related to modeling customer solutions, including providing "subject matter" expertise for customer pursuits. Supports training of site operations personnel during account start-ups and on an ongoing basis as needed. Develop standardized and ad hoc site and/or customer reporting. May investigate and recommend new technologies and information systems. May conduct feasibility analyses on various processes and equipment; calculates cost benefits and business impact and proposes solutions. May partner with Operations to develop financial models to analyze productivity and payroll. Required Education and Experience Associate's degree in business, transportation, logistics, or related field, required Bachelor's degree or equivalent level of experience is preferred. 1-3 years transportation logistics industry related experience, required Our Organization is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process. Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities will be provided upon request.
jobdescription.283: Business Process Analyst Mississauga Job Description Job Summary The Patient Support Services (PSS), Business Process Analyst is responsible for the overall capturing of business requirements as it relates to PSS application change requests, as well as planning, managing and delivering projects with the department of Patient Support Services. Activities include the coordination and prioritization of requests that come in from our Program Staff and Customers of all new and ongoing PSS initiatives. This person acts as the business matter expert and liaises with our Bayshore Information Technology group to ensure deliverables are met during our monthly release cycles of various application toolsets. The Business Process Analyst is responsible for PSS program specific CRM configurations and maintaining InfoBay program documentation. As well, the Business Process Analyst acts as the business project lead and business representative on all PSS IT related projects to perform requirements gathering and sign off, project coordination of activities, timelines and scope creep, and the coordination of business resources required to complete user acceptance testing.  Duties and Responsibilities Duties and Responsibilities of Business Process Analyst include (but are not limited to): Leveraging tools and applications in Bayshore to manage and deliver system and application changes for the PSS department. Process map business requirements and process workflows to articulate business needs. Validate and test application changes and provide feedback to both business stakeholders and I.T. developers. Documentation of application changes and training guides, work instructions and release notes. Manage and prioritize with the business the order of operation required for application changes, and project initiatives. Leverage their project management skills to efficiently manage project roles, identify resource requirements, status reporting, define project deliverables and ensure the quality of projects. Collaborate with I.T. to ensure projects are completed within the established project plan, and delivered on time. Managing risks, evaluating, and re-evaluating change requests, maintaining the defined scope parameters. Both from a day-to-day perspective but also, from a long-term project perspective. You will be responsible for troubleshooting, anticipating and deploying solutions to issues as they arise. Provide assistance to team members, and clients as needed in application changes. Support and collaborate with the PSS Training & Education team to provide training and operational education to CRM users and on new application changes and releases to ensure best practice data entry is consistent. Complete system administration activities for the applications including new pharma launches in order to maintain the PSS specific configurable menu items, workflows and functions. Update InfoBay documentation following CAB approval or as program requests are received (enrollment forms, client materials etc.) Look for ways to improve processes and increase the configurable items in the application support process. Act as a business point of contact for level 1 application support and manage escalations to I.T. from our internal stakeholders as needed during implementations of application changes and operationally Track and resolve issues when escalated, initiating corrective actions as appropriate to manage delays or address system problems. Participate and lead our Change Advisory Board meetings to manage application release process. Provide Business Applications Manager progress updates on initiatives and deliverables. Establish and manage relationships with customer business and project stakeholders. Escalate as required to Management when additional help or resources are required. Complete other tasks as required by BSRx Management.  Job Qualification Qualifications Bachelors or College Diploma in Systems Analysis, Business Analysis, or equivalent work experience. Experience leading or supporting health care project implementations is an asset. Experience with Use case diagramming, workflow and business analysis documentation methodologies. 1-3 years’ experience working with clinical teams to develop and implement application changes. 2-4-6 years’ experience documenting business requirements and articulating those requirements to I.T. professionals. Experience working with MS CRM, Procura, MS Sharepoint, BSRx Connex, MS Project, Excel, Powerpoint Experience working with specialty pharmaceuticals and an understanding of home health services is an asset. Experience with and an understanding a variety of roles within Patient Support programs, Specialty pharmacy, Reimbursement services also an asset. Ability to work independently or within a team environment. Strong communication skills and ability to communicate cross-functionally in a variety of mediums. Ability to handle difficult situations and solve problems in a rapid fashion Ability to handle difficult and stressful situations with diplomacy and ease Strong analytical and problem solving skills Client Focused, and ability to act with a clear sense of urgency Proven ability to drive continuous improvement processes Bilingual (English and French) is an asset
jobdescription.285: TD Description Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward. Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Department Overview The Digital Marketing Analytics & Insights function within Marketing is a central source of internal and external digital insights and data analytics which supports both corporate and business unit strategies for TD Bank Financial Group Canada The Digital Marketing Analytics & Insights team mission is to be influential change agents and consumer advocates to help deliver the better bank and to drive shareholder return through optimizing the impact of digital experience. We do this by delivering hindsight (descriptive analytics), foresight (predictive analytics), and insight (prescriptive analytics) on how to optimize, personalize and strategize. The group seeks to deliver excellence in analytics and insights to support short-term business success as well as long-term strategy of the bank. The Digital Marketing Analytics & Insights team brings together a diverse range of technical and business expertise including digital analytics, website analytics, big data, cloud, E2E analytics, market research, business analytics, data science and modelling, business intelligence, data strategy and governance, data management and visualization. Job Description About this Role The successful candidate will be responsible for Personalizing the website experience. Digital Marketing Analytics & Insights supports the central marketing function within TD Bank Group with high quality, innovative, and insightful information to help build value for our customers and shareholders. Digital Marketing Analytics & Insights is a located in Toronto. It supports most consumer facing TD Bank Group lines of business.  Your goal as a part of the Digital Analytics team is to use testing methodologies to understand and learn the client experience and suggest improvements and changes to better personalize the consumer experience and return greater shareholder value. You will be a key player in the TD's personalization journey and will collaborate with different groups within and outside of marketing to drive change.  1. Translating key business objectives into insight rich experiments that drive a better experience and a higher marketing ROI 2. Testing different segment/audiences and thier impact on marketing ROI 3. Understand the business objective, translate those into a test and use the results to make informed decisions 4. Work in a consultative role to provide "value-added" insights in the form of analysis, interpretation and advice of website personalization  Your success will be predicated on your ability to forge strong partnerships, communicate effectively, solve problems, and continuously strive for achieving results. Job Requirements What can you bring to TD? Responsibilities: o Design/execute/measure website experience through testing methodologies o Continuously improve campaign design and delivery by leveraging any and all analytical tools/techniques at your disposal o Manage your project pipeline to ensure agreed upon timelines can be met o Proactively provide analytical guidance to key stakeholders, based on deep understanding of the businesses, to understand and enhance the personalization experience o Maintain a culture of risk management and control, supported by effective processes and sound infrastructure  Skill Sets: o Familiarity with website personaization through testing methodologies (Predictive Models, Experiment Design, A/B testing, Sample Size calculations, Net Performance Measurements, etc.) o Technical and detail oriented o Knowledge of leveraging customer data from internal data warehouses through the use of SAS, Hadoop systems, Omniture, SQL Servers, DOMO, Big Query and Google Marketing Cloud o A project management mindset to help deliver on time to specifications o Team player while able to work independently o Pragmatic decision maker blending a mix of intellect, experience and street smarts o A customer driven mindset Additional Information Qualifications o 4+ years of relevant experience in a digital marketing, A/B testing, website analytics, consulting, or agency-side role in financial services/telecom (or other high volume direct marketing industries) o Significant experience with Omniture/GA360 and website data an asset o Knowledge of testing methologies and clickstream data; knowledge of databases and data structures; knowledge of open source python/pyspark an asset o Experience designing experiments to test user experience o Degree in business, science, statistics, engineering, or other quantitative discipline o Track record of getting things done and solving problems Inclusiveness At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs. jobdescription.287: SENIOR ANALYST, DATA TEAM (Temporary Full-Time) – Extendicare   Extendicare is a leading provider of care and services for seniors throughout Canada. Through our network of over 115 operated senior care and living centres, as well as our home health care operations, we are committed to delivering care throughout the health care continuum to meet the needs of a growing seniors’ population in Canada. Our qualified and highly trained workforce of 23,700 individuals are united by a dedication to quality care and by our vision of being the best provider of senior care and services in Canada.   Candidates are invited to apply for the above position to work at our Corporate located in Markham, Ontario.   Reporting to the Director, Data Strategy will be responsible for development of data transformation processes and utilities, as well as supporting data analysis, clean-up and mapping from multiple systems used across Extendicare.   RESPONSIBILITIES  Data acquisition Research and create and execute queries to retrieve data from legacy systems primarily via SQL Create data retrieval scripts or other approaches as appropriate for data in non SQL DB format. Data Analysis and cleanup Perform in-depth data analysis on legacy data sets including Supporting mapping to target system Identifying exceptions, patterns, approaches to cleanup Directly engage with internal and external stakeholders to resolve data quality and data integrity issues Design and create ad-hoc data cleaning and transformation scripts and processes using tools such as SQL, SSIS, Python etc. Data validation - design and create scripts, tools, or approaches to allow validation of: data loaded into target systems (e.g. Workday) data alignment between multiple datasets internal data integrity of datasets   QUALIFICATIONS  5+ years of general data analysis experience including excellent understanding of SQL and complex queries 5+ years of general professional experience Bonus Skills Scripting or general programming experience Workday SSIS

jobdescription.289: Dermalogica Sales Data AnalystGeneral Description:This role is based in our Toronto office but reports into the Global Dermalogica Office in the States. Success is; generating performance enhancing insights through the combination of disseminating quality analytics across the business and from diving deeply into key topics. We need to empower people across the business with information as well as supporting our entrepreneurial culture through building, testing and iterating hypotheses. To do that we need people with analytical expertise and the motivation to apply it to prestige skin care.Our analytics agenda is moving at pace and this role is key to continuing to move us towards our goal to be industry leading. We have work to do to; establish a standard data model within a future proofed environment, continue to develop analytic tools across chosen software (Tableau) and to build analytical skills across the business.The right person for this role demonstrates a passion and curiosity in identifying and interpreting trends within complex data sets to deliver actionable insights. This role reports through the finance function to the Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) Manager but is broader in scope than simply financial/sales analytics.Key Job Accountabilities:· Sales Analytics/Performance Managemento Demonstrate ability to synthesize data and focus on key, relevant business insights. Ability to effectively communicate insights and recommendations that contribute to the development of business driving strategies.o Create models to understand how new business impacts existing channels and highlight the potential risk factors.o Lead weekly calls with key members of the sales team to review their territories to ensure that key drivers and emerging trends are understood, and there is full transparency of gaps to target (sales performance, innovation penetration, inventory levels, etc.)o Supporting sales and management team with tracking new accounts, compiling monthly/quarterly bonuses and commissions, understanding utilization and data in CRM platform, and any ad hoc requests.· Developing reports & dashboards across Tableauo Ensure the different corporate functions have the standard analytical tools to be self-sufficient in performance management.o Embed user friendly analytical tools for the team, which includes monitoring usage, shutting off what is not used, and having all workbooks assessible to the users in the proper formats.o Review current distribution of reports in Excel and determine what cane be simplified/automated in Tableau.Experience and Competencies Required: · Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Finance, Data Analytics, or other related field.· 3-5 years of previous analytical experience· Strong leadership skills (planning, communication, relationship building, influencing)· Expert knowledge of SQL, Tableau, and Excel required. Any additional business intelligence tools (Power BI, Alteryx, etc) or programming knowledge is a plus.· Excellent initiative and follow-up skills, and ability to carry out a variety of responsibilities.· Fast learner for fast-paced work environment.· Demonstrate an analytical mindset, enjoy problem solving and understand how to ask the right questions to deliver solution focused outcomes.· Courage to challenge established norms in a constructive way and drive change.Expected start date: 2021-03-15Job Types: Full-time, PermanentBenefits:Dental careExtended health carePaid time offRRSP matchStore discountVision careWellness programSchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridayWork remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19
jobdescription.291: POSITION DESCRIPTION  POSITION: Business Analyst – Environmental REPORTS TO: Director, Product Management Cority leverages its cutting-edge SaaS-based technology and broad EHSQ product suite to partner with organizations around the world to effect meaningful change in the way environmental, health, safety and quality is managed. Cority stands by its customers as they attain performance goals, reduce EHSQ risks, enhance corporate productivity, and create a healthier workforce. The company has received many accolades for its strong employee culture and outstanding growth rate including recognition as one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies; being shortlisted for the Canadian Chamber of Commerce’s Private Business Growth Award; and being named by Aon Hewitt as one of the Best Employers in Canada. LOCATION: Toronto, Canada, Carlsbad, CA, or Remote.  PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES: Aid with the development and furthering of the Environmental Product which includes:  Build the products into a best-in-class solution. Gather, research and develop requirements to continually improve the product. Document product specifications and collaborate with R&D to build prototype functionality. Problem solve design issues and bugs in the application, including documenting solutions and establishing priority for future releases/service packs. Support Sales-led demos (both remote and on-site, as agreed upon) as an application subject matter expert. Technical resource to Sales for RFP completion. Support Marketing documentation development, ‘thought leadership’ initiatives, and ‘social media’ initiatives. Key contact for product testing questions/issues relating to the Environmental Product. Key contact for helpdesk questions/issues relating to Environmental Product. Resource to Consulting for implementation support. Communicate and train internal and external stakeholders on developed functionality. Additionally, work with the product team on general product improvements and projects as required. Some cross-functional work in other areas of the product may be required.   QUALIFICATIONS AND CHARACTERISTICS OF AN IDEAL CANDIDATE:  Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Environmental Science, or an Environmental related field; and/or Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or related field. Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail The self-starting individual should have a minimum of two years experience working in an Environmental role within a large organization with a mature Environmental Management System or in the technology industry as a business analyst. Knowledge of Chemical Management, Air Emissions, GHG, Waste Management, environmental sampling, geospatial data representation (e.g. GIS-based solutions) and/or other key areas of Environmental management are an asset. General understanding of EU, US, Canada, and/or Australia regulatory frameworks related to Environmental regulations is a plus. Experience working with an EHS software solution is desired. An ability to grasp issues, problem solve, and suggest innovative solutions is an asset. Communication skills, both verbal and written, are critical to the success of this candidate.   ABOUT CORITY: Cority is an enterprise software company based in Toronto with a global client base. The company’s core product is a software platform that is used by large corporations, NGOs and government agencies to manage employee health and safety. If you’re interested in learning more, go to www.Cority.com Apply for This Job
jobdescription.292: Job Description:  Scope of Position The Senior Technical Support Analyst supports and maintains enterprise IT infrastructure services (Email, Active Directory, Servers, Networks, MDM, Firewalls, Security, etc.). They plan and execute assigned infrastructure & business projects. They research, recommend, and implements IT standards and records (e.g., inventory). Participate in the procurement process for IT hardware/software and IT service agreements. Day-to-day direction is provided by the team lead or manager as required. What you need to be successful Diploma in Information Technology field or an equivalent combination of education and/or experience and/or relevant designation required. 6 - 7 years of relevant technical support experience required. Experience developing system images and deploying images to computers and servers using various imaging solutions. Experience supporting, configuring, and troubleshooting issues with active directory. Experience supporting, configuring, and troubleshooting issues with Microsoft Exchange and Firewalls. Experience sizing, building, configuring, and deploying windows servers. Experience supporting, configuring, and troubleshooting issues virtual environment (Hyper-V, Vmware). Experience in project management fundamentals, with the ability to plan common infrastructure projects. Knowledge of security concepts and procedures (Encryption, MFA, Access rights, patching, vulnerability management, end point protection, etc.). The following skills will be considered as assets: Cloud certification; Security certification; MS PowerShell scripting; Excel formulas & data analysis What you’ll be doing Key responsibilities of this position include: 75 – 85% of the Technical Support Analyst’s time will be spent on special projects or activities (e.g. research, evaluate, and implement technical solutions). Deploy, support, and maintain corporate infrastructure systems (Servers, Active directory, MS Exchange, MDM, Firewalls, security systems, etc.). Plan and execute assigned infrastructure projects. Provide support to the Help Desk and work with them on transitioning infrastructure changes from the project phase to day to day operations. Participate in and administer the selection and acquisition of software, hardware, and related technology. Formulate and update hardware and software standards and policies. Prepare and maintain administration documentation including equipment inventory, asset management, software licensing and system availability statistics for computer and network equipment. Research, recommend, and evaluate new software tools. Assist with IT network, hardware, and software strategies. Ensure that adequate network and hardware security, backup, and disaster recovery processes are implemented and maintained. Provide off business hour attention as may be required (Support, maintenance, cutovers, etc.). Support Environmental, Health and Safety (EHS) policies and initiatives. Perform other duties as may be assigned Position: salaried - exempt Reports to: Team Lead CHEMTRADE is a publically traded (TSX: CHE.UN) chemical manufacturing and handling company headquartered in Toronto, Canada with 65+ locations across North America and Brazil. Chemtrade provides industrial chemicals and services to our customers in three main business segments; Sulphur & Performance Chemicals, Water Solutions and Electrochemicals. Chemtrade is a reliable industry partner to the Oil & Gas, Pulp & Paper, Water Treatment, Food & Beverage and Pharmaceutical industries and is committed to the codes and ethics of Responsible Care 14001. We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for the position; however, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. Learn more about Chemtrade by visiting www.chemtradelogistics.com or follow us on Facebook. #LI-POST #chemtrade123
jobdescription.293: We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients. At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute. To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com Job Description What You'll Be Doing You’ll lead complex projects to design strategic solutions aligned to CIBC’s enterprise architecture roadmap. As a Business Systems Analyst, you’ll support collaborative end-to-end project implementation and act as a subject matter expert in both business and technology following values, principles and practices of both Waterfall and Agile/Scrum delivery. You’ll participate in all phases of application delivery with a diverse team to create and build flexible, innovative solutions that deliver a best in class client experience. How You'll Succeed Understanding and Documenting Requirements – Work closely with business partners to gather complex business requirements and facilitate requirements discussions to ensure you meet project needs through daily scrums, JAD sessions and requirements elicitation sessions. Build strong relationships, lead discussions, listen and ask the right questions to ensure solutions meet requirements. Solution Design – Build client-focused solutions that meet business requirements. Prepare and validate requirement documents around areas such as scope clarification, business and solution requirements. Leading and Mentoring – Support end-to-end project implementation and act as a subject matter expert in business and technology. Drive to collaborate and support individuals and cross-functional teams to resolve organizational, operational and process problems within an agile environment. Project Delivery Team – Work with the Project Delivery Teams to identify, anticipate, assess, manage and resolve issues and risks related to requirements' activities and deliverables. Communication – Proactively communicate and collaborate with business partners to analyze information needs. Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with diverse groups, managers and subject matter experts and ability to negotiate (able to express oneself clearly and concisely both verbally and in writing) effectively to manage project delivery and project coordination of complex activities. Who You Are You can demonstrate experience in: 3-5 years of hands-on experience in a BSA role with preference in the digital space (Mobile, Web and Online) . You have strong knowledge and ability to collect and assess business requirements, prepare business requirements systems document, requirements traceability and user stories. It’s an asset if you have experience with software development methodologies (SDLC, Agile, Scrum, Waterfall, etc.) and digital applications. You have a degree/diploma in: Computer Science, Business, and/or a related field, and you’ve spent at least 3 years in a BSA role leading projects and designing solutions. Previous experience working in Agile projects and working knowledge of JIRA, Confluence will be an added advantage. You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it’s the right thing to do. You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You're confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way. You're driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to create a shared vision. Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard. Values matter to you . You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability. What CIBC Offers At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will: Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home Connect : Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, and individual development planning Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan What You Need to Know CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit Expected End Date 2021-04-01 Job Location 55 Yonge St, 12th floor Employment Type Regular Weekly Hours 37.5

jobdescription.297: Venture is a leading national marketing and communications agency that helps entrepreneurs build global brands. Working with entrepreneurs to carve new paths is our passion – whether we’re working with Canada’s largest corporations or the country’s most exciting start-ups.We are looking for a Digital Analyst with experience in retail and CPG marketing to join our team. We want someone with integrity, attention to detail, and, above all else, a self-starter’s approach to problem solving. In partnership with Venture’s full-service team, you will help the clients of one of Canada’s leading independent marketing agencies ground their marketing and communications in research, data, analytics and up-to-the-minute knowledge of markets, consumers and our campaigns.ResponsibilitiesAs a member of Venture's strategy and digital communities, you will work with colleagues and clients to:Conduct digital analysis, web analytics, and social and mobile measurement and reporting to discover key insights and provide ongoing recommendations to clientsParticipate in the development of goals and KPIs and the strategies to meet them, and apply critical thinking to ensure our campaigns are delivering the greatest results for our clientsWork with members of Venture’s Strategy, Digital, and Integrated Media teams to establish and set up measurement frameworks for digital campaigns and web properties, and to report on resultsPrepare and verify industry and client data reports in support of ongoing activities for clients or within the agencyConduct research related to SEO and SEM marketing, and provide recommendations to clientsMake recommendations to colleagues and clients regarding up-to-date digital marketing tools and trendsDesired skills and experienceWe are looking for applicants with five or more years as a digital analyst within a client or agency environment, who speaks the language of retail and CPG marketing and ecommerce.The successful candidate will have:Experience and comfort analyzing ecommerce, consumer and retail data, and providing insights-based recommendationsEnhanced familiarity and expertise with the range of Google marketing tools, including Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Data Studio, and Google Search Console; as well as PowerBI and Excel, with the ability to unearth and present key insights for colleagues and clientsDemonstrated HTML experience, and familiarity with WYSIWYGsExperience working with CMS systemsExceptional analytical, strategic, and research abilitiesExcellent communications, interpersonal and listening skillsExcellent writing and presentation development skills and high attention to detailDemonstrated success meeting deadlines while handling a variety of concurrent projects and assignmentsCompleted post-secondary educationVenture has offices in Calgary and Toronto. However, we will entertain candidates seeking to work remotely from other locations.To apply please send us your resume and cover letter.Job Type: Full-timeSchedule:Monday to FridayLicence:Google Analytics (Preferred)Work remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19
jobdescription.298: Address: 100 King Street West Job Family Group: Business Management Supports the business/group leader in the effective implementation, maintenance and administration of first line of defense (1st LOD) programs (e.g., operational risk, AML, compliance, regulatory, etc.), including overseeing business operations within the jurisdiction to ensure adherence and efficiency. Contributes to a strong risk management culture through collaboration with other first line employees, and second & third line functions to ensure Compliance, AML or operational risks are identified, mitigated, monitored and reported on an ongoing basis. Qualifications: Supports multiple, similar business units with corresponding number of regulators. Assists with the implementation of risk management programs/ frameworks while identifying and minimizing negative impacts to the business. Develops and implements risk mitigation strategies. Acts as a subject matter expert in the evaluation, development and implementation of an internal control system. Supports the execution of strategic initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders. Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders. Ensures alignment between stakeholders. Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide insights and recommendations. Monitors and tracks performance, and addresses any issues. Builds change management plans of varying scope and type; leads or participates in a variety of change management activities including readiness assessments, planning, stakeholder management, execution, evaluation and sustainment of initiatives. Monitoring to ensure that 1st line jobs are following defined processes and procedures. Develops, documents and maintains business/group procedures updating and obtaining approvals as regulations or the operating environment changes and communicates changes to the business/group & relevant stakeholder groups. Supports the development of measurable sustainment strategies including assessing and recommending mitigations for industry/ segment-specific risks and prioritizing opportunities presented by internal and external stakeholders. Tracks exception/exemption requests and corresponding approvals. Builds awareness, knowledge, and skills and, as necessary, provides communication, practical tools and ongoing support including making presentations, to promote a culture of risk identification and management. Supports the management of 1st LOD program for the business/group in compliance with appropriate principles, standards & direction from the second line of defense groups. Includes developing and promoting program and ensuring the execution of all program components. Works with assigned business/group leaders to implement 1st LOD programs and frameworks, developing and maintaining an in-depth understanding of the applicable regulatory and internal risk management requirements. Interprets and provides advice on the application of the requirements for the business/group. Develops and maintains an understanding of the business/group strategies and objectives, products and services, internal and external stakeholders and business processes as well as the underlying infrastructure to identify and manage implications and risk exposures for the business/group. Identifies, investigates, analyzes, documents & mitigates program risks, taking into account jurisdictional issues, and raises any issues or concerns to senior leaders and other stakeholders. Analyzes the impact and effectiveness of the program through periodic reviews. Recommends adjustments to the overall program, policy or processes within the business/group in accordance with the Risk Appetite Statement, Governance and Corporate Policy. Supports the business/group through internal/external audits or regulatory examinations and assists in development of action plans to resolve any identified issues. Provides support to the development and delivery of training and awareness programs within the business/group to increase awareness of and compliance to risk management requirements. Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus. Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules. Works independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unique situations. Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed. Typically between 4 - 6 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Program Management - Good. Technical proficiency gained through education and/or business experience. Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth. Collaboration & team skills - In-depth. Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth. Influence skills - In-depth. Data driven decision making - In-depth. We’re here to help At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world. As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. jobdescription.300: ROLE: Business Analyst, Projects REPORTS TO: Senior Project Manager, Investor and Corporate Reporting LOCATION: Corporate Office in Richmond Hill COMPANY OVERVIEW Venterra Realty is a privately held Canadian corporate success story by any measure. It is a technology company, an investment management company and a commercial real estate company. Venterra has $3.0 billion assets under management; revenue of $250+ million. It owns and operates over 60 multi-unit residential properties, representing more than 18,000 units in the highest growth cities in the Southern U.S.  Investors have enjoyed some of the best risk-adjusted returns available in the market with an average annual return of 18.0% over a 20-year period. Financial performance of the firm’s investments has exceeded the average performance of the top U.S. REITs by 50% over the past five years. Significant capital is available to fund further growth. Customers (Residents) at Venterra properties rate their living experience in the top 5% nationally of all apartment communities. The CEO, John Foresi was also named a 2018 Glassdoor Top CEO. The values-driven corporate culture is applauded by employees. People join for a job and stay for a career.  Technology is in the DNA of its founders and they are the leaders of Venterra today. The Chairman gained a Master’s Degree in Artificial Intelligence before most of the world had heard of the words. Earlier in their careers, the Chairman and the CEO jointly led the growth and sale of a highly successful software technology business, focused on transportation logistics optimization. They then applied their business and technology acumen to the real estate industry and created Venterra. 2020 Fortune Best Workplaces for Women 2020, 2019 & 2018 Fortune Best Workplaces in Texas 2020, 2019, 2018, 2017, & 2016 Fortune Top 100 Best Medium Workplaces 2018 Fortune Best Workplaces for Diversity 2018 Houston Top Workplaces 2018 Glassdoor Top CEOs 2021, 2017 & 2016 Glassdoor Best Place to Work 50 Most Engaged Workplacesby the Achievers Corporation And have 98% of our communities recognized as "Top Rated"by ApartmentRatings.com  We are looking for people who: Have strong personal values and want to work for a values-based company Are ambitious and hard working with exceptionally high personal standards Embrace problem-solving and learning new skills Thrive in a rapidly changing and high growth environment Are passionate about driving continuous improvements and the use of technology with data to drive business results THE OPPORTUNITY This is an exciting time to join Venterra. We are seeking to build on Venterra’s current success and continue to position the organization as a leader in the use of finance technology. Our solutions have been a combination of implementing customized third-party solutions and building solutions from scratch. In support of Venterra’s growth plan, the Investor Reporting Team is in the process of transforming Venterra’s end-to-end Investor Management lifecycle through the implementation of a third-party Investor Management and Accounting Software. Reporting to the Senior Project Manager, Investor and Corporate Reporting, the Business Analyst, Projects will have the opportunity to execute critical Venterra projects and initiatives. Initially, this role will have a mandate to partner with the Senior Project Manager, Business Stakeholders, and the Vendor to lead the refinement, analysis, documentation and execution of project requirements and business processes for the end-to-end Investor Experience project through to project completion. Other initiatives will be assigned based on Venterra’s Annual Business Plan priorities and Business needs for both the Investor Reporting and Corporate Reporting teams. KEY JOB RESPONSIBILITIES Collaborate with stakeholders and the project team to elicit, analyze, specify, validate, prioritize, and document business and stakeholder requirements Manage and track the status of requirements throughout the project lifecycle by identifying, analyzing, redefining, coordinating, and implementing, as required Organize and facilitate meetings, discussions, and workshops among stakeholders, and between the business and external providers to assist with prioritizing and coordinating the implementation of competing deliverables Develop and maintain detailed and accurate plans and documents (e.g. Requirements Traceability Matrix, Action Items Matrix, Scorecards, etc.) to ensure project deliverables will achieve the approved requirements Partner with stakeholders and third-party vendors to define and execute user acceptance testing criteria, and to track, validate and report on issue resolution status through to acceptance and approval Create clear and concise process maps, workflows, charts, visuals, training materials, end-user communications and other documentation, as required Analyze current state business processes to identify opportunities for efficiency and automation, and partner with stakeholders to define, document and seek approval of redefined future state processes Support RFP processes and vendor evaluation and management efforts Provide post-implementation support to business stakeholders and users for project related deliverables Other ad hoc initiatives and requests as required CANDIDATE PROFILE Undergraduate degree in Business Administration, Business Process Improvement, or related discipline; PMI-BPA certification is an asset 5-7 years experience in a Business Analyst/Project related role, preferably in SaaS, HCM, ERP or other software implementations Candidates who can demonstrate proven Business Analyst experience in leading projects through the end-to-end lifecycle and through successful software implementations will be preferred Possesses confidence, a high sense of urgency, and ability to take ownership, think critically and solve problems with minimal direction and guidance Knowledge of project management and change management principles and experience with implementing change in a project environment Demonstrated experience in organizing and facilitating workshops, and with leading stakeholders through requirements and acceptance criteria elicitation; UAT scripting and execution; task analysis, assignment, and approvals; and, workflow and business process re-engineering and documentation Superior coordination, organizational and facilitation skills with keen attention to detail Strong verbal and written communication skills to effectively interpret, document and present business requirements, specifications, reports, project documents, implementation plans, etc. Exceptional interpersonal skills to interact effectively and build professional relationships with individuals at all levels of the organization Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office (Outlook, Excel, Word, Teams, Visio, PowerPoint, etc.) Experience in real estate or asset management is preferred but not required Venterra Realty is an equal opportunity employer. Accessibility accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all stages of the selection process.

jobdescription.303: Job Family Communications Primary Location Toronto  Position Language Requirement English Only  Language Skill Level (Reading) - Language Skill Level (Writing) - Language Skill Level (Speaking) -  Status of Employment Permanent Work schedule(s) Full-time  Work at CBC/Radio-Canada At CBC/Radio-Canada, we create content that informs, entertains and connects Canadians on multiple platforms. Our successes and accomplishments are driven by embodying and upholding values, which include creativity, integrity, inclusiveness and relevance. Do you think you have the ability and drive to keep up with this exciting, ever-changing industry? Whether it be in front of the camera, on air, online or behind the scenes, you would be joining a team that thrives on making connections and telling stories that are important to Canadians.  Your role As a Senior Research Analyst you will be an integral part of a dynamic team that provides on-going research for CBC's English Canada's initiatives. You will assist in the design, implementation, analysis and presentation of market, media, and audience research studies undertaken by the Custom Research team. Core responsibilities of the Senior Research Analyst will be questionnaire design, survey scripting and deployment, monitoring data collection, data analysis, report writing and presentation of results.  Key Tasks: Conduct and manage quantitative and qualitative research initiatives for CBC English Services. Select or create the research design or methodology best suited to meet current needs. Questionnaire design and survey scripting, sample deployment. Work with external sample providers and troubleshoot data collection issues. Use SPSS or other software to analyze survey data and present them in easily understood tabular or graphic formats. Synthesize this information and build reports that highlight insights in a clear and concise manner. Present findings to internal stakeholders.  We are looking for a candidate with the following profile: Academic and professional training in social science research with a post-secondary degree in communications, social science, media studies, or relevant discipline, or equivalent education and experience. Minimum B.A, but M.A preferred. Knowledge of the media landscape, in general, and of CBC, in particular. Requires in-depth knowledge and industry experience of current qualitative and quantitative market research methodologies. Demonstrated survey and questionnaire design expertise, particularly in the media and audience research field, including program testing, host testing, website testing as well as Brand Lift Studies. Demonstrated technical expertise with survey scripting tools such as Sparq, Alchemer, Qualtrics or Survey Monkey. Demonstrated competency in creating compelling reports and presentations of market research data with a focus on insights. Advanced MS Excel and MS PowerPoint skills, Google docs, slides and sheets. Experience using large syndicated data sources (vividata, Numeris, comScore, EA Prizm, etc.). High level of oral and written communication skills, especially for the presentation of research findings. Excellent interpersonal skills. Excellent attention to detail to ensure data accuracy. Sense of initiative and creativity in conceptualizing research problems, designing methodologies, analyzing, interpreting and presenting data. Requires the capacity to respond in a timely way to a wide range of requests, both urgent and long-term, and to handle multiple priorities.  Candidates may be subject to skills and knowledge testing. If this sounds interesting, please click on ''Apply online''. We thank all applicants for their interest, but only candidates selected will be contacted. CBC/Radio-Canada is committed to being a leader in reflecting our country’s diversity. That’s because we can only create and tell the stories that connect Canadians, by having a workforce that mirrors the ever-changing makeup of our country. That’s why we, as an employer, value equal opportunity and nurture an inclusive workplace where our individual differences are not only recognized and valued, but also extend to and pervade all the services we provide as Canada’s public broadcaster. For more information, visit the Diversity and Inclusion section of our website. If you have accommodation needs at this stage of the recruitment process, please inform us as soon as possible by sending an e-mail to recruitment@cbc.ca. You are invited to consult and familiarize yourself with our Code of Conduct, which can be found on our corporate website. All employees must adhere to the Code as a condition of employment. We also invite you to take a look at our policy on conflicts of interest. In the event that you become an employee, it will be important to inform us, as quickly as possible, of any situation that, because of your hiring, constitutes or could appear to constitute a conflict of interest. Wherever in the wording of the job description either gender is used, it shall be understood to include all genders.
