jobdescription.305: What is the opportunity? At the heart of our economy is a national payments system, safely circulating billions of dollars each day. But the payments system must modernize to support the rapidly changing needs and expectations of the Canadian marketplace, foster innovation and strengthen competition within the payments ecosystem. RBC has an opportunity to learn from modernization initiatives around the world and set its own path towards a world-class payments system capable of meeting the needs of a global economy and to put in place a solution that will establish a competitive advantage for RBC. To address this opportunity, RBC is currently is seeking to hire an experienced Senior Business Analyst who can manage and support both business and system requirements process. What will you do? Facilitate collaborative sessions with large and diverse business stakeholder groups to drive requirements discovery, analysis, and review. Apply advanced elicitation techniques to work with different types of stakeholder groups Lead requirements prioritization and leverage techniques to drive out business priorities Define business analysis approach including tasks and deliverables based on the project and delivery methodology (Agile/Iterative Waterfall). Verify and validate quality requirements with the impacted stakeholders Develop plans and accurate estimates for completion of requirements, continuously improving the level of detail and accuracy of estimates. Analyze and document scope of the business solution using enterprise-standard requirements methodology Manage risks, assumptions and constraints for requirements, and communicate to appropriate parties. Analyze and document both detailed business and system solution requirements using enterprise standard requirements methodology Build and maintain a repository of reusable requirements documentation to support future initiatives, following the enterprise standards What do you need to succeed? Must-have Minimum 5 years of experience in a Senior Business Systems Analyst role with proven experience with various methodologies such as Waterfall, Iterative, and Agile delivering medium and large-scale payments projects Must be able to analyze system interactions and clearly articulate and document end-to-end system flows Must have solid understanding of Payment Systems, API development and ISO 20022 SWIFT messages. Experience in managing diverse stakeholders, providing clear communications and presenting assessment options Must be able to produce requirements artefacts: Problem Opportunity Analysis, Scope Modelling, Business Process Mapping, Business Context Diagraming, Use Cases & Scenarios, Business Rules & Data Catalogue, User Stories, Story Decomposition, Story Mapping and Requirements traceability Nice-to-have Knowledge of Wire Room, Payment Processing, Real-Time Gross Settlement (RTGS/LYNX), Automated Clearing Settlement System (ACSS), Cash and Liquidity Risk Management, Clearing and Settlement process Relevant college, university, and/or post-graduate degree in Business Analysis What’s in it for you? We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual. A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team Opportunities to do challenging work Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies Learn more about RBC Tech Jobs  Join our Talent Community Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.  Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers. jobdescription.306: Address: 100 King Street West Job Family Group: Data Analytics & Reporting The purpose of this role is to support the U.S. Credit Stress Testing team in the preparation of regular, periodic and ad-hoc credit stress tests, including regulatory stress testing submissions for all Wholesale and Retail portfolios as required. In this role, the candidate will be responsible for execution and creation of SAS jobs required for stress testing models and automation of manual files in SAS. Additionally, this person shall be a subject matter expert on data utilized in stress testing and assist in any research required to understand stress testing results. The team is responsible for all aspects of credit stress testing lifecycle with a focus on analytics, tactical execution and strategic continuous improvement. This effort involves meaningful contributions to credit analysis and stress testing activities and close partnership with upstream and downstream groups. Supports the research and development of stress testing and scenario analysis methodologies and related strategies in support of the management of risks arising from changes in the market and external environment for business/group portfolios and products. Applies knowledge of analytics algorithms and technologies to develop models, methodologies and supplementary stress testing tools and infrastructures that assess the impact of a stress on risk capital and ensure risks are properly identified, understood and risk related strategies are enabled. Summarizes statistical findings, draws business conclusions, and presents actionable business recommendations used in the management of risks and related activities e.g. defining tolerance for adverse outcomes, capital modelling, assess capital and liquidity, recovery actions, portfolio and risk management strategies and tactics. Acts as a trusted advisor to assigned business/group. Influences and negotiates to achieve business objectives. Recommends and implements solutions based on analysis of issues and implications for the business. Assists in the development of strategic plans. Identifies emerging issues and trends to inform decision-making. Researches existing or emerging requirements & related best practices to assist and develops recommendations for changes/enhancements. Assists with the interpretation of new or changing regulations and assessing impacts to the governance frameworks. Helps determine business priorities and best sequence for execution of business/group strategy. Conducts independent analysis and assessment to resolve strategic issues. Leads the development and maintenance of stress testing and scenario analysis methodologies and frameworks. Ensures alignment between stakeholders. Represents the stress testing and scenario analysis function during internal/external regulatory audits and/or examinations. Coordinates the management of databases; ensures alignment and integration of data in adherence with data governance standards. Builds change management plans of varying scope and type; leads or participates in a variety of change management activities including readiness assessments, planning, stakeholder management, execution, evaluation and sustainment of initiatives. Leads or participates in defining the communication plan designed to positively influence or change behaviour; develops tailored messaging; and identifies appropriate distribution channels. Leads and integrates the monitoring, measurement & reporting on the status of the stress testing and scenario analysis program to internal & external stakeholders. May provide specialized support for other internal and external regulatory requirements. Provides input into the planning and implementation of ongoing operational programs in support of the stress testing and scenario analysis framework. Leads/participates in the design, implementation and management of core business/group processes. Works with stakeholders to identify the business requirements, understand the distinct problems, and the expected outcomes; models and frames business scenarios which impact critical business processes and/or decisions. Administers and evaluates changes to stress scenarios and / or model parameters in response to changes in the market and the external environment. Identifies where corrective actions are required and escalates per guidelines; ensures corrective action is taken as necessary. Works with various data owners to discover and select available data sources from internal sources and external vendors (e.g. lending system, payment system, external credit rating system) to fulfill analytical needs. Consults with stakeholders to improve consistency and transparency of risk measurement, metrics and reporting. Develops and maintains in-depth knowledge of business and related risk management requirements and legislative/ regulatory directives and guidance. Supports the management of governance meetings (e.g. committee, management, board meetings, etc.) as required; facilitates development and approval of agendas, gathering and distribution of documentation related to agendas, and creation of meeting minutes/output. Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders. Ensures alignment between stakeholders. Analyzes data and information to provide insights and recommendations Monitors and tracks performance; addresses any issues. Leads/participates in the design, implementation and management of core business/group processes. Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus. Provides specialized consulting, analytical and technical support. Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules. Works independently and regularly handles non-routine situations. Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed. Qualifications: Intermediate knowledge of SAS strongly desired (database queries, spreadsheet development/analysis, run/use of loss forecasting or projection models). Experience managing large data sets using MS Excel preferred. Experience with strong attention to detail working within tight deadlines desired. Typically between 5 - 7 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience. In-depth knowledge and understanding of stress testing and scenario analysis methodologies and frameworks. Proficiency in statistical/numerical software. In-depth experience in quantitative risk modeling, calculation of Regulatory and Economic Capital. Deep knowledge and technical proficiency gained through extensive education and business experience. Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth. Collaboration & team skills - In-depth. Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth. Influence skills - In-depth. Data driven decision making - In-depth. We’re here to help At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world. As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. jobdescription.307: Overview:  We are currently seeking a collaborative individual to join our team as an Analyst in the Performance Analytics & Reporting department. In this role, you will be responsible for be responsible for supporting the OEB’s utility performance analysis and reporting activities. This includes assessments of utility performance scorecard data and analysis of performance trends to assist the Board in decisions. The department also monitors the financial and non-financial performance of Ontario’s electricity utilities, natural gas utilities, and other regulated entities. Responsibilities: Initiates and develops plans to achieve, and deliver data analytics Identifies relevant issues and provides in-depth analysis associated with financial and non-financial data for regulated entities. Provides analytics expertise to internal and external stakeholders regarding data gathered and insights into correlations & trends seen through utility reporting. Working closely with other departments, supports policy implementation through specialized reporting requirements and data analysis. Conceptualizes and builds analytical models to improve reporting and industry analytics and presents information to both internal and external stakeholders. Delivers on projects related to performance assessment (e.g. enhancement of utilities scorecard) Collaboratively works with other team members on analytics best practices and utility operations Prepares and/or reviews monthly, quarterly, and annual statistical and project status reports/publications, ensuring information published is accurate and thorough. Develops and/or enhances new and/or existing policies and procedures Qualifications: Undergraduate degree in Finance; Economics; Mathematics; Data Science; Engineering or a related field; 3+ years of relevant experience in the energy sector including performance assessment, industry insights, asset management, system planning; 2+ years’ experience translating large data sets into actionable information and valuable insights for decision making purposes; Experience and knowledge of electric utility performance metrics, including key drivers and challenges 2+ years’ experience in a utility or regulatory environment is preferred; Previous working experience with data analytical solutions and tools such as Excel, SQL, VBA, Oracle BI, SAS, R, Tableau, Alteryx; Knowledge of financial/management reporting; Practical knowledge supporting projects with interdisciplinary teams, understanding stakeholder expectations, and managing own project timelines / deliverables; Excellent oral and written communication and interpersonal skills. Knowledge of the Ontario Energy Board Act, 1998 and related regulatory policies is an asset;
jobdescription.310: We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients. At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute. To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com Job Description What You’ll Be Doing As a Business Analyst you will be Implementing changes to CIBC systems to deliver high quality information to our internal and external stakeholders. You will become an integral part of CIBC and be able to deliver changes that maintain a balance between project deliverables and ongoing maintenance as well as continually improving on existing processes. Work with business and technology partners to plan and perform the User Acceptance Testing of projects of varying scope. Where applicable, prepare high level business requirements/user stories create test plans, documenting and communicating test results as required by the nature and scope of the enhancement. Maintain controls related to the integrity of risk data, conducting ongoing data quality review, ensuring new initiatives including program/product/process design implementation, systems, procedures, documentation etc., meet the standards required to support the business unit objectives and overall controls How You’ll Succeed Understanding and Documenting Requirements – Work closely with business partners to gather complex business requirements and facilitate solution design discussions to ensure you meet project needs. Build strong relationships , lead discussions, listen and ask the right questions to ensure solutions meet requirements. Experience with Agile methodology , writing user stories , managing scrum calls , prioritizing backlogs, etc. Analytical Thinking – Strong analytical, problem solving, and decision-making skills. Your experience should be sufficient to interpret risk measures, regulatory reporting guidelines / principles to deliver accurate and complete results to both internal and external clients. Regulatory acumen– Excellent understanding of the regulatory landscape will result in producing quality, timely and accurate changes to CIBC’s systems. Who You Are You love to learn. You're passionate about growing your knowledge, and you know that there is no limit to what you can achieve. You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You're confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way. It’s an asset if you have knowledge of Basel II/III/IV Framework methodologies, relevant financial standards (IFRS-9) and BCBS 239 requirements for risk data aggregation & reporting, understand Capital Adequacy Reporting guidelines set out by OSFI(particularly Credit Risk) and understand how this is used within bank. You embrace and champion change. You'll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best. Values matter to you. jobdescription.311: Strategy & Analytics - Strategy Analyst 1881 Yonge St, Toronto, ON M4S 3C4, Canada Req #128  Monday, February 22, 2021 HomeEquity Bank is the leading national provider of reverse mortgages to homeowners aged 55 and over, Canada’s fastest growing demographic segment. HomeEquity Bank originates and administers Canada’s largest portfolio of reverse mortgages under the CHIP Home Income Plan™ brand. New mortgages are originated on a direct to consumer basis as well as through referral arrangements with the six largest banks, leading mortgage brokers and financial planning firms. HomeEquity Bank has been the main underwriter of reverse mortgages in Canada since its predecessor; Canadian Home Income Plan Corporation pioneered the concept in 1986. HomeEquity Bank has a highly effective direct-to-consumer distribution model (B2C), as well as an established referral network (B2B), including Canada’s major banks, credit unions, financial planners and mortgage brokers.  HomeEquity Bank is exceptionally well positioned for further growth for a number of very important reasons: 1) positive demographic trends in the 55 years old and over segment, 2) wider awareness and growing demand of reverse mortgages in the market, 3) significant barriers to entry for competitors, and 4) HomeEquity Bank’s firm position as market leader. Position Summary  Reporting to the Vice President, Strategy, the Strategy Analyst will work in conjunction with the Shared Services Team to help build out the strategic initiatives. This role requires a strong strategic thinker with excellent data analysis and business case writing skills and the ability to research, ideally with some financial services experience, to assist in the strategic planning process, as the company continues to grow its reverse mortgage business. The successful candidate must be able to exercise discretion, good judgment and take initiative. Working closely with the Executive Team, across the bank, the incumbent must act as a key resource in providing the research and analytical support required to develop and achieve our corporate strategy. He / she will ensure all activities are compliant with governing regulations, internal policies and procedures and will assist the Vice President, Strategy with our current strategic initiatives  Major Elements of the Role Support bank annual strategic planning; work with all business units to align business strategy with overall bank goals and strategic objectives Conduct regular industry research (trends, technology, competitive environment, best practice, etc.) and prepare reports for internal stakeholders Support strategic initiative implementation Support business case building for key investments and initiatives through quantitative analysis and simple financial modelling Support bank business reporting, data and analytics projects Conduct customer study as needed Skills and Experience Required Bachelor’s Degree in commerce; Finance or Accounting preferred Strong analytical and critical thinking skills Strong verbal and written communication skills Will thrive in a collaborative, fast-pace work environment Team player and motivated by shared success Individuals must comply with the Bank’s AML, Fraud and Privacy Policies and procedures and be vigilant in the detection and prevention of money laundering, terrorist financing, fraud and the safeguard of all client information. HomeEquity Bank complies with the Employment Equity Act. Our Employment Equity program is intended to help ensure that all Canadians have the same access to the labour market and to ensure the full representation of members of the four designated groups which include: women, visible minorities, Aboriginal People and Persons with Disabilities. If you would like more information on the HomeEquity Bank please visit: www.homeequitybank.ca. If you'd like to find out more about the CHIP Home Income Plan solution, please visit www.chip.ca.  Other details Pay Type Salary
jobdescription.312: Considering the current affairs, Allstate will be conducting virtual interviews and has made arrangements for new hires to work remotely till its deemed safe to return to office  Through our core values, Opportunity, Flexibility, Community, Diversity and Family, we have worked hard to develop and nurture a culture where employees feel valued, experience personal growth, have career options and truly enjoy the work they do. Our team is growing and we are actively looking to hire Operations Planning Analyst to join our Operations Planning and Sales Compensation team within the Allstate Sales and Service department! Reporting to the Manager, Planning and Sales Analytics, you will be responsible for: a) Developing and delivering key agent and agency performance metrics to the appropriate stakeholders as per specific service level agreements; b) Developing and disseminating agent/agency performance data relative to established benchmarks (i.e. plan, averages, award-level requirements, compensation); c) Designing ad-hoc data analysis scans and models based on stakeholders needs; and d) Providing analysis and commentary on the department expenses.  Accountabilities: Identify, develop, and monitor tracking mechanisms to assess sales performance and opportunities;  Build quarterly sales planning documents at an Agency, Director and National level incorporating latest market performance data;  Ensure delivery of optimal results with appropriate metrics, including quality, timeliness, productivity as well as external and internal customer service satisfaction to meet the team’s objectives;  Create and publish reports on agent/agency performance metrics in a format conducive to providing the department and field managers key performance indicators;  Using performance metrics data, compile and provide to HR reports that detail the correct compensation level (i.e. APB, IPB, APB promo);  Develop, maintain and report accurate agent deployment records. Perform accurate computation of agent/agency “Incentives For Growth” rewards and distribute authorities and accesses to Agency Managers and Directors;  Obtain, arrange and analyze complex models on an ad hoc basis that provide critical insight into market performance and Marketing;  Complete reports for the Leadership Team with accuracy and analysis on areas of opportunity for improvement and assess emerging trends;  Communicate effectively with other functional departments, i.e. Marketing, Operational Readiness and Operational Effectiveness as well as HR on shared projects such as sales planning.  Qualifications & Experiences: University degree in Business or Finance;  2-3 years’ experience in an operations/sales planning or similar role;  Advanced level proficiency in Excel, Access, and Tableau;  2-3 years demonstrated experience and proficiency in database query and spreadsheet development;  Strong analytical skills;  Strong problem solving skills;  Excellent interpersonal & collaboration skills;  Attention to detail and accuracy is required  Other duties as assigned. The Demand Planning Analyst will also create and maintain forecast models, assist in incorporating business intelligence and forecast information gathered from sales, marketing, finance, and other sources into that demand plan utilizing their analytic and interpersonal skills. Creating reports and automated system alerts to proactively identify forecast exceptions  Assisting in the creation of best-in-class processes to improve forecast accuracy and bias  Engaging and collaborating with sales teams to ensure better inventory planning, demand Signal Exception Analysis, new business materialization and service level analysis  Drive analysis and provide insights related to overall network optimization, stocking analysis, core assortment framework and other related adhoc activities  This Job might be for you if: Possess a strong understanding of logistics and distribution gained through 2-4 years of Supply Chain experience  College/University education in /Supply Chain Management, MBA is an asset  You have strong interpersonal skills with the ability to influence internal and external customers to drive value-added solutions  You possess strong analytical skills and proven ability to analyze data trends with the use of reporting tools (ex. Excel, Access) and initiate action from findings.  You have the ability to work successfully in a team environment as well as individually  Proven ability to handle multiple tasks at the same time and be able to prioritize effectively  You have strong facilitation, presentation, and effective communication skills  You have knowledge of category management is an asset  Cardinal Health is committed to employment equity and encourages applications from women, visible minorities, Aboriginal peoples and persons with disabilities. jobdescription.322: About Citylitics Inc. Citylitics delivers predictive intelligence on local utility & public infrastructure markets. The U.S. needs to invest $4.5 Trillion over the next 5 years to upgrade its infrastructure, including water, energy, public transit, roads, airports, and more. Citylitics is the only source of predictive intelligence on where, how, and why these infrastructure investments will be made. Our Data Engine transforms over a billion documents buried in 31,000+ cities & utilities data sources into high value intelligence for targeted business development. The largest infrastructure industry leaders rely on Citylitics for external datasets and intelligence reports. Citylitics' vision is a world where data drives trillions of dollars of societal infrastructure investment towards the most ideal social, economic, and environmental outcomes. Who We Are Looking For We are looking for a Data Analyst who can query and extract interesting data from our databases, analyze it, turn it into actionable solutions and storylines, and develop presentations for internal and external clients. You will be responsible for turning raw data into impactful insights. You will be a key resource for client engagement, research, and future product features. You will develop ideas for structured analysis and curate hypotheses in line with market interests. You will also prepare data and execute analyses using sound statistical methods and established data modeling techniques. Most of our team is based out of Toronto but we are working remotely due to COVID-19. We are open to fully remote candidates but have a preference for candidates based in Toronto, Kitchener/Waterloo, Milwaukee, Chicago, or Austin. We have office bases in Toronto, Milwaukee, and Austin. Requirements The ideal candidate will demonstrate a strong command of data-driven best practices and knowledge of relational databases. They will be able to work independently for much of their time, but will also work with the wider team to seek input from the Product, Sales, Client Success and Engineering Teams on data that we need to add to our Data Roadmap. They will then work to clean and standardize data, build specs and schemas, and manage data ingestion processes to ensure timely and accurate uploads to our Data Warehouse. This includes providing insights into the causes of data issues, point out anomalies, create dashboards and generate insights reports. This role is primarily responsible for the quality and integrity of the data at Citylitics. The interview process will include a data aptitude test that must be completed in order to be considered for this position. What You Will Accomplish: Deliver infrastructure-related data & analytics that our clients need and answer any related follow-up questions that our team or clients may have regarding the source or consistency of the data Deploy your proven data skills to dig deep and parse through thousands of data sources relating to infrastructure across North America Champion the integrity and coverage of our data by developing tools to streamline data aggregation and automation processes Manage client projects including client calls, scoping, delegating data aggregation tasks, instructing/coaching others on the data aggregation Design and document a repeatable and successful data ingestion process that will be incorporated in our search tools and client-facing platforms, having a significant impact on how intelligence gets delivered within the infrastructure industry. Writes scripts to aggregate data for client projects - clean the data, standardize it, back it up and report on progress to the Team Lead and the larger team Work closely with the Client Success and Product teams to query and package data that supports our Product Roadmap and helps make impactful team decisions Requirements: Technical chops - Python and SQL for scripting and an advanced knowledge of Excel Written and verbal communication - well-spoken so you can communicate technical processes (like where our data is sourced, how we process it, how we apply filters, etc.) to clients or non-technical users Organized - takes pride in writing clean and readable code, putting together a functional and well-designed dashboard or build a spreadsheet that is concise and easy to sift through Have experience managing data collection projects including understanding the importance of data integrity, the tradoffs of using spreadsheets and the value of communicating data collection steps clearly Undergraduate or graduate degree in Data Science, Engineering, Information Studies, Market Research, Journalism or similar level of project experience A willingness to fail and find dead ends, but learn fast and make immediate adjustments At least 1 year in a client-facing role is an asset Benefits Why Citylitics? This is a rare opportunity to influence positive change through your work within one of the biggest societal challenges of our generation (infrastructure - from water to transport to energy and more). Contribute to delivering a disruptive solution with a compelling value proposition into an industry that is eager to hear from you and in a market with no direct competition. We live at the cross-section of infrastructure, startup and data science. We are a unique team focused on a unique opportunity. There is no corporate bureaucracy here. You will accomplish more here in a few months than what you would in a few years at a large, entrenched technology company. Perks include company-paid transportation, health & fitness benefits, a generous yearly training budget, and work-from-wherever days in addition to your competitive salary and incentive bonuses. We work hard. We win together. We are on a mission to solve the world's infrastructure needs. We enjoy happy-hour patios and social events (though virtually these days!). We believe our team's diversity makes us the best we can be! Application Deadline is March 31st, 2021, but candidates will be selected for interviews on a rolling basis.
jobdescription.323: Job DescriptionWith a network of 100 stores in the United States, Canada, and the United Kingdom, Metal Supermarkets is the largest small quantity metal distribution specialist in the world. We have been providing businesses and consumers with quality customer service and products since 1985. Our company is experiencing strong growth, and to support that growth we need to expand our team.We are seeking a Programmer Analyst to develop and refine enhancement solutions within our ERP platform working closely with our external technology partners, head office, and store staff. This is a permanent full-time position with a growing company in a stable industry. We provide a competitive salary, comprehensive health and dental benefits, and three weeks of annual vacation.ObjectivesThe Programmer/Reporting Analyst will provide services in all areas of application and reporting development work, including business requirements, analysis, and design, programming, testing, documentation, and deployment. In addition, you will provide effective and timely response to business needs, taking a lead role in detecting and resolving associated technical issues and problems.Work hours will be Tuesday-Saturday from 10:30 am - 7 pm but subject to change according to business requirements. Special projects may require work during nights, weekends, and public holidays, with time off provided in lieu.Primary Responsibilities: Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:· Analyzing the needs of internal departments and assisting staff with the development· Reviewing code to ensure best practices are in place· Analyze complex data to develop automated reporting with VBA and Excel (majority of work), and Jasper Reports· Create macros to work with a huge amount of data and for Excel reports· Develop VBA programs to perform tasks automatically· Developing test plans and software documentation to support code modifications and additions in the Current ERP System· Develop a strong understanding of installed systems and technology options.· Work closely with stakeholders to determine enhancements and solutions, assessing the impact to existing work processes and systems, and pinpoint how to manage integration.· Define, document, and translate business requirements into detailed functional specifications.· Assist in translating requirements and user cases into test conditions and expected results for product, performance, user acceptance, and operational acceptance testing.· Provide operational and process-related analysis and support frequently presenting and explaining system design, process/data charts to obtain business input or buy-in.· Manage projects to ensure availability of scarce resources and on-time delivery of projects by holding vendors and internal resources accountable to timelines.· Communicating with other teams to resolve issues or implement change control, if required.· Work as a team member in a fast-paced, Agile environment.· Work closely with Senior Management team to improve business processes through new or existing technologies· Ability to self-manage a new application throughout the entire application development life-cycle with minimal support· Have the ability to analyze and troubleshoot problems remotely.· Support Metal Supermarkets’ Vision, Mission and Core Values.· Other duties as assigned from time to time.Desired Qualifications include: · Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or a related discipline with 7 years’ experience· Minimum 5 years’ experience writing VBA (Visual Basic for Applications) with database interaction4+ years implementation of relational or proprietary databases with a strong understanding of SQL Server or PostgreSQLProficiency with Visual Basic for Application (VBA) and Excel VBA programming experienceComprehensive knowledge of MS Excel application – Pivot Tables, FormulasExperience with data analytics, BI reporting tool like Jasper Reports· Application Development, Systems Integration and Database Administration of MSSQL Server 2005/2000/7.0/6.5, PostgreSQL 9.x/10.x· Understanding of ERP systems is must· Ability to run traces, performance monitoring, blocking & good problem-solving skills are requiredHighly numeric aptitude with excellent analytical skillsFlexibility to operate within an Iterative, Agile or Waterfall project methodologies· Solid Comprehension of data and database concepts including: ability to interpret data dictionaries, creation and interpretation of Entity Relationship Diagrams, working knowledge of data maps, data diagrams/structure· Ability to research and investigates defects/issues related to requirement/specifications.· Solid communication skills, both written and verbal.· Able to handle multiple projects with shifting priorities.· Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.· Demonstrates some leadership skills and independence.· Good understanding of emerging technologies.· Ability to navigate, troubleshoot, and quickly develop in-depth technical understanding of newAssets: · Experience with HTML, XML, SQL Server, Java and/or .NET technologies would be an asset.Location: 520 Abilene Drive, Mississauga, ON L5T 2H7Job Type: Full-timeAdditional pay:Bonus payBenefits:Dental careExtended health carePaid time offRRSP matchVision careSchedule:Day shiftHolidaysWeekendsExperience:ERP: 1 year (Preferred)Database Administration: 1 year (Preferred)VBA : 3 years (Preferred)Location:Mississauga, ON (Preferred)
jobdescription.324: The Supply Chain Analyst is responsible for analyzing data and providing unbiased insights and recommendations to the logistics teams, to optimize overall company performance. The primary objective of the Supply Chain Analyst is to increase in and outbound service levels to our customer’s distribution centers, increase on shelf-availability, help drive sales and optimize network inventory at distribution centers. The incumbent of this position will be required to work remotely.ResponsibilitiesEnsure that delivery of goods is more efficient by determining which goods, in what quantities, and at what location are required to meet anticipated demand and ensure that shortages are minimized.Monitor Days on Hand KPIs – inbound service level, on time arrival, DC to Store service level, daily shorts, forecast consumptionReview Planned Arrivals file and Supplier scheduleAnalyse Monthly Fill Rate ComplianceValidate distribution requirements planning and largescale promotions to allocationResponsible for master data clean upParticipate in joint demand planning – Customer forecast vs NT forecastOverstock review and action planning (prepack/seasonal/in-out)Prepare for and attend Quarterly Transport and Joint Business Planning meetingsParticipate in customer Monthly Supply Chain Review – Supply Chain / CategoryGenerate and review date sensitive inventory (DSI) reportPromotional review and action – By DC /By BannerRequirementsUniversity degree in Business, Operations management, or Finance is required5-7 years experience supply chain analyticsDemonstrably high-calibre analytical ability and presentation skillsDemonstrate excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to effectively interact with and help influence a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts.Kowledge of "Warehouse management" tools, processes, and performance indicators___________________________________________L'analyste de la chaîne d'approvisionnement est chargé d'analyser les données et de fournir des informations et des recommandations impartiales aux équipes logistiques, afin d'optimiser les performances globales de l'entreprise. L'objectif principal de l’Analyste de la chaîne d'approvisionnement est d'augmenter les niveaux de service à l'entrée et à la sortie des centres de distribution de nos clients, d'augmenter la disponibilité en rayon, d'aider à stimuler les ventes et d'optimiser les stocks du réseau dans les centres de distribution. Le titulaire de ce poste sera tenu de travailler à distance.L'analyste de la chaîne d'approvisionnement est chargé d'analyser les données et de fournir des informations et des recommandations impartiales aux équipes logistiques, afin d'optimiser les performances globales de l'entreprise. L'objectif principal de l’Analyste de la chaîne d'approvisionnement est d'augmenter les niveaux de service à l'entrée et à la sortie des centres de distribution de nos clients, d'augmenter la disponibilité en rayon, d'aider à stimuler les ventes et d'optimiser les stocks du réseau dans les centres de distribution. Le titulaire de ce poste sera tenu de travailler à distance.ResponsabilitésVeiller à ce que la livraison des marchandises soit plus efficace en déterminant quelles marchandises, en quelles quantités et à quel endroit sont nécessaires pour répondre à la demande prévue et veiller à ce que les pénuries soient réduites au minimum.Surveiller les indicateurs clés de performance des jours en cours - niveau de service à l'arrivée, à l'heure d'arrivée, niveau de service de DC à magasin, courts-circuits quotidiens, consommation prévueExaminer le dossier des arrivées prévues, ainsi que le calendrier des fournisseursAnalyser mensuellement la conformité du taux de remplissageValider la planification des besoins de distribution et les promotions à grande échelle à l'allocationResponsable du nettoyage des données de baseParticiper à la planification conjointe de la demande - Prévision de la clientèle vs prévision des NTExamen des surstocks et planification des actions (préemballage/saisonnière/en sortie)Préparer et assister aux réunions trimestrielles sur les transports et la planification conjointe des activitésParticiper à l'examen mensuel de la chaîne d'approvisionnement des clientsGénérer et examiner le rapport d'inventaire sensible aux dates (ISD)Revue promotionnelles et actions par centre de distribution et par bannièreExigencesUn diplôme universitaire en commerce, gestion des opérations ou finance est exigé5-7 ans d'expérience dans l'analyse de la chaîne d'approvisionnementCapacité d'analyse et de présentation de haut niveauDémontrer d'excellentes aptitudes à la communication orale et écrite et la capacité à interagir efficacement avec un groupe diversifié, des cadres, des gestionnaires et des experts en la matière et à les influencer.Connaissance des outils, des processus et des indicateurs de performance de la gestion d'entrepôt.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentSchedule:8 hour shiftEducation:Bachelor's Degree (Required)Experience:supply chain analytics: 5 years (Required)
jobdescription.325: Business Systems Analyst (9 month contract) (210085)  Why you’ll love working here: You’re making an impact by helping to deliver on our Pension Promise World class Defined Benefit pension plan 100% company paid Extended Health and Dental benefits for permanent employees Business casual dress code Annual wellness reimbursement program for health & wellness-related expenses permanent employees Virtual fitness, yoga and meditation classes, nutritionist consultations and wellness seminars Following the advice of Canadian health authorities, we have implemented a work-from-home policy for our employees, to mitigate the risk of potential spread of COVID-19 and support social distancing. Job Summary Reporting to the Consultant, Business Solutions, the Business Systems Analyst is responsible for technical documentation, supporting project delivery and coordinate process redesign and BI development initiatives led by the Business Solutions Group ("BSG"). Contributing to the overall effectiveness and delivery of business solutions for the Financial Reporting and Business Planning ("FR&BP") department, this role is responsible for working with various BSG to document requirements and provide support to key project deliverables to ensure business solution integration and alignment of processes, systems and information. What you will do: Document systems specifications including data, ETL and reporting for solutions developed by BSG. Participate in solution delivery and support project leads in requirements gathering, process mapping, design, development, and implementation. Facilitate project coordination for process and BI delivery through status communication, defect management and issue resolution. Provide input into specifications and user acceptance test documents as applicable, to support technology and process initiatives through to completion. This includes identifying gaps, issues, and misalignment. Analyze data to identify issues and leverage modern BI tools to support business decisions. Assist business users in understanding any problems and challenges by working with them to enhance system and workflow capabilities to ensure quality deliverables that meet business and project objectives. Work collaboratively with IT to deal with business solution issues and identifies plans for resolution.  What you bring: University degree and/or a combination of equivalent training, education and experience 3 plus years in progressive roles dealing with business analysis and production support Experience in system documentation specializing in data and reporting specifications Strong knowledge of business requirements gathering, process mapping and gap analysis Knowledge of business analysis best practices and methodologies with practical application experience Familiar with core Corporate Accounting functions Familiar with risk and controls in a Finance environment Experience in the Pension and/or Financial Services industry an asset Business Analyst certification an asset Collaborative, professional, accountable, and trustworthy Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills Ability to support multiple projects and work under pressure Excellent written and verbal (interpersonal and communication) skills Ability to effectively adapt to change Excellent business analysis and time management skills Experience using business intelligence tools, including design, maintenance and documentation Ability to implement process improvements where necessary Ability to plan, organize and monitor work effectively to ensure standards of performance are adhered to Ability to work independently with minimal direction Notice for job applicants  Following the advice of Canadian health authorities, to mitigate the risk of potential spread of COVID-19 and support social distancing, all recruiting activities including interviews and new hire onboarding will be conducted online. While we are doing our best to ensure reasonable response times, please expect some delays during the recruiting process due to the current situation. Thank you for your patience and understanding during these challenging times.  For additional information on our adjusted recruitment process, please email us at hrinbox@hoopp.com.  About HOOPP  Established in 1960, the Healthcare of Ontario Pension Plan (HOOPP) is a multi-employer defined benefit pension plan for Ontario's hospital and community-based healthcare sector. We serve more than 381,000 members who provide valued healthcare services at more than 590 employers across the province. At HOOPP, we exist to provide a stable and reliable pension for our members that starts in retirement and is paid for life. As one of Canada's largest and most respected pension plans, HOOPP's net assets reached $94.1 billion at the end of 2019 and our funded status remained strong and stable at 119%.  HOOPP's core values - professional, accountable, collaborative, compassionate and trustworthy - guide our every interaction with our members, employers and employees. We've become one of Canada's leading pension plans by consistently challenging ourselves and embracing innovation. From our unique investment management approach to our innovative technology and thought-provoking research, we constantly seek to push the boundaries, and we do this by hiring passionate, forward-thinking people.  Our high-performance culture is founded on collaboration, respect and belonging. HOOPP is an equal opportunity employer and we're proud of our diversity. We select applicants for employment solely on the basis of their qualifications. Should you require accommodation because of a disability during the recruitment and selection process, please contact our Human Resources team. We will be happy to consult with you so that arrangements can be made for reasonable accommodation.  Primary Location Toronto Job Finance Employee Status Temporary Job Type Standard Schedule Full-time Job Posting Mar 5, 2021, 1:15:06 PM
jobdescription.326: BE authentic . BE influential . BE the expert . Be all that and more at Colliers International. At Colliers International, we help leaders succeed by helping them build amazing workplaces, businesses and communities around the world. We do this by thinking differently, sharing innovative ideas and offering a unique and collaborative workplace where you can succeed. Who you are You will be responsible to engage with key business stakeholders and is accountable for conducting business analysis for a variety of corporate initiatives. This position requires exceptional analytical and documentation skills. You bring the specific ability to convert business requirements into detailed functional architecture, User Stories and support developers/vendors in understanding the User Stories as they build out business solutions following Agile principles. What you bring A bachelor’s degree in business administration, computer science, or related field. Ten (10) or more years of experience in business analysis An analytical self-starter, creative thinker, and fast learner to take the initiative to troubleshoot, recommend processes improvements Experience with integrating various intricate custom and commercial systems Expert organizational skills to work with a vast array of information and present in an organized manner at any time. Experience with the following: Experience with Enterprise systems such as CRM (Dynamix or other), Financial, asset management Working with custom solutions and integrations experience with Email Marketing Systems preferred experience with incident mgmt., problem mgmt., task mgmt. tools (Such as ServiceNow, MS DevOP) MS SQL Query Skills with exposure to SSRS and SSIS (MS Azure and asset) Bonus skills and experience Experience/Exposure to Commercial Real Estate would be beneficial Dynamics AX and Workday Data Governance Master Data Management Machine Learning and AI What success looks like You will Participate in all phases of the software development lifecycle, including requirement gathering, analysis, solution design, configuration, development support, testing, and user support. You successfully Learn and document the requirements of proprietary software applications & endorsed hardware platforms related to the client-facing applications. You successfully Conceptualize and analyze Business problems using various methodologies to enhance both effectiveness and efficiencies of technology and business operations. You have ability to create Business Cases, Business Requirements Document, Design Documents, other Business requirements artifacts, and testing documentation. BE who you are and what you want to be with Colliers International. We’d love to meet you. Apply today to join our team.  Direct applicants only please, no agencies.  Colliers is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce. Colliers encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants' disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. If you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact the recruitment team by email at canada.careers@colliers.com.
jobdescription.327: Business Analyst - Data, Systems & Business Solutions On behalf of our client in the Banking Sector, PROCOM is looking for a Business Analyst - Data, Systems & Business Solutions. Business Analyst - Data, Systems & Business Solutions – Job Description Technical Solution Design & Analytics. You will help our team make data-driven decisions. Development of agile metrics (Sprint velocity, burndown, etc.) to contribute to oversight of Software BAU (business as usual) team oversight and increase agile maturity. Lead, guide and support multiple work stream leads / consultants through the design and implementation of targeted change strategies including identification of change impacts to people, process, policy, and structure, stakeholder identification and alignment, appropriate communication and feedback loops, success measures, training, organizational readiness, and long-term sustainability Developing comprehensive technical solutions for specific problems both as part of BAU process and transformation initiatives Contribute to and/or lead the design and development of software (prepare the production readiness checklist) and data solutions including prototypes, proof-of-concepts, sandboxes, labs and so forth. Work on portfolio of initiatives across capital systems affecting economic and regulatory capital, leverage ratio and other critical risk reports Understand and capture context, problem statements and detail business requirements Create complex BI reporting packages and dashboards utilizing regulatory capital data infrastructure built around Hadoop as well as localized DataMart and other data sources. Contribute to and/or lead the efforts to enhance business processes through automation and fuse ML/AI Establishing Frameworks & Process Redesign. You will develop key business processes in line with new capital infrastructure. Following the data and metrics extracted above, investigate a business process, interview people, analyze systems, document as appropriate Communicate findings concisely and succinctly. Work with FRO team members to devise, weigh and implement run books. Technical Writing. You will help cultivate re-usability of Product Knowledge. We’re migrating software platforms, and all of our operations and processes need to be re-documented and organized. Develop a program to preserve and organize this knowledge, and then execute on the strategy.  Business Analyst - Data, Systems & Business Solutions – Mandatory Skills At least 8+ year’s hands-on experience as a Business Analyst with at least 5+ years on an agile project. Strong Business Process Mapping, Process Analysis and Business Process Reengineering skills are essential. Strong analytical skills with a demonstrated ability to comprehensively analyze business processes and workflows Experience in leading the Target Operating model (TOM) activities in support of different data streams, implemented / analyzed Data Transfer controls, Data Quality Checks and established the system robustness evaluation report. Lead the analysis studies in production, maintenance, reliability, sanitation and management systems. Experience in to updating the RTB runbooks/playbooks, job flow monitoring and incident management they are putting together and work on developing handoffs and equivalent procedures Experience in Updating the Policies, procedures and Handbooks based on the target infrastructure. Experience in mapping and documenting of interfaces between legacy and new systems Experience in facilitating workshops and conducting interviews Database experience and data manipulation using (two or more of) SQL Server or Oracle, Hive and HBase, Teradata, NoSQL and other similar tools is required Data discovery, visualization and reporting experience using Tableau, Power BI or similar tools is required  Business Analyst - Data, Systems & Business Solutions – Nice to Have Skills Basel III/IV, Risk Management, Software Development, Technical Solution Design, Strong familiarity with latest technology stacks for data processing platforms Foundational understanding of bank’s balance sheet, wholesale and retail products including lending, derivatives and SFTs, related risk management concepts and regulatory requirements (Basel accords) Foundational understanding of credit risk minimum regulatory capital requirements and related concepts such as PD, LGD, EAD Foundational understanding of Hadoop ecosystem and Spark Framework. Prefer programming experience in Python Data integration, transformation and wrangling experience Experience with data lakes, data warehouses, data marts, data governance and data quality Strong foundational understanding of Machine Learning and AI concepts and some experience with practical applications is required  Business Analyst - Data, Systems & Business Solutions - Assignment Start Date ASAP – 12 months to start Business Analyst - Data, Systems & Business Solutions - Assignment Location Toronto, ON – Work Remotely
jobdescription.328: Title: Genomics Database Developer/Analyst - GP Department: BioComputing Centre Job ID: 21-0090   Organizational Overview Great people, exceptional teams building a stronger Public Health Ontario. We are Public Health Ontario (PHO). We live our values as a shared promise to each other, our clients and our partners. We value credibility, innovation, responsiveness, collaboration, integrity and respect. With our partners in Ontario's health system, we monitor and address the needs of the population by providing the scientific evidence and expert guidance that shapes policies and practices for a healthier Ontario. With locations across Ontario, we are working to ensure that Ontario has the strongest public health system in the world so that every day Ontarians wake up in one of the safest places to live in the world. For more information about PHO, visit www.publichealthontario.ca Position Details- Position Title: Genomics Database Developer/Analyst - GP Department: Bio Computing Centre Location: 661 University Avenue, Toronto Duration: Permanent  Hours of work: Full-time 36.25 hours per week  Compensation Group: OPSEU Salary: $37.99- $47.11 per hour Posting Date: March 8, 2021  Closing Date: March 22, 2021 Internal candidates will be considered first Position Summary- To support the development and implementation of a robust genomics program at Public Health Ontario (PHO) to monitor genomic changes and rapid detection of emerging variants of pathogens of public health significance for Ontario by providing skills and expertise in the development, administration, and maintenance of scientific databases especially designed for genomics and bioinformatics. PHO has been mandated by the province to lead the establishment of a hub and spoke model for integrated program model for COVID-19 genomics in Ontario, working in collaboration with Ontario Health and other clinical laboratories and researchers undertaking genomics. The program will enable and support early identification and containment, enhanced case and contact management, outbreak management, surveillance and epidemiological analysis and reporting. As the hub for this program, PHO will increase its capacity to undertake genomics for COVID-19 variants of concern (VoC) and contribute to sequencing up to 1000 specimens a week (of the anticipated provincial total sequencing need of 2000 specimens per week). PHO will also provide enhanced COVID-19 analytics and host a provincial expert advice on variants VoC to provide advice to decision-makers for improved methods, tracking and interpretation of emerging mutations and variants, and meaningful public health action. The immediate focus is to strengthen and expand the COVID-19 genomics program resulting in direct medical and/or public health action for the pandemic response. The goal of this program is to enable the delivery of an integrated genomics initiative for Ontario's COVID-19 public health response. Key Responsibilities- Elicits and reviews business requirements for databases and data extractions with business customers, aggregates findings and develops/implements plans to create, accommodate, migrate and integrate multiple sources of data in a variety of formats within current technical constraints. Works with biocomputing and genomics staff to elicit, confirm and document database specifications and recommends database solutions, including tools and technologies, to match specifications and meet PHO guidelines. Extracts data from various PHO operational systems and other data repositories, works with data owners to transform and interpret the data and provides datasets for reporting or analytic functions. Translates business data management requirements into data models and schemas for the design and development of databases and other data management mechanisms within the overall data architecture of PHO. Recommends tools to support a wide array of data including genomic data (tracking SNPs, mutations, annotations, lineages, etc.), geospatial and statistical data; discovers, recommends or defines special performance considerations, proposes possible solutions supported by risk and cost-benefit analyses and develops an overall database implementation strategy. Monitors the data and information needs of the Genomic Program area to ensure their needs are being met. Designs and develops datasets, data models, databases and data repositories for PHO customers (internal and external), analyzes the data needs of diverse business customers, makes recommendations and eventual commitments regarding performance, reliability, accessibility, efficiency and security of stored data and ensures that all databases satisfy business needs, meet commitments and comply with PHO privacy and security policies. Administers existing enterprise databases by: developing a database maintenance and application performance monitoring plan to ensure all PHO data is secure but easily accessible by authorized users; recommends and implements methods and controls to maintain data accuracy and integrity; assists in the development of standards and best practices to ensure data is consistent, clearly defined and used appropriately; and, corrects detected deficiencies. Ensures that implementations of new data stores of any kind or changes to the existing environment are planned and executed to address testing, back-ups, go/no go decision points, back out and recovery and protection of existing technical and business environments. Identifies, logs, tracks and resolves implementation and operational issues. Deploys and tests security measures and reviews privacy legislation and ensures databases comply with data/information privacy and security policies, especially for Personal Health Information (PHI) and monitors for continued protection and compliance. Develops interfaces between internal and external databases as required. Keep up-to-date with, and researches, the latest trends in database management and technology to recommend the most appropriate tools for database development, data extraction and transformation. Liaises with other database administration, Bioinformatics Analysts, Bioinformaticians, Computational Biologists, System Administrators, and solution development colleagues to ensure that architectural integrity and standards are maintained across the information, application, technical and security architecture domains as new databases are developed and implemented. Provides general and technical support, advice and comment to business customers, project teams and application developers regarding the use and updating of databases and the feasibility of solutions being proposed, establishes and assesses policies, protocols and processes and recommends changes and participates in committees and working groups to represent database management. Other duties as assigned. Knowledge and Skills- Familiarity with computational and bioinformatics analysis methods, database requirements, and data end products for reporting and visualization specifically for Whole-Genome Sequencing / Next-Generation Sequencing Knowledge of more than one operating system, especially Linux-based operating systems (Ubuntu, CentOS) and the tools, processes and technologies used in developing and managing multiple databases Knowledge of cloud-based architectures, such as OpenStack, and leveraging these environments for efficient database implementations Knowledge of relational SQL databases such as PostgresSQL, MySQL, MSSQL Server , Oracle and/or other database software and associated software stack. Familiarity with non-relational NoSQL databases (e.g. MongoDB) is a plus Knowledge of "extraction, transform and load" tools such as SQL, Informatica and techniques to manage data integrity and quality. Knowledge of reporting, statistical, and Business Intelligence tools such as R, PowerBI, Crystal Reports, Cognos, and SAS to customise reporting and enable business customers to exploit business analytics. Knowledge of a variety of database programming software tools and business analysis techniques to solicit and understand customer requirements and translate them into functional database structures. Knowledge of the development and application of information and data architectures to support public health surveillance, analytics and epidemiology. Knowledge of PHO lines of business and their general data and information together with knowledge of the various applications that support the business community including: Biocomputing centre, clinical, scientific, research and administrative systems such as finance and HR in order to ensure that new databases complement and leverage existing applications. Knowledge of central technologies at PHO such as SharePoint to facilitate database integration and exploits its collaboration, content and document management, web and cloud computing features to optimize the use of databases. Knowledge of security standards and legislation such as FIPPA and PHIPA to ensure that databases comply. Knowledge of web-based applications and the technical infrastructure in which databases operate to enable efficient interfaces and leverage technical architecture and network capabilities. Knowledge of the database technology vendor community to research emerging technologies and recommend those that anticipate changing business needs, develop justifications and get planning approvals. Knowledge of formal change and incident management processes such as Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) to ensure that databases, tools and processes are implemented without risk to the technical and business environments and make sure that database problems are resolved promptly and permanently. Education and Experience- Position requires an Undergraduate degree in Computer Science or Management Information Systems or equivalent experience and supplementary training and education. 5 years' experience in database development and in developing and implementing data and database management mechanisms and structures preferably related to genomics and bioinformatics data. Interest in molecular, developmental and/or evolutionary biology in particular bioinformatics and genomics. Attributes and Competencies- Communication skills to share database technical information or solution designs with non-technical business management and staff Written and verbal communication and negotiation skills to develop and present solutions, performance reports, technical designs, documentation, risk analyses, cost/benefit analyses and recommendations to colleagues and management and business customer management and gain approval for courses of action when needed. Anticipates problems typically associated with developing and implementing new databases or the adoption of new database and other technology such as incompatibility with existing technologies or sub-standard performance and develops plans to minimize risk and protect the business and technical environments additionally engages technical colleagues, vendors and affected business managers to identify and resolve difficult problems. Planning, organizational, scheduling and prioritization skills to manage own work assignments and tasks, handle multiple concurrent activities, respond to fluctuating demands, meet tight deadlines, resolve incidents, support changing customer requests and provide technical advice and guidance to colleagues and customers.
jobdescription.329: Job Advert Want to see your expertise recognised? As a Logistics Centre Analyst with RB, you’ll have the freedom to let your logistics know-how shine.  Logistics Centre Analyst Mississauga, Ontario Competitive Salary & excellent benefits package  Reckitt Benckiser's Logistics Analyst, Warehouse position is an ideal role for an entry-level Supply Chain professional looking for a challenging and rewarding career with a growing consumer goods company. This role will give you the opportunity to gain meaningful "hands on" work experience and to make significant contributions toward the four main facets – safety, quality, operations and inventory of Reckitt Benckiser's Logistics organization. You’ll succeed because… …you’re highly analytical, capable of gathering and processing complex data from a wide variety of sources. You know what best practice looks like in distribution and logistics. You take a leading role in driving change and driving business improvements. Importantly, you also build strong relationships, working well with suppliers and internal teams alike. You’ll love it because… …you’ll get to make an impact like never before. You’ll be responsible for your own projects - we can’t wait to hear your ideas. The products you help us get out there will make people’s lives better. Our iconic brands will provide an incredible platform for you. And our dynamic, ownership-driven culture will help bring the very best out of you, every day.   Is this You?
