jobdescription.337: About us Dyson is a global technology enterprise. We’re growing fast and our ambition is huge – more categories, more locations and more people. Dyson launched in Canada in 2006 with our headquarters in the heart of Toronto, where we’ve been recognized as one of the top employers to work for. In recent years, we’ve expanded our reach and grown exponentially across many teams, from digital and direct, to field sales, and our growing number of Dyson Demo stores. About the role The Senior eCommerce Analyst will lead actionable reporting of data and insights to guide strategic decisions and drive our direct-to-consumer channel strategy. The ideal candidate should have extensive experience in eCommerce analytics and strong commercial acumen to be able to analyze the business from a 30,000ft view, as well as a 100ft view and provided clear recommendations. They will drive understanding of digital behavior and identify opportunities to improve customer experience and sales performance across DysonCanada.ca and traffic-driving media channels. Ongoing sales analysis and reporting: Analyze eCommerce and total market trends and communicate recommendations that support the direct-to-consumer channel strategy. Analyze product range and promotion performance to determine optimal assortments and opportunities to maximize return on investment. Assist in developing an understanding of base rate and lifts. Present insights and recommendations via written and verbal communications that can be understood by a broad audience. Collaborate with eCommerce lead on forecast modeling to support monthly business processes. eCommerce Platform & Journey Analysis: Proactively monitor the eCommerce platform for changes in customer behavior and communicate these insights and recommendations, with commercial thinking, to the team to drive change. Work closely with eCommerce and Category teams to cultivate a deep understanding of what resonates with our owners in order optimize end-to-end customer journeys. Support eCommerce enhancement planning by identifying new opportunities and quantifying the impact for business case prioritization. Collaborate with eCommerce team to develop multi-variant and A/B tests, and support post-test analysis. Partner with Media team to drive the creation of weekly channel performance reports (SEO/SEM, Display, Paid Social, Affiliates) to supplement agency reporting. Identify high value / underperforming audiences and opportunities to improve visitor engagement Maintenance & Ad Hoc requests: Build and maintain custom dashboards using tools such as Adobe Analytics, GA, Data studio and Tableau. Educate and empower teams to self-serve data. Develop appropriate tagging strategy to capture the necessary KPIs and metrics, and verify accurate data collection. Maintain working knowledge of industry best practices and changes in analytics platforms, and identify how they impact existing programs. Investigate specific issues and propose solutions by analyzing data from a wide range of sources including digital analytics data, customer feedback and session replay tools. Identify additional analysis as required Fulfil other duties as necessary. Forge links with other markets to ensure sharing of best practices Identify opportunities that fall within the role to enhance professional growth Review systems and current methodologies and make recommendations for improvements to enhance overall analytical capabilities of the team About you Bachelor’s degree required 3+ years in an eCommerce Analyst or Retail Sales Analyst role required, with a strong understanding of eCommerce user journeys Master of web analytics tools such as Google Analytics and Adobe Analytics Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel (VBA/macros experience) and highly proficient in all Microsoft Office Applications, including PowerPoint. Storytelling - Can easily distill complex analytics into simple themes that are appropriate for non-technical stakeholders Working understanding of data management, multi-channel marketing strategies and conversion rate optimization Strong analytical, problem-solving skills, and commercial acumen to apply context to analysis Able to demonstrate a proven track record of identifying digital optimizations based on customer insight and data, and its interpretation into actionable test hypothesis and campaigns Comfortable quickly flexing between longer term strategic thinking and day-to-day execution Proactive, creative team playing who enjoys problem solving and enabling those around them Possess a high sense of urgency, strong attention to detail and high standards for the quality of their work Benefits At Dyson, how we reward you is linked to our high-performance culture. But it’s about more than salary and bonus. Through a package of financial, lifestyle and health benefits, we support whatever stage of life you’re in and the moments that matter. Financial benefits: Dyson Matching RSP contributions Company Paid Life Insurance and Accidental Death and Dismemberment (AD&D) Short-Term and Long-Term Disability Field Sales ONLY: Product Ownership Program Employee Referral Program Generous Dyson Product Discounts Lifestyle benefits: Competitive Paid Time Off including Floater Holiday, Sick, and Vacation Time Generous Maternity Leave Program Employee Assistance Program Health benefits: Medical, Dental and Vision Coverage Options Dyson is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment that reflects the diversity of the community in which we live. If requested, we will provide reasonable accommodation during the recruitment process for persons with disabilities. Contact us at americas.talentacquisition@dyson.com for more information. Dyson is an Equal Opportunity Employer. #LI-DYSON Interview guidance  We are following the government guidelines regarding COVID19. At this time all interviews will be conducted via video or telephone. We’re taking these precautionary measures to protect both our employee and candidate wellbeing. Our Talent Acquisition team will work with you and provide further information as appropriate.
jobdescription.338: Job Type: Permanent Primary Location: Multiple Locations, Greater Toronto Area, Canada All Available Locations: Montreal; Toronto Enjoy flexible, proactive, and practical benefits that foster a culture of well-being and connectedness. Build a network of colleagues for life Be expected to share your ideas and to make them a reality. Join the People Experience team! What will your typical day look like?  The Senior Analyst, Data Governance aligns under Tier 2, Specialized Services. This team provides administrative, transactional and specialized operational support to meet business needs through end-to-end lifecycle consultation with exceptional customer service. In this role, you will: Establish and maintain data quality management best practices, standards, guidelines and processes and ensure adherence across the organization through regular audits; Develop, maintain and communicate systems security frameworks to ensure the safeguarding of our people data; Provide strong data analysis and solutioning in the data governance domain enabling stakeholders to manage, control and leverage quality information within and across business units and functional domains. This includes maintaining various dashboards, capability metrics and provision of reporting to identify trends, potential issues and support solutioning; Liaise between Talent and other business areas (e.g. IT, Privacy) to ensure that requirements for protecting sensitive data are clearly defined and communicated and new data quality requirements are understood and documented effectively; Work with technology vendors and IT to ensure that the technology environment is optimal, embracing new functionality and capabilities within existing tools, and helping to plan for future enablement. About the team  People Experience is a tiered, centralized team, providing a scalable platform to respond to changing business needs, and drive continuous improvement across the Culture and People Office function. The team is the face of HR to the business and delivers people inquiry, intake management, program services, and people leader services (aligned to lifecycle stage and Workplace Experience pillars). With a focus on the employee journey, People Experience delivers end-to-end operational experiences through defined processes that are standard for all business segments. Enough about us, let’s talk about you  You are someone who has: A relevant Degree such as Computer Science, Business Administration or equivalent; 3 – 4 years data management experience, ideally within the Professional Financial Services sector; Demonstrated expertise with data quality management, governance, business and data requirements analysis, metrics and controls; Experience with data systems/tools and related software for information profiling, quality and metadata management, ideally PeopleSoft and SAP; Knowledge of practices/technology in areas such as data stewardship, business intelligence, data models and Master Data Management; Strong analytical and problem solving skills which you utilize to quickly problem solve, determine solutions, provide insights into best practices and advise our stakeholders at every level across the firm. This may include the presentation of data quality findings and data management education; Excellent verbal and written communication skills, demonstrated organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities and a detailed and quality focus; A commitment to building collaborative team relationships, contributing to a positive work environment and working effectively within a matrix environment. Why Deloitte? Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make an impact that matters in a way that you never thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and develop our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, connect, and lead. We do this by making three commitments to you: You will lead at every level: We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster. You can work your way: We give you the means to be flexible in how you need and want to work, and we have innovative spaces, arrangements and the mindset to help you be wildly successful. You will feel included and inspired: We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work. The next step is yours Sound like The One Firm. For You? At Deloitte we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities! Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates that represents the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes candidates from Indigenous communities in support of living our values and our commitments to our Reconciliation Action Plan . We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation in the recruitment process, or need this job posting in an alternative format. We’d love to hear from you! By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally. Deloitte Canada has 52 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.
jobdescription.340: Data Analyst toronto Toronto, Ontario, Canada Please note that candidates must have an eligible work permit for Canada.  Do you want to experience the essence of a large organization in a company with a personal touch? Come and work with us! We are looking for creative, innovative, and collaborative people like you to join our team. At the heart of Alithya’s values is the well-being of our employees and their families. That's why, we continue to follow the Public Health Agency of Canada’s recommendations closely.  We remain close to you, while keeping our distance via Phone, Skype, Zoom or however you like.  Take your ambitions to the next level Provide data analysis and standard reporting support, which includes: extracting data from various source systems and data stores by performing light business coding (SQL, VBA, Unix, etc.) and system parameter setting; performing ad-hoc queries and developing/automating financial/statistical models using a variety of software applications (Excel, Access, etc.). Perform impact analysis on proposed changes, evaluating potential impacts on data and applications, and reporting and effectively communicating potential risks/effects to supported business customer base; Interface with management, users, and information technology professionals to solve complex business problems; Focuses on process automation and re-engineering. When it just clicks! Does this sound like you? 7 years of data analysis experience; 5 years of experience with measurement or list generation tools; Experience with SAS, Oracle and Tableau; Nice to haves: Adobe Campaign skills; DOMO skills; Telco experience; Languages required: English: 4/4 34401 Life at Alithya 37.5 hours per week; Opportunities to develop and grow your career; Work with diverse technologies, projects, clients and sectors; Spend your days in a creative and innovative environment; Share experience and knowledge as part of an agile and dynamic team; A great balance between work and personal life; Access to exciting educational opportunities (internal, conferences, events, courses, certifications, etc.); Personal recognition of your important professional contributions; Great cultural diversity across our teams. Why join our team? Because creativity, passion, integrity and wellness are the company’s core values, we are looking for people like you who are enthusiastic, innovative, open-minded, team players and eager to learn.  Working at Alithya is a chance to be part of an energetic, dynamic, and growing team of more than 2,000 professionals in Canada, the United States and France. Our diverse practices and the extensive major projects entrusted to us by our prestigious clients allows us to offer many high growth potential opportunities to our employees in well-established technologies.  Alithya Group is an advocate for workforce diversity and as such, encourages the participation of women in management roles. We belong to the 30% Club, which encourages women’s access to leadership positions.

Excel, Access) ##Ability to effectively execute essential functions in support of a sales team ##Understanding of the insurance life cycle ##Experience or knowledge of various channels of sales (e.g. broker, tied agent, direct) ##Ability to monitor and analyze portfolio performance ##Ability to express ideas and messages clearly, both written and verbally; ability to "sell" an improvised or prepared audience-winning story ##Ability to persuade and motivate others to act, without executive authority  Allianz Global Corporate & Specialty (AGCS) is a leading global corporate insurance carrier and a key business unit of Allianz Group. We provide risk consultancy, Property-Casualty insurance solutions and alternative risk transfer for a wide spectrum of commercial, corporate and specialty risks across 10 dedicated lines of business. jobdescription.342: Submit your information for this opportunity Apply Now Business Analyst - Markham, On L3R 0G7 Hallmark Career Opportunity Business Analyst Role Objective: Applying product/customer/category performance analysis and combining with insight into consumer behaviour, you will provide learning and recommendations that contribute to the achievement of overall business goals and growth. Responsibilities & Duties: Provide business analysis and insight for Walmart and other key customers Primary responsibility is to act in a category advisor-type role for Walmart. Prepare weekly, quarterly and annual summary of category analysis and tracking, primarily using Retail Link. Analyzes sales data to identify issues, trends and opportunities to drive the business Through fact-based analysis, develop actionable insights and recommendation to support business development and objectives Research business trends and results, consumer purchasing behaviour, economic conditions, and market innovation to inform business performance and recommendations Monitors competitive activity in the marketplace, including product programs, marketing initiatives and innovation. Participate in customer meetings providing business guidance based in analysis and insight  Develop recommendations to optimize business performance Identify opportunities to grow the business through sales analysis, trending, consumer insight informed by in-depth knowledge of Walmart and other customer strategies and objectives Develop and present recommendations for space planning, product assortment, pricing and promotions to drive category growth Develops actionable recommendations to address/solve issues to drive sales Provide recommendations for product replenishment to optimize retail sales Provide recommendations for sell-down activity to minimize lost sales Provide shelf-back planning to optimize sales and sell-through recommendations Analyses include, but are not limited to, Gap Space, Assortment, Pricing, Promotions, Productivity, Margin Contribution Provide recommendations for product and assortment development including expansion, contraction, addition, deletion Collaborate with Customer teams to provide recommendations that will guide assortment, pricing, promotion strategy development Collaborate with Category Management team to ensure model line development supports business requirements and strategy Provide product breadth and depth by requirements  Collaboration & Leadership Demonstrate collaboration and fearlessness in actions and decision-making. Effectively engages stakeholders in short- and long-term business planning; monitors performance against plans and makes recommendations for ongoing improvement Effectively collaborate with stake holders to develop strategies for new programme placement and rooftop targeting to deliver optimal performance. Proactively participate with business partners to share knowledge, insight and perspective. Support business planning activities and presentations with analysis and insight based tactical and strategic insights and recommendations. Facilitate debate and negotiation to identify best outcome Links with peers in U.S. to share and foster best practice techniques and methodologies Identifies and takes initiative to act on opportunities and leverages synergies with the U.S. team  Communication Develops and maintains professional and effective relationships stakeholders, and actively collaborates to drive the business and support growth Develops and maintains effective relationships with retailers to maximize understanding of the business and reporting needs. Act as key link to data, performance and related insight Required and Preferred Competencies: 5 years of business and space/assortment experience working with major retailers. CPG experience would be an asset. Walmart & Retail Link experience Experience with retail technology systems preferred Demonstrated ability to think end-to-end on programs and business processes Post-secondary degree in Retail, Finance or Marketing Ability to develop innovative solutions within budget restraints, to realize program goals. Strong analytical skills. Excellent written and verbal skills. Excellent computer skills, strong MS Office knowledge including advanced Excel and PowerPoint. Establishes and maintains strong relationships with cross-functional teams. Must have excellent organizational, communication and presentation skills. Time and project management skills, including the ability to work on multiple projects with multiple stakeholders at the same time. Bilingualism would be an asset. jobdescription.344: Company DescriptionFor almost 30 years, Lorex has been a leader in the marketplace when it comes to innovative security technology for both home and small business use. We achieve this by continuing to produce innovative monitoring solutions, all backed by cutting-edge technology and a dedicated team of forward thinkers. Using the latest technology and innovations, Lorex strives to produce solutions to both enhance security and fit your lifestyle.Job SummaryThe eCommerce Business Analyst is a key member of the Lorex Web Team, reporting to the Director of eCommerce sales and operations. The eCommerce Business Analyst will be responsible for identifying, collecting, mapping, managing and analyzing online and direct to consumer business related data points, such as sales and other KPIs. Also, this position will be responsible for sales & P&L data and process management (CMF/3MF), business strategy development, business SOP management and market & competitive analysis. The main objective is to mine and connect vast datasets related to eCommerce and provide data-driven insights back to the team. The key will be to identify trends eCommerce business relative to the market to identify possible opportunities/risks.Location: Lorex head office, Markham, OntarioDuties & Responsibilities: Maintain the eCommerce data warehouse ensuring consistency across the data sourcesProvide data-driven insights to the team and key stakeholders on key learnings for eCommerce business on a weekly, monthly and quarterly and yearly basis. Purpose is to apply these learnings in tandem with the CPFR process to analyze opportunities and risksProduct group and SKU level sales analysis including (market assessment, promo trend and correlation to each channel, P&L by each channel, product mix trend, seasonality, etc.)Responsible for building analytics tools/models as needed by functional teams (example: supply and demand curve for optimal price point/profit) and developing processes and tools to measure performance and accuracyDrive the SKU level weekly sales forecast for eCommerce business and the monthly target planning process for eCommerce channel by reviewing, validating, and aligning with the team and director of sales and operation and product level forecastAssess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources as they arise, and providing optimal data gathering techniquesPerform market and competitive research and analysisResponsible for sales & P&L management and reportingResponsible for developing CMF/3MF processes and following a monthly rhythm to report to senior management team.Responsible for understanding the eCommerce recognition process and support the team fixing various issues to ensure all sales data is captured in the systemDevelop regular analytics and reports based on all available data sets for various internal key stakeholdersDevelop clear KPIs, build dashboards and provide regular updates to the managementMake recommendations to management for improvements to various projects, tasks, and objectives.Performs other ad-hoc duties as assigned.Requirements: · Knowledge, Skills and Abilities (KSAs) Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Statistics, Economics, Information Technology or related fieldSuperior data management, qualitative & quantitative analytical and data visualization capabilities. Expert in data management & visualization tools: (ie. Excel, Access, Power BI, SAS, Tableau, etc.)Strong analytical and organizational skills and demonstrates the ability to solve complex problems by reviewing related information.Strict attention to details: Excellent written and verbal communication, analytical and strategic thinking skillsExcellent management and control of workflows to produce deliverables within required timeframes and quality standardsStrong interpersonal and partnering skills to facilitate effective working relationshipsExcellent verbal and written communication skillsSolid understanding of consumer electronics industry and eCommerce business structure· Competency Profile Proven ability to drive multiple concurrent projects to success.Demonstrates a strong sense of urgency and is able to work in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment with a strong focus on risk mitigation and customer experience.Ability to handle all confidential matters professionally; always maintaining the privacy of our clients account informationHigh attention to detail and the ability to think strategically· Background Experiences Minimum 5 years of relevant experienceExperience in data analysis, data management, and consumer electronics industry preferredExpert in with Microsoft Office Suite softwareHigh proficiency in SQL, and any additional coding skill is an asset.Lorex Technology is offering an attractive base salary depending on experience.Lorex welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. jobdescription.347: Sharing Economy Analyst LOVE WHAT YOU DO Work is a big part of our lives, so it makes sense to choose a company that offers truly rewarding work. At Economical Insurance®, your contributions, creativity, and energy won’t go to waste. Our passionate culture and pioneering mentality infuse everything we do, which is why our one-million-plus policyholders know we’ll protect their homes, businesses, farms, cars, and pets like they’re our own. We’re not afraid to see how far we can push the envelope to make insurance better. Our family of companies includes Sonnet, the only Canadian home and auto insurer offering a fully online buying experience, and Petline, the largest Canadian pet insurance company. We’re also preparing to become a publicly traded company, a once-in-a-lifetime career opportunity for everyone who joins our team. If you’re looking for a company that takes care of its people — and its customers — and has a track record of doing big things, get ready to love it here. What can you expect in this role? Providing analysis on sharing economy business performance Supporting the implementation of guidelines, governance and reporting framework Working effectively with the commercial account in order to drive an aligned strategy to profitably grow our business Data input into the policy management software Supporting weekly, monthly, quarterly reporting requirements with timely, actionable data following logical exploration on emerging trends and risks where applicable Participates in review of operational process workflows to highlight and address inefficiencies with data supported actions and expected results Development of PowerPoint presentations, analytical data sets and reports Supports CI Operations and CI leadership in managing the roadmap for CI initiatives (e.g. process improvement) Assisting with the evaluation of new business opportunities to grow the sharing economy accounts Coordinating meetings across departments/various stakeholders  What do you bring to the role? University degree or a college diploma Minimum of 2 years insurance experience Excellent analytical skills Team player adaptable to a changing environment Professional, friendly and courteous in all interactions Perform well in a busy operation and remain calm under pressure Strong written and verbal communication skills. Background in Data analytics (strong excel skills with previous experience developing tables and graphs in addition to PowerPoint presentations) Experience with policy coding  We also take potential into consideration. If you don’t have this exact experience, but you know you have what it takes, be sure to give us more insight through your application and cover letter. Go ahead and expect a lot — you deserve it. We offer: Competitive salaries, with potential for an annual raise and bonus Pension and savings programs, with company-matched RRSP contributions Generous time away, including vacation and personal needs days Paid volunteer days and company matching on charitable donations Educational resources, tuition assistance, and paid time off to study for exams Two annual wellness campaigns — participants earn up to $300 each year to spend on almost anything supporting health and work-life balance (think things like spa days, daycare, pet grooming) An unlimited employee referral bonus program Flexible work schedule Discounts on products and services  HOW TO APPLY To complete the online application process, you’ll need to upload your resume and cover letter in one document. Our inclusive work environment welcomes diversity and supports accessibility. If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process, please let us know by contacting: hrsharedservices@economical.com. Visit economical.com to learn more about us and what we’re up to.
jobdescription.348: Equivalent Experience  Our client is actively looking for Analysts to join the Capital Markets Business. Experience with Excel, SQL, Python or other data analytics tools are huge bonuses.  Responsibilities Include: Collect, understand and transmit the business requirements for the project, and translate these into functional specifications and detailed test plans Provide technical knowledge with respect to the application of complex regulatory requirements Assess and comply with banking and other applicable regulations, such as DFAST, MiFID, Basel III and Dodd Frank, as well as understand the evolving regulatory landscape. Qualifications: 2-5 years of experience working in a financial institute as a Business Analyst Experience with Python, SQL, VBA, or R Experience with working in medium to large teams in complex project environments Knowledge within Capital Markets (fixed income, equities, FX, derivatives, commodities, etc). Advantageous to have experience within regulatory space (Dodd-Frank, CCAR, MiFID, FATCA, Basel) Results orientated with excellent communication and interpersonal skills  À propos d'Aston Carter: Aston Carter, une division d'Aerotek, est un fournisseur d'envergure mondiale de services de recrutement et de dotation de personnel pour les sociétés à la recherche de professionnels du milieu des affaires hautement spécialisés. Aerotek est une société en exploitation d'Allegis Group, un fournisseur multinational de solutions en matière de talent. Avec plus de 60 bureaux en Europe, Asie et Amérique du Nord, Aston Carter offre une expertise locale, régionale et mondiale pour répondre aux besoins uniques de ses clients. Reconnu "best of staffing" par nos clients et le talent que nous recrutons, Aston Carter s'engage à livrer un service hors pair a tous nos partenaires d'affaire. As a Best of Staffing® Client and Talent leader, Aston Carter has an unrivaled commitment to delivering first class service to clients and business professionals across a variety of disciplines, including Accounting and Finance as well as Governance, Risk and Compliance. With more than 60 offices across Europe, Asia Pacific and North America, Aston Carter provides local, regional and global expertise to drive value and meet our customers' unique needs. jobdescription.349: Junior Data Analyst We are looking for an enthusiastic self driven Junior Data Analyst to join our fast growing digital marketing team in Toronto, Canada.  This role offers the opportunity to get your hands on a variety of Digital Marketing data sources and work in a client-facing capacity with household name brands across both Canada and the US. You will support the SEO and Paid Media teams by building and maintaining custom Data Studio reports, extracting data through APIs, running Python scripts and executing SQL queries on our data warehouse. By working alongside a diverse and highly technical digital team, you’ll learn quickly and get highly valuable experience. Our head office is in Vancouver, however we have a growing team in Toronto and are excited to hear from motivated people who love data and have a passion for creating things. Key Responsibilities Here’s what you’ll be doing: Building reporting dashboards with BI tools like Data Studio Using Google Analytics as an analyst and administrator Preparing custom reports by extracting and transforming data Asking questions on data using SQL Running and building Python scripts to facilitate automated tasks Requirements Familiarity with digital marketing data sources Experience creating interactive real time dashboards Some experience with SQL and a scripting language like Python Proficient in Excel / Google Sheets Comfortable reading HTML and JavaScript Basic understanding of HTTP requests and browsing the web Strong curiosity Desire to build things and take initiative Highly motivated for personal excellence  The ideal candidate loves data analysis and probably even does it in their spare time. They have experience with Digital Analytics and have used BI tools to create dashboards and have written scripts to automate tasks like data extract, transformation and presentation. Benefits Benefits Competitive salary RRSP Matching Comprehensive Health / Dental / Life package Unlimited paid vacation Summer Fridays - Get out early and enjoy the sun Training Budget  Our Culture A fast growing team within a collaborative global digital marketing agency Join the largest and most technical SEO team in Canada Entrepreneurial thinking is encouraged and rewarded Currently working remote in Toronto - but plans for an office as the team grows Flexible Work From Home days (once back in the office) A relaxed and welcoming work environment

Obtain, clean and analyze data from Region of Peel - Public Health programs, as required. Present data in useful, understandable formats including tables, charts, maps, customized reports, and data dashboards using a variety of software. Provide support on technical issues related to health status, surveillance and/or program data Provide technical input on database design and maintenance. About Us:  The Region of Peel serves more than 1.4 million residents and approximately 173,000 businesses in Brampton, Caledon and Mississauga. jobdescription.356: Reference No. R2587018 Position Title: MES Business Analyst - Vaccine Department: Project Management B100 Location: Sanofi Pasteur Limited, Toronto, Ontario Sanofi Pasteur: The world’s leading vaccine company Sanofi Pasteur, the vaccines division of Sanofi, is the largest company in the world devoted entirely to human vaccines. Our driving goal is to protect people from infectious diseases by creating safe and effective vaccines. Our company distributes more than 1 billion doses of vaccine each year, making it possible to vaccinate more than 500 million people across the globe. Sanofi Pasteur offers the broadest range of vaccines in the world, providing protection against 20 bacterial and viral diseases. Sanofi is dedicated to supporting people through their health challenges. We are a global biopharmaceutical company focused on human health. We prevent illness with vaccines, provide innovative treatments to fight pain and ease suffering. We stand by the few who suffer from rare diseases and the millions with long-term chronic conditions. With more than 100,000 people in 100 countries, Sanofi is transforming scientific innovation into healthcare solutions around the globe. Job Purpose: The Manufacturing Execution System implementation for B100 requires a MES Business Analyst position with a combination of technical and business analysis skills to contribute to the project. The professional will be part of the MES project team and be contributing from a technical and validation perspective to help ensure MES rollout is delivered on time, on budget and to the intended scope as defined by the project team and approved by the project steering committee: As a business analyst, collaborate in the planning, design, development, and deployment of new solutions, and enhancements to existing solutions. For instance, create process models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to solutions developers. Coordinate and manage meetings with the B100 teams and extended project teams (e.g. application Core Teams). Liaise with various business groups in the organization to facilitate the implementation of MES system and new or improved business processes. Develop and maintain requirements, design specifications, traceability matrix, test scripts, and business cases during the planning and development phases of ITS projects. Effectively manage day-to-day tasks in project plans for the project. Ensure assigned tasks are completed on time and within budget, or that scope, duration or budget changes are well-communicated and approved by ITS management and B100 management. Coordinate, perform, and support in-depth testing, end-user reviews, modified and new processes validation. Context and Challenges: This profession role will support implementation of core solutions for a major capital project. This includes technical understanding and process familiarity of shop floor systems. The role will require a mix of technical and business competence and acumen and an ability to translate business requirements to technical design. Key Accountabilities: Successfully delivery of the assigned tasks. Collaborates with manufacturing operations, ITS teams, quality organizations and project leadership to develop validation documents, specifications, test scripts, documentation, and to execute the project tasks within the Sanofi global core solutions model. Key Requirements: Education: Bachelors of Applied Science/Engineering with 5+ years of pharmaceutical manufacturing or ITS related experience . Experience & knowledge: Experience with Vaccines and / or Biologics manufacturing processes Solid understanding of IT Technologies and shop floor manufacturing solutions, including DHS – Data Historian System (OSISoft PI) MES – Manufacturing Execution Systems (Werum PAS|X) Experience in application deployment (software development life cycle -SDLC), including management of change, testing strategies and testing execution Broad understanding of ITS Technologies and Solutions Experience with validation practices Good understanding of the organization’s goals and objectives Effective written and verbal communications skills Language: Fluent English Sanofi is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. Our goal is to attract, develop and retain highly talented employees from diverse backgrounds, allowing us to benefit from a wide variety of experiences and perspectives. We welcome and encourage applications from all qualified applicants. Accommodations for persons with disabilities required during the recruitment process are available upon request. jobdescription.358: Req ID: 113886  NTT DATA Services strives to hire exceptional, innovative and passionate individuals who want to grow with us. If you want to be part of an inclusive, adaptable, and forward-thinking organization, apply now.  We are currently seeking a Analyst Relations Manager to join our team in Toronto, Ontario (CA-ON), Canada (CA).  Analyst Relations Manager:  The Analyst Relations Manager ensures that NTT DATA and its global services strategy are well understood and supported by key analysts who advise enterprise customers on purchasing decisions. The role is responsible for maintaining strong relationships with analysts, proactively driving the business to leverage analyst relationships effectively, managing RFIs for analyst reports and collaborating across the analyst relations team, marketing team, and sister companies. Since this is a global role, the AR Manager ensures all relevant Operating Companies are represented in the work.  Responsibilities include:   Create, execute and manage analyst relations programs in support of NTT DATA. Cultivate and strengthen strategic relationships with top-tier analysts, ensuring they are current on NTT DATA's strategy and familiar with the company's overall portfolio, messaging and key executives. Support and offer guidance for optimal performance in critical reports, including Magic Quadrants, Waves, and PEAKs. Provide analyst relations support for industry events and NTT DATA events. Plan and execute analyst engagements, briefing tours, strategy days and site visits. Support team tools that drive planning and greater efficiency; use measurement programs to track results and inform future planning. Leverage analyst resources to support key marketing and sales support activities. Act as analyst relations representative and liaison with executive stakeholders and colleagues from international locations and sister companies. Partner with colleagues to drive and enhance business results across multiple geographies, teams and stakeholders and contribute to a world-class industry analyst relations function.  Qualifications:   Excellent interpersonal and executive presence skills, including a proven ability to develop and maintain relationships. Strong written and verbal communications skills; ability to think on feet. Fluency in English & ability to work in US time zones Ability to synthesize, interpret and summarize third-party analysis and research for cross-functional audiences. Experience interacting at all levels of a company, including senior management. Able to manage multiple projects concurrently; comfortable working with remote colleagues and stakeholders; experience working across disciplines and geographies. Comfortable with technology concepts and a general knowledge of the IT industry Knowledge of major analyst firm online resources (Gartner/Forrester/IDC) mandatory  Basic Required Qualifications:  Fluency in English & ability to work in US time zones  Preferences:   Knowledgeable of regional/cultural requirements; experienced in international business affairs. Self-organized team player with a demonstrated ability to achieve objectives. Proficiency in using online tracking and measurement tools desired; experience in data analysis desired Strong experience with ARchitect desired #LI-NAM  INDSALES  About NTT DATA Services  NTT DATA Services is a global business and IT services provider specializing in digital, cloud and automation across a comprehensive portfolio of consulting, applications, infrastructure and business process services. We are part of the NTT family of companies, a partner to 85 % of the Fortune 100.  NTT DATA Services is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, gender, disability, age, veteran-status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other class protected by law. jobdescription.360: Job Description Given the current circumstances, the resource will be working from home, 100% of time. As working conditions return to normal, they will be expected to be onsite.  Business Overview The Market Research team is part of Fidelity Canada’s Corporate Affairs group, and provides market and/or competitive insights to support the firm’s business development, thought leadership and strategic planning efforts. What You Will Do We are looking for a natural communicator with a strong analytical foundation and innate curiosity to join our team as a Market Research Analyst. This role is responsible for analyzing, interpreting and communicating insightful market and/or competitive research in support of business development, thought leadership and strategic business planning for Fidelity Canada. You will gain diverse exposure to Fidelity's functional areas and leadership teams and will have the opportunity to see tangible results from your research. The Value You Deliver Primary Research: Assist with Fidelity Canada’s primary research program including questionnaire design, sampling, data collection, and analysis. You will play a meaningful role in synthesizing quantitative and qualitative data and preparing research reports and/or dashboards for key internal partners. Secondary Research: Support Fidelity Canada’s advisor and institutional business lines with demand analysis and competitive positioning to identify key financial industry trends and uncover new business opportunities, working closely with industry-leading market research partners to inform strategic decision making. Project Management: Oversee strategic projects for the Corporate Affairs group including scheduling, collaborating with internal and external partners, identifying risks, and reporting. What We're Looking For A minimum of 3 years' relevant experience is required, preferably in the financial services / asset management / market research industries A Bachelors degree in a business, economics or quantitative focus area A Post-graduate degree in a business or quantitative subject area (including MBA) is an asset Bilingualism in English and French is an asset Completion of the CSC designation is preferred Completion of the MRIA designation is considered an asset, as well as other investment-focused designations CFA/CAIA/CIM/etc The Skills You Bring Solid understanding of the financial services and asset management industry. Excellent analytical and quantitative ability with proven skills in conducting sophisticated data analysis. Excellent oral and written communicator with well-developed data visualization and presentation skills. An avid learner who stays ahead of trends and is confident in their ability to learn new technologies and adapt to constantly evolving demands. Ability to work well under pressure while maintaining high standards. Ability to build rapport and credibility with stakeholders including business leaders at all levels. Fidelity Canada is an equal opportunity employer Fidelity Canada is committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. We will consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national or ethnic origin, age, disability, family status, protected veterans’ status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected ground. Accommodation during the application process Fidelity Canada welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in the selection process. If you require an accommodation, please email us at FidelityCanadaStaffing@fidelity.ca . No telephone inquiries or agencies please. We thank all applicants for their interest, please be advised that only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Why Work at Fidelity? We are proud to be recipients of the following: Awards Canada’s Top 100 Employers (4th consecutive year) 2020 Greater Toronto’s Top Employers (8th consecutive year) 2020 Canada’s Top Family Friendly Employer (3rd consecutive year) 2020 Imagine Canada, Caring Company Canada’s Top Employer For Young People National HR Awards - Best Corporate Social Responsibility Program Award, Venngo Healthy Workplaces Award Workplace Benefits Awards – Health and Wellness Program Canadian Compassionate Companies Award Designations A Canadian Compassionate Company An Imagine Canada Caring Company

Performance Management: Manages the various tools used to support the performance measurement of the logistics functions. This includes the maintenance, development and use of our analytical tools to provide accurate and meaningful Key Performance Indicators. Coordinates and promotes the growth and development of the Concrete Direct digital tool suites. Provides training, support and development feedback for the continued improvement of the tools. Utilizes the LYTX driver management tool, analyses performance data and creates appropriate reporting to drive active management of the system. Develop and maintain a preventative maintenance program that ensures legal compliance and tracks costs. Identify and develop digital solutions for logistical functions that will provide operations employees to receive and use real time performance data to measure and improve performance Relationship with Others Operations Managers Logistics managers , order takers and dispatchers Plant Superintendents and Batchers Customer Experience Manager Specific Accountabilities: Continuous improvement of Logistics by providing accurate KPIS to front line managers and measurement of success Analyze data to identify specific actions by markets and down to the individual plant to improve operational effectiveness Work with the Performance Management team on the Operational Performance Plans, providing input data and monthly measurement of performance. Work within the markets observing the field challenges and identifying opportunities for improvement Effective, consistent and efficient Fleet Maintenance Programs to minimize maintenance costs Provide training for digital tools Dimensions 750 Ready Mix Trucks 70 loaders located 80 Plants reporting to Director of Manufacturing Performance Qualifications College graduate in Business or CET Highly developed Digital Skills Data management, JAVA script and familiarity with common platforms such as Google and SAP Bilingual- French/English Lominger Competency Action Oriented Change management Business Acumen Digital focus Creativity Customer Focus Innovation management Organizational agility Presentation Skills Process management Self-Development  LafargeHolcim As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture. Payments Data domain expertise like ISO XML, CAMT52 etc. would be considered as a plus. Formulate and define systems scope and objectives for complex projects and foster communication between business leaders and IT Consult with users and clients to solve complex system issues/problems through in-depth evaluation of business processes, systems and industry standards and recommends solutions Support system change processes from requirements through implementation and provide input based on analysis of information Consult with business clients to determine system functional specifications and provides user and operational support Identify and communicate risks and impacts, considering business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment Act as advisor or coach to new or lower level analysts and work as a team to achieve business objectives, performing other duties and functions as assigned Has the ability to operate with a limited level of direct supervision. jobdescription.367: Requisition ID: 92145 Join the Global Community of Scotiabankers to help customers become better off. In this role you will help the Director/Sr. Manager to lead a project team responsible for the delivery and daily operations of a project/application for Global Capital Markets technology team to meet their business needs. This will include overseeing and participating in the research and analysis of business processes, facilitate business and IT collaborations, and defining requirements that lead to the design and implementation of effective solutions. In addition, the candidate is responsible for the testing of new systems or enhancements as well as the integrity of daily operations and ensuring ongoing support. Key Accountabilities Responsible for the successful implementation of specific business line solutions for projects and support highly complex business applications for Derivatives and Structured Products Formulates and defines systems scope, and objectives based on a thorough understanding of the requirements of the specific business line, and the data /system flow architecture. Participates in all phases of the IT System Development Lifecycle (SDLC). Acts as a liaison between developers and business team members. Provides timely project status updates to the Project Manager; identifying/reporting project risks as early as possible and proactively mitigating project risks as identified. Provides expert knowledge of cross-functional and business processes, with ability to handles extremely complex problems to meet the business needs of Global Capital Markets Collaborates as the business lead with multiple technology groups and vendors to ensure that the application, integrations, infrastructure and security architectures are designed to meet evolving business requirements, meet standards for reliability, scalability, performance and availability and align with Scotia IT&S Technology roadmap. Continually acquire and enhance knowledge of the business strategies and policies, risk management practices and methodologies, product offerings, financial markets, financial instruments, regulatory requirements, Back Office processes, and rapidly changing technology to be able to provide effective business solutions and services to the end user business lines Analyze complex situations and problems and do the necessary research using multiple sources of information to help arrive at innovative solutions. Coach/mentor junior staff of the team Responsible for System Artifacts such as BRD’s, Tech Specs, IST Plan, Test Cases, evidence of test execution, UAT Strategy, UAT Test Plan etc. Manage the relationship with business users, other project teams and other stakeholders Functional Competencies Highly analytical and attentive to details, must be a self starter, result oriented and customer focus. A high level of interpersonal and verbal communication skills necessary to relate to other people at their systems knowledge level. Ability to exercise good judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions Ability to solve technical problems/ processes and understand complex details to create business solutions to meet clients' needs Have expertise in very complex business and technical processes and their implications across the enterprise. Demonstrate an informed knowledge of business functions related to Global Risk Management to resolve problems and capitalize on improvement opportunities Strong SDLC and technical knowledge such as RiskWatch, Risk script, Linux, Scripting, SQL, python and familiar with RDBMS (Postgres, Oracle, etc). Experience with agile and continuous integration and delivery an asset. Experience with risk management, derivatives applications, valuation and market data knowledge would be an asset Have project management and agile delivery experience would be an asset Education/ Experience A recognized under-graduate degree in business administration, mathematics, computer science, or engineering related discipline. Have at least 8 to 10 years of relevant IT and business industry work experience in capital market preferred. Proven IT experience with an emphasis on highly complex systems/business initiatives. A CFA or FRM designation would be an asset. Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto As Canada's International Bank, we are a diverse and global team. jobdescription.368: Requisition ID: 97604  Join the Global Community of Scotiabankers to help customers become better off. Analyst - Regulatory Business Sustainment, Internal Controls, GBM 97603 Why work for Scotiabank? Scotiabank is among the largest banks in the world and the most international bank in Canada. We are powered by our 97,000 high-performing teammates who make a real difference across the globe as a leading provider of advice, products, digital experiences, and financial services. Together with our Digital Factories around the world, we are dedicated to helping our 25 million customers become better-off. This is a place where you’ll get to learn and develop your skills, while being recognized for your hard work. At Scotiabank, we’re passionate about bringing our whole selves to work, allowing us to create inclusive work environments for everyone to enjoy. Say hello to a career at Scotiabank!  Global Banking and Markets  Global Banking & Markets provides a full range of investment banking, credit and risk management products and services relevant to the financing and strategic development needs of our clients. Our products include debt and equity financing, mergers & acquisitions, corporate banking, institutional equity sales, trading and research, fixed income products, derivatives, energy, foreign exchange and precious & metals. We also cross-sell the full range of wholesale products and services offered by the Scotiabank Group. Position   As the Analyst you will assist with the design and execution control processes with input from the GBM business lines (Line 1A) and the second lines of defense (e.g. GBM&T Compliance), thereby contributing to the overall success of the first line of defense in managing operational risks inherent in the businesses. The Regulatory Business Sustainment (RBS) group within the GBM Internal Control operates as the Bank’s center of excellence in the first line of defense for ensuring compliance with G20 regulations including Derivatives regulations in Canada, US, Europe and APAC Derivatives regimes, collectively referred to as the OTC Derivatives Regulations. In addition, the group provides oversight for some of the Volcker rule requirements in the first line of defense. The Analyst will support the RBS team of regulatory specialists who monitor and report Scotiabank's compliance with OTC Derivatives Reforms such as Dodd Frank, EMIR and similar rules in Canada, and Asia and Volcker. The Analyst is primarily responsible for supporting the effective execution of GBM controls and monitoring and oversight functions. RBS works closely with the Front Office, as well as Global Wholesale Operations, Compliance, Legal and Technology groups. This position requires organization and coordination skills, curiosity, creative problem solving and the ability to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment Requirements Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in business, or related field (eg. Mathematics, Accounting). Minimum 0-3 years in the financial industry or similar environment Strong analytical skills and ability to work with large quantities of data, research and organize results. Ability to work with multiple stakeholders to execute projects. Good oral and written communication skills. A demonstrated ability to collaboratively work in a team environment under tight deadlines. Intermediate to Advanced user capabilities in Excel, Word, PowerPoint Attention to detail and organizational skills This role requires successful completion of the NFA Swaps Proficiency Requirements within 90 days of assuming the role. The following skills would be an asset: Knowledge of key current rules and regulations governing banking institutions, specifically in the Capital Markets business Capital market products knowledge Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto As Canada's International Bank, we are a diverse and global team. We speak more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. Our employees are committed to a superior customer experience and use the Bank’s six guiding sales practice principles to ensure they act with honesty and integrity.  At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. The ideal candidate will be a Microsoft Excel and SQL guru, having experience with data analysis, complex calculations as well as dynamic model building. We want someone who can also take a database and design required SQL to collect and analyze historical data and perform various costing and efficiency scenarios. Knowledge of pricing, rates and costing in the transportation would be an asset. The candidate will need to ensure to complete and deliver the project deliverables within the allowed timeline.RESPONSIBILITIESCollect and analyze data from various backend data sources to answer specific business-related questions using a variety of tools, though primarily Excel.Participate in new business RFPs, doing analysis on available data to determine new rates.Costing of customer accounts based on historical data to determine operating ratiosMonitor KPI’s and create KPI visibility report(s) on a weekly basis using MS Excel. Identify anomalies for the week and present the findings along with the visibility report for discussion.Creation of SOPs in MS Word, Vision, Sharepoint medium and staff training as needed.Assist Senior Management with creating specific reports as required.Travel to other branches may be required from time to time for short periods (1-2 days) for specific initiatives.POSITION REQUIREMENTSUniversity degree/Professional designation relating business analysis, data analysis, or similar is preferredOperational knowledge of transportation is nice to have – LTL, TL, Intermodal/Rail, Drayage, Trans Load, Warehousing, Cross-Border, etc.Minimum of 3 years of experience in advanced analytical skills using VBA in Excel is requiredExperience with MS Visio is nice to haveExperience with Crystal Reports design and automation would be a plusHigh level of organization skills including ability to follow established guidelines, methods and procedures to achieve desired results.Time management skills (i.e. ensuring that all KPI reports are prepared correctly and in a timely manner, the ability to work under pressure and meet strict guidelines, etc.).Communication skills (verbal, written, facilitation, e-mail) including an ability to interact with all levels of organization. English language skills are a must; French would be a plus.General computer skills including a high level of comfort with Office 365 and associated applications.Experience with TMW Truckmate and its Business Intelligence software is a plusWORKING ENVIRONMENTThis position requires confidentiality in dealing with client and corporate information, employee performance information and strategic business and financial objectives of the company.We are a fast-paced environment, with tight deadlines, multiple priorities, and the chance to be a part of making a good company into a great company! If you are looking for a challenge, growth, and chance to be part of a terrific team, this is the place for you!Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $0.00 per hourEducation:Bachelor's Degree (Preferred)Experience:Advanced Analytical Skills: 3 years (Preferred)
jobdescription.373: Wattpad is a global multiplatform entertainment company whose vision is to entertain and connect the world through stories. Since 2006, we’ve been on a mission to use the power of community and technology to unleash the full potential of stories to the world. Every month 90 million people around the world spend over 23 billion minutes on Wattpad to share and discover stories they can’t find anywhere else. Our brand banner includes: Wattpad, Tap by Wattpad, Wattpad Labs, Wattpad Studios, Wattpad Books and Wattpad Brand Partnerships. We’re proudly based in Toronto, but our reach is global. Come build the future of entertainment and storytelling, and write your next chapter with us! At Wattpad, we have a massive scale and reach across our global users; this is what makes us unique. It’s been an exciting time of growth, change and development for Wattpad. We are expanding our analytics practice at Wattpad and are searching for a Data Analyst Team Lead. The Practice’s main focus is to support all of Wattpad's business units and product squads, from building ad-hoc reporting to metrics creation to forecasting and predictive insights projects. The goal is to advocate for and facilitate data-informed decision-making throughout the organization. What you'll be doing: Provide support and guidance to a driven, passionate and capable data Analytics team Manage and work closely with our Data Analysts on solving business problems and delivering value Plan, develop and scope large, impactful analytics projects in collaboration with the team and business partners Help guide and develop the processes and practices of the Analytics team to continuously improve our ability to deliver valuable insights Help shape the departmental vision and direction of the Analytics practice at Wattpad Promote and support the development of best practices, recommendations on tools and technology, and the overall technology evolution within the Analytics practice Liaise with business leads across Wattpad teams regarding key learnings and their business applications, taking our technical insights (and problems) and condensing them into a digestible, understandable format Extract and analyze complex information from a variety of databases and transform data from large datasets into insights suitable for various audiences What we're looking for: 5+ years’ of practical experience in a data oriented field, with established team leadership working in a rigorous data-driven environment or experience grown in a fast-paced start-up or technology company Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills; you’ll be providing you’ll also be working with different teams to help answer questions, so it is crucial you can communicate your work to multiple stakeholders Experience with statistical modelling, operational modelling, forecasting, and A/B/N testing, experimental design Functional, hands-on experience with SQL and Python, in a production environment You take initiative and find creative and scalable ways to solve problems You can deliver, especially under pressure, multi-tasking and meeting challenging deadlines, all while upholding a high degree of quality University degree in Economics, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field preferred Bonus points: Previous experience with Bayesian inference and ways of refining complex priors is a plus (e.g. Experience with Markov Chain Monte Carlo methods) Please submit a GitHub repo or Jupyter notebook from a project you’ve completed or worked on. Or, share a link to similar work. This can be from an academic or industry project. What we offer: Competitive salary Career development; we believe in mentorship and supporting you to achieve your goals Health benefits, fully covered on us! RRSP Contributions Generous vacation and Parental Leave Top-up $200/month Transit and Home Office Allowance, choice of hardware, flexible hours, hybrid office and remote work options Corporate discount for gym membership for you and your family A beautiful office in downtown Toronto, with easy access to transit And a whole lot more! **Update: Wattpad is still actively hiring for this role! We are a robust and growing business; our search for new talent continues.** Due to the current state with COVID-19, Wattpad will conduct all interviews in a distributed manner using applicable third party software where needed and using visual interface tools such as Google Hangouts and Zoom. Our intention is to respect everybody's need for safety and adherence to social distancing. We also want to respect our team's personal needs and capacity for professional commitments during this time; consequently our pace for the interviewing process might be impacted. About Wattpad Who are we? Entrepreneurs and Do-ers. Our vision is to entertain and connect the world through stories, and our mission is to use the power of community and technology to unleash the full potential of stories to the world. What does that mean? We are visionaries, community builders, passionate problem solvers, storytellers, coffee snobs (tea drinkers, too!), curious by nature, and culturally diverse. What are we obsessed with? Our users. Solving complex problems and maximizing flow. Learning constantly. Building the next great storytelling product. Finding the greatest stories ever told. Dogs (and cats), coffee, and good snacks. How do we work? Autonomously, collaboratively, respectfully. Balancing with work, family, and play...and all while having a great time. Culture and Diversity Wattpad is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate. Period. Wattpad welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. We have taken a leadership position on creating a culture and an organization that truly values diversity. We are committed to fostering a global team that reflects the diversity of the Wattpad community. At Wattpad, we believe cultural fit doesn’t mean culturally identical, and diversity of thought helps us to challenge one another to think big and think differently. We consider employment applicants without regard to age, race, colour, national origin, citizenship, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status, marital status, disability status or any other protected status. If you have any special needs or accessibility requirements, please let us know. We will do our utmost to accommodate, in accordance with applicable local legislation.
jobdescription.375: Job Description: We are Canada Life Being a part of Canada Life means you have a voice. This is a place where your unique background, perspectives and talents are valued, and shape our future success. You can be your best here. You’re part of a diverse and inclusive workplace where your career and well-being are championed. You’ll have the opportunity to excel in your way, finding new and better ways to deliver exceptional customer and advisor experiences. Together, as part of a great team, you’ll deliver on our shared purpose to improve the well-being of Canadians. It’s our driving force. Become part of a strong and successful company that’s trusted by millions of Canadians to do the right thing. Be your best at Canada Life. Given the size and scope of our organization, we have the flexibility for this position to be located in the following head office locations: Montreal, Toronto, London, Winnipeg. Role description What you will do Independently work with subject matter experts (SME) from across the organization to identify and document current state processes and to identify process improvement opportunities Engage with team members to identify and document alternatives and recommend future state processes that improve the customer experience and drive efficiencies for the organization Collect, clean, analyze and visualize data to inform data driven decisions Work with system SME and data product SME to create mapping of data between source systems and data product Identify and document data requirements to meet business outcomes Work closely with the delivery team to identify, coordinate, and consolidate dependencies to deliver on the release plan Work closely with the Tech and Data team members to ensure adequate testing by contributing to test plans, identification of test situations and test cases, execution of test plan and verification that test results meet business expectations Identify, escalate and contribute to the resolution of issues and mitigation of risks What you will bring Strong fact-finding skills – Ability to elicit and consolidate requirements from multiple stakeholders Action oriented - Ability to quickly consume information and translate it into meaningful action Exceptional critical thinking skills - Ability to identify and document the happy path as well as all the edge cases Excellent written and verbal communication skills - Ability to communicate complex messages and trade-offs clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences Well-developed collaboration skills - Ability to build strong relationships with a diverse set of stakeholders at all levels of the organization, ability to conduct workshops Demonstrated attention to detail - Ability to produce high quality output under strict and accelerated timelines True flexibility and adaptability - Ability to work in ambiguous situations; resilient and tenacious with a propensity to persevere Previous experience in creating process flows, documentation, data mapping and analysis, functional testing and validation Comfortable with handling and analyzing large amounts of data including querying, mapping between systems etc. Broad knowledge of insurance domain (Group life/health/disability) and understanding of underwriting, policy administration, enrollment and claims systems Working knowledge of navigation in mainframe systems Strong understanding of Azure cloud, Data Warehousing and Data Analytics flow Working knowledge of Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Data Factory and Azure SQL Previous experience with data analysis and visualization tools preferred (Tableau and Power BI) Strong knowledge of Agile Mindset/Behaviors: Challenger mindset and passion to challenge status quo to find new solutions and drive out of the box ideas – embraces change Believes in a non-hierarchical culture of collaboration, transparency and trust across the team Has a learning mindset to take on versatile roles as needed Be your best at Canada Life- Apply today We are one of Canada's top 100 employers! Canada Life serves the financial security needs of more than 13 million people across Canada, with additional operations in Europe and the United States. As members of the Power Financial Corporation group of companies, we’re one of Canada’s leading insurers with interests in life insurance, health insurance, investment and retirement savings. We offer a broad portfolio of financial and benefit plan solutions for individuals, families, businesses and organizations. By ensuring that RMTs maintain professional Standards of Practice and are held accountable for their conduct, CMTO protects the public’s right to receive high quality, safe and ethical Massage Therapy treatment.WORKING @ CMTOThis is a full-time salaried position conveniently located just steps from transit at Davisville subway station in midtown Toronto. Please note that this role is temporarily 100% work from home to mitigate the risk of potential community spread of COVID-19 and protect the safety of our team.Our team is collaborative and respectful, with high emotional intelligence and a strong dedication to our mission. This opportunity will allow you to put your mark on our IT systems, technical business processes, and projects to help us achieve strategic solutions in alignment with the envisioned future of the College.If you are in search of an opportunity where you can blend your passion for people with your technical process engineering skills, then we’ve got the role for you!ABOUT THE ROLEReporting to the Manager, IT Applications, the Technical Business Systems Analyst performs business process and systems analysis, maintains system applications, supports processes, and drafts technical and process documentation. combination of extensive technical experience and education in business administration considered.Minimum of 5 years’ experience in a similar role, preferably in the not-for-profit, regulatory, health, and/or education sector.CBAP designation and experience in Enterprise System implementations preferred.SKILLSDemonstrated technical expertise in a wide range of technology areas.Advanced proficiency in the use of technology in daily work e.g., MS Office 365, SAP Concur, APIs, WordPress, SharePoint, DocuSign, and Adobe.Advanced proficiency with SQL, XML, Json, HTTP, HTML 5.Knowledge on Data Modelling and Data Visualization Tools MS Power Bi/Tableau.Working knowledge of relational databases and data analytics.Organizational and time management skills with a proven ability to deliver on shifting priorities and competing deadlines.Flexible, resilient, and resourceful in managing organizational change.Critical thinking, judgement, and strong attention to detail when problem-solving.Communication, collaboration, and initiative to resolve issues in a team structure.Customer-service excellence focus and a natural ability to exercise patience.INTERESTED?To be considered for this role, please forward your resume and cover letter via email on or by March 23, 2021. Please state the job posting title and your name in the subject line of the email.We thank all applicants for their interest in CMTO. This role provides business insights through data mining and analysis as well as reporting and dashboard creation and maintenance.Key ResponsibilitiesResponsible for the maintenance, design, modification, and creation of new and existing Operational and Operations Financial reporting and dashboards (PowerBI, SQL Server Reporting, Sharepoint, etc), including leading reporting system changes or upgrades for the Operations teams.Collaborates with Operations Leaders and across Numeris departments to identify and recommend Best Practices for reporting and analysis using multiple data sources, in alignment with QA and legal requirements. Understands the end-to-end flows of Operations data to identify issues with reports and achievement of metrics.Responsible for the data gathering/extraction, manipulation, and analysis of operational trends for special projects, continuous improvement initiatives, recommending approaches, and foundational metrics for continuous improvement through measurement tools, analytics, scorecards.Sets the foundation for predictive analysis and the build of Operations Business Intelligence, collaborating with other business analysts, data owners, and internal departments to provide a holistic view of the organizational current state and possible future states to measure operational success.Maintains strong knowledge of Business Intelligence tools and methods, assesses operational needs, provides cost/benefit analysis for new data analytics tools such as AI, collaborating with IT and other business unitsQualifications & ExperienceUndergraduate degree required in Computer Science, Math, Finance, Economics, Statistics or a related field.More than 5 years and up to 7 years in a data analytics or metrics reporting role.Advanced knowledge of and experience with Relational Databases and data extraction using SQL, SQL Server Reporting ServicesAdvanced experience MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, Sharepoint, Outlook)Advanced experience with Reporting and Analysis tools (PowerBI, QlickSense) including designing, building, and maintaining dashboardsExperience in Operational environments, particularly Contact Centre Operations and Contact Center Technologies an assetProject Management experience an assetExceptional analytical, communication, and collaboration skillsWhat’s in it for you?Projects – opportunity to work on exciting projects and make an impact on the broadcast industryCompetitive benefits package and group savings and retirement program.Education reimbursement - for those wishing to pursue additional professional development, funding up to $1,000 per year is available through our education reimbursement programWork-life balance – flexible summer hours program and we offer paid days off during the holiday closure between Christmas and New Year’s Day.Perkopolis – participation in a program that provides exclusive discounts on products and services to employees.
